item.title: Marketing Manager
item.content: Senior Marketing ManagerAre you a senior marketing professional with a passion for performance marketing? Do you crave genuine autonomy, growth and development with a progressive, ambitious employer? If you want to be part of something spectacular on a global scale, where your hard work and dedication is not only acknowledged but rewarded, then this might be the opportunity you&#39;ve been waiting for.Role:As a Marketing Manager, you will be working remotely for an exciting tech start-up with a difference. Reporting directly to the CEO, you will be responsible for creating and implementing a marketing strategy which will generate leads, develop the brand and raise awareness of a cutting-edge workforce management platform. You will be supported by a team of Graphic Designers, Content Writers and SEO/PPC experts with the opportunity to grow and develop your team. This is a business at the start of what is destined to be a remarkable journey that you will be integral in shaping.You will have operational control which will include:Building your marketing budget and reporting on ROIDeveloping, guiding, and motivating your teamSetting KPIs for all marketing activityWorking collaboratively with the Head of SalesProvide insight and ideas to engage with your target audience of temporary staffing agenciesEnsure a holistic approach to your marketing strategy, including exhibitions, social media, SEO/SEM, PPCRequirements:Whilst this is a remote position, the ideal candidate would be Dublin based or able to travel to Dublin on a regular basis. You must be results driven and dynamic, with a real desire to drive this project and allow the company to achieve its full potential and beyond. You will have:Previously worked within Saas or Recruitment industries, ideally temporary staffingStart-up experience is desirable but not essentialPerformance marketing focused, with solid SEM/SEO knowledgeDemonstrable track record of setting and achieving targets with regards to lead generation, content engagement and increasing in brand awarenessOutstanding communication and time management skillsAbility to work autonomously, generate ideas and implement strategyExcellent work ethic and a genuine desire to succeed You will be rewarded with a generous basic salary of between &pound;40k - &pound;70k, dependent on experience. This will be supplemented with an annual performance based bonus and regular salary reviews. You will enjoy regular expensed travel as well as a full benefits package and real career development.This is an incredible opportunity for anyone looking to join a growing and forward-thinking business. To find out more information, call Safer Hand Solutions and ask for Rebecca Quilliam-Brown, or apply today to be considered for the role.Please note, Safer Hand Solutions are acting as an employment agency on behalf of a client and by applying you agree to register with us and for us to hold your details on file. Due to the volume of applications, we will only contact applicants who have been successfully shortlisted, but may contact you in regards to any other suitable vacancies

item.title: IT Infrastructure Scheduler, great role in Waterford

item.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
item.content: At Bracken Recruitment we are working exclusively with our Software Consultancy client to recruit a Business Intelligence Analyst. This is an excellent opportunity to join a fast passed growing business. They need a talented BI to take leadership on a current project and complete the remainder reports requested by the client. Position is based in Dublin City Centre.This role is a bit of a hybrid role with development, analysis and testing but we are looking for someone who comes from a strong SQL Development background and good experience working with SSIS packages.Job Responsibilities * Act as the primary liaison between Company and their Client for current ongoing project * Gather, document and understand BI requirements from multiple stakeholders * Provide timelines / estimates on project deliverables * Support BI projects from inception through the various stages of the development lifecycle * Liaise with the wider technical team to understand and resolve BI technical issues * Work with business users to fully understand their BI needsExperience Required * 4 or more years&rsquo; experience is ideally required, with recent experience in a BI role a must * 4+years&rsquo; working SSIS packages * 4 years&rsquo; experience working with Power Bi * 3+years&#39; working with SSRS reportsEssential and Desirable Skills: * 4-5 years&rsquo; experience in a Business Intelligence role * Background in BI systems and procedures * Solid understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework * Expert with BI technologies, especially Microsoft Power BI, familiar with Tableau * Solid understanding SSRS and SSIS Packages * Strong problem-solving skills * Strong communication and interpersonal skillsBenefits: * Work from home opportunities * Contract length: circa 6 months

item.title: Electrical Engineer
item.content: Malone Group is an established engineering and safety services company specialising in delivering complex projects for companies in the food &amp; beverage, pharmaceutical and utilities sectors in Ireland, UK and CanadaThe Electrical Engineer will be a key project role within the Company&rsquo;s operations, working within the Engineering Department. The position requires a broad knowledge of, and experience in the range of technical roles and responsibilities carried out by this department. The individual will be involved in multi-faceted projects involving change management, building compliance, electrical design (LV &amp; MV), space management and advising on more efficient energy managementReports to: Operations Manager.Key relationships: Group Engineering Director, project managers, project engineers, CAD DepartmentResponsibilities * Defining project scope including budgets to ensure projects are fully developed at concept stage * Providing technical support for information requests prior to, and during construction phases * Design and collaborate with other disciplines to create a construction set of documents and work with regional vendors and manufacturers to specify the appropriate electrical equipment * Design of equipment and infrastructure associated with MV &amp; LV electrical systems * Design of electrical systems associated with life safety and security systems * Design &amp; development of control panel layouts, electrical schematics, instrument and control loop drawings, assembly drawings and bill of materials * Adherence and monitoring of project programmes to include regular progress tracking * Working with local utilities to understand and define site utility requirements * Reviewing and approving equipment submittals * Providing technical support for information requests prior to, and during construction phases * Overseeing the installation of projects on Customer sites, to include all elements of Quality, Health and Safety and Technical compliance * Working with commissioning teams to properly test and validate installation, operation, and performance of electrical systems * Effective management of all financial and commercial aspects of site related contracts, including variation orders and related Customer/Sub-contractor negotiations * Work with a team of engineers to ensure tasks are allocated and achieved in accordance with project requirements and in line with the Company&rsquo;s values, quality standards and business objectives * Operating as an Ancillary Certifier for the purpose of BC(A)R and undertaking inspections prior to BC(A)R project certification.Candidate Profile * Degree in Electrical Engineering with a minimum 5 years&rsquo; post qualification experience * Chartered Engineer desirable but not a requirement * Excellent understanding of the European Electrical Codes * Knowledge of building codes and regulations. * Fundamental understanding of critical LV electrical equipment * Working with multiple electrical software including- Autocad, Dialux, Amtech, REVIT, etc * Possess leadership and problem-solving skills * Be a motivated, highly dependable individual with solid communication skills, attention to detail, and an ability to maintain high quality standards * Ability to mentor electrical project engineers as required * Demonstrate leadership qualities to maintain relationships with internal and external customers. Ability to quickly identify and remove roadblocks * Proactively organises and plans ahead to ensure optimum resource allocation and project timelines are met * Ability to carry new design concepts through exploration, development and into deployment/construction * Ability to work on multiple projects of different scale and complexity at any one time * An ability and willingness to think outside of the box to find creative and innovative solutions to reduce costs with no impact on quality, reliability or maintainability * Enjoys solving problems, interacting with customers, suppliers and contractors and eager to maintain strong constructive relationships

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.content: Our client, a leading independent investment research and governance advisory firm is expanding their Engineering team in Limerick. The successful candidate will join a team that is working towards new platform for our client&rsquo;s core business. Candidates must have experience with all levels of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for an enterprise level application.Role and Responsibilities * Leading technical direction within the team in terms of infrastructure and devops and best practices in relation to Infrastructure as code and Cloud platform infrastructure. * Working in a large team with a long term goal of delivering a new platform for our core business * Redesigning and re-implementing legacy systems using cloud based services to meet our rapidly growing need for horizontal scaling * Actively participating in agile ceremonies (Backlog refinement, Planning, Daily Stand-ups, Sprint Reviews and Retrospectives). * Providing valuable insights in design reviews and code reviews. * Being available out-of-business hours for production support (level 2-3) on a rotational basis.Requirements * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills * Strong documentation skills. * Willingness to give and take feedback and share knowledge * A strong desire to learn and improve. * The ability to influence software engineering best practices within your team. * From a technical perspective we do require a degree in computer science and your experience should also include a minimum of 5 years development experience through the entire life-cycle of an enterprise application. * At least 2 years of this should include practical experience of working in a devops role.Use of the following technologies and methodologies would be a distinct advantage: * Terraform or similar IaC tooling * Ansible, Powershell DSC and similar configuration tooling * Azure (AZ Cli, Portal) * Azure Devops/VSTS (Boards, Pipelines, Repositories, Artifacts, Test Plans) * Docker * .NET Core * Git * Bash, Powershell * Nuget, NpmClicking the &ldquo;Apply Now&rdquo; button means that you agree to the processing of your personal data for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes, carried out by QPTech in accordance with the provisions of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (EU) 2016/679.You also agree to share your personal data with other entities of QPTech and potential employers for purposes related to the recruitment process. QPTech may also contact you from time to time to inform you of events we are hosting that you may find interesting.Providing data is voluntary, you have the right to inspect, correct or request deletion of your data at any time. A request to delete data means withdrawal from any further engagement in QPTech&rsquo;s recruitment processes and will result in the immediate deletion of your data. If you do not agree, please do not click the &ldquo;Apply Now&rdquo; button.Please visit QPTech&rsquo;s website to read the full Privacy Policy ((url removed)

item.title: Trainee Field Service Engineer
item.content: Do you have a strong interest for electromechanics? Are you fascinated with repairing, servicing and see how things work? Would you love to work for a market leader within the white goods industry as a Field Service Engineer?The Concept Academy are hiring Trainee Engineers to join a market leader of large domestic appliances such as washing machines, refrigerators, dishwashers, cookers &amp; tumble dryers.Who are we looking for?We are seeking keen individuals with a willingness to learn that would love to get hands on within a new industry. You will have a passion within electromechanicals with basic experience also being advantageous. Other qualifying areas or experience that may be considered are; vehicle maintenance, coffee machines, vending machines, ticket machines, parking machines, washing machines, tumble dryers, dishwashers, microwaves fridges etc.It is important that you are able to demonstrate;Fantastic customer service skillsEnergetic, driven &amp; great attention to detailEagerness to learnProblem solving in difficult situationsGood oral and written communication skillsLong term goal to be trained as a competent engineer Our training academyFully comprehensive training including classroom, workshop and theory4 week training course at client Head Office in Dublin starting on 1st February then a further 2 weeks shadowing a Senior Engineer within the field.This would require you to stay overnight within the week and go home on weekends during training Life after trainingYou have completed your 4 week training, you have a shiny new van, tools and parts all loaded, you&#39;re ready to go &hellip; so what&#39;s next?Service repair and maintenance within domestic settings on a range of domestic appliancesMonitor and maintain adequate stock levelsCompleting service calls via PDAMonthly one to ones with Regional Supervisor &amp; Team quarterly meetingsOngoing training and skill set monitoringAiming for first time fix rateDay to day updates via Coordination TeamThis role is homebased, to be considered for the Dublin area, it is essential that you live within 40 miles of the city centre What&#39;s on offer?&euro;26,000 per annum&euro;1,000 salary increase after 6 monthsVan &amp; fuel cardComprehensive training courses direct from manufacturer followed by 2 week shadowing on the field.20 days holiday + bank holidaysPayable through an umbrella companyQuarterly engineer reward schemeAccess to PerkboxThis is an ongoing training contract &amp; you will have the opportunity to be made permanent (based on performance)Uniform, Tools, test equipment, footwear, PPE, face masks, hand sanitiser provided The EssentialsStrong interest in an engineering disciplineFull Driving LicenseRight to work in IrelandMust be over 21 years oldAppropriate delivery point for a courier to have 24/7 access to deliver stock e.g. (garage, storage unit, ideally 50 sq foot) is essentialGood written &amp; excellent verbal communication skills across all levelsGood time management and organisation skillsMust be able to pass relevant security vetting.Happy to stay away from home training at Head OfficeConfident using Android devices What is the interview process?Initial telephone screening to discuss background, training academy &amp; the roleVideo call with Service Delivery Coordinator competency based / technical questionsFace to face / video interview with Service Delivery ManagerThis would be a fantastic role for a trainee who wants to become a field service engineer and learn a new industry. We are recruiting heavily over the next year, so if you don&#39;t see a vacancy within your area, but you want to register your interest, please email your CV with the subject - Academy Engineer Interest

item.title: Health & Safety Officer
item.content: Building Staff Solutions (BSS) are hiring a Health &amp; Safety Officer for our client, a very well-known Large Main Contractor with long history of completing projects on time, within budget and to the highest standards. The role will be based on a site in Carlow and the successful candidate will be responsible for advising on overall compliance in matters of Health &amp; Safety.Your ResponsibilitiesConducting regular, formal site audits and carrying out inspections as directed in the Safety Management SystemEnsuring that record of statutory inspections are kept for all activities and plant equipmentDelivering and completing statutory notifications to the Health &amp; Safety Authority for the project and all incident / accident reporting and to conduct inspector site visits as required by the Health &amp; Safety AuthorityDelivering Health &amp; Safety induction program&#39;sfor new employees or contractors working on siteManaging and making recommendations for Personal Protective Equipment required for all EmployeesAssisting Site Management in compiling cost records and forecasts for all issues associated with Health &amp; Safety including, but not limited to, contra charges, training, purchases, etcServing as company representative at Site meetings;Organizing and chairing the Safety Meetings for Sub-Contractors personnelEnsuring sub-contractor safety statement&#39;s andrequired Method statement are available on site and assess sub-contractor statements and method statements, assisting where requiredAdvising / assisting Site Management in drafting and communicating Method StatementsCompiling, updating and communicating site Emergency PlansConducting preliminary accident investigations and statutory notifications, while keeping Group Safety Officer updatedMaking sure First aid is available, that an adequate quantity of First Aid supplies is in stock and that all relevant Certs are updatedCollecting and collating relevant information for inclusion in the Safety File and preparing for handover to the Client at the end of the project.What you need to have3rd Level Health &amp; Safety Qualification Essential With 1+ Years&#39; ExperiencePrevious experience managing safety on siteExcellent communication, leadership, training and presentation skillsExperience in the construction industryExperience with Irish or UK contractsWhat you get in returnExcellent working environmentLatest available training to assist you in your roleCompetitive Salary - &euro;40k P.A Company vehicle or fuel allowance Work for a well-structured and supported organisation that prides itself on delivery of service and customer satisfaction.If you are interested in this role, Please click apply or contact David on (phone number removed)/ today for a strictly confidential conversation.Job 36692 - INDHP BSS will process the data you have provided to help us find you suitable employment and offer you opportunities to help further your career. item.title: Supply Chain Manager
item.content: Supply Manager Louth &euro;40-50kThe Supply Manager is responsible for ensuring that the end to end Supply Chain runs smoothly and efficiently, enabling the company to deliver the best possible availability for the business.Working collaboratively alongside all other departments the Supply Manager will be responsible for managing and identifying new inventory policies, identifying opportunities for business improvements and help shape the overall supply strategy.Responsibilities * Implement and drive supply chain strategies * Utilise analytical skills to maintain master data integrity and accuracy * Identify and develop robust solutions to potential supply risks and capacity bottlenecks * Lead the development of the supply planning capabilities * Identifying key process issue areas for improvement and executing plans for improvement * Line management of production planning teamsRequirements * Knowledge of supply planning and wider supply chain principles working in a busy environment * Excellent knowledge of SAP * Comfortable generating procurement proposals with (PP/DS) * Excellent IT skills comfortable with a wide range of data interrogation tools * Effectively use a blend of data and great initiative to make decisions * Provide analysis, reports and information for strategic decision making * Proactive, enjoy problem solving, and root cause analysisIf you are ready for a new opportunity please send your CV, this is an immediate requirement.INFORM3 Recruitment is an equal opportunities employer. By applying to this position, you accept the terms of our privacy policy, please find on our website

item.title: Senior QC Analyst
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Execute analysis of raw materials, in-process material, and finished product in compliance with schedule.</li><li>Complete analysis in accordance with SOP and standard methods.</li><li>Calculation of results and reporting of data, including trend analysis as required.</li><li>Execute analysis of water, cleaning samples, etc. as required.</li><li>Execute calibrations and PM of equipment as required to ensure equipment is appropriate for use for analysis.</li><li>Co-ordinate maintenance schedules with external suppliers to ensure compliance with schedule and in-house procedures.</li><li>Preparation of all solutions, reagents, etc. associated with analysis.</li><li>Execute stock control on laboratory consumables including reagents, solvents to ensure there is adequate supply to execute tasks. Complete purchase orders as required and manage materials on receipt.</li><li>Participate in the preparation of QC documents including SOPs, specifications, method.</li><li>Execute validation studies and transfer studies to ensure equipment, methods, and personnel are appropriately qualified.</li></ul> <p></p> <ul><li>Minimum of 5 years' experience using HPLC and/or GC analytical methods.</li><li>Training or mentorship of junior staff with a similar role highly desirable.</li><li>Good oral, written, and presentation skills</li><li>Sound decision making and problems solving skills to assure business unit compliance.</li><li>Strong analytical skills, ability to analyze data and trends and draw conclusions.</li><li>Good mathematics background with an understanding of basic statistical concepts.</li></ul> <p><br/> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?LmUDS8J591Zy%2fBE2xBec4wf" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Senior Project Manager/Contracts Manager
item.content: Vacancy: Senior Project Manager/Contracts ManagerLocation: DublinSalary: &euro;100K -&euro;120K + package This role is to manage the design and construction of a large scale data centre for the Client / Developer.&nbsp; The Project has a 2yrs programme and the successful candidate must have previous Data Centre experience and will be overseeing both theMain Contractor &amp; Design Team.This is a great opportunity for a Senior Project Manager/Contracts Manager to join one of Ireland&rsquo;s leading developers, who specialise in delivery of large-scale development projects as well as Grade A Offices, Healthcare, Retail, Industrial and Data Centre&nbsp;properties. &nbsp;The Senior Project Manager/Contracts Manager will have worked on large projects within main contractor/developer for at least 7 years consecutively in a similar capacity and have a minimum of 12 years&rsquo; construction experience in total.As the successful candidate your duties will include:Project design brief and design development, coordination of design team and other consultants.Coordination and management of any levies, development contributions, EIS,Traffic studies, archaeology, Demurs report, AA screening, bonds, Part V, compliance, CMP, fire certs, disability access certs, light studies, building control obligations under BCAR such as compliance statements, commencement notices, Assigned and Ancillary certifier appointments.All aspects of Construction phase delivery of projects.Managing HS&amp;E and coordinating the PSDP and PSCS roles and responsibilities.Detailed Programming of works and production of project execution plans.Developing detailed cost plan, packages, schedules and budgets.Produce subcontractor, material, labour, plant and prelim schedules and trackers.Procurement of main contractors, materials, labour, plant and prelim.Manage and monitor project progress, quality and compliance with building regulations.Manage contractor agreements, applications, valuations, certs, with-holding certs, payments and variations.Managing utility provider appointments and designs.Liaising with local authoritiers and relevant State agencies and departments.Managing BCAR documentation and certifications.Liaising with auctioneers, advertising agencies, solicitors, client / purchaser representatives, managing sales documentation and closings.Site TIC procedure and hand over to Local Authorities.Developing in Joint Venture arrangements.About you:Ideally Degree qualified in Project Management/Civil Engineering (or similar); alternatively trade background with right experienceProject management &amp; delivery experience within a safety critical environmentFully conversant with safety regulationsDemonstrable experience with both the commercial &amp; project deliverables on previous projectsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to engage and motivate the people working with youFull Clean Driving LicenseIT LiterateProven ability to lead teams and manage Contractors

item.title: Energy And Sustainability Consultant
item.content: If you are looking for an opportunity to build on your sustainability experience, this is the role for you. My client is looking for someone with 2 years plus experience in a consulting environment with experience in LEED and BREEAM AP.If you want to join a dynamic and growing team please contact Maeve for a confidential chat.Requirements: * 2 years&rsquo; experience as a sustainability/ energy consultant or related position * A degree in Architecture /Engineering/ Environmental/ Sustainability or related subject * Qualifications in the following; LEED AP BD&amp;C / ID+C, BREEAM AP + WELL AP Desirable * Experience with environmental lifecycle assessments and whole life costing desirable * Knowledge of Irish planning legislation would be an advantageThe role: * Develop and manage client relationships (Internally and Externally) * Present evidence of completing the assessment process * Understand and apply the current and proposed Irish sustainability related legislation to project solutions (Building regulations, Local Planning Policy) * Undertake LEED BD+C &amp; ID+C Assessments * Undertake BREEAM International Assessments * Advise clients on all areas of sustainable design and provide solutions * Manage sustainability contributions from varying design stakeholders * Prepare thorough, high quality, technical reports which in a clear concise manner, communicate any issues and conclusions * Liaise with clients and project teams

item.title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer
item.content: The company:One of my best clients within Building Services sector established over 20 years ago is now looking for Senior Mechanical Engineer due to the growth of the business. The company have continued to increase their workload and deliver quality, innovative engineering solutions for our clients even during that difficult times. They have got clients in the UK, Ireland and abroad and they work across a range sectors including Healthcare, Education, Residential, Industrial, Commercial and Hotel &amp; Leisure. The company has now 3 thriving offices and offers a great career progression and help with your Chartership process to become a Chartered Building Services Engineer.The role for Senior Mechanical Design Engineer:The client is looking for a hands-on and focused engineering consultant who can uphold company&rsquo;s approach to quality-driven success. Ideally, you will have Building Services Consultancy Design experience and will be a competent user of Amtech, Relux/Dialux; BIM experience will be advantageous. * A thorough understanding of the theoretical and practical application of their engineering discipline, and a strong understanding of the other disciplines offered by the company. * Proven experience of delivering detailed designs through the full design cycle. * Expert knowledge and experience in the following Mechanical design areas: Water Services, Heating / LTHW, HVAC, Fuel, above-ground drainage and BMS. * Deep knowledge of CIBSE, IEC, BS, IS and EN Standards. * Deep knowledge of Irish building regulations, particularly TGD part B, F, G, L and the ability to demonstrate this knowledge in design and project lead. * Excel at working on several projects simultaneously and show the ability to prioritise and plan work. * Demonstrate a good understanding of other building disciplines in the design and installation of buildings. * Exhibit leadership qualities while working as part of a team. * Ability to make prompt, disciplined project decisions. * Excellent attention to detail and interpersonal skills. * Commercial Awareness.Skills and requirements for the role of Senior Mechanical Design Engineer * Minimum Degree qualification in Mechanical Design Engineering or Building Services * Minimum degree in Mechanical Engineering * Chartership desirable. * 7-9 years building services consultancy design exposure * Expert user of Microsoft office. * BIM experience advantageous. * Experience with thermal modelling, energy assessment, dynamic energy modelling software advantageous

item.title: Graduate Programme UK/IRE 2021
item.content: Have you recently graduated from university and looking for the opportunity to learn, grow and develop within an Industry leading business? If so, we are offering Graduates the opportunity to complete a two year programme &nbsp;&nbsp;in our logistics and shipping divisions. These placements will be across numerous Locations in the UK &amp; Ireland. With a current Group turnover of &pound;2bn, DFDS are one of the largest Shipping &amp; Logistics leaders in Europe.The Graduate Role... Over a two-year rotational programme starting February/ March 2021, you will gain knowledge and experience to build your understanding of our business, our customers, and the wider industry. During your programme you will take part in four placements, these could be at any of our twenty+ sites throughout the UK and Ireland so a willingness to travel and relocate is essential.You will have exposure across multiple operational functions gaining experience within the following areas:&nbsp;Operations - Logistics, Warehousing and ShippingSales / Account ManagementTransport Planning / Co-ordinationCustomer ServiceData AnalysisProject Management&nbsp;A mentor will be assigned to support integration into the organisation and the development of each graduate including the completion of a key business improvement project.What you will need to be successfulWe look for more than just a degree. We look for ambitious, energetic people with the drive to succeed and enthusiasm to deliver customer excellence. You will be a motivated individual who can work in an ever-changing environment. You will be curious, adaptable, collaborative, analytical, commercially aware, and most of all you will be someone who can contribute and share best practice. You will have achieved a minimum of a 2:1 honours degree, preferably but not essentially with relevance to Shipping or Logistics and have a full UK Driving Licence. If this is the Graduate Placement for you, please apply direct or email Sean Harfield&nbsp;at (url removed) &nbsp;for more info

For any additional information get in touch Syntech Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept our T&amp;C&#39;s, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found on our website (url removed)

item.title: Trainee Web Developer
item.content: Trainee Web Developer - No Experience RequiredAre you looking to kick-start a new career as a web developer?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Coding Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee within 20 miles of your location upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part-time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps, you can be placed into your first role in as little as 3-6 months:Step 1 - Front End CodingComplete a selection of professional and industry-recognised coding courses covering HTML, CSS and Javascript. The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes, accessed through a portal that you can study on from home. You can log into the portal at any time, meaning this can be completed around any full-time job.Step 2 &ndash; Full Stack Development + Practical ProjectsYou will be studying all the relevant back end coding languages and gaining skills that will qualify you as a fully-fledged web developer. Step 2 is heavily focused on the practical element of learning. With our Traineeship, you will be practising the skills as you learn them, through our inbuilt labs. You will also be completing projects throughout the course which will be perfect to include in your portfolio to showcase your new skills.Step 3 &ndash; Official Microsoft ExamYou will be prepared to go and sit the official Microsoft 98-383 exam &ndash; Programming using HTML5 and CSS3. Our Student Care team will arrange for you to take the exam at your local Pearson Vue testing centre.Step 4 &ndash; Building your portfolioThe final step will be to build your own portfolio website. The portfolio plays a key part in the hiring process as it gives the employer a real insight into your level of ability, creativity and personality. The portfolio is like a practical extension of your CV as it demonstrates your programming skills and project work for employers to see.Your Web Developer RoleOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training, which includes the online courses, practical projects and building your own portfolio, we will place you into a Web Development/Software Development role, where you will be guaranteed a great starting salary. We have partnered with a number of large organisations strategically located throughout the UK, providing a nationwide reach of jobs for our candidates.At a one off cost of &pound;1295, or 8 monthly payments of &pound;187, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Read through the information? Passionate about starting a career in coding? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.&lsquo;Please note that this is a training course and fees apply

item.title: Site Manager
item.content: Site Manager &ndash; CorkEuro Executive Recruitment has been retained by one of Munster&rsquo;s leading main contractors to recruit a an experienced Site Manager to join their team to cover projects in the Cork area.The Role: * To oversee the day-to-day management of a project of varying sizes, from start to completion. * Manage on site construction team for the successful delivery of the project * Manage all Health and Safety aspects of the project. * Manage onsite supply chain for the projects to ensure timely delivery of project * Oversee quality of the finished product to ensure it adheres to the drawings, details and specification all to the client&rsquo;s expectations. * Manage project programs and monitor progress on site to ensure delivery of completed project. * Hold regular onsite progress meeting with project team and suppliers to ensure a coherent approach to the project. * Contribute to the formulation of the construction methodology and project management plan for the project, adopt and improve these as the project advances. * Comply with company management, quality, and environmental systems. * Represent the Company at all project meetings * Managing client expectations on all contracts to ensure new and existing relationships are developed and maintained.Requirements: * Min 5 years&rsquo; experience working with a main contractor. * 10 years practical experience in construction with previous building experience such as large commercial or residential projects. * You will have over 5 years&rsquo; experience team leading in a similar capacity * Previous experience working on residential projects is advantageous.For more information on this role please contact Kevin Hallissey or to apply, click &#39;Apply Now

item.title: Civils Estimator
item.content: Vacancy: Civils EstimatorLocation: Clare / DublinSalary: &euro;65K&nbsp;&nbsp; - &euro;75K (DOE)&nbsp;&nbsp; 3DPersonnel&rsquo;s client is one of Irelands leading contractors who have grown and developed over the years to become one of Ireland&#39;s leaders in the sector.3D Personnel&rsquo;s client are currently looking to fill the role of Civils Estimator to be based in Clare or Dublin.&nbsp;Your role as Estimator:Obtain competitive prices for materials and sub-contract packagesOversee or complete quote analysis comparisonsCheck and amend rate/price build-ups where necessaryPrepare tender build-ups for internal adjudication and carry out adjustments where necessaryPreparation and collation of relevant information/ documentation for handover meeting, ensuring all teams are suitably briefedRequirements:5+ years&rsquo; experience in a similar roleCivil Engineering or Construction related degree essentialExcellent time management skills and must be able to complete projects before deadlinesStrong analytical skillsAdvanced IT skills

item.title: Cleaner
item.content: This role is for a cleaner in a retail store in Liffey Valley, to work as part of a team to follow a specification to provide a safe and clean environment. General cleaning duties required and an induction will be completed on site

item.title: HGV Technician
item.content: HGV Technician- Environmental / Recycling Business- Northern Ireland / Republic of Ireland border- Up to 37,400&euro; Basic salary, plus bonus and overtime- Benefits: On-site parking, Life insurance, Company events &amp; social hours, Company pension, Employee discounts, and Wellness programmes***This is a Covid-19 Secure Job*** Employer is an Essential Service.&nbsp; Our client is Ireland&rsquo;s leading environmental, waste and recycling management company. Using the latest technology, they produce secondary raw materials and new products from the everyday items people throw away. They offer solutions in Domestic Waste Management, Commercial waste as well as supplying skip hire and managing the Irish councils&rsquo; road sweeping. Our client is a large company with an even larger reputation. Key to their success is having minimal downtime from their skip lorries, bin lorries and waste moving trucks. Ideally they need all of them all of the time. And this is where they need additional assistance. Your role will be to keep their vehicles on the road. Working as part of a team, from a designated service and maintenance site you will service, repair and maintain their fleet of HGVs. You&rsquo;ll be an experienced and skilled HGV technician with electrical and hydraulic experience, either within a fleet maintenance environment or a main dealer environment. You&rsquo;ll be used to working to tight time frames, producing excellent work as well as on occasion finding novel and innovate solutions to keeping a vehicle both legal and on-the-road. In return for your skills and experience our client is offering a great basic salary and benefits. Applications are encouraged from both ROI and UK. If you are applying from outside ROI our client will assist in procuring you a PPS (Your Personal Public Service) number, you&rsquo;ll need to gain access to ROI social welfare benefits. Our client is hiring immediately, so apply today. If you want to know more about this fantastic HGV Technician opportunity, please get in touch with Jimi Matthews quoting 97196, HGV Technician. &copy; Perfect Placement UK Ltd &ndash; See our website for details

item.title: Health and Safety Consultant - Field based
item.content: The Portfolio Group are delighted to be recruiting on behalf of Peninsula, an award winning international organisation providing Business Support, Employment Law, Health &amp; Safety and Employee Wellbeing services to a range of clients.Job OverviewThe Health &amp; Safety Department are looking for hardworking professional Health &amp; Safety Consultant with a high level of technical knowledge and experience, gained within the construction sector. You will have the ability to build strong relationships with your clients and deliver a high quality, cost effective consultancy service. Ideally you will be a chartered member of The Institution of Occupational Safety &amp; Health or equivalent.Day-to-Day ResponsibilitiesConduct yourself in a professional matter at all times (including appearance, use of PPE, communication etc.) ensuring that you comply with both company and departmental policies, procedures and protocolsTo visit clients premises for the purpose of carrying out agreed contractual workUndertake health and safety visits to client&#39;s premises in accordance with departmental protocols and contract requirements, in particular where SLA&#39;s are in placeSubmit any relevant reports or other such associated documents in accordance with client demand and departmental protocolsAdvise and instruct clients in the use of Health and Safety Management systems.Liaise with the HSE and other Enforcing Authorities on behalf of clients when required to do soAdvise clients on matters of Health and Safety standards and best practice affecting their business. Assist clients with accident or other special investigations as requiredAttend company meetings, courses etc. when required to update and maintain professional skills/knowledgeSupporting the client through effective crisis management where requiredPeninsula have a great reputation for providing high quality consultancy services and working as part of the Health and safety team will offer a role with great challenge and variety to develop your career with industry leading training.We seek applications from Health &amp; Safety professionals who can demonstrate excellent skills in managing client relationships, able to offer practical solutions to clients utilising your extensive technical knowledge of Health and Safety. Successful candidates will hold one of the following professional memberships; GMIOSH, GradIOSH, MIIRSM, CIEH, whilst candidates with associate memberships or NEBOSH National Diploma or equivalent will also be considered. (phone number removed)CT01AINDIRE

item.title: MEP QA Engineer
item.content: MEP QA EngineerAn exciting contract opportunity and opportunity for an experienced and enthusiastic MEP QA Engineer to join our client a prestigious and well established tier one construction company in West Dublin. Preferred candidates will be experienced in working in busy contract environments on highly regulated manufacturing projects within the pharmaceutical, semiconductor, brewing, food and beverage industries. M&amp;E contractor experience in roles from construction stage through commissioning to handover preferredThis role is an immediate start, and our client is looking to hold interviews and candidate started on site in the coming 2-3 weeks.Duties will include:Auditing trade qualifications, and validating MEP sub-contractor&rsquo;s site activities.Liaison with sub-contractors to ensure work matches Quality Assurance Plans.Ensure proper maintenance of QA standards and processes.Ensure all materials delivered, installed on site comply to project/ client spec and standards.Walk down of systems and ownership of same to bring to handoverGenerating punch list and closing out same with client.Reporting regularly with project and senior construction management to ensure optimal Quality Standards maintained and adhered to on site.Experience and Skill Sets Required. * Valuable experience with P&amp;ID&rsquo;s and isometrics * Mechanical / Electrical Engineering Degree, Mechanical Trades Certification or equivalent Construction Projects experience * 5+ years&rsquo; experience gained on similar projects role

item.title: Remote Recruiter
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Senior Oracle APEX Developer
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to fill this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Integration of third party APEX plug-ins.</li><li>Suggesting application design enhancements and new product features.</li><li>Evaluating new technology options, recommending the adoption of new technologies.</li><li>Other activities and responsibilities that may be deemed appropriate as required.</li></ul> <p></p> <ul><li>Managing web page layouts with APEX templates and themes, APEX 5 Universal Theme in particular.</li><li>Integrating REST APIs into APEX applications.</li><li>Relational Data modeling.</li><li>Oracle Database performance and tuning.</li><li>Knowledge of web application usability trends.</li></ul> <p></p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?2c9mBmqBU40FpnJbYu6DSwd" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: QC Associate 30283
item.content: Orion Group Life Sciences have an exciting opportunity for a QC Associate for our Multinational Biotechnology client based in the South of Dublin area on a 12-month contract.Job PurposeUnder minimal supervision, successful candidate would be responsible for one or more of the following activities in QC including microbiological testing, method transfers and verification, sample and data management and equipment maintenance. This role is for an experienced and technically strong associate who will spend 90% of their work day performing testing. The successful candidate would contribute to team by ensuring the quality of the tasks/services provided by self and contribute to the completion of milestones associated with specific projects or activities within team.This role will support manufacturing operations, as such some extended hours, shift and weekend work may be necessary as required.Main Responsibilities of the roleEndotoxin testing of water, in-process and drug product release samplesBioburden testing of water &amp; in-process drug product samplesSterility testingWater samplingLab Support duties such as Biological Indicator testing, Growth Promotion, Media Preparation, Identifications and Autoclave.Writing technical reportsPerform analytical testing as a main priority with efficiency and accuracyWith a high degree of technical flexibility, work across diverse areas within the labPlan and perform multiple, complex routine/ non-routine methods and procedures and a large variety of assays.Report, evaluate, back-up/archive, trend and approve analytical data.Troubleshoot, solve problems and communicate with stakeholders.Initiate and/or implement changes in controlled documents.Participate in audits, initiatives, and projects that may be departmental or organizational in scope.Write protocols and perform assay validation and equipment qualification/verification.Introduce new techniques to the lab, including method transfers, reports, validations and protocols.Evaluate lab practices for compliance and operational excellence improvement on a continuous basis.Approve lab resultsDesired Experience and Background of the successful candidateBachelor&#39;s degree in a science disciplineBiopharmaceutical QC experience in a microbiology labExperience with regulatory compliance in cGMP manufacturing and testing of pharmaceutical productsExperience working in endotoxin, bioburden or sterility testingProficient in GMP systems such as LIMS Labware &amp; LMESExperience in a wide variety of microbiological techniques, including but not limited to Bioburden, Endotoxin, Sterility (in an Isolator), Environmental Monitoring, Rapid Micro techniques, Microbial Identification, Media prep, Water Sampling.Understanding and application of principles, concepts, theories and standards of GMP QC microbiology laboratories. Deepens technical knowledge through exposure and continuous learningKnowledge of related regulatory/industry considerations, compliance issues and/or scientific discovery SkillsTake initiative to identify and drive improvementsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFor more information on this role, call Ian Towler on +353 (0) (phone number removed) or email (url removed) for a completely confidential chat about this role and other opportunities using the reference number: (phone number removed)Our role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment

item.title: Strategic Sourcing Consultant
item.content: Strategic Sourcing ManagerAn exciting opportunity to join a well-known telecoms provider as a Strategic Sourcing Manager. You will report into the Data Analytics Manager and we be responsible for working with category sourcing experts to spec, design, build and support category and supplier reporting models.Key Responsibilities: * Work with the IT team to develop and evolve the strategic sourcing reporting functions and capabilities by providing inputs into the development programme * Support testing of delivered features * Develop operational reporting models and scorecards to manage and control the strategic sourcing and audit activities * Collect and share sourcing taxonomy categories with the relevant teams * Ensure the highest level of accuracy across all engagement with supported teamsSkills &amp; Experience: * 3+ years experience in business intelligence * Experience working in a cross functional, virtual team environment * Experience in QlikView/QlikSense development * Experience in Six Sigma * Project Management experience * Worked with multiple ERP&#39;s / SAP * Excellent verbal and written communication * Problem solving skills * Ability to work in a fast-paced environment * Proficient with Microsoft suit applicationsTo arrange an initial interview please apply today

item.title: Civil Engineer / Wind Farm
item.content: Reference: 612ASPosition: Civil Engineer / Wind FarmContract Status: PermanentLocation: Sligo, IrelandSalary: Highly competitive + benefitsCompany Info:This company is one of the most impressive multi-disciplinary consulting firms who can boast innovation and excellence in the development of commercial and civil projects. They are considered to be &ldquo;leading-edge&rdquo; as well as business led Engineers who not only deliver in terms of their design but also work closely with the numbers to ensure that the project and company achieve optimum profitability.They currently have a vacancy for a Civil Engineer to work within the field of renewable energy and wind farms. The position would ideally suit a person who has already worked within this field of work and has a keen interest in the wind farm/energy environment. You will need to have strong project management skills and have a proven track record within the field of infrastructural works, ideally with some level of relevant experience.Responsibilities: * Your role will be focused on the project management and development of their wind energy business. They currently have a number of projects in this area and it is a growing division for the group. * You will be managing the projects from start to finish and offer technical advice and expertise in the office and on site. * Design and construction of the wind farm projects and assessment and report writing * Your role will involve full co-ordination of the team to ensure the effective delivery of the project * High level of client service and focus on providing a level of client attention that will exceed expectationRequirements: * &shy;Experience of working within the wind farm sector is essential. * Strong attention to detail and a proven track record within project management. * Excellent communication skills with English as a first language is essential * Degree qualified as a Civil Engineer or related disciplineIf you&rsquo;re interested in this role, kindly forward an up-to-date copy of your CV in a word format to Andy

item.title: Sales Executive
item.content: Military Autosource (MAS) are currently recruiting for sales positions in Germany and Italy. The positions are located on US military bases throughout the region. No previous experience necessary.Sales Representative - experienced and trainees.Is your current job standing in the way of achieving your goals? If you aren&#39;t where you feel you should be, then you owe it to yourself to explore a career with Military Autosource.The Role:The key purpose of the role is to understand and meet American military service members&rsquo; personal transportation needs and turn them into satisfied customers.All representatives undergo a world-renowned and extensive 3-6 month training programme, ensuring you are given the best opportunity and tools to develop into a highly successful Independent Sales Representative. You will be supported by a member of the Senior Sales Team who will mentor you to achieve success and offer you continual development throughout your career.We give all representatives a chance for personal and professional growth and potential management opportunities, as well as substantial financial rewards and incentives.The Candidate:We are looking for highly driven and passionate individuals who are looking for not just a job but a future career!Essential Criteria: * Due to the nature of the role, all successful candidates will have a valid British, Irish or EU passport and full driving license by start date * No previous criminal convictions * Be in a position to re-locate overseas within 4-6 weeksDoes this sound like you?If you are interested in working for an exciting and pioneering company, then this could be the role for you.All candidates must possess the following attributes to be considered: * Enthusiasm * Competitive * Ambitious * Hard working * Highly drivenWe will be in touch within 7-10 days to make you aware of the next steps.Salary: Guaranteed training allowance, followed by a great commission package with OTE in excess of &pound;45,000 with no upper limit.The Company:Military Autosource is the world-leading, exclusive distributor for many major car and motorcycle manufacturers, including Ford, Lincoln, Chrysler, Jeep, Dodge, Ram Trucks and Harley-Davidson operating throughout Europe and the Middle East. For over 50 years, MAS has been providing service directly to U.S. military personnel who are serving outside of the United States. Military personnel can order a brand new car, truck or motorcycle and take delivery either overseas or upon their return to the United States. This is considered a quality of life program by the U.S. military and is part of a Department of Defence program, which provides preferred pricing and exclusive guarantees to those serving their country.To apply for this position, please complete the short application form on our website by clicking the apply button below.Please Note:You don&#39;t need to fill out the work history section as we will obtain this information from your CV

item.title: Senior Software Team Lead
item.content: SUMMARYAs the successful candidate, you will join a new R&amp;D operation as they grow out their capabilities in Galway city. You will have every opportunity to grow and develop with the operation as it will continue to grow out the team over the next few years. You can expect to be involved in the day to day coding about 60%of your time with the other 40% spent managing, developing, and mentoring your team.DAY TO DAY ACTIVITIES * Provide hands-on technical leadership in the development team. * Drive the implementation of development activities. * Work collaboratively with other stakeholders to understand high-level requirements and develop software architecture and design. * Manage your team in the execution of development plans. * Create and promote best practice in the development and oversee code reviews. * Champion innovation in technologies, processes, and tools. * Mentor and develop your team.WHAT WE LOVE TO SEE * Solid software engineering background, with experience developing enterprise-scale web/cloud-based commercial software products. * Evidence of leading complex software development projects through all phases of the software development life cycle using Agile/Scrum methodologies. * Strong experience with both back-end and front-end technologies * STACK: &ndash; Java, React, Node.js, HTML, CSS, REST, GraphQL, SQL, Spring * Experience with AWS is a plus. * Experience integrating with external systems would be great.Opportunities like this in Galway are rare so if you are interested please apply now for fast consideration. You&#39;ll join a great team with management that have great experience in growing out greenfield software R&amp;D sites. Salary and benefits are very competitive

item.title: Supply Chain Manager
item.content: Distag QCS are a rapidly expanding business, distributing and manufacturing engineering components to Manufacturers and Distributors throughout the UK and Ireland.The company is structured in four closely related divisions: * Hydraulic Components &ndash; hose, fittings, assemblies, steel tubing * Agricultural Trailer Parts and Accessories &ndash; axles, suspensions, braking systems, drawbar components * Bespoke Products &ndash; offering design and production service from drawings or samples, complete outsourcing solutions * Open Drives &ndash; mechanical power transmission componentsThe company&rsquo;s major areas of focus, currently, are the manufacturers of Agricultural Machinery and Trailer Manufacturers, and Crushing, Screening and Recycling machinery.Distag offer a highly entrepreneurial environment for talented individuals to grow in. It is an exciting (and challenging) environment, where the work is varied and absorbing - no two days are the same!The Role:We are seeking a dynamic, committed and ambitious Supply chain manager to join our expanding team, at our facility in Tullow.The successful candidate will be responsible for the process of ordering, monitoring, planning, expediting &amp; controlling stock by: * Running Bi-Weekly, or Monthly stock movement reports, generated by our MRP system * Placing &amp; monitoring stock orders with our global suppliers * Manage overall stock levels in line stock efficiency requirements * Negotiate on pricing and delivery with our global suppliers and transport companies * Liaise with couriers or shipping companies in the event of expediting urgent product requirementsThe successful candidate will need exceptional analytical skills, be highly proficient in Excel and other MS Office products such as outlook and planning. Have very strong organisational skills, and be extremely diligent in day to day tasks.Key Requirements: * Degree, or equivalent, in Supply Chain Management or Business * 3-4 years&rsquo; experience in a relevant Supply chain environment * Strong organisation skills * MS Office suite mainly Excel &amp; Outlook * Hands on approach, with practical skills an advantage * Close attention to detailCandidates will be expected to demonstrate their ability to work on their own initiative, as well as being able to work with a highly talented team, in a dynamic fast-growing business.Salary will match the successful candidate&rsquo;s skills and experience, and reflect the importance we place on this new role

item.title: H&S Manager
item.content: Role: H&amp;S ManagerLocation: CorkSalary: DOERole is mainly based in the Cork office, though the successful candidate should expect to travel from site to site depending on projects undertaking and audits required on site.Duties:. As head of the Health and Safety department the main objective is to minimise accidents and injuries and to promote a culture where safety is placed firmly at the top of the Company&rsquo;s agenda. Maintain the Company&rsquo;s high Health, Safety and Environmental standards, and ensure ongoing development and implementation of improved EHS practices, policies and procedures. Remain abreast new legislation and maintaining a working knowledge of all applicable legislation. Regularly update the company&rsquo;s Safety Statement in compliance with the current regulatory requirements. Develop and maintain company EHS standards, policies, systems, procedures and programs applicable to the Company and projects. Drive and lead site EHS functions to align with corporate goals and develop programs and continuous improvement efforts. Provide EHS leadership and direction for management, professional, technical and support staff across the Company. Provide information, advice and support to site management teams and all employees on all aspects of EHS issues. Liaise with internal and external auditors with particular focus on continuous improvements to the existing management systems, processes and assuring legal compliance. Comply with company ISO Management System requirements i.e. perform your work according to the Company process documents, procedures and maintaining document information/completing department forms/records as required. Maintain department processes and procedures to comply with ISO 45001 and ISO 14001. Help develop and improve company internal processes and management system by reporting corrective actions, updates and improvement ideas. Liaise with the HSA and other outside agencies in relation to EHS matters, including reporting, auditing nand ensuring recommendations and guidelines are fully complied with. Work with department managers to implement a positive EHS culture. Promote a proactive HSE approach/attitude among all employees. Promote employee awareness/training for EHS. Review Preliminary H&amp;S Plans and supporting project documentation prior to projects commencing in order to develop Construction Health and Safety Plans, CEMP&rsquo;s, Traffic Management Plans and Stakeholder Management Plans etc.. Liaise with Local Authorities to ensure all relevant project applications are managed in a timely manner. Develop RAMS registers based on construction programmes. Monitor Subcontractors in relation to compliance with current Company policy. Undertake regular unscheduled audits across projects to ensure compliance with Company policy. Provide detailed job descriptions for all Project EHS Officers, clearly setting out specific roles and responsibilities. Assign KPI&rsquo;s to each position within your team, conduct staff appraisals and monitor and review performance.Assign Project EHS Officers across our sites, being mindful for project requirements. Ensure that safety inspections, audits and all other EHS functions are carried out throughout all sites. Monitor and report on site accidents and incidents and report through internal procedures. Other duties as assigned by senior managementRequirements:. Relevant third level qualification in Health &amp; Safety and Environmental. Have a minimum of 5 years&rsquo; experience in a similar role. Qualified Manual Handling Trainer. Site experience and knowledge of the construction sector. Experience in team management. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Excellent planning, organisational, training, teamwork and presentation skills. Have experience working closely with the HSA to ensure compliance across all projects. Have experience working with ISO45001 and ISO14001. A passion for Health &amp; SafetyFull Clean Driving LicenceBenefits: Competitive Salary, Transport, Private Health Insurance, Pension Contribution, Death in ServiceInsurance, Laptop, Phone and On-site Gym

item.title: Clinical Trial Senior Manager
item.content: Our Client makes a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that they do is their talented and motivated professionals, circa 800 of whom are based in Cork. There they boast vibrant workforce made up of over 44 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.Purpose:The Clinical Development Senior Manager (CDM) is responsible for the recruitment, retention and resource assignment of the Consultants, Associates, and Assistants (study managers) managing trials in the Clinical Development (CD) organization. The CDM provides leadership, direction, and technical/ process expertise to the study managers. The CDM leads the clinical teams responsible for the execution and delivery of the clinical package. The CDM supports execution of the integrated clinical development plans (i.e. compound/indication-level) and clinical trial packages that are aligned with the asset team.Primary Responsibilities:People Management * Recruit, develop, and retain a diverse and highly capable workforce * Ensure robust individual training plans and timely completion of required training for direct reports. * Support and enable talent identification and career development that reflects an end-to-end mindset and demonstrates judgement-based decision making. * Ensure study manager competencies are present and continuously improving. * Manage study manager workload based on portfolio prioritization, regional requirements, and individual level of expertise, and address implications to overall resource management and strategies. * Serves as mentor for study managers and others in the CDDA.Clinical Delivery * As applicable, support clinical development of assigned asset(s) from strategy and profile development through submission, inspection, approval and post-launch support. * Demonstrate strong business acumen, problem-solving skills, and learning agility to help teams plan for contingencies, and adjust to change. * Works closely with the CTPMs to ensure efficient and on-time execution of trials and enables aggregation / roll-up of key trial metrics to track the status of the portfolio. * Utilize regulatory and process knowledge to drive decision-making * Effective ManagementRequirements: * Bachelors Degree, preferably in a scientific or health-related field * Previous experience, at least 5 years in a lead role in the pharmaceutical industry and/or clinical development * Must understand clinical development processes and the interdependencies of various tasks that require coordination among cross-functional team members and third parties * Demonstrated core project management skills through management of complex/cross-functional projects, and/or clinical trials with a strong knowledge of regulations and guidelines * Strong communication skills; able to communicate clearly and succinctly with team members and leadership * Must be capable of managing staff virtually and across geographies/culture * Other Information/Additional Preferences: * Project Management certification (e.g., PMP) * Prior experience in working with external business partners (e.g., CRO, Alliance, Joint Venture) * Prior submission and inspection experience * Prior experience with the management of business plans * Strong self-management and organizational skills; able to manage workload, set personal and team priorities and adjust as needed * Able to influence others without direct authority * Strong problem-solving skills; able to anticipate and recognize systemic problems, diagnose root causes and take corrective actions to prevent reoccurrence * Travel may be requiredOur Client does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

ideally Tractors.Experience with precision farming practices including: Autosteer, ISOBUS and RTK.Skills and knowledge of mechanical, electrical and hydraulic systems to repair Agricultural Machinery.Excellent communication skills, customer service skills, relationship building skills and IT skills.An inspirational leader and team player.Additional Information:This is a permanent full-time position, 37.5 hours per week.Reporting directly to: Managing Director.Salary package:A highly competitive basic salary is on offer, depending on experience.Plus Benefits: Company car, pension scheme, 25 days holiday plus bank holidays, sick pay, private healthcare scheme, life assurance and career development.We thank all applicants who apply for this role. We recruit specifically for all roles within the Agricultural industry and support the recruitment needs of all related clients including; Farms, Agricultural Machinery, Fresh Produce, Food, Horticultural, Equestrian, Finance and Veterinary companies on an International basis. We offer an exceptional service with a personable, yet highly professional approach

item.title: CQV Lead
item.content: CQV Lead candidate must be a highly motivated leader with solid interpersonal skills that allow them to collaborate well with various individuals, groups and departments, in addition to a technical foundation.The successful candidate must have upfront development of the C&amp;Q strategy, Initially, this role will cover the front-end aspects as well as hands-on capability later in project.This project is expected to run until the end of 2023Responsibilities: 1. Lead and coordinate commissioning and qualification activities on a biologics expansion project incorporating utilities, Labs and process equipment. Ensure compliance with HPRA, MHRA, FDA and cGMP requirements 2. Plan and track activities and liaise with the various stakeholders on the commissioning team and the overall project. Provide technical process support to the commissioning team throughout the project life cycle. Participation in HAZOP and design reviews. Oversee the generation, execution and approval of Commissioning &amp; Qualification documentation. 3. Management of vendor engineers and contractors during C&amp;Q activities; 4. Ensure that handover from construction to commissioning is properly defined, documented and in line with project requirements ensuring handover packages are reviewed and complete. 5. Ensure that C&amp;Q activities are scheduled, budgeted and resourced in line with the project delivery requirements. Ensure sequencing of handover of systems is properly aligned with the project requirements. Develop, agree and provide all required trainingBASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Third level degree in a relevant discipline; Proven level of experience in delivering Commissioning, Qualification &amp; Validation (CQV) activities within the biotechnology sector including developing all required Project Validation Plans, Master Plans, System Lists, Commissioning Procedures etc 2. At least 10 years of experience in a cGMP manufacturing environment with minimum of 5 years in a lead role. 3. A proven track record of leading commissioning and qualification activities of complex projects and developing cross-functional initiatives. 4. In-depth understanding of large scale biotechnology unit operations, principles of biochemical engineering, and process data analysis; 5. Strives for results and sets ambitious tangible and measurable targets; takes personal responsibility for achieving results; reviews and evaluates progress against agreed targets, timelines and budgets; 6. Strong knowledge and experience in GMP environment and working within Quality System; 7. Strong knowledge and experience in project management, ASME BPE, and ISPE guidelines; 8. Good knowledge and experience in EHS; 9. Self-motivated with minimum management and Good communications skill; 10. Fluent in written and verbal English communication.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Proven leadership capabilities in a prior role; 2. Able to engage and align other stakeholders outside the project team; 3. Ability to understand and communicate risks and develop and execute contingency plans; 4. Extensive experience in the operation of large scale biotechnology processes; 5. Hands on experience with large scale biotechnology unit operations; 6. Bio-process manufacturing experience is highly desirable; 7. Proven ability to lead cross-functional and technical teams and align, motivate and empower team members

item.title: PLC / SCADA Engineer
item.content: We&#39;re recruiting for a talented PLC / SCADA Engineer to execute Industrial Automation and MES projects for a new biopharmaceuticals manufacturing facility.ABOUT THE JOBAs a PLC / SCADA Engineer you will be responsible for PLC programming, the development of SCADA systems, and then providing technical support for these custom solutions.
