item.title: Medical Device Cybersecurity Specialist
item.content: Job Description:Our client is a world renowned Medical Device company. The position can also be REMOTE.The consultant will be a subject matter leader with a regulatory background and a detailed working knowledge of cybersecurity technologies, standards (e.g. ISO 27001, ISO 27006), practices, policies, and their application in a global medical device market. The role will proactively work with Quality, Regulatory and IT Leaders and business units to implement techniques that meet defined policies and processes for cyber resiliency and vulnerability management. Key activities include risk management (evaluation, control, risk/benefit analysis, residual risk acceptability and reporting), product and enterprise application controls.Requirements&bull; Minimum Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Science, Engineering or Medicine with a minimum of 10 years medical device industry experience, particularly within in vitro diagnostics or other related regulatory affairs environment. Experience with Security, Internet Technology, Risk Management and Privacy Practices&bull; Practical knowledge leadership with well-developed interpersonal, communication skills; management and motivation experience of groups or indirect teams.&bull; Extensive knowledge of Quality Systems, including successful interactions with regulatory bodies.&bull; Must be able to interpret country regulations and guidelines on cybersecurity, and to convert these into practical and pragmatic deliverables. Practical knowledge of regulations (e.g. US FDA cybersecurity guidance) and standards (e.g. ISO 27001).&bull; Must have prior practical program/project management experience.&bull; Experience dealing with international locations and cultures

item.title: Trainee Web Developer
item.content: Trainee Web Developer - No Experience RequiredAre you looking to kick-start a new career as a web developer?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Coding Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee within 20 miles of your location upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part-time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps, you can be placed into your first role in as little as 3-6 months:Step 1 - Intro to DevelopmentComplete a selection of professional and industry-recognised coding courses covering HTML, CSS and Javascript. The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes, accessed through a portal that you can study on from home. You can log into the portal at any time, meaning this can be completed around any full-time job.Step 2 &ndash; Full Stack Development + Practical ProjectsYou will be studying all the relevant back end coding languages and gaining skills that will qualify you as a fully-fledged web developer. Step 2 is heavily focused on the practical element of learning. With our Traineeship, you will be practising the skills as you learn them, through our inbuilt labs. You will also be completing projects throughout the course which will be perfect to include in your portfolio to showcase your new skills.Step 3 &ndash; Official Microsoft ExamYou will be prepared to go and sit the official Microsoft 98-383 exam &ndash; Programming using HTML5 and CSS3. Our Student Care team will arrange for you to take the exam at your local Pearson Vue testing centre.Step 4 &ndash; Building your portfolioThe final step will be to build your own portfolio website. The portfolio plays a key part in the hiring process as it gives the employer a real insight into your level of ability, creativity and personality. The portfolio is like a practical extension of your CV as it demonstrates your programming skills and project work for employers to see.Your Web Developer RoleOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training, which includes the online courses, practical projects and building your own portfolio, we will place you into a Web Development/Software Development role, where you will be guaranteed a great starting salary. We have partnered with a number of large organisations strategically located throughout the UK, providing a nationwide reach of jobs for our candidates.At a one off cost of &pound;1295, or 8 monthly payments of &pound;187, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Read through the information? Passionate about starting a career in coding? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.&lsquo;Please note that this is a training course and fees apply

item.title: Polish Clinical Trial Assistant
item.content: Job DescriptionOur client makes a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 500 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.Job descriptionThe Clinical Trial Capabilities Assistant role provides technical support to the clinical trial capabilities team in support of clinical development. The assistant is responsible for activities related to investigator sites readiness, maintenance and close out. The assistant will ensure inspection readiness through a complete, accurate and readily available Trial Master File. Additional local responsibilities may be required as needed/appropriate for the local geography and/or to cover regional differences.Key Objectives / Deliverables:Clinical Trial Responsibilities * Initiate investigator site activities, including collection and submission of regulatory documents. * Track and ensure site compliance to effectively drive timelines aligned with company priorities * Communicate directly with sites to enable start-up and maintain an active collaboration with sites during maintenance and close-out * Support TPO and investigator payments as appropriate * Manage site account requests * Invoice query resolutions * Identify, communicate, and resolve issues * Accountable for accurate and complete data entry of clinical trial information into various clinical trial systems to allow tracking, performance metrics reporting and to meet regulatory compliance requirements. * Ensure appropriate archiving of documents to meet Lilly record retention polices and regulatory requirements.Qualification Requirements: * Applied knowledge of project management processes and skills * Appreciation of / experience in compliance-driven environment * Ability to learn and comply with regulatory requirements and internal policies. * Effective communication, team work and problem solving skills * Very good attention to details and accuracy * Self-management and organizational skills * Excellent computer skillsLilly does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

item.title: Electrical Project Manager | Europe
item.content: Electrical Project Manager | EuropePermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp;&nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose As Electrical Project Manager you will be responsible for a number of construction projects across the Kirby Electrical Business Unit. The Project Manager plans, organises, leads, coordinates and controls all activities concerned with the construction of Electrical (LV, MV &amp; HV) Projects. The Project Manager participates in the conceptual development of an engineering construction project and leads its organization, scheduling and implementation. He/she is the key point of contact with the client and builds and creates strong, assertive and positive relationships. They ensure that the site meets and exceeds environmental, health and safety standards. They ensure a quality focus and quality outcomes so that the Kirby Group vision, mission &amp; values are fulfilled.&nbsp;Electrical Project Manager Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp;&nbsp; Project Start-Up: Arrange and chair handover of project from estimating department to construction team Liaise with OM in staffing of project Validate project and in doing so develop business plan, cost control system, cashflow and billable schedules, etc. As Project Manager you will be tasked with producing procurement plan, drawing / design plan, construction programme, s-curve and histogram Liaise with client and design team on procurement and engineering issues Develop project safety and quality plans Mobilise sub-contractors and labour in accordance with business plan Mobilise site establishment &nbsp;&nbsp; Project Running Phase: Agree a training plan for staff and operatives particular to your site in conjunction with the OM Manage your site team in the effective day to day running of site activities Ensure compliance with programme, materials deliveries and engineering, quality and safety issues Attend meetings with Clients Hold weekly progress meetings with sub-contractors and ensure that safety and training are discussed Ensure effective cost and sales control in conjunction with Q.S Advise client in good time of current sales plan Ensure productivity at work face is measured on a weekly basis also maintain project progress control Submit monthly internal reports to the OM &nbsp;&nbsp; Project Completion:&nbsp; Ensure testing and commissioning is carried out in accordance with the Quality Plan Ensure final design audit (if applicable) is carried out by the EM Complete and certify all &lsquo;life systems&rsquo; in good time for handover date Ensure all systems are demonstrated to Client and District Surveyor Handover O&amp;M manual and record drawings Prepare final account with the QS, submit and agree with client in line with company objective Demobilise site team and establishment in conjunction with the OM Produce a project close-out report and submit to the OM Archive project Maintain contact with client for warranty period and thereafter when retention monies are collected &nbsp;&nbsp; Other Duties:&nbsp; Maintain a site / day book Attend and participate in monthly project managers meetings Develop your skills in line with agreed training plan Put forward idea&rsquo;s for continuous improvement of company Maintain contact with your client base Maintain excellent working relationships with the client from project start up to project completion &nbsp;&nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Project Manager 3rd level qualification in Electrical Engineering, Building Services Engineering or Strong Trades background. You will ideally possess 10+ years relevant experience in a similar role Experience working on large data centre/Pharmaceutical/Industrial project environments and largescale fast paces office fit outs working under main contractor Worked as the P.S.C.S. (main contractor) Detailed knowledge of the Project Manager role Detailed knowledge of Engineering Commercial knowledge and understanding Health, Safety and Environmental systems and procedures Ability to juggle and manage many priorities Ability to plan and programme Prioritise and allocate time according to priority Assess relative risk and allocate time according Lead and motivate the team Manage performance: monitor, give feedback, and confront issues. Effective communication skills Ability to estimate Using resources at disposal to best effect &nbsp;&nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Project Manager/ M&amp;E Project Manager position or other Electrical Project Manager / Contracts Manager opportunities based in Ireland, UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Sales Executive
item.content: Military Autosource (MAS) are currently recruiting for sales positions in Germany and Italy. The positions are located on US military bases throughout the region. No previous experience necessary.Sales Representative - experienced and trainees.Is your current job standing in the way of achieving your goals? If you aren&#39;t where you feel you should be, then you owe it to yourself to explore a career with Military Autosource.The Role:The key purpose of the role is to understand and meet American military service members&rsquo; personal transportation needs and turn them into satisfied customers.All representatives undergo a world-renowned and extensive 3-6 month training programme, ensuring you are given the best opportunity and tools to develop into a highly successful Independent Sales Representative. You will be supported by a member of the Senior Sales Team who will mentor you to achieve success and offer you continual development throughout your career.We give all representatives a chance for personal and professional growth and potential management opportunities, as well as substantial financial rewards and incentives.The Candidate:We are looking for highly driven and passionate individuals who are looking for not just a job but a future career!Essential Criteria: * Due to the nature of the role, all successful candidates will have a valid British, Irish or EU passport and full driving license by start date * No previous criminal convictions * Be in a position to re-locate overseas within 4-6 weeksDoes this sound like you?If you are interested in working for an exciting and pioneering company, then this could be the role for you.All candidates must possess the following attributes to be considered: * Enthusiasm * Competitive * Ambitious * Hard working * Highly drivenWe will be in touch within 7-10 days to make you aware of the next steps.Salary: Guaranteed training allowance, followed by a great commission package with OTE in excess of &pound;45,000 with no upper limit.The Company:Military Autosource is the world-leading, exclusive distributor for many major car and motorcycle manufacturers, including Ford, Lincoln, Chrysler, Jeep, Dodge, Ram Trucks and Harley-Davidson operating throughout Europe and the Middle East. For over 50 years, MAS has been providing service directly to U.S. military personnel who are serving outside of the United States. Military personnel can order a brand new car, truck or motorcycle and take delivery either overseas or upon their return to the United States. This is considered a quality of life program by the U.S. military and is part of a Department of Defence program, which provides preferred pricing and exclusive guarantees to those serving their country.To apply for this position, please complete the short application form on our website by clicking the apply button below.Please Note:You don&#39;t need to fill out the work history section as we will obtain this information from your CV

item.title: Head of Regulatory Affairs
item.content: Basic summary:&nbsp;To Manage the Veterinary Regulatory affairs team and to achieve new marketing authorisations and maintain existing Marketing Authorisations in an efficient manner in line with company strategy. To act as the qualified person for pharmacovigilance (QPPV) for veterinary products.Essential duties and responsibilities:The functions of the Veterinary Regulatory Affairs Manager include but are not limited to the following:-Maintain Existing Marketing Authorisations World-WideDesign product-specific regulatory programmes and agree priorities and time schedules in conjunction with the management teamOrganise and lead the submission and approval of new products via national, mutual recognition, decentralised and centralised proceduresOrganise and co-ordinate appropriate resources to meet the demands of the Regulatory Programme as agreed with Managing Director/senior management teamManage Veterinary Regulatory affairs team and provide advice to R&amp;D in relation to regulatory requirements for veterinary productsIdentification and Out-sourcing of Animal Studies to Good Laboratory Practice (GLP)Identification and Out-sourcing of Animal Studies to Good Clinical Practice (GCP) approved sitesProtocol design for Clinical / Bioequivalence / Tolerance studiesCommunication with study directors responsible for out-sourced trial workLiaise with regulatory bodies within Europe and with appointed agents in other countriesNegotiate win/win situations with regulatory bodies on issues that arise during assessment.Review regulatory issues in Contracts, Secrecy Agreements and Sales and Distribution AgreementsKeep up to date with changes in global regulatory requirementsMaintaining veterinary pharmacovigilance systemConducting continuous overall pharmacovigilance evaluation during the post authorisation period of productsManaging of the provision to the NCAs or the Agency of any other information relevant to the evaluation of the benefits and risks of a VMPManaging the Preparation of Periodic Safety Update Reports for submission to Regulatory authorities in relation to national, MRP, DCP and centrally approved Marketing AuthorisationsManaging the maintenance of Pharmacovigilance systems (CRF&rsquo;s PSUR data base, Line Listings)Competencies:&nbsp;Organisational skills, personal efficiency, time management skills and the ability to prioritise competing demands are key communication skills.Ability to lead a team and manage diverse personalities and viewpoints.&nbsp;Ability to build relationships and collaborate with others is vital.Strategic decision-making within the business as an influencer.&nbsp;Being able to understand company finances, resourcing and ultimate aims of the business is important role-modelling.A strong working knowledge of best practice processes, change management implementation, coaching and mentoring.Proven people management capabilities. Ability to motivate a team and collaborate cross-functional and across geographiesDemonstrated ability in prioritising key initiatives, driving growth and setting targets and KPIs to monitor the performancePositive and proactive person who is energised by having great responsibilityPractical, action-orientated approach to managing priorities and teams.Strong computer skills in MS OfficeQualifications:Scientific qualification and background preferably B.Sc. or equivalent.Minimum 8 years in a FDA/CVM regulatory/R&amp;D environment preferably with experience of generic applications. Knowledge of EU regulatory submissions would be an advantage.Experience in busy problem solving environment with the ability to work to tight deadlines and on one&rsquo;s own initiative.Detailed technical knowledge of products and processes.Strong Customer Service focus both internally and externallyGood command of technical English (both written and spoken)Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously

item.title: IT Systems Support – Contract
item.content: IT Systems Support &ndash; Contract, DublinOne of Ireland&rsquo;s largest public service bodies, with their headquarters based in Dublin 6, is hiring an IT Operations Analyst (level 3 Technical Support).This role would suit an experienced IT Level 3 / 4 support analyst who is looking for an opportunity to challenged in her or his career.The post holder will require a considerable degree of commitment and adaptability and will be able to prioritise and manage workloads to meet demanding deadlines. The successful candidate shall demonstrate a positive attitude and will require a high degree of self-motivation, will contribute to the wider strategic aims of the business and be able to work in a flexible manner.Key Deliverables:-Support and system maintenance for complex applications.-Provide technical assistance to client teams as appropriate.-Implement technical changes to the system in the Live environment under the supervision of the client&rsquo;s technical resources.-Provide Level 3 technical support to include:-Responding to technical calls escalated from L1 and L2 support teams.-Performing daily health checks on the system.-Liaising with the relevant Live Operations teams as required.-Liaising with external vendors as required.-Communicating resolution to Accenture and client teams.-Work with the client and Accenture management teams to accurately plan and implement future technical enhancements and releases.-Implement all technical changes to the system in the test environment before they are implemented in live.-Execute Technical Tests for all new functionality and fixes prior to release into the live environment.-Liaise with Third Party Vendors on behalf of the client to prioritise issues, fixes and software releases.-Attend Infrastructure Request (IR) meetings to determine impact on relevant environments.-Agree to work towards Continuous Improvement initiatives in collaboration with the client.-Escalate issues in a timely manner, when required.-Provide relevant status updates to team lead.-Monitor and track incidents to resolution.-Assist with prioritisation of issues.-Assist in the preparation of management reports in line with the client and Accenture&rsquo;s requirements.-Develop and maintain knowledge of relevant IT systems.-Keen to learn - seek opportunities to improve own knowledge, skills and performance.Mandatory Skills and experience: * At least 4 years&rsquo; experience in an IT Operations role * BSc or MSc to honours level in a computer science or network related field. * Knowledge in Windows server and desktop operating systems * Knowledge of virtualisation technologies is preferable * Knowledge of ITIL best practices particularly incident management and configuration management beneficial * Experience working with large scale client network Windows 7 &amp; Windows 8 * Customer-focused and customer-first mindset, with excellent customer service and communications skills * Organised, logical, thorough, and proven analytical and problem-solving ability * Self-starter and self-managed. Works on own initiative and ability to carry out activities independently * Assumes personal ownership of operational responsibilities and project tasks * Pays attention to detail and has proven ability to drive out the detail in procedures and documentation * Proven ability to provide ownership of technical issues from assignment until resolution in accordance with Service Level Agreements (SLA)What&rsquo;s on offer: * Excellent Salary depending on experiencePerks/Extras:Competitive packageApply NowIf you would like to discuss this opportunity in person or with one of our IT Resourcers please forward your CV to Vantage Resources or contact Clare Grogan on (phone number removed) for a confidential discussion. Vantage Resources will not forward your details without prior discussion and approval.Vantage Resources is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for engagement and/or employment. An inclusive and diverse workforce is an essential part of the development of our organisation&rsquo;s culture which we believe enhances both our working environment and the service we provide to our customers

item.title: Health and Safety Partner
item.content: Does this sound like you... The role of the Health and Safety Partner will be to ensure compliance with health and safety legislation throughout our entire retail estate in Ireland. To support the team in eliminating enforcement actions and injury claims.You will work closely with the Head of Profit Protection and Safety, the Health and Safety Manager and all retail colleagues, including the Country Manager, Area Managers and Store Management.As the Health and Safety Partner for Ireland, based in Ireland and the role will involve travel throughout NI and ROI. There will be occasional travel to our Customer Support Centre in Walsall to work alongside the wider Health and Safety Team, the role reports to the Health and Safety Manager. How you&#39;ll make an impact... Visiting stores and leading investigations for any major accidents within specific sites and presenting the findings to the Health and Safety teamUndertaking regular Health and Safety audits and inspections, including revisit auditsInvestigating incidents, accidents and complaints and compiling reports for the Retail Team and Health and Safety ManagerDetailed analysis of accident data, providing recommendations for improvements&nbsp; The skills you&#39;ll need... NEBOSH General Certificate in Occupational Health and Safety (or equivalent)Excellent understanding of UK and Ireland Fire and Health and Safety LawExperience of dealing with serious incidents, including enforcement notices of actionMulti-site management experienceFood safety qualification would be desirableFull and valid driving licenceThe finer details:Strong interpersonal and collaborative skillsAbility to influence and drive changeA resilient nature and assertive approach are essentialExcellent communication skills, both written and verbal and have an eye for detail and be able to communicate the critical message(s) to a broad and diverse audience What we can offer... Competitive salary&nbsp;Potential to earn bonus&nbsp;Free on-site car park&nbsp;Onsite coffee loungeLong service awards&nbsp;Additional holiday purchase - (once a year window to apply)Pension&nbsp;Life Assurance About us... Since opening its first store in Burton-upon-Trent in 1990, Poundland, has built a network of over 850 stores in the UK and the Republic of Ireland, offering top brands and great quality own brand products that provide customers with amazing value every day.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Poundland offers thousands of quality products in store with over 1,000 well-known brands in 17 shopping categories including food and drink, health and beauty, household, gardening, DIY, pet, stationery, books, DVDs and toys.&nbsp;It is on a journey from a single price to a simple price point retailer.&nbsp; While the majority of items in its stores are at its original &pound;1 price point, it is extending ranges above and below &pound;1 that also offer amazing value.Now part of Pepco Group with over 2,500 stores across Europe, Poundland also trades internationally in the Republic of Ireland through its Dealz brand. Dealz has a growing store base in both Poland and Spain.Within the UK, Poundland has also rolled out its fashion brand PEP&amp;CO to approximately 300 of its larger stores. PEP&amp;CO, launched in 2015 as a standalone brand, offers customers a full range of women&#39;s, men&#39;s and kids&#39; fashion and is now bringing new style to Poundland with simple low pricing on family fashion that&#39;s hard to find on local high streets.PEP&amp;CO was also nominated in the 2019 Retail Week Awards as Private Label of The Year

Headquartered in metro Atlanta, Georgia, we have offices throughout the world and are part of RELX (LSE: REL/NYSE: RELX), a global provider of information and analytics for professional and business customers across industries.QUALIFICATIONS&bull; Strong knowledge of SPRING framework&bull; Knowledge of JUNIT and Mockito framework for unit tests (or similar frameworks)&bull; Sound knowledge of React Javascript framework&bull; Familiarity of industry best practices &mdash; code coverage.&bull; Basic knowledge of Agile software development methodologies.&bull; Basic knowledge of data manipulation languages.&bull; Knowledge of data storage subsystems.&bull; Knowledge of behavioral and test driven development.&bull; Ability and desire to learn new processes and technologies.&bull; Basic oral and written communications skills.ACCOUNTABILITIES&bull; Write and review portions of detailed specifications for the development of system components of moderate complexity.&bull; Complete simple bug fixes.&bull; Work closely with other development team members to understand product requirements and translate them into software designs.&bull; Operate in various development environments (Agile, Waterfall, etc.) while collaborating with key stakeholders.&bull; Resolve technical issues as necessary.&bull; Keep abreast of new technology developments.&bull; All other duties as assigned.We&rsquo;re a superb company to work for, with great people, world class technology, market leading products, a culture of innovation and collaboration, and superb career prospects.At LexisNexis Risk Solutions, we believe in the power of data and advanced analytics for better risk management. item.title: Senior Continous Improvement Analyst
item.content: Senior Continuous Improvement AnalystOur client is recruiting for a Senior Continuous Improvement Analyst to join their team in Galway. This team works on and supports the delivery of programs and projects to continuously improve manufacturing &amp; operational processes or business services aligned with business strategies. As a change agent in a fast-paced environment, this role will both be challenging and rewarding. This role is commutable from Clare and Mayo. Key Responsibilities&#149; Champion creating continuous flow in multiple process environment&#149; Critically review batch production processes and identify opportunities to reduce lead time, reduce inventory, drive efficiency improvement and improve service levels, through the implementation of lean initiatives&#149; Act as a &lsquo;Change Agent&rsquo; in the introduction of lean tools &amp; principles in manufacturing and drive/sustain improvements by working directly supporting and mentoring Operations and Engineering at all levels&#149; Assist in the identification and organization of resources required to achieve successful initiative/project implementation - Coach individual project teams to enable them to succeed in continuous improvement deployment&#149; Monitor and critically review progress of value streams against plans and achievement of continuous improvement against key performance operations assessment criteria. Responsible for identifying and highlighting further opportunities in delivering improvements in process performance along with identifying opportunities in methodologies that sustain gains&#149; Assist in the definition of project scoping and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders ensuring technical feasibility of Continuous Improvement Projects&#149; The facilitator responsible for assisting the project manager in the successful planning, scheduling and completion of continuous improvement projects. Review detailed project plans to monitor and track progress&#149; Develop skill levels of site personnel to implement and sustain Continuous Improvement. Provide training, coaching and mentoring in lean principles to both direct and indirect including cross-functional personnelEducation, Experience and Skills &#149; Level 8 degree qualified ideally in the Industrial Engineering field or equivalent&#149; Lean Six Sigma certification (minimum Black Belt) with 5 - 10 years post qualification experience&#149; Qualifications / Certifications in Lean Practices a distinct advantage&#149; Experience in AutoCAD / Solid Works an advantage&#149; Experience rolling out &amp; embedding CI methodologies in batch production environment(s) - Confirmed delivery of tangible benefits using CI approach&#149; Excellent analytical skills and a strong visionary of waste reduction&#149; Proven experience in facilitating Kaizen workshop events&#149; Strong facilitation, coaching, motivational and influencing skills&#149; Experience supporting successful project teams, including the development of employees and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders&#149; Demonstrated experience in PIM, VSM, 5s, Cell Design, 3P in a manufacturing environment&#149; Demonstrated self-direction &amp; organizational skills&#149; Excellent problem-solving skills&#149; Excellent written and verbal communication skills&#149; Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office&#149; Proven ability to adapt to changing work priorities in response to a rapidly changing environment&#149; Ensures adherence to quality and safety standards with all improvement effortsFor further information on this role please contact Deirdre Finnerty on (phone number removed)/ deirdre@hero.ieCheck out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website &ndash; (url removed)Please Note: Under its obligation under the Data Protection legislation, HERO Recruitment will not forward your details to any company without your prior approval

item.title: Site Utilities Engineer - HVAC
item.content: Site Utilities Engineer - HVACJob Role * The Site Utilities Engineer - HVAC is responsible for safe and efficient operation and maintenance of all site&rsquo;s HVAC systems in line with relevant auditing (e.g. HPRA\FDA) and safety standards. * Own and manage the site HVAC Utilities throughout facility to deliver compliant systems capable of safe and continuous supplies to all points and users without interruption or impact. * Ensure safe and compliant start up and when in sustaining, an effective Utilities Operation, control and monitoring system. * Lead consistent application of site wide maintenance and calibration philosophy. * Drive operational excellence and continuous improvement mind-set for HVAC Utilities site wide within the Engineering team.Responsibilities * Act as SME for site HVAC Utility systems. Point of contact for all HVAC Utility related queries. * Task Supervisor and Area Owner for all HVAC Utility System related work and timely resolution of issues whilst ensuring compliance at all times. * Management and Control of associated site HVAC Utilities Operational Budget. * Support audits on the HVAC Utility and associate Compliance/Safety programs, ensureing compliance with Safety, Quality, Environmental Regulatory and Corporate requirements. * Support all safety and environmental programmes. Adhere to safe working practices as set out in the Safety Statement and other company safety rules. * Drives the consistent application of maintenance systems, standards and best practice across the various production and support areas to ensure continuous and reliable supply of HVAC utility systems across the site. * Review and approve HVAC Utility system modifications, change requests, and SOP&rsquo;s. * Develop and champion continuous improvement programs that increase the performance and reliability of HVAC utility equipment and systems. * Support Engineering Projects, Validation, Warehouse, QC, QA and other departments on all HVAC Utilities Projects/Issues with regard to specification, scope definition, budget preparation, detailed engineering design, purchasing, inspection, Validation, Installation and Commissioning of all new machinery and buildings. * Participate in risk assessments, inspections, audits and incident investigations. * Lead Deviation investigations within department. * Use lean six sigma tools to drive root cause identification and CAPA completionRequirements * 5 to 10+ years Engineering experience. * Technical qualifications at third level or equivalent in Engineering. * Experience of operation of HVAC equipment within Sterile / Biotech Pharmaceutical sector * Knowledge of safety, GMP and environmental regulatory requirements associated with HVAC. * Demonstrated capability within an Audit environment (specifically EHS and GMP).Desirable * Ability to lead &amp; motivate multi-skilled maintenance technicians. * A proven track record of delivering continuous improvement and value added activities. * Good priority setting skills, and the ability to deal with multiple tasks

item.title: Software Developer
item.content: We have an exceptional new role available in Dublin.As our client expands their office in the city, they now have multiple positions available. One of which is for an experienced Software Developer.You will have the opportunity to work with a multinational software company focusing on architecture and environmental conservation.Our client is the leading supplier of software for their industry and their success can be attributed to their dynamic team, cutting-edge technology and sustainable design. Their software is used globally and the only one of its kind. You will have the opportunity to join a company successfully making an environmental impact and your contribution will benefit generations to come.Some of your experience should include: * 3+ years&rsquo; development experience * Strong C++ and C knowledge * Experience with modern data structures and design patterns * Agile / Scrum experience * Focused on great user experiences * Strong design skills * Experience developing multi-user / multi role, client server applications * Relevant educationSome of your responsibilities will include: * Develop next generation product platform * Convert technical requirements into a solid plan * Specify tests to ensure code is operating as it should * Work closely Product Owners and Design colleaguesAlthough not essential, the following experience is beneficial: * Good Python programming skills * Knowledge of Perforce * Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio * Knowledge of FortranOur client emphasises creativity, collaboration and product ownership. If you would like to be at the forefront of conserving the earth&rsquo;s natural resources, then this could be the role for you. For this Software Developer role, our client offers an excellent package. This includes a competitive salary, flexible working hours, pension, health insurance and additional holidays. You will also have the chance to be involved in creating cutting-edge technology that will help the environment across the globe. For more information on this Software Developer role, contact Eddie on (phone number removed) or eddie@carrickrecruitment.ie

item.title: Cost Accountant
item.content: Cost Accountant County Louth &euro;30-40kMy client, a global Manufacturing company has an immediate requirement to recruit a Cost Accountant to join their team.The successful candidate will be working within a busy environment tasked with maintaining and improving the cost accounting functions ensuring company accuracy and compliance targets are met.Responsibilities * Ensure all materials are accurately recorded and documented * Preparation of standard costing for new items * Interrogating of data and analysis/reporting * Play a key role in supporting the development of the cost accounting processes * Performance and productivity analysis * Budget modelling, forecasting and project analysis * Prepare reports and ensure variances from forecasts are explainedRequirements * 2 years cost accounting experience * Experience of a manufacturing environment with understanding of bills of materials * Advanced Excel and analysis skills. * Good communication skills with the ability to make decisions and apply judgement using own initiative * Ability to multitask, prioritise and manage time efficientlyThis is an excellent opportunity with a growing, stable business which offers personal development and a career path. If you are interested in this position please apply with a copy of your CV.INFORM3 Recruitment is an equal opportunities employer. By applying to this position you accept the terms of our privacy policy which you can find on our website

item.title: Mechanical Commissioning Lead
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to fill this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Carry-out commission-ability reviews and recommend commissioning requirements</li><li>Develop mechanical commissioning activity schedule</li><li>Develop mechanical pre-commissioning checklists from project specifications</li><li>Manage a team of engineers and supervisors across multiple commissioning activities running concurrently</li><li>Attend Client commissioning meetings</li><li>Chair internal commissioning meetings</li><li>Produce regular commissioning reports</li><li>Develop commissioning KPI's to monitor & highlight progress</li><li>Review vendor O&M's and ensure compliance with project specifications</li></ul> <p><strong></strong></p> <ul><li>Minimum 8 years' experience in commissioning of mechanical systems with a minimum 2 years in commissioning management position</li><li>Must be a team player but capable of working on own initiative</li><li>Full M&E system interface knowledge essential, electrical commissioning knowledge an advantage</li><li>M&E contractor experience in roles from construction stage through commissioning to handover preferred</li><li>Mechanical Engineering/equivalent 3rd Level required, accreditation with a recognised commissioning body a distinct advantage</li><li>Data Centre construction & commissioning experience an advantage</li><li>Excellent fault finding & rectification skills</li><li>Excellent people management and communication skills required</li></ul> <p> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?M6cLAoMN8pNpwQl%2fhRknmAx" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: QA Engineer
item.content: I have an exclusive new role available for a QA Engineer. It is with an innovative software house in Dublin who have big growth plans for 2021. They are looking for their first QA Engineer, so in this role you will have the autonomy to set all of the processes and strategy for QA. You can choose the tools, frameworks etc that will be used Their tech stack is Microsoft - C#/.Net/ Azure etc but they are flexible on the technology to be used for automation - it is your call! Ideally, they would like to automate as much of the testing as possible but again this will be up to you Currently they are working 100% remotely due to the pandemic and will allow up to 80% remote after (but you would need to be in the office at least 1 day every week).RequirementsComputer Science Degree (or similar)ISTQB certification desirableAt least 3 years experience in a QA engineer roleExperience setting up test automation frameworks - Selenium or similarStrong coding skills, ideally C#Experience setting the process / strategy for QAAzure experience This is an ideal role for a mid-level QA Engineer with strong technical skills who is keen to grow their career. This company will be growing so there is the potential for this to develop into a lead roleFor more info on this, or to find out what other QA / Test roles are available, contact Seamus at Reperio. Or apply by sending your CV through the linkReperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: Cyber Security Trainee
item.content: Trainee Cyber Security Analyst - No Experience RequiredAre you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Cyber Security Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps, you can be placed into your first role in as little as 8 weeks:Step 1 - Online TrainingThe first step is completing a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised IT Support courses by CompTIA, Microsoft and Cisco. The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study from home. You will also be assigned an expert tutor to help you throughout your training.Step 2 &ndash; Practical TrainingYou will gain the practical experience by using our cutting edge Livelabs. Gaining hands-on experience is essential in today&rsquo;s IT industry for both certifications and keeping up to date with new technologies. Theory is often not enough these days, companies require hands on practical experience to make sure you&#39;re job ready.Step 3 &ndash; Official examsYou will then go on to sit the CompTIA A+ exams to give you the official certifications which will be recognised worldwide. The CompTIA A+ is the most commonly asked for certificate in entry level IT roles.Step 4 &ndash; IT Technician placementYou will be placed into your first role as an IT Technician. You will need to gain two years experience in this role before you can progress into a cyber security analyst role. While working as an IT Technician, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to move into the cyber security field. This will consist of online training, practical training and an official exam.Cyber Security RoleOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training in step four and have the required two years experience in the IT industry, you will be ready to move into your Cyber Security Analyst role. We have partnered with a number of large IT companies who have a massive shortage of qualified cyber security staff.At a one off cost of &pound;945, or 8 monthly payments of &pound;137, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Read through the information? Passionate about starting a career in IT? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.&lsquo;Please note that this is a training course and fees apply

item.title: Lab Supervisor
item.content: Team Horizon currently has an exciting opening for a QC Supervisor to work on our client&rsquo;s modern &lsquo;bulk tablet&rsquo; finish facility that manufactures solid and capsule formulations.As the new Lab Supervisor you will support the QC team to perform the analysis of raw materials, bulk, and finished products in compliance with current quality criteria, respecting deadlines, and managing costs. In addition, you will maintain technical and systems excellence in the laboratory by coaching and training analysts to ensure right-first-time behaviour by implementing improved working practices in terms of efficiency, and compliance.Why you should apply: * Join a company that has developed a stand-out culture of innovation, inclusion and development, and consistently features as a great place to work. * Generous package with good base salary and benefits to including but not limited to health insurance, pension and bonus. * Join an organization who embrace diversity, equality and inclusion and puts patients first. * Work with innovative new technologies, in combination with the depth of expertise that exists within the local workforce, that have allowed our client to develop and deliver products and processes to support their wider global needs. These range from small scale clinical trial supply to large commercial manufacturing.What you will be doing: * Allocate the work of the department to the QC staff to ensure effective schedule adherence * Supervise the work performed in the QC department and perform annual appraisals of QC staff while insuring up to date training and development * Control products (raw materials, intermediates, and finished products) by following procedures (general, specific, of analysis and use, and qualification of equipment) so as to meet schedule demands * Review analytical data and approve and release material as defined in relevant procedures * Coordinate and manage equipment maintenance and repair activities * Deliver operating budgets, ordering, and supervise expenditure * Maintain an awareness of technical developments for instrumentation analysis and schedule training for the team as appropriate * Perform investigations, and ensure a follow-up on anomalies, failures, and external complaints * Implement and manage change control systems for QC activities including assessment of changes for impact and develop action plans * Ensure appropriate procedures are in place by preparation and review of SOP&rsquo;s, methods, and specifications. * Complete documentation reviews, reports, preparation, and trending activities to ensure compliance * Ensure QC activities are executed as prescribed by in-house procedures and in compliance with requirements of cGMP and relevant safety standards. * Participating and follow-up the audits and/or inspections carried out at the site by the authorities or clients * Prepare and review QC department reports and metrics e.g. monthly quality report, analysis trending reports, exceptions reports, KPI reports, etc. * Communicate to senior management on key events and issues etc. via normal in-house reporting structure e.g. meetings, formal reports, etc. * Develop technical specifications and project justifications as required * Establish project schedule and key milestonesWhat you need to apply: * 3rd level qualification in a relevant Science discipline * Minimum 4 years of analytical experience in the pharmaceutical industry with supervision experience essential. * Proven track record in an analytical role. Must be expert in HPLC, GC, LCMS, GCMS, Automatic titration, Identification techniques. * Strong knowledge of regulatory requirements. * Proficient in using analytical equipment in the QC lab. * Involvement in product transfers/method transfer experience preferred. * Results-driven striving to meet all targets and metric standards as set by department/site and division leaders

item.title: Hiring Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Account Receivable with fluent German
item.content: O2C AR AnalystResponsibilitiesThe primary role of the O2C AR Analyst is to assume direct responsibility for the Credit Management of their Affiliate customers. The main objective is to reduce the risk of financial loss to the Company. * Be seen as a &ldquo;go-to&rdquo; information resource for O2C AR credit management queries * Effectively analyse all customer financial statements, payment trends &amp; financial ratios to recommend creditlimits to the affiliate process owner * Analyse account discrepancies to ensure the customer account is enabled for payment * Manage the monthly Aged Debt review for your affiliate including the underlying analysis &amp; the overallpresentation &amp; follow ups * Prepare &amp; present Quarterly Credit Committee data for Global Treasury and Affiliates CFO&rsquo;s. * Execute Sales Order credit release in a compliant &amp; timely manner on a daily basis * Review key metrics &amp; communicate to stakeholders to ensure KPIs are being met &amp; improved * Support global/regional O2C projects with influence on excellent credit management * Support the overall O2C AR team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members andtraining of new team membersBasic QualificationsUniversity Degree in Accounting/BusinessDemonstrated knowledge of Order to Cash work stream with a minimum of 2 years experience in a multinational Shared Services environmentMinimum 2 years customer facing experience.Must demonstrate strong telephone communication skills with ability to influence and negotiateFluency in English + GermanExcellent active listening skills with effective verbal skills to respond to customers with a rational and empathetic manner.Able to respond flexibly and empathetically to customer needs, managing their expectations effectively.Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills, written and oral communication skillsAccuracy and attention to detailHigh learning agility in a fast paced environmentProblem solving skillsTo be able to translate business goals into specific objectives, and specific objectives into detailed needsTo translate the information into meaningful understandings that are directly applicable to any project assignedAbility to demonstrate process improvement skillsTo be able to compare solution options, and evaluate how well they meet a particular needAbility to develop strong working relationships with various levels of personnel in the company&rsquo;s Financial Organization, Affiliate Organization, customers, third party providers, and external auditorsGather information efficiently and recommend solutions persuasivelyAble to work under pressure, juggling short deadlines, multiple priorities and concern for maintaining standards.Good time management skills.Effective prioritization showing ability to be flexible whilst meeting customer needs and managing their expectations.Proficient with Microsoft Office software (Excel, Word, etc&hellip;)Additional Skills/Preferences * Compliance and controls experience * Strong customer service skills * Second fluent language * SAP experience

item.title: Chemical Engineer
item.content: Chemical EngineerWhy work for this company?Our client discovers, develops, manufactures and commercialises medicines, vaccines and diagnostic products, which are complemented by bio-devices, genetic tests and a range of services. They serve veterinarians, livestock producers and people who raise and care for farm and companion animals in more than 100 countries.Company Profile65+ years of experience in animal health.Nearly $6 billion annual revenues.25 manufacturing sites around the world.10,000 employees worldwide of which 1,100 employees are committed to R&amp;D. Responsibilities Support process &amp; facility start-up initiatives.Support HAZOP/ process risk assessments plan.Support the engineering department in the application of Process Safety elements. Assist with technology transfer of API processes, including process fit, identification of equipment needs, and facility modifications.Provide oversight for Mechanical Integrity Programs (I&amp;E, Fire Protection, Equipment, RVs, Piping, etc.)Collaborate closely with Operations colleagues in the preparation of Master Batch Records and execution of process HAZOPs, Hazard identification, risk assessments and chemical agent risk assessments and FMEAs for tech transfer of API processes.Supporting improvement of chemical manufacturing process safety performance, product transfers and new product introductions.Assist in the design and implementation of reliable and cost-effective engineering solutionsFacilitate the management of change processes from a process safety perspective.Collect and analyze technical data, generate reports including conclusions and recommendations where needed.Manage close out actions for production/projects etc. RequirementsAn honours degree in Chemical Engineering or related discipline.Minimum 6years&#39; experience in Pharmaceutical Manufacturing.Experience working in an API environment.Knowledge of mechanical systems (HVAC systems, power generation, utilities)Ability to read engineering drawings.Mastery of chemical engineering principles, practices and theories with pharmaceutical experience.Experience with scale-up techniques for processes from laboratory to plant scale.Due to a high volume of applications only those progressing to the next stage will be contacted.Randstad encourage applications from individuals of all ages &amp; backgrounds. Whilst appointments will be made on merit alone candidates must be able to prove their right to work in the UK or the Republic of Ireland (as relevant). Randstad acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment &amp; an employment business for temporary recruitment as defined by the Conduct of Employment Agencies &amp; Employment Business Regulations 2003

item.title: Remote Recruiter
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Architectural Technician

Seeking to expand their international existing team, this firm are looking for an experienced Architectural Technician seeking to grow and develop in a fast moving environment.The company has operations in Cork, Ireland and the UK and they have a consistent stream of work ahead of them. They work predominantly with the manufacturing arena as well as pharmaceutical companies who enjoy their efficiency of work and their expert knowledge. Due to increased demand, the team are seeking an additional Architectural Technician to add experience and knowledge to the group.Responsibilities:- You will be accountable to produce drawings/designs for a range of projects.- Liaise with clients and contractors on projects to ensure the design process is carried out to all requirements- Performs design/drafting assignments, requiring advanced working knowledge of design/drafting standards, practices and techniques.- Works collaboratively in a team environment with other Technicians and Architects with minimal supervision.- Actively promotes and contributes to the successful completion of projects from initial concept, through the planning process to implementation.- Assumes responsibility and meets or exceeds deliverable deadlines for own portion of the project scope, schedule and budget.- Confidence and accuracy using AutoCAD and use of Revit.- You will be working as part of a team and therefore a good team work ethic is essential.Requirements:- You will be a qualified Architectural Technician with ideally 5-15 years experience.- Proficiency in AutoCAD and Revit and have a good understanding of BIM.- Strong and clear communication skills and the ability to deal effectively with clients- Ability to work as part of a team.- Exhibits planning and organisational skills with the ability to work under pressure on multiple project deadlines.- Demonstrate ability to see a project through to completion.- Existing experience in Ireland would be an advantage but not essential.- Must be an EU citizen or eligible to work in Ireland

item.title: QC Analyst 4740
item.content: Responsibilities This position is responsible for carrying out tasks and projects related to equipment, lab utilities and testing procedures as required by Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP). Partners with other Departments to ensure that all QC testing activities are completed in an efficient manner. General Responsibilities * Achieves competency in laboratory methods and procedures. * Trains other QC analysts in laboratory methods and procedures * when required. * Performs analytical testing activities in relation to method * validation and technical transfer activities to ensure that all * methods meet ICH, USP and EP guidelines. * Executes validation, operation, maintenance, calibration and * troubleshooting of equipment and its associated software. * Writes, executes, reports and reviews IQ/OQ and PQ protocols to * ensure that all relevant equipment is qualified for cGMP use. * Performs routine and non-routine analytical testing activities. * Review and approval (where appropriate) of laboratory test * results. * Ensures that testing and results approval are completed within * agreed turnaround times. * Writes and reviews laboratory TMs, SOPs and WIs as directed by * company policy. * Ensures QC activities are carried out in compliance with product * license commitments, cGMP and company quality standards. * Is an active member of the QC group and provide assistance with * other group activities as required and communicates relevant * issues to the QC Team Leader and Manager. * Deals with non-conformances/ deviations in an accurate and * timely manner. * Deputizes for the QC Team Leader as appropriate. * Maintains and develops knowledge of analytical technology as * well as cGMP standards. * In process control testing and activities to support the production * units. Qualifications and experience * A third level qualification of a scientific/technical discipline is * required. * Knowledgeable of FDA/EMEA regulatory requirements applicable * to biologics and/or pharmaceuticals. * Builds strong productive relationships. * Demonstrates ability to work with teams and individualsOur role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment

item.content: General Operative (Fork Lift Certified)Ashbourne, Co Meath&euro;11.50 &ndash; 12.50 per hourBoden Group are working with a global Facilities Management business who are looking to take on a General Operative for a site in Ashbourne, Co Meath. You&rsquo;ll be responsible for delivering hygiene and waste services to an excellent standard, and carrying out any tasks on-site that require Fork Lift Truck training. This is a full-time permanent position working 39 hours a week Monday-Friday, with immediate interviews and start.You&rsquo;ll need to have experience in an industrial setting, preferably food manufacturing or similar, with knowledge of working to GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) processes. The successful candidate will also need to hold a Fork Lift Truck licence.Key Duties and Responsibilities: * Delivering all hygiene and waste services on site to an excellent standard. * This will include bin gathering and waste removal, keeping truck and loading bays clear, emptying bins and ashtrays around the site, and working with external suppliers to coordinate waste collections. * During winter months you will also be required to ensure all roads, walkways and loading bays on site are fully gritted and safe to use. * Supporting the Supervisor and on-site team with any tasks that require Fork-Lift use * Make sure yourself and the team are wearing correct uniform and PPE, and following company Health &amp; Safety policies at all times * Follow good Manual Handling practice at all times * Ensuring any accidents or incidents are logged and recordedWhat you&rsquo;ll need to succeed: * Must hold a FLT (Fork-Lift Truck) licence * Valid SafePass * Full clean driving licence * Excellent verbal and written communication skills * Experience working in a manufacturing environment (knowledge of GMP would be useful) * Able to work alternative hours, shifts and unsociable hours where required * Great team-working skills, able to meet challenging targets and multi-taskIf you&#39;re interested in this role, please apply via this advert with your up-to-date CV.If this job isn&#39;t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position within Facilities Management in Ireland, please get in touch with Marlie at Boden Group for a confidential discussion about your next move

item.title: Sales Executive
item.content: Military Autosource (MAS) are currently recruiting for sales positions in Germany and Italy. The positions are located on US military bases throughout the region. No previous experience necessary.Sales Representative - experienced and trainees.Is your current job standing in the way of achieving your goals? If you aren&#39;t where you feel you should be, then you owe it to yourself to explore a career with Military Autosource.The Role:The key purpose of the role is to understand and meet American military service members&rsquo; personal transportation needs and turn them into satisfied customers.All representatives undergo a world-renowned and extensive 3-6 month training programme, ensuring you are given the best opportunity and tools to develop into a highly successful Independent Sales Representative. You will be supported by a member of the Senior Sales Team who will mentor you to achieve success and offer you continual development throughout your career.We give all representatives a chance for personal and professional growth and potential management opportunities, as well as substantial financial rewards and incentives.The Candidate:We are looking for highly driven and passionate individuals who are looking for not just a job but a future career!Essential Criteria: * Due to the nature of the role, all successful candidates will have a valid British, Irish or EU passport and full driving license by start date * No previous criminal convictions * Be in a position to re-locate overseas within 4-6 weeksDoes this sound like you?If you are interested in working for an exciting and pioneering company, then this could be the role for you.All candidates must possess the following attributes to be considered: * Enthusiasm * Competitive * Ambitious * Hard working * Highly drivenWe will be in touch within 7-10 days to make you aware of the next steps.Salary: Guaranteed training allowance, followed by a great commission package with OTE in excess of &pound;45,000 with no upper limit.The Company:Military Autosource is the world-leading, exclusive distributor for many major car and motorcycle manufacturers, including Ford, Lincoln, Chrysler, Jeep, Dodge, Ram Trucks and Harley-Davidson operating throughout Europe and the Middle East. For over 50 years, MAS has been providing service directly to U.S. military personnel who are serving outside of the United States. Military personnel can order a brand new car, truck or motorcycle and take delivery either overseas or upon their return to the United States. This is considered a quality of life program by the U.S. military and is part of a Department of Defence program, which provides preferred pricing and exclusive guarantees to those serving their country.To apply for this position, please complete the short application form on our website by clicking the apply button below.Please Note: You don&#39;t need to fill out the work history section as we will obtain this information from your CV
