item.title: Programme Manager
item.content: AIRPORT PROGRAMME MANAGERDESCRIPTION:Under general direction, the Airport Programme Manager will be responsible for managing cost, schedule, and contract performance of major programs or series of programs, within the Airport Authority including:Plans, organizes and integrates company resources required to successfully manage the program(s) and meet contractual obligations.Establishes goals and objectives for the program team and obtains their commitments to those goals.Is the main interface for the Program Management group working with customers delegating specific contract roles to other team members.The three primary criteria for a successful delivery of programs are on-time, on-budget and meeting customer expectations.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Develops with the team and presents to management the overall program status on a continuous basis as required.Establishes program budgets with program team members and maintains effective cost and schedule controls.Analyzes and resolves minor subcontractor performance issues and advises Program Management of major subcontractor performance issues. Recommends corrective course of action(s).Monitors and assesses performance; identifies problems and institutes corrective actions as requiredEstablishes goals for program and objectives for team members communicates those results to individuals and functional management at conclusion of program.Disseminates contract or proposal requirements to all team members. Performs or delegates, as required, internal and customer coordinator of activities.Serves as main point of contact for customer for all program goals, issues, and initiatives, and coordinates with program management team members to accomplish all contract deliverablesProvides day-to-day program interface with main customer and other key program stakeholders along with key service program management team members, including preparation and delivery of financial and performance data and analytics, and communication to customer at monthly program management reviewsEnsure all program and contract deliverables are met, drive internal and external customers in the completion and optimization of contract performance.Coordinates the on-time delivery, storage, install, test, commissioning, and hand-over of equipment with high customer satisfaction.Manages and coordinates contractual correspondence, and drafts contractual letters when necessaryManages and evaluates financial and technical trade-off analyses required for proposed changes in a program.Assigns individual responsibilities for each segment of work. Authorized work and releases budgets to all team members.Develops procedures to facilitate efficient production flow for product line products; recommends measures to improve methods, performance and quality. Suggests changes to overall efficiency.Interfaces with all major subcontractors to discuss program status and cost/schedule performance.Coordinates proposal preparation, statements of work and specifications.Responsible for follow-on work with on-going customer(s), and project(s).The duties and responsibilities may change from time to time without notice and include but are not limited to the duties described above.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:Bachelor&rsquo;s degree (BS) in Computer / Electrical / Mechanical / Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or related field required.A minimum of 5 years of related program management experience, knowledge of government programs and contract management preferred.International, and multicultural business experience is a requirement for this position.Past experience managing program management administrative staff is a plus.Knowledge of MRP and/or ERP/CRM systems preferred.PMP Certification is preferred for this position.OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills are required for effective interface with internal and external customers.A strong background in digital x-rays or other 2-D imaging systems technology is a must for this position.Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and to effectively present information and respond to questions from management and customers is essential.Must be proficient with Microsoft office applications.Must be able to travel on regular basis a minimum of fifteen percent (15%) of the time to key customers and suppliers.Must be able to successfully negotiate pricing, terms and conditions with range of suppliers and customers.Ambitious, transparent, empathetic, hard-working, benefit focused, result oriented, team player with effective communication and strong leadership skills

A commitment to further developing German language skills will be required. item.content: National Account Manager | Fresh Produce | Ireland Salary - &euro;45,000 - &euro;60,000 dependent on experience About the client:- We are working with a large and very successful Fresh Produce business who have a strong presence in the UK, Ireland and Internationally. As a result of the significant growth of one of their Key Retailer Accounts, they are now looking for an experienced National Account Manager to take control of their Irish accounts. About the job:- You will be the main point of contact for one of their major retail customers and acting as the ambassador for the business. It will be your job to work closely with the customer to identify the opportunities in the various categories you will be involved in. Armed with this, you will be in the best position to find the win-win scenarios. The Ideal Candidate:- Naturally a background in retail account or commercial management is crucial. Fresh produce would definitely be an ideal, but actually understanding very short shelf life product would be OK as well. You will need to be able to work well on your and be driven to grow the account as much as possible. You will be supported by a very experienced team in the UK and will have access to some of the best produce in the world. item.title: HSEQ Manager
item.content: Role: HSEQ ManagerLocation: Kildare * Provides advice, guidance, and instruction on all HSEQ matters to all persons working in the Company, including employees, Sub-contractors, Suppliers and Visitors to sites. * Manages, updates and maintains the company Integrated Management System and ensures the continual improvement of the systems, in conjunction with the Factory and Project H&amp;S Teams. * Manage the development of standardised systems and documentation across all projects and premises. * Act as the primary point of contact for external audits from certification and statutory bodies, such as SCCS, EPA, HSA, etc. * Assist in the preparation of tender submissions and pre-qualification documentation. * Represent the company at tender submissions and industry events if required. * Assumes the responsibility for Occupational Health &amp; Safety within the company. * Prepares, agrees with Directors, and installs a Safety Statement and ensures compliance with stated Safety Policy and Health and Safety Regulations. * Liaises with all Company Management Sections and engages all personnel in a united effort in accident prevention and ensuring healthy working conditions. * Chair EHS Meetings across all projects to ensure a unified approach. * Order work to stop if of the opinion that, any activities represent a serious risk of personal injury to persons in that area. * Completes Site Safety Inspections on projects in liaison with Site Management, recommends improvement and reports to the Project Managers. * Ensures that full co-operation is given to all Safety Representatives that are elected and that adequate time and training is provided for discharge of their duties. * Ensures Project Specific Safety &amp; Health Plans, Quality Plans and Environmental Plans are developed for individual projects where required and recommends relevant procedures and personal protective equipment. * Reviews or follows up where necessary on Inspection Reports, Health and Safety suggestions, complaints, and requests for information. * Carries out Investigations to establish cause of accident, incident or dangerous occurrence and recommends for future avoidance. * Arranges for training of employees at all levels in conjunction with Site EHS Teams. * Assists in on-going training of employees as requested. * Acquires and distributes HSEQ publications, literature, and materials. * Arranges for the regular active monitoring of the implementation of health and safety policies and procedures such that the key health and safety objectives of the project can be achieved, maintained, and improved upon. * Ensures that Sub-contractors have been properly vetted prior to commencement and that all required documentation is received * Ensures that adequate protection is provided to protect the public and particular attention is given to ensure children are kept clear of the work area at all times. * Take immediate action where unsafe working conditions/practices are observed and make appropriate corrections, including disciplinary action if merited. * Advise and Assist in the enforcement of the controls put in place across our workplaces to minimise the transmission of COVID-19 and lead by example in the wearing of appropriate PPE

item.title: Electrical Quantity Surveyor | Dublin
item.content: Electrical Quantity Surveyor | Dublin &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. &nbsp; Role Purpose The role of Electrical Quantity Surveyor will have you working across various contracts ensuring the maximum commercial benefit for the company and will entail a cradle to grave delivery from tender stage through to final accounts and all-encompassing duties in between. &nbsp; Electrical Quantity Surveyor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Skilled and budgeting, reporting, developing BOQ&rsquo;s, profit plans. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Good communication skills. Undertake and manage interim commercial meetings with the Client and Internal Project Team. Report in detail as required for the Project Manager on the commercial status of the project. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Manage subcontractor accounts, interim valuations and final accounts. Ensure payment certificates are processed and payments are made per the agreed sub-contract and procurement terms. Retentions apply as per agreements. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As a member of the commercial team, the Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be tasked with administering the contract obligations and meet additional Client requirements. Issue interim and final accounts and progress applications per project and contract requirements.&nbsp; Monthly applications to be all inclusive of accurate remeasures, site changes, dayworks and any applicable contract claims. Identify escalations, material or labour, as appropriate. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ability to identify potential commercial risks and ensure prompt reporting of same to Senior Management. Follow direction of Senior Management in undertaking work duties. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have a practical understanding of scheduling and the associated commercial implications. Ensure close collaboration with Planning Engineer regarding accuracy of progress reporting. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be capable of costing and agreeing daily work changes to include managing the subcontractor remeasurement of contract works, site dayworks and site change orders. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain accurate records and provide necessary detailed backup to support commercial tracking and costing. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ability to work on own initiative and can prioritise without direction. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Speed and accuracy of information a priority. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Negotiate, as necessary, with clients or their representatives. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Set an example of enthusiasm, loyalty and hard work in the performance of all duties. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Quantity Surveyor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Minimum 4+ years of Quantity surveying experience essential on Electrical Projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3rd level qualification in Construction Economics / Quantity Surveying ideally coupled with a technical background as either Electrician or Electrical Engineer &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Experience working on electrical value projects in-excess of &euro;4million within the data centre, pharmaceutical, industrial or commercial sectors. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Proficient in excel. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Detailed knowledge of commercial management and QS Role within construction &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Knowledge of contract conditions and their applications &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Overall understanding of the business, client and Sub Contractor relations, and installations &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent Communication/Interpersonal Skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent Record Keeping and Administration Skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Process driven and focused on EHS and Quality Work Management Systems and Processes&nbsp; &nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Quantity Surveyor/ M&amp;E Quantity Surveyor position or other Senior Quantity Surveyor / MEP Quantity Surveyor opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Linux Systems Administrator
item.content: At Bracken Recruitment we are working exclusively with our client an Irish Software Development company who are currently seeking a Linux Specialist for a permanent position in Dublin City centre.If you are looking for a role where you will be challenged on a daily basis and continuously learn within a great team and excellent work culture then this is the job for you.Experience, Skills and knowledge needed for the role:&middot; Excellent at automating tasks using Bash scripts.&middot; Experience patching servers and performing ongoing security enhancements.&middot; Strong professional experience working with Hypervisor (VMWare, Hyper-V).&middot; Solid Knowledge with Cloud platforms (AWS, GCP). Add on Azure&middot; Deep knowledge of networking fundamentals( TCP/IP, Routing, VPN&#39;s, VLAN&#39;s, Peering, Load Balancing, etc).&middot; Strong understanding of basic web technologies (HTTP, HTML, DNS, TCP, etc).&middot; Well able to manage large environments with more than 400 servers.&middot; Outstanding at managing firewalls and networking devices (TCP/IP, Routing, VPNs, VLANs, Peering, Load Balancing, HTTP, HTML, DNS, TCP)Requirements for this role:&middot; 10 yrs. + as Linux Specialist experience with Operational Systems (Windows and Linux).&middot; At least 6 years with virtualization (VMWare, Hyper-V, Xen and KVM) and AWS, GCP and Azure.&middot; Over 5 years&rsquo; experience working with e-commerce companiesSubmit your CV and Karen will be in touch to organise a meeting

item.title: System Handover Coordinator
item.content: System Handover Coordinator &ndash; DundalkA new and exciting contract opportunity now exist at our clients Dundalk Site for a System Handover Coordinator across the Utilities and other Engineering Departments.Reporting to the Associate Director of Engineering as System Handover coordinator you will manage the schedule of handover of the various engineering systems to the sustaining team, keeping track of all the requirements for the group and alerting of any potential issues.PURPOSE- The System Handover Coordinator will also include coordination between M&amp;E and associated trades contractor companies and engineering services suppliers engaged on Utilities project install across multi-disciplined functions.- The selected candidate will typically have prior related system handover experience; ideally in construction, preferably GMP Setting with engineering and/or validation experience in a biological/sterile manufacturing environment and have a proven track record in handover management and services coordination.- The system handover coordinator will work in conjunction with system leads to support the project and ensure the project milestones are adhered to.- With our clients extensive range of facilities and environments, this is an excellent opportunity to work across many diverse areas including Biological, Automation, Capital Projects, Maintenance, Safety, Technical Services, Utilities and Validation.DUTIES- System handover Coordinator for the group &ndash; ensuring the sustaining team and project team are aligned with handover requirements.- Stay up-to-date with the project schedule in order to react accordingly on identification of any change.- Partnering with colleague&rsquo;s cross-functionally to ensure system handovers are progressed well in advance of project start.- Driving collaboration between groups within the Engineering function proactively looking for synergies and innovative ways of doing work.- Constantly assessing systems and processes to see what improvements can be made to work smarter and more efficiently while all the time being compliant- Complying with Global and site Policies, Procedures and Guidelines, regulatory requirements and execute current Good manufacturing Practices (cGMP) in the performance of day to day activities.- Compliance via documentation completion, risk assessments, closing out corrective action, participate in audits and inspections and proactively highlighting any issues around compliance.- Working collaboratively to drive a safe and compliant culture.- Collaborating with multiple partners e.g. company network groups, CQV, vendors and quality.- Assisting with management of EHS documentation associated with projectsEDUCATION- Bachelor Degree / Diploma; in Engineering or Technical discipline. Trades background idealEXPERIENCE- Working in a Trades /Contractor Construction Project Environment- Experience in a similar role /pharmaceutical multidisciplinary projects.- Engineering and/or CQV experience in a sterile manufacturing environment- Excellent Coordination/ Site Communication skills- Proven track record in management of change controls.- Experience in leading through change would be an advantageTECHNICAL COMPETENCIES:- Knowledge of regulatory/code requirements to Irish, European and International Codes, Standards and Practices- Proficient understanding / experience of utility equipment. Biological/Sterile utilities an advantage- Proficiency in Microsoft Office and job-related computer applications required- Have a proven record of project management in a commercial project site- Having a strong safety ethosBUSINESS SKILL SETS- Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills, to interface effectively with all levels of colleagues and with external suppliers and stakeholders in a team orientated manner- Understand the specific responsibilities of all Dundalk functions as they relate to the clients Engineering /Utilities department as well as associated groups (QA, Operations, CQV etc)- Excellent people management skills- Strong influence skills- Demonstrate analytical and systematic problem-solving skills- Effective time management and multi-tasking skills- Trouble shooting skills- Goal/results orientated- Excellent attention to detail- Self-motivated- Flexible approach- Strong change management skills- Effective conflict resolution skills- Negotiation skills- Strategy planning and development- Risk management skills- Excellent facilitation and assessment skills

item.title: Italian speaking Regulatory Affairs Executive
item.content: Italian speaking Regulatory Affairs Executive - Team Lead - Agrochemical / Agriculture - Dublin - Salary NegotiableWe have a fabulous opportunity for an accurate and performance driven Italian speaking Regulatory Affairs Executive, with experience in the Agricultural or Agrochemical sectors, to lead a small team of regulatory affairs executives at a fast-growing, international company in Dublin.The Regulatory Affairs team is responsible for obtaining and maintaining product registrations for the company&rsquo;s products, based on exacting regulatory requirements across international markets. The team liaises with regulatory bodies in particular countries to ensure understanding of what is required in order to compile dossiers for products to comply with each country&rsquo;s legal standards.This role is a fundamental part of the R&amp;D team and the successful candidate will be responsible for key deliverables, fundamental to the company&rsquo;s long-term strategies in European and global markets.Our client will consider supporting relocation costs as this role is based in Dublin.You, in a nutshell: Suitable candidates will need to have an excellent academic record, qualified to at least primary degree level in Chemistry, biochemistry or equivalent. You will also need to possess demonstrable experience in a regulatory affairs role (approx 3-5 years), preferably within an industrial setting.The ability to present clear and concise written arguments to support a specific regulatory or scientific position on a topic is fundamental to the role.Opportunity: This is a technically demanding but very rewarding role for a scientist looking to utilise their academics and experience in a growing, cutting-edge environment.Key responsibilities as the Italian speaking Regulatory Affairs Executive / Team Lead will include: * Lead and mentor a team of Regulatory Affairs Executives to complete the preparation of regulatory documentation and submissions to relevant regulatory authorities to obtain product authorisations for the product portfolio * Providing updates on changes to regulatory guidance or legislation to the R&amp;D team * Developing, in partnership with project management, project plans and budgets * Maintaining regulatory compliance for relevant products in the portfolio * Developing, supporting and training the regulatory affairs team * Preparing and reviewing guidance notes * Confidential management of sensitive and technical information and collating and communicating data to team members * Plus more!What we&rsquo;re looking for: * Excellent academic record, qualified to at least primary degree level in Chemistry, biochemistry or equivalent * Previous experience (3-5 years+) in regulatory affairs, ideally within an industrial setting * Previous team leader experience is beneficial * Italian language skills * Ability to present clear and concise written arguments to support a specific regulatory or scientific position on a topic * Ability to perform tasks in an accurate and timely manner * Excellent attention to detail * Ability to critically evaluate a wide range of data/information and make recommendations and to implement non-standard solutions to complex problems * Highly organised self-starter * IT literate including MS Office * Ability to work calmly when under pressure and juggle demands * Proactive team player * Proficiency in an EU language would be highly advantageous (French, German or Spanish)Interested?If you have the academics, experience and language skills we&rsquo;re looking for then we want to hear from you ASAP!Please ensure your CV showcases you fully and submit it now, quoting &lsquo;LO- Senior Regulatory Affairs Executive

item.title: Assistant Credit Controller
item.content: Assistant Credit Controller- BT34/BT35 postcode (Newry)- Environmental Company- Great Rates of Pay, Hours and Company BenefitsThis role is based in Republic of Ireland (Eire) however only 14 miles from Newry.Our client is Ireland&rsquo;s leading environmental, waste and recycling management company. Using the latest technology, they produce secondary raw materials and new products from the everyday items people throw away. They offer solutions in Domestic Waste Management, Commercial waste as well as supplying skip hire and managing the Irish councils&rsquo; road sweeping. Our client is a large company with an even larger reputation. Owing to increased business they are looking to increase the accounts administration team: In this role as Assistant Credit Controller you will make outbound calls to company debtors as well as Assist/support the company&rsquo;s Credit Controllers. You will be expected to follow up when a customer has moved past 42 day credit period making daily calls by phone to debtors, as a means of reducing aged debt. Use of Email, SMS and letter communications to customers is required, as such good written communication skills are as essential as oral. Fully flexibility is required for this role as you may well be asked to perform additional duties such as Cover front desk when required or Call Centre cover when required. You will be responsible for any number of the company&rsquo;s customer base throughout various locations and you will be expected to ensure all the different types of customers are captured in the running of reports - Running daily/weekly reports as required Working within a credit control team where tasks are supported and sharedThe requirements&nbsp;for this Assistant Credit Controller role are:- Some administrative experience is required- Ability to work as part of a team and autonomously- Ability to multi-task and work within a fast paced environment- Excellent customer service skills- Decisive, can-do attitude- Good Microsoft Office skills and must be proficient with Excel The working hours are Monday to Friday with a 40 hour week expected.To apply please send your current CV quoting Assistant Credit Controller 97274, or for more details call Jimi Matthews at Perfect Placement.&nbsp;&copy; Perfect Placement UK Ltd &ndash; See our website for details

item.title: Seasonal Bat Ecologist
item.content: <p><u><b>PLEASE MENTION GREENJOBS IRELAND WHEN APPLYING TO THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY</b></u></p> <div> <p> Seasonal Bat Ecologist </p> <p>MKO is a Galway‐based planning and environmental consultancy providing services to both the private and public sectors. The company provides an extensive range of specialist services in the fields of Planning, Ecology, Ornithology, Planning and Estates and Project Management. </p> <p>MKO is seeking to recruit Seasonal Bat Ecologists to join the Ecology team. The successful candidates will be working on projects including the wind energy and road and built infrastructure sectors. Experience within these sectors will be an advantage to prospective candidates. </p> <p>The positions available will offer the successful candidates the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects utilising the various skills they may have acquired through formal training, personal interest and previous work experience. Due to the nature of bat survey work, there will be a requirement to work outside normal office hours. </p> <p>The successful candidate will be expected to:</p> <p>• Have a minimum of a third level honours degree or higher, in ecology, environmental science or another equivalent discipline. </p> <p>• Work as part of a multi‐disciplinary team of staff members to deliver project requirements. </p> <p>• Have a high level of overall ecological field skills, highlighting any specialist ecological expertise (either academic or interest) in their application. </p> <p>• Have experience in the use of GIS, Kaleidoscope Pro, BatExplorer, Ecobat and Microsoft Office. </p> <p>• Have a full driver's licence. </p> <p>The key responsibilities associated with the role will include:</p> <p>• Undertaking background research, desk studies and ecological fieldwork, to best-practice guidelines and methodologies;</p> <p>• Compiling, organising and analysing large datasets; </p> <p>• Ensuring the correct setup, maintenance, deployment and management of equipment;</p> <p>• Reporting </p> <p> Candidates interested in the available position should apply by emailing an up to date Curriculum Vitae and Cover Letter/Email to - info(at)mkoireland.ie . </p> <p> A full driver's licence is an essential requirement for carrying out survey work. As part of their application, candidates should also specify their particular abilities in the range of ecological field skills, including botanical, ornithological, vertebrate, invertebrate, aquatic and marine surveying. </p> <p> The closing date for applications is 22nd January 2021. </p> </div> <p><u><strong>FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT THIS ROLE AND TO BEGIN THE APPLICATION PROCESS PLEASE CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON</strong></u></p><img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?rBSbPGYkJFhlHSWdcy1qXAy" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: EHS Advisor
item.content: EHS Advisor | Northern EuropePermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. &nbsp; Role Purpose The role of the EHS Advisor is to provide Environment, Health and Safety guidance working with the project team. You will implement and maintain the Kirby management system for the project.&nbsp; The role is to coordinate all EHS Matters within various Project Management Teams and to report constructively all EHS matters to Project Manager. Under the direction of the EHS Manager, the EHS Advisor will be responsible for providing support to the Project Managers, supervisors and workers. This position will provide leadership and coordination of the day-to-day EHS requirements of the assigned project(s). The role may require to be positioned on a project full time or working on various projects. This role requires frequent travel between projects and may require overnight stays. &nbsp; Key Functions of the EHS Advisor Provide advice, guidance, support and instruction in all EHS matters to management, safety representatives and employees (including where applicable to sub-contractors, suppliers and visitors to sites). Provide leadership through good example. Be proactive in all matters concerning the role. Identify training needs, report requirements to project team and carry out training as required. Audit and inspect projects, agree and prepare achievable corrective and preventive action plans towards compliance to and continual improvement of the EHS on the project. Report on business EHS risks, KPIs and trends accurately with data and recommend constructive actions towards continuous improvements. Ensure incidents are reported and investigations are carried out in a thorough and professional manner in order to identify root causes and corrective and preventive action plans. Ensure that Site EHS Plans, RAMS and other associated site documents are updated and compliant with statutory and other requirements and that they are reviewed on a continuous basis. &nbsp; EHS Advisor Responsibilities Reports to EHS Manager, Site Managers/Supervisors and Project Manager. Is conversant with the contents of the Kirby safety statement, environment manual, risk assessments, aspects &amp; impacts, legislation and procedures. Provides advice, guidance, instruction and training in all EHS matters to management, safety representatives and employees (including where applicable to sub-contractors, suppliers and visitors to sites). Carries out internal audits and site inspections in conjunction with Site Management, recommends corrective actions, improvements and document findings. Prepares in conjunction with site management team a project specific EHS Plan, induction and Risk Assessment Method Statements (RAMS). These shall be compiled and agreed prior to work commencing and ongoing through lookaheads. Ensures that the project specific EHS Plan, induction and RAMS are up to date, reviewed periodically and communicated to all relevant persons (including clients, Main Contractor, other contractors, visitors and others who may be affected by that work). Visits each new project, sets up the necessary site safety files (Series 500 &amp; 600), registers, abstracts of regulations, posters, SEOR program, etc., and ensures that site establishment complies with the legislation, client regulations and company regulations as a minimum. Reviews Contractor Appointments and ensures that correct appointment is carried out and that only competent contractors are used on projects. Introduces and implements effective measures aimed at the prevention of incidents at work. Reports on incidents and/or dangerous occurrences should they occur to the EHS Manager, Project Manager and Site Managers as required. Reports on areas of concern to the relevant party for correction. Persistent and serious areas of concern are to be reported immediately to line management as per (1) above. Retains evidence of communications with relevant parties. Carries out incident investigation in conjunction with site management, establishes cause of incident or dangerous occurrence and recommends method for future avoidance. Audits the company site safety file, (Series 500 &amp; 600), makes sure that hazards/risks are regularly assessed, that control measures are implemented, that inspections are carried out and that all incidents are reported, investigated and closed out. Prepares Monthly KPI Report for their projects, issues monthly return of Site Visit Schedule, SEORs, KPIs, violations to the EHS Manager and the Business Unit Manager. Issues new SDS to EHS Manager. Provides training and information to the workforce using appropriate training aids and media as required. Issues records of training to HR to update the training matrix. Attends the regional EHS Coordination Meeting. Attends the EHS meeting with the Business Unit Manager, as required (1 per region). Attends internal and external site meetings as required &ndash; safety meetings, coordination meetings etc... Implements and promotes the company Incentive Scheme on all projects. Arranges distribution and maintenance of fully stocked first aid boxes on site. Monitors P.P.E usage and advises site management on type of protective equipment required. Issues non-conformances, commendations and disciplinary warnings both written and verbal if required or instructed to do so. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the EHS Advisor5+ Years&rsquo; Experience in similar industry. Knowledge of Electrical and Mechanical preferably. Diploma to NFQ 8 in Occupational H&amp;S. Certificate to NFQ 6 Environmental Management. Safe Pass, (CSCS (UK)), Train the Trainer, First Aid, Training Instructor. Internal ISO14000 and ISO45000 system auditor. Experience with the Construction Regulations and CDM roles, with experience working with sub-contractors. Experience with EHS Management Systems, safety schemes and tendering e.g. ISOs, Achilles, SSiPs etc. Excellent communication skills, through presentations, reports, written and verbal. Ability to work with Kirby / client / main contractor Safety and Project teams. Ability to work well within strict deadlines. Ability to be able to prepare Audits and EHS reports, to a high standard. Up to date with Legislation, Standards, Guidance, Advice and Compliance. Proactive in identifying positive and negative acts, ability to follow through with realistic corrective and preventive actions. Ability to lead and coordinate incident investigations and utilise root cause analysis. IOSH Member or Equivalent. &nbsp; &nbsp; For more information on this EHS Advisor/ Safety Officer position or other EHS Advisor / Safety Advisor opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact Kirby Group Talent Acquisitions Team confidentially on +353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Site Engineer
item.content: Site Engineer &ndash; Leixlip, Co. KildareEuro Executive Recruitment has been retained by one of Ireland&rsquo;s leading services contractors to recruit a Construction Site Engineer to work on a largescale project based in Leixlip.This a great opportunity working with an internationally established contractor working on a number of large projects across Ireland.The successful candidate will achieve a generous salary for this role.The Role: * Setting-out from engineers&#39; drawings, site surveys, as-built drawings * Reading &amp; interpreting drawings for layouts, materials measure etc. * Planning works efficiently with project milestones in mind. * Management of subcontractors/general workforce on site. * Liaise team members and clients. * Ensure that all works are carried out to the highest standards of health and safety. * Ordering and control of materials on site. * Maintaining the site records.Requirements: * Engineering Degree/Diploma. * 2+ years&#39; experience in a similar role within construction. * Strong interpersonal skills, written and oral communication skills. * Self-motivating to deliver on safety, quality &amp; programme. * Ability to work as part of a team. * Full driving license.For more information on this role please contact Kevin Hallissey or to apply, click &#39;Apply Now

item.title: Production Supervisor
item.content: Production SupervisorNew Production Supervisor to join medical device Technology department in an Evening Shift position.Job PurposeTo develop and maintain a feasible plan for hiring, training and management of personnel and to ensure quality issues, process and material flows are operated efficiently. Through his or her management style, the Supervisor actively demonstrates and propagates the core values of the company. He or she is a strong team player and demonstrates this through the integration of key goals with appropriate other functions (e.g. Engineering, Quality, Logistics, Finance, R&amp;D, HR etc.).Key Responsibilities&#149; Planning - including developing /maintaining a viable plan incorporating hiring, training, capacity-modelling, efficiency/yield assumptions, ramp-rate, learning-curve etc.&#149; Liaising with ware-housing, quality assurance, bulk-packaging and sterilisation areas to ensure prompt shipment of product.&#149; Maintaining GMP / Housekeeping at a high level within the department through the involvement of all team members.&#149; Cross-functional management of QA, materials, IS and HR support for the team.&#149; Interacting and liaising with the other manufacturing teams and Logistics to prioritise backorders.&#149; Managing process and material flows, space management, and working with the Engineering group to maximise utilisation of space designated for specific operations area.&#149; Administration duties which include Time and Attendance system, Holiday planning, Build Plan review Back Order review, Travel planning etc.&#149; Works with EHS to identify significant environmental impacts of operations and to establish goals and targets around significant environmental impacts.&#149; Good knowledge of GMP / FDA regulatory requirements, housekeeping, health and safety.&#149; Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and ability to liaise with various support groups.&#149; Previous experience of people-management and demonstrated ability in people motivation, organising and team building would be a distinct advantage.&#149; Solid record of attention to detail and strict adherence to procedures.Qualifications/Background&bull; HETAC Level 8 in a relevant discipline&bull; Prior experience in a similar role&bull; Previous polymer processing experience is a distinct advantage&bull; Good technical capabilities, communication skills, teamwork abilities and initiative.&bull; Proven ability to work well as part of a team &amp; on own with minimum supervisionFor further information on this Production Supervisor role in Galway please contact Fiona Keane on (phone number removed) or email fiona@hero.ie Check out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website &ndash; (url removed)Please Note: HERO Recruitment will not forward your details to any company without your prior approval

item.title: Home Care Specialist Contributor
item.content: This is your opportunity to contribute to the improvement of CareAs a leading provider of compliance policies, procedures and guidance and inspection tools. QCS is directly responsible for helping more than 100,000 people receive better care. That is a phenomenal achievement, but we know we can do more!Our team of self-employed Contributors create content for fact sheets, blog posts, tutorials and tool kits and some engage publicly by speaking at industry events, recording webinars and contributing to podcasts. We currently seek expertise in both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland.The self-employed Contributors work alongside the QCS Policy Team. Our Policy Team comprises of administrators, policy and procedure writers and external subject specialists for Domiciliary Care, Nursing and Care Homes as well as GP and Dental Services. The team ensure that QCS is continuously offering a product and services portfolio to support our customer&rsquo;s ability to meet regulatory requirements, deliver outstanding care and ensure evidenced based best practice is followed. The policies and procedures reflect the unique requirements for each regulatory authority and ensure a product for each nation and sector. QCS has strived to build a widely trusted and respected brand based on the quality of our content and our commitment to help support providers in delivering outstanding care and the Policy Team play an important part in QCS. The primary function of a Specialist Contributor is to write policy

item.title: Lead Software Engineer
item.content: OpportunityYou will join a Galway company as they build out a world-class engineering team. They are gaining new customers rapidly and expect to grow out the team quickly, hence the need for this principle engineer role. You will bring your technical leadership experience to the table and play a crucial role in solving complex technical problems, analyse billions of data points, and develop creative and elegant solutions. You will code and keep up to date with the latest available technologies and you will be given every opportunity to grow and develop your skills as the team scales upWE LOVE TO SEE: * Experience of hands-on software engineering, with Java and/or Python, using Micro-services Architecture and cloud services. * The ability to mentor other developers, promoting problem-solving skills * Demonstrated interest in building cloud-based big data pipelines and working with big data technologies. * A record of owning and delivering on projects from planning to delivery. * Knowledge of best practise data structures and optimization algorithms. * Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts * Experience with GIS software/analysis tools as well as routing algorithmsYou join an open culture where ideas and creativity are encouraged and your efforts will have a direct impact on the company&#39;s products. An attractive package is available for the successful candidate. Apply now

item.title: National Account Manager | Food | Ireland
item.content: National Account Manager | Food | IrelandSalary ~&pound;30-45k + package DOEAre you an experienced account manager with a proven track record of developing business within the food sector? Can you build long term commercial relationships to drive a business forward? If so, we want to hear from you.About Our ClientOur client is a family-owned, international group of food businesses who manufacture and supply a variety of value-added food, drink and ingredient products. They are steeped in history and have grown over the course of the past ~150 years to be a major force in the food industry across Europe. They offer a variety of branded and own-label products with a focus on quality and real flavour. They are committed to developing their employees to strengthen the capabilities of the team and see the business grow together. They live by their values - they don&#39;t just put them up on the walls, their values are at the core of everything that they do. Although a large business, they retain a family-owned feel and work very closely together to deliver projects.About the RoleThis role will focus on the delivery of commercial results within the food industry in Ireland. You will utilise your experience and knowledge of the market to develop long term relationships with foodservice and food manufacturing customers. You will take a consultative sales approach and utilise your knowledge of the food sector to identify routes to market and key customers. You will feel comfortable pitching for and developing new business relationships. You will work closely with internal and external teams to understand and predict customer opportunities and needs. You will break down doors to connect the client and their products to food customers in Ireland.The Ideal CandidateThe ideal candidate for this role will have a proven track record of opening and developing business with food customers. You will be familiar with the different ways of working within the sector and be able to demonstrate your ability and history of delivering projects with key customers in Ireland. You will be a strong communicator with emotional intelligence who can adapt to the customer you are working with to negotiate effectively. You will be driven and motivated to develop a business and your skills. You will ideally be based in the South of Ireland.Minimum RequirementsIn order to be considered for this position, you will, as a minimum have at least 5 years&#39; sales experience into the key food customers. You will be able to demonstrate your ability to land new business, develop accounts and deliver. You will be a strong team player, who can work within a flat structure and lean operation, whilst delivering on your own KPI&#39;s and targets.Salary~&pound;30-45k DOE + package including car/allowance, bonus, pension, healthcare etc.Application ProcessThe successful applicant will move through a three-stage interview process. This will include completing a presentation and a call with the European head office. This process can take time to complete and our client is committed to finding the right person for their team.How to ApplyIf this sounds like you please apply via the link. To discuss the role in more detail please contact Tom on (phone number removed) or Job reference TEM12901

item.title: IT Security Analyst
item.content: What you will do: * Develop communications and actively promote information security awareness among all staff. Advise internal organizations on best practices for securely managing information as well as assist with the design &amp; implementation of a formal security awareness/training program for Information Security &amp; Compliance. * Monitor all types of access to protect the confidentiality and integrity of customer and employee data and ensure compliance with organization policies and standards. * Provide input to audit log requirements/designs and periodically check audit logs to ensure these are being maintained to agreed retention levels. * Participate in both project and operationally focused work regarding end user Security Protection technologies and implementing standards/processes. Participate in the implementation of recommendations arising from vulnerability assessments and other potential threats. * Responsible for network security and perform onsite IT Security audits.You will ideally have: * A degree in computer science or IT Security or a combination of equivalent professional training and security industry certifications, combined with 3+ years related work experience. * Worked with SIEM, Data Loss Protection, Vulnerability Management, Forensics, IDS/IPS, privilege and identity management as well as software and security architectures, like NISt and ISO27001; * Endpoint Detection and Response tools such as Crowdstrike/Cylance/Carbon Black desirable. * Knowledge of industry standard processes (SDLC, CMMI, Change Mgmt, ITIL,OWASP) * Knowledge of network and host-based intrusion detection (NDS/HDS), non-repudiation, access control, network security, threat modelling, SSL/TLS, Digital Signatures, auditing architectures, application vulnerabilities and Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) is desired

item.title: QA IT Specialist
item.content: About the Role:Zenith Technologies is looking to hire QA IT Specialist to work on site of our biotech client in Dublin West. The successful candidate will work on site expansion project and will provide compliance support for the implementation of new laboratory systems.Responsibilities: * Providing independent quality review and approval of system changes. * Requirements, risk assessments, protocols and reports for new and modified systems. * Supporting and approving computerised systems investigations and test deviations. * Ensuring consistent approach to qualification, change and deviation management across systems being implemented on the project. * Providing timely and pro-active QA IT support and guidance to facilitate project timelines, including close collaboration with the technical and business units. * Where required, engaging with QA IT teams from other sites and capital projects to standardise and align approach to computerised systems compliance.Qualifications &amp; Requirements: * Bachelors&rsquo; degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or the Life Sciences. * Min. 5 years of experience in QA IT/CSV, CSV, lab instrumentation and/or a similar role in the pharmaceutical industry. * Working knowledge of relevant regulations and industry standards. * Proven ability to meet timelines, prioritise tasks and engage with stakeholders. * Excellent communication skills. * Project management experience will be an advantage

item.title: Senior Reliability Engineer, Device and Product Performance
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to fill this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Member of the device and product performance group responsible for metrology, engineering and design verification, device control strategy and reliability requirements to support device development for Biological, Respiratory, Injectable and Dermatological Combination Products </li><li>Responsible for establishing reliability plan and specifications for emergency use products in line with FDA guidance </li><li>Responsible for authoring reliability reports to support regulatory submissions and approvals on a range of device programs </li><li>Work with the device design group build reliability into the device design from design concept ensuring each feature and function is linked to appropriate metrology controls </li><li>Develop metrology specifications for device components using appropriate tolerance intervals and statistically justified sampling plans </li><li>Responsible for liaising with manufacturing sites to ensure reliable measurement systems are in place such as metrology fixtures, functional testers and any other analytical equipment used on site </li><li>Development of design inputs and outputs based on characterization of comparator products, regulatory requirements, design intent and user requirements </li><li>Responsible for ensuring adequate manufacturing controls and release activities are implemented to ensure the final Combination Product meets the reliability specifications </li><li>Responsible for liasing with component and/or assembly suppliers to ensure process validation acceptance criteria is in line with overall device reliability plan </li><li>Work with team to develop a Fault Tree Analysis for Combination Products to ensure all potential failure modes are identified and adequate controls are implemented to prevent occurrence </li><li>Responsible for ensuring the reliability specification is translated into the product specification as part of design transfer to the commercial site </li><li>Provide technical support to manufacturing sites during filling and assembly process development. Responsible for designing experiments and manufacturing trials to identify process controls, reliability requirements, sampling plans and release specifications. </li><li>Trending and statistical analysis of design verification and manufacturing data including compilation of technical reports to support combination product development lifecycle. </li><li>Ensures all activities within team are conducted and executed to the appropriate quality standards within the GDD Quality Management system. </li></ul> <p> </p> <ul><li>The ideal candidate will be a qualified, experienced pharmaceutical professional with a proven track record of success, a positive attitude and who wants to progress in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Masters/Degree in Engineering/Science with experience in a late stage R&D or Technical Support environment</li><li>Previous experience of working as an Engineer or Scientist role in a regulated and GMP environment on combination products i.e. injectable products</li><li>Experienced in application of statistical techniques to support regulatory submission of medical devices and/or combination products</li><li>A working knowledge of ISO 13485 & FDA 21 CFR Part 820 Design Control requirements would be an advantage</li><li>Highly driven and motivated person who can work as part of a flexible, dynamic team whilst taking responsibility for individual tasks in a Subject Matter Expert role</li><li>It is essential that the candidate will be both highly innovative and well organised, having excellent planning and communication skills and able to operate across all site teams. In addition, the candidate must be able to work under pressure and have a proven track record of problem solving and effective time management.</li><li>Well-developed communication skills to lead or facilitate effective discussions. Able to communicate technical and/or project information to key stakeholders</li><li>Some travel will be required as part of this role</li></ul> <p> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?cEE7qa%2bxCwpV4sbXY9qIuwl" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Intermediate Quality Manager
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Identify the manufacturing process defects (scrap, non-conforming material and customer complaints) by dispositioning non-conforming material, identifying primary root causes and suggesting corrective and preventative actions. May be responsible for querying and bounding data to support implementation of basic product stops.</li><li>Develops product quality plans, documents and systems by creating product specifications, quality specifications and quality plans in conjunction with other product development team members.</li><li>Develops process monitoring systems by identifying critical process steps applying methods to reduce process variation in order to reduce/eliminate the cause of defects.</li><li>Leads process improvement efforts by identifying methods to capture quality metric data and by performing appropriate analysis methods to enhance sustaining product design and new product development.</li><li>Assists in creation of quality tools and training materials by understanding the limitations of existing quality tools and training materials and by helping to identify more effective tools and materials.</li><li>Participates in validation activity Role may very between providing input to owning activities such as protocol/report writing and managing execution of validation actives.</li><li>Participates in corrective and preventative action activity.</li></ul> <p> <b></b></p> <ul><li>National Framework of Qualifications (NFQ) level 7 qualification in a relevant discipline and 3+ years of related work experience</li><li>Wide application of technical principals, practices and procedures. Strong understanding of business unit function and cross group dependencies knowledge and application of concepts, practices and procedures.</li><li>Will perform this job in a quality system environment.</li><li>Establishes and cultivates an extensive network of support to facilitate completion of assignments.</li></ul> <p><br/> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?7WCPEDCS1m00HBl%2brATqmgh" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Site Clerk
item.content: Job DescriptionAbout UsKeegan group is a well-established, leading supplier of high quality construction products within Ireland and the UK. We began by producing ready mix concrete and have now expanded into concrete block manufacturing, precast wall and floor manufacturing and most recently producing calcium carbonate.We supply our quarry products to customers in the commercial and domestic markets around Dublin, Meath, Kildare, Offaly and Louth. Our precast is supplied all over the UK and Ireland and our calcium carbonate is supplied to feed mills all over Ireland.We are currently seeking an experienced SIte Clerk to join our expanding team. Our head office is located in Trammon, Rathmolyon, Co. Meath, which is home to our Limestone Quarry, our Precast design department, state of the art precast manufacturing plant, concrete block plant, concrete batching plant and lime plant. This position is based on site in DublinDuties:&middot;Working closely with site manager&middot;Order processing and administration&middot;Site inductions&middot;Filing of site reports, orders, and memos&middot;Managing the daily operations of the site office&middot;Tracking and recording all site documentation&middot;Effectively dealing with enquiries&middot;Coordination of meetings&middot;Liaising with personnel throughout the organisation&middot;Maintaining a professional image for the company in all dealings with public &amp; on site&middot;Ensure all health and safety reports are maintainedEssential Experience &amp; Skills:&middot;Previous Construction experience as a Site Clerk, Site Administrator, Document Controller is desirable&middot;Strong attention to detail&middot;Excellent organisation &amp; communication skills&middot;Confident in dealing with sub-contractors, engineers, and site managers&middot;Proficient IT&middot;Ability to work on own initiative

item.title: CSV Lead
item.content: About the Role:Zenith Technologies is looking to hire a QA IT (CSV) Lead to join our client&rsquo;s Biopharmaceutical site in Dunboyne, Co.Meath.QA IT (CSV) Lead will design and manage all compliance activities for the assigned GxP regulated computerized systems throughout each system&#39;s lifecycle.He/She will provide and co-ordinate QA IT oversight and support for the computerised systems that are being implemented as part of a major capital project to ensure compliance with regulatory expectations and company Computer Systems Validation (CSV), System Development Lifecycle (SDLC), Cyber Security and Data Integrity requirements. The QA IT (CSV) Lead will actively contribute to the overall validation strategy and liaise with relevant technical and business units to drive consistent and compliant approach across the systems.Responsibilities:&bull; Providing independent quality review and approval of system lifecycle documentation, such as plans, requirements, risk assessments, protocols and reports for GxP systems, including but not limited DCS, automated equipment, MES and associated local infrastructure.&bull; Providing input into the validation strategy for computerised systems, including leveraging approach.&bull; Liaising with technical and business units to drive consistency and understanding of compliance expectations.&bull; Ensuring adherence to relevant regulations and company procedures, including DI.&bull; Providing timely and pro-active QA IT support and guidance to facilitate project timelines.&bull; Actively working with QA IT colleagues within the site as well as the global QA IT organisation to ensure alignment with the current site and other projects.&bull; Escalating any potential compliance issues in a timely manner.Qualifications &amp; Requirements: * Min. 7 years of experience in QA IT/CSV, CSV and/or a similar role in the pharmaceutical industry. * Project experience in a senior specialist / lead position. * Strong compliance background * DeltaV, OSI PI and PAS-X experience * Experience with ISA S95 and S88 standards * Experience of Testing GAMP Category 3, 4 &amp; 5 systems &amp; knowledge of CFR 21 Part11 * Excellent knowledge of relevant regulations and industry standards. * Proven ability to meet timelines, prioritise tasks and engage with stakeholders. * Excellent communication skills. * Project management experience will be an advantage

item.title: BIM Engineer
item.content: Vacancy: BIM EngineerLocation: DublinSalary: &euro;50K - &euro;55K + package3D Personnel&rsquo;s client is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services in the M&amp;E and Power Transmission and Distribution Sectors and to a large number of blue chip companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, the company has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.The Role Reporting to the BIM Lead the BIM Engineer has responsibility for delivering all 3D and 2D co-ordination milestones on each project. The role of the BIM engineer is project specific and all engineers to be based on site within a BIM environment when requested. When not working on a specific project the BIM engineer will be based within their Business Unit office and report to the BIM Lead. They may need to assist other smaller projects and produce tender information.KEY FUNCTIONS&bull; Support the project team with regard to all co-ordination deliverables&bull; Delivering all 3D and 2D deliverables set by the BIM lead&bull; Assisting the BIM Lead with production of 2D co-ordination and installation drawings&bull; Assisting the BIM Lead with 3D elements needed for design and co-ordination&bull; Supporting all parties working within the BIM process&bull; Working within a team environment help to achieve efficient project deliveryRESPONSIBILITIES &amp; ACCOUNTABILITIES &bull; Detailing of 3D elements needed for design and co-ordination&bull; Production of 3D model files through Revit and where needed Fabrication Cad&bull; Production of 2D co-ordination and installation drawings&bull; Ensuring that detailed model files are co-ordinated and clash free by clashing against federated model on a constant basis (every 30min)&bull; Taking direct instructions from BIM lead on all design issues&bull; Administration of Vault files&bull; Clash detection of submitted files&bull; Daily building of federated model&bull; Ensure all files submitted in correct format&bull; Attend weekly co-ordination meetings when requested&bull; Support all parties working within the BIM process&bull; Assist with clash resolutions on site&bull; Verification and preparation of layout drawings to meet contract requirements&bull; Confers with project engineer and project management staff to resolve problems and explain drawings to production or construction teams and providing adjustments as necessary&emsp;&bull; Production of all verified record drawings&bull; Site surveying &amp; verification including point cloud scanning and total station operation&bull; Production of all 2D project drawings&bull; Updating and administrating of all co-ordination documents registers and drawings&bull; Assist with tenders and other drawing requirements from the business unit.BIM Development1. Work within a designated project working as part of a project team2. Gain knowledge of mechanical &amp; electrical systems with regard to 3D co-ordination3. Develop knowledge of onsite co-ordination, fabrication and construction4. Attend co-ordination meetings and develop communication skills5. Move to a BIM lead position when the opportunity arises and deemed ready by the BIM managerESSENTIAL BASIC EXPERIENCES/QUALIFICATIONS:&bull; A degree in Engineering, Architecture or Design&bull; A minimum of 2 years&rsquo; experience within a BIM\Co-ordination role&bull; Strong communication and organisational skills&bull; Ability to work under pressure and to short deadlinesCOMPETENCIES TO BE DEMONSTRATED:&bull; Results Orientation&bull; Commercial Acumen&bull; Customer Service/Relationship Builder&bull; Innovates and Improves Processes&bull; Attention to Detail&bull; Resilience and Positivism&bull; Team Worker/Builder

item.title: Hiring Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Tech Transfer Lead (Senior)
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Development of validation plans, process performance qualifications for vial and syringe filling.</li><li>Ensuring all aspects of activity within any given process validation adheres to required policies and procedures, including safety and training.</li><li>Ensure that the site meets the quality requirements of its customers and applicable regulations (FDA, EU & international standards) with a full understanding of CMC business process related to technology transfer.</li><li>Participate in process validation cross functional teams at the site to ensure adherence to required policies and procedures and be responsible to deliver against organizational goals and project milestones.</li><li>Pre-approve and post-approve process validation protocols and assessments from a quality system documentation perspective.</li><li>Actively communicates across functions and sites and is a strong collaborator with all the functional groups at the receiving site, sending site and corporate functions.</li><li>Act as the responsible point contact from ADL site for the transfer project for drug product teams and Global Operations Teams.</li><li>Assist in the development of any existing validation program to ensure continued compliance to the necessary regulations and input to site validation guidance documents.</li><li>Collate and report on relevant shipping and filter validation.</li><li>Assist in deviation and exception resolution and root cause analysis.</li><li>Contribute to product quality assessments and process flow documents.</li></ul> <p></p> <ul><li>Third level Bachelor's degree in science, engineering or a relevant quality discipline with 5 years' experience in a similar role OR Master's degree & 3 years of directly related experience OR Associate's degree & 10 years of directly related experience.</li><li>Knowledge of cGMPs and other worldwide regulatory requirements.</li><li>Problem solving ability and excellent oral and written communications skills.</li><li>5 + years of experience in support of Commercial Protein Drug Product (DP) processing in specific areas such as sterile processing, process characterization, tech transfer (to commercial DP sites) or validation.</li><li>Strong skills in applying fundamental engineering and scientific principles to the design, implementation and process validation of protein freeze-thawing, filtration, mixing, filling (PpK / batch homogeneity) and/or lyophilisation processes. Knowledge of protein biochemistry with regard to chemical and physical stability.</li><li>Project management skills including the ability to manage multiple projects and evaluate project resource requirements.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Quality systems, Drug Product Manufacturing and Validation.</li><li>Demonstrated ability in providing leadership to cross-functional teams to advance complex projects to completion. Excellent Communication skills are essential for this role.</li></ul> <p><br/> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?iUuq8KJf7fbQUWUKc8R8Sgv" width="0" height="0" />
