item.title: Trainee Health And Safety Advisor
item.content: Trainee Health &amp; Safety AdvisorAre you looking to kick-start a new career in health &amp; safety?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Health &amp; Safety Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee within 20 miles of your location upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part-time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps, you can be placed into your first role in as little as 3-6 months:Step 1 - IOSH - Managing SafelyYou will begin by studying the IOSH Managing Safely online course. Here you will learn about the basics of health and safety.The course is delivered online in its entirety through video tutorials, quizzes and presentations. You will be given access to your own learning portal which allows you to study from anywhere.Upon completion of the course modules, you will sit a short, multiple choice quiz which will result in your first qualification in the industry.Step 2 - NEBOSHYou will need to decide whether you would like to study the NEBOSH General, Construction or the Fire Safety course, depending on the path that you intend your career to follow. You will have an expert tutor on hand if required.NEBOSH as a governing body sets such high standards that it&rsquo;s therefore the most sought after qualification not only in the UK, but across the globe. Becoming NEBOSH certified truly sets you apart from the rest of the field.Step 3 - Risk AssessmentsThe third step focuses on the practical application of what you have learned during your studies. You will write a series of risk assessments that need to be up to a workplace standard. This is not only to ensure that you have retained all that you have learned, but is also a requirement to gain your NEBOSH certification.Step 4 - NEBOSH ExamsThe final step will be to sit the official NEBOSH exams, which we will book for you once you are ready. The exams can be sat in one of the official NEBOSH testing centres, or online. (Online only currently available for general certificate).Once your exams have been passed, you will be ready to move onto our recruitment stage and start your new career within the world of Health and Safety.Your Job Upon CompletionOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training and exams, we will place you into an entry level health &amp; safety role as either a advisor, officer or coordinator, where you will be guaranteed a starting salary of &pound;18K-&pound;30K. We have partnered with a number of large organisations strategically located throughout the UK, providing a nationwide reach of jobs for our candidates.Responsibilities:&bull; Maintain and manage health and safety polices, safety training and document control systems&bull; Maintain, update and create standard operating procedures and assist in the implementation of continuous improvement safety projects&bull; Ensure all health &amp; safety policies, procedures, rules and regulations are adhered to, regularly reviewed, updated and communicated&bull; Complete regular reviews of risk assessments for all work equipment and operations&bull; Ensure that all accidents are documented, investigated and recommend improvements&bull; Conduct safety inspections, fire drills and fire alarms are correctly reported, safety inspections, risk assessments and lone working procedures are managed, and employees are aware of their responsibilitiesAt a one off cost of &pound;945, or 8 monthly payments of &pound;137, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in health &amp; safety and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Read through the information? Passionate about starting a career in coding? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.&lsquo;Please note that this is a training course and fees apply

item.title: MEP Quantity Surveyor
item.content: MEP Quantity SurveyorMunichJob Reference: JR(phone number removed)Salary: &euro;40,000 - &euro;60,000 + Generous Allowance, Accommodation, and TravelRotation: Long weekend home every two weeksMEP Quantity Surveyor Job profile:Are you an MEP Quantity Surveyor who is interested in joining a main contractor on large data centre construction projects in Europe? This is an opportunity to join this rapidly growing sector on a large project in Munich for a reputable main contractor as an MEP Quantity Surveyor.This position is offered on a rotation basis (with accommodation, flights, and in-country travel covered) on a two-week basis, with a long weekend at home every two weeks.MEP Quantity Surveyor Key activitiesThe successful MEP Quantity Surveyor candidate&#39;s responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:Review and understanding project contract documentationPreparing and analysing supplier and sub-contractor enquiriesPreparation and issuing of contract documents to our supply chainMonitoring change in our scope of work and pricing of variationsPreparing and agreeing Monthly progress applicationsFinancial and contractual control of sub-contractor accountsIssuing of contractual notices and evaluate loss and expense/acceleration claimsProviding fast, accurate, competitive and profitable estimatesPreparation of monthly commercial project reportsProvide Data and analysis of issues &amp; risks as required by ManagementManaging and forecasting of project Cash flowsLiaising with the client, main contractor and other departmentsAll other duties associated with this role MEP Quantity Surveyor specificationThe following will be required of the MEP Quantity Surveyor:Academically (Degree) qualified and/or relevant experience in the industry3-5 years&#39; experience in a QS roleA wide understanding of work contractsA working knowledge of Mechanical/Electrical Work Packages MEP Quantity Surveyor Personal Skills and Qualifications relevant to the RoleThe successful MEP Quantity Surveyor will be the following:Good with FiguresAble to negotiate with clients on a professional levelExperience in use of Excel a requirementExcellent Analytical and problem-solving skillsHigh level of accuracy and attention to detail To Apply for the position of MEP Quantity Surveyor, or to find out what other opportunities we can offer in the critical systems construction sector, please contact Joe Raymond at Project Resource Ltd.Services advertised by Project Resource are that of an Employment Agency/Business. Project resource is an equality and diversity recruitment agent and employer

item.title: Junior Electrical Design Engineer
item.content: The company:One of my best clients within Building Services sector established over 20 years ago is now looking for Junior Electrical Design Engineer due to the growth of the Building Services team. The company have continued to increase their workload and deliver quality, innovative engineering solutions for our clients even during that difficult times. They have got clients in the UK, Ireland and abroad and they work across a range sectors including Healthcare, Education, Residential, Industrial, Commercial and Hotel &amp; Leisure. The company has now 3 thriving offices and offers a great career progression and help with your Chartership process to become a Chartered Building Services Engineer.The role of a Junior Electrical Design Engineer * Competent in the design and specification of electrical building services in a variety of industry and project types, sizes and complexity. * Experience of involvement in detailed designs through full design cycle. * Knowledge and experience of Electrical Systems including: Lighting &amp; Emergency Lighting, Small Power and Data, Fire alarms, CCTV &amp; Intruder Alarms, LV Power Distribution and Containment. * Knowledge of CIBSE, IEC, BS, IS and EN Standards. * Design and specification of the following: * Lighting &amp; Emergency Lighting * Small Power and Data * Fire alarms * CCTV &amp; Intruder Alarms * LV Power Distribution * Containment * Assist modellers to produce detailed working drawings in 3D and scheme drawings. * Develop project scope with design team / client * Primarily office / home based, occasionally representing EDC at client meetings as required. * Carry out all work in a professional manner, building EDC&rsquo;s excellent reputation within the industry.Skills and qualifications for the role of Junior Electrical Design Engineer * Minimum Degree level in Electrical Design Engineering or Building Services * Minimum 2 years Electrical Building Services Design exposure * Proficient user of the following: * Dialux * Amtech * Microsoft Office (Word/Excel/PowerPoint etc.) * Autodesk Applications (AutoCAD/Design Review) * Commercial &amp; Residential sector knowledge/experience a strong advantage. * Building Information Modelling (BIM) knowledge will be advantageous. * Project management, problem solving, presentation, communication, and IT skills essential. * Team player with the ability to learn from your colleagues

item.title: Electrical Site Supervisor
item.content: Electrical Site Supervisor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. Role Purpose The role of the Electrical Site Supervisor is to support the Site Manager in the organization and co-ordination of site-based activities and to lead and co-ordinate teams of Electrical Engineering trade professionals on site. The Supervisor will be responsible for tracking and recording of site daily activities and progress. They will lead their teams to deliver to quality, on time and to budget in a safe and efficient manner. They will deal with obstacles and develop team capacity. &nbsp; Electrical Site Supervisor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project in line with the Kirby Way: &nbsp; Commercial: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fully understand your IFC scope of work and notify IFC variations to CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete take-offs for variations as requested. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Populate SE progress assessment form in conjunction with planners. &nbsp; Schedule: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Develop 2 week look ahead and agree it with CM at weekly meeting. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Coordinate work with other trades in your area through whiteboard and directly. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure your scope is construction complete for agreed start dates of testing and commissioning. &nbsp; Scope: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and fully understand IFC Scope of works. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and agree area site set-up with C.M. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Install area site set-up in line with agreed plan &ndash; all on wheels, nothing directly on the floor. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Appoint person responsible to maintain and clean your area. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure temp power is available for directs and subcontractors prior to required date. &nbsp; Quality: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Understand Quality objective of Project &ndash; snag free systems on time. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand Quality Control Plan which is based on 6M&rsquo;s. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement Quality Control Plan on site. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand ITP. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement ITP. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure only specified materials are used for your scope of installation. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete Weekly Quality Audits and check lists. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear quality audit actions as soon as possible. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Identify snag items as the installation progresses &ndash; stand down crew for TBT if snags are repeated. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear snag items to suit walkdown schedule. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all personnel have seen relevant FoK&rsquo;s to their task. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conduct quality TBT&rsquo;s. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure the works are adequately protected. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure Drawings are Red lined and signed in line with agreed due dates. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Collate and File all relevant documentation delivered with materials, plant and equipment. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Read and understand the manufacturer&rsquo;s instructions. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure materials, plant and equipment are installed to specification and manufacturers recommendations. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure installation is in accordance with P&amp;IDs and Isometrics. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Understand and follow the requirements associated with maintaining the correct files on site. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Advise CM if NCR is necessary. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel have the relevant training for the allocated tasks. &nbsp; EHS: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand the safety objective of the project &ndash; target Zero incidents and understand why &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel are inducted including subcontractors prior to starting any task. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Plan all tasks through identifying hazards in your work area, assessing the risk, determining and implementing control measures prior to starting any task &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Planning is particularly important for MIMO, Working at Height and Working with/around electricity &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure appropriate RAMS are in place for all tasks &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand the RAMS, advise CM of any required amendments prior to undertaking the task, do not start task until RAMS are updated &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that employees and subcontractors are properly instructed and sign up to appropriate RAMS as required. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure SPA&#39;s are in place when setting your personnel and subcontractors to work and are appropriate for the task and signed by yourself &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Coordinate work with other trades in your area (co-sign SPA&rsquo;s where possible) &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure exclusion zones and restricted zones are identified and noted on daily whiteboards &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Enforce rule that no persons to work underneath other trades working at height &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure housekeeping issues are highlighted and noted on daily whiteboards &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; All materials and tools used while working at height must be secured, tethered or removed from location &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Large cable pulls to have an exclusion zone in the relevant area, if too disruptive to other trades then cable pulls must be done through night work. Night work needs to be agreed in advance with CM &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain a tidy workplace. Ensure that cleaning takes place regularly or as work is carried out and place of work and access routes are kept clear. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel have the relevant training for the allocated tasks. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The operation of a protective or control device is to be done by Intel or a Kirby AP, no other person is authorised to switch on or off a protective or control device &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Encourage participation by all in SBO scheme &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure prompt close out of SBO&rsquo;s &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that all plant and machinery including power and hand tools are in a good condition, defect free and that statutory, in-house inspection and maintenance procedures are carried out as required. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that any defects in plant and equipment are rectified or remove defective items as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that you complete &lsquo;Site Supervisor Safety Audit&rsquo; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear any actions from audit as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conduct &ldquo;Tool Box&quot; talks and keeps attendance records in the site safety file. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Inform the employees of their safety performance on site and any improvements needed through the behavioral notice card system &ndash; Green, Yellow and Red &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Escalate incident situations through informing CM or PM as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Participate in incident investigation &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement determined incident remedial actions to prevent reoccurrence of incident as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that adequate fire-fighting equipment is available where necessary and there is a competent person in the crew to use &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that the area first aid box is adequately stocked, maintained and there is a member of the crew competent to use it &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that all power tools are 110 volts. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Issues permits where required, ensure that the requirements for these permits are maintained and copies of all work permits are filed in the safety file e.g. hot work permit to work etc. when competent to do so. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Demonstrate safety leadership by not &ldquo;turning a blind eye&rdquo;. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that employees do not participate in horseplay or improper conduct at the place of work. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Stand down any person from the workplace deemed to present a hazard to themselves or others and report them to CM or PM. &nbsp; Procurement: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist CM with development of Procurement schedule. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Track delivery of all relevant orders to ensure delivery dates align with procurement schedule and programme. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Requisition minor materials in line the IFC requirements and track delivery. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all IR&#39;s for minor equipment are completed correctly. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement plan to ensure all deliveries are checked and verified. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all materials are correctly Stored &ndash; nothing directly on the floor. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Comply with purchasing procedure with regard to delivery docket management. &nbsp; Communications: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Deliver briefings on key project daily or weekly items, deliver safety and quality TBT&rsquo;s. &nbsp; HR and Subcontractors: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure Biometric or facial recognition clock is in operation and all operatives are instructed on its use (including subcontractors) &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Track and detail actual personnel on site daily (directs and subcontractors) for your scope of work and submit to CM daily &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete Employee assessment forms for tradesmen and apprentices. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Advise CM on performance of directs and subcontractor&rsquo;s compliance with our expectations, both good and where there are development opportunities &nbsp; General: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review relevant construction pack (specifications, schedules and drawings) for your scope of work and develop a set of familiarisation notes for Construction Manager (CM) or Project Manager (PM) to review. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Take ownership for your work area and scope of work. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Escalate when necessary (after you have done what you can) any safety, quality, schedule, coordination with other trades, personnel and commercial issues to CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attend Weekly project meeting with CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist Construction Manager is compiling Lesson&#39;s learned at the end of the project. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Site Supervisor &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Senior Trades qualification or equivalent coupled with 5+ years site experience within pharmaceutical/medical device, commercial, industrial or data centre type sectors &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can interpret schematics and electrical drawings &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong understanding of site activities and how they are planned and coordinated &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Record of success as a Trade Leader &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Familiarity with materials ordering and lead times &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong client focus &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Commercial acumen &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Planner/Organised &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Influencer &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conscientious &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Decisive and action oriented &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Team player &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attentive to detail and record keeper &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Results oriented with the resilience to work under pressure &nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Site Supervisor position or other Electrical Site Supervisor / Mechanical Site Supervisor opportunities based in Ireland, UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: IT Service Manager
item.content: IT Service ManagerTEKsystems are partnering with a global client based in Dublin, Ireland, who are seeking the skills of an experienced IT Service Manager to work on a long-term project. This is a contract position that will initially run for 12 months, but it is more than likely that there will be extensions beyond this.Applicants must have a background in leading infrastructure projects including network refreshes/upgrades as well as EUC roll-outs and deployments. You must be able to liaise and strategise with various stakeholders within the business, and communication skills are essential for this role!Below are a list of a few of the key skills that are required alongside some of the project experience mentioned above:IT Service ManagementProject ManagementExcellent communication and collaboration skills across a variety of stakeholdersSelf motivatingAdditional but not essential qualities include:Educated to degree level or a similar such qualificationIT Specialist education would be ideal, but is by no means essential IT Service Manager, Service Manager, Services Manager, Infrastructure, Network, EUC, Desktop Support, Project Manager, Project Management, Service Delivery, IT Service Manager, Service Manager, Services Manager, Infrastructure, Network, EUC, Desktop Support, Project Manager, Project Management, Service DeliveryTrading as TEKsystems. Allegis Group Limited, Maxis 2, Western Road, Bracknell, RG12 1RT, United Kingdom. No. (phone number removed). Allegis Group Limited operates as an Employment Business and Employment Agency as set out in the Conduct of Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses Regulations 2003. TEKsystems is a company within the Allegis Group network of companies (collectively referred to as &quot;Allegis Group&quot;). Aerotek, Aston Carter, EASi, Talentis Solutions, TEKsystems, Stamford Consultants and The Stamford Group are Allegis Group brands. If you apply, your personal data will be processed as described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice available at .To access our Online Privacy Notice, which explains what information we may collect, use, share, and store about you, and describes your rights and choices about this, please go to .We are part of a global network of companies and as a result, the personal data you provide will be shared within Allegis Group and transferred and processed outside the UK, Switzerland and European Economic Area subject to the protections described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice. We store personal data in the UK, EEA, Switzerland and the USA. If you would like to exercise your privacy rights, please visit the &quot;Contacting Us&quot; section of our Online Privacy Notice at for details on how to contact us. To protect your privacy and security, we may take steps to verify your identity, such as a password and user ID if there is an account associated with your request, or identifying information such as your address or date of birth, before proceeding with your request. If you are resident in the UK, EEA or Switzerland, we will process any access request you make in accordance with our

item.title: Hiring Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Receptionist
item.content: CompanyThe client is a multi-national medical device manufacturer whose mission is to improve the quality of life through the design, development, and manufacture of high quality, affordable medical products, for the benefit of patients and health professionals and with respect to their employees.Role summaryThe Receptionist will manage the front desk and be the first point of contact between the company and its clients. This is an excellent position for someone with previous reception experience.Responsibilities * Management of the front desk * Diary management * Liaising with clients to take bookings and answer queries * Taking cash, card, and cheque payments * Issuing invoices and receipts * General administration * Maintaining and updating the Management System * Conducting Covid risk assessments * Basic bookkeeping responsibilities * Other ad hoc duties as requestedRequirements * +3 years&rsquo; experience in a similar role * Excellent interpersonal and organisational skills * Strong communication and interpersonal skills * Strong Microsoft Office skills * Experience using a CRM * Basic bookkeeping would be an advantageRemunerationAttractive remuneration will be offered in line with experience and would be firmed up during the interview process. If interested to explore please apply enclosing your CV in Word format and Cover Letter

item.title: CSV Engineers-Lab- West Dublin
item.content: CSV Engineers-Lab- West DublinLong term contract opportunity to join a premier Biopharma manufacturing organisation based in West Dublin on an exciting new project.. item.title: Lead Mechanical Design Engineer
item.content: Adecco have an amazing opportunity for an experienced Lead Mechanical Design Engineer to join a successful manufacturing company based in Co Clare. The successful applicant will have 2 direct reports and will report into the Director of the company. The role will include new product design and manufacturing, scheduling of production, organisation and prioritisation of projects and use of software in 3D (SolidWorks) to create and modify existing parts/products/assemblies. Required:*Minimum degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar qualification Minimum 2 years&#39; experience with 2D and 3D software (SolidWorks) and drawings*Knowledge of sheet metal and fabrication techniques*Very proficient in Microsoft Excel*Excellent verbal and written communication skills with different disciplines.*Excellent time management and attention to detail.*Experience in leading a teamThere is an excellent package on offer for the right candidate so if you feel this could be the role for you or if you would just like more information then please submit your CV todayAdecco Ireland is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

item.title: General Secretary
item.content: Job SummaryThe General Secretary will be joining an incredible organisational representative and networking association which seeks to support the Boards of Management of schools providing education for children with special needs in Ireland and is a recognised partner in the education process.The General Secretary will manage the office and provide administrative support to the Executive Committee, whilst taking full responsibility and daily management of all related duties, including policy, research and marketing, recording and maintaining all Income and Expenditure, preparation of monthly financial reports, and will be the voice for the organisation&rsquo;s representation in parliament. The General Secretary will have lobbying experience along with knowledge of special education in Ireland, excellent interpersonal, communication and organisational skills.Main Duties and Responsibilities * Prepare and arrange meetings of the Executive Committee, AGM, conferences, and seminars * Record and maintain all Income and Expenditure transactions, under the direction of the Honorary Treasurer * Assist in the preparation of monthly financial reports for approval of and presentation by the Honorary Treasurer * Assist the Honorary Treasurer in the preparation of annual budgets and annual audit * Identify, organise and support training for Boards of ManagementCommunicationProvide response and advice to queries from members and to maintain relevant records, prepare, maintain, and develop regular Newsletters and Flyers and to maintain and keep refreshed and up-to-date Website, communicate with members and to maintain an up-to-date database of membersRepresentation/NetworkingRepresent our organisation at relevant conferences, seminars, and meetings and to report back to the Executive Committee, develop and maintain a database of relevant agencies, schools etc. Maintain communication/representation with the Department of Education and Skills along with other Government agencies and Management bodiesResearchAdminister research projects commissioned by the organisation, keep abreast of all relevant legislation, gather, and disseminate to the Executive Committee information on current and emerging issuesCorporate Advocacy/PolicyAssist in developing a strategy and strategic responses, draft policies, and submissions for approval of the Executive CommitteeMarketingDevelop a membership base, to include Special, Mainstream Primary and Post-Primary schools and raise the profile of the organisation and its functions by assisting in the development of a marketing plan.To apply for this role, please call our recruitment team, upload or forward your CV and someone will be in touch shortly

item.title: Remote Recruiter
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Manager
item.content: Managers lead shifts every week, making sure customers get a fast, accurate, friendly experience every visit. A Shift Manager provides leadership to crew and other managers during a shift to ensure great Quality, Service and Cleanliness to customers.Shift Managers perform a variety of tasks, which may include planning for each shift, monitoring performance during the shift, taking action to ensure the team is meeting McDonald’s standards, monitoring safety, security, and profitability, and communicating with the next Shift Manager to help prepare him/her to run a great shift, too. Shift Managers may also be responsible for meeting targets during their shifts and for helping their assigned Departments meet their goals.

item.title: Design Manager DM/159x/10
item.content: Our client is a sector leading Designer, Manufacturer & install of Modular Precast Concrete Infrastructure solutions. Focused on enhancing their market position in the rapidly growing UK & Irish markets for the demand of high-quality engineer products manufactured off-site they wish to appoint a Design Manager based at their head office in County Carlow. Key Responsibilities: Reporting into the Managing Director and part of the senior management team the Design Manager will be responsible for providing overall engineering leadership & direction including innovation & strategy Ensuring efficient and effective engineering and innovation performance shaping the technical strategy of the Company lead the Design Department and directly assist on all strategic and tactical matters as they relate to design, engineering and innovation. Drive improvements to: Ensuring consistent and appropriate quality & efficiency of design for opportunities tendered Development of best practice for Design & Detailing department (building on significant “catalogue” of successful reference projects) Management of innovation for new products and improvement of existing products and processes Support the technical management of relationships with key customers, suppliers and JV partners maintaining the highest standards of health & safety in both factory and site-based activities and processes. Areas of responsibility include: Design & Detailing Management of Design & Detailing team Identifying and Promoting optimum approach on design solutions and design strategies Review of Design team output (Proposals, Approval and Production Drawings) Value Engineering and Proposal Optimisation Configuring schemes for maximum competitiveness, undertaking technical and feasibility studies including foundation support approaches. Development and succession planning Engaging at an early stage with client engineering teams Innovation Strategy and Planning Innovating, Optioneering, Challenging, Testing - Rethinking what we do and how we do it Resolving inefficiencies and proposing alternative practices as they arise including manufacturing methods Innovation strategy and R&D tax credit methodology and practices Risk Management / Technical Persuasion Preparing arguments on contentious technical or contractual matters Offsite work inspecting/defending/solving Business Development / Opportunities Finding new business opportunities both local and global Maximising the efficiencies of our manufacturing plant and identifying the right mix of products as part of that process Preparing arguments on contentious technical or contractual matters Technical Presentations External, internal and factory tours Production Planning & Techniques Observing and reporting on craftsmanship and haz-ops in production. System improvement opportunities etc. Health & Safety Commitment to the Work Safe Home Safe strategy Grants R&D Tax Credits Manage grant / R&D Tax Credit application processes to ensure compliance with requirements of relevant grant aiding authorities Key Skills and Qualifications: Qualified Structural Engineer with experience in the manufacturing or construction sector and in particular with reinforced concrete solutions. The successful candidate will be an independent person, team focused and someone who has the ability to provide both coaching and mentoring to the Design & Detailing Team. Self-motivated individual who has extensive industry experience and strong commercial awareness. Experience of working, managing, influencing and building relationships at all levels of a business. Good interpersonal, problem solving, analytical and two-way communication skills. Ability to use initiative and get things done without direct line authority, to exercise personal influence, resolve conflict, and bring about required behaviours. Capability to proactively seek feedback on self; recognize own capabilities and take initiative to continually improve. Demonstrate leadership ability and the capability to develop team members in support of individual career goals and team objectives. Interested in personal career development in organisational management and leadership and in assisting with the development of the next generation of managers Barnaby Stewart Built Environment Email: info@barnabystewart.com Applicants must also be eligible to work in Ireland Unfortunately, due to our high number of applications we are unable to respond to all applicants. If you do not hear back within 2 weeks of submitting your application, please assume your application has been unsuccessful.

item.title: Quality Manager
item.content: Quality ManagerA QM permanent role is available with a medical device company in Cork. This role is also commutable from Tipperary and Kerry. Achieve the Quality manager will be responsible to manage and develop the Cork facility quality team and to provide expert QA support to ensure plant goals and objectives.Responsibilities&#149; Develops and manages a high performance quality engineering team with focus on customer needs, compliance, product quality, and risk mitigation.&#149; Is viewed as a leader or expert in the areas of QSR and ISO/MDD standards within one&rsquo;s own group, constantly promoting awareness of best industry practices and making appropriate decisions on a daily basis using the Quality Engineering Manager/Site QA Director as the final arbitrator on critical quality decisions.&#149; Develops, directs and executes plans for major segments of complex projects from a quality perspective.&#149; Compiles and analyses operational, test and validation data to establish technical specifications and performance standards for newly designed or modified products and processes.&#149; Takes a leadership role in developing and implementing new techniques and initiatives to enhance the Quality management system on site and across the Corporation where possible.&#149; Is key to developing staff on new quality initiatives and assists understanding and rollout of quality initiatives across the department/site.&#149; Is a champion of continuous improvement with particular focus on product quality through six sigma initiatives.&#149; Is an effective people manager resulting in a motivated high performance team. Is an influential team member, fully motivated to achieve and demonstrate best practices in line with the department and site objectives.&#149; Is an effective people manager resulting in a motivated high performance team. Is an influential team member, fully motivated to achieve and demonstrate best practices in line with the department and site objectives.&#149; Works with EHS to identify significant environmental impacts of the operations and to establish goals and targets around significant environmental impacts.Education &amp; Experience Requirements&#149; Minimum level 8 relevant Engineering/Science degree&#149; Ideally 4 years + experience in a leadership role within a manufacturing environment&#149; Experience/training in problem solving and process improvement methodologies&#149; Excellent interpersonal and communication skills&#149; Ability to work as part of a team and meet targets/goals efficiently&#149; Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills&#149; Strong knowledge of quality principles and the ability to utilize these methods in a manufacturing environmentFor further information on this Quality Manager role in Cork please contact Helga Reeves on (phone number removed) helga@hero.ieCheck out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website &ndash; (url removed)Please Note: Under its obligation under the Data Protection legislation, HERO Recruitment will not forward your details to any company without your prior approval

item.title: Lighting Technical Engineer
item.content: Lighting Technical EngineerAn exciting position has become available for a full time Lighting Technical Engineer to join a friendly team based in County Wicklow. The successful candidate will earn a competitive salary. The successful candidate will be passionate about providing customers a &ldquo;wow&rdquo; experience and ensuring their success. Reporting to the Managing Director, the Lighting Technical Support Engineer will play a key role in supporting our customers on every project from their tailored design through to the project completion and ensure every customer is delighted with their experience.You must have an electrical / lighting background and live in LeinsterRole Requirements * Computer skills; basic skills with Design Software (AutoCAD and/or 3-D modeling), proficiency with Visual Lighting Software, a demonstrated ability to work with spreadsheet tools, along with proficiency with Microsoft Office products. * Industry knowledge; knowledge in the following areas along with a proven ability to apply knowledge to perform a wide array of jobs activities and elevate operational effectiveness: * Working knowledge of lighting technologies and controls * Proficient knowledge of construction trade * Knowledge of the ETCI codes of practice; Leed , Breeam and Well standards * Technical writing; a demonstrated ability to successfully write clear and complete technical reports and proposals * Critical thinking; history of actively analyzing, assessing, evaluating and reflecting on information gathered from observation, experience or communication * Communication; demonstrated ability to successfully communicate in a variety of formats across all levels of an organization * Decision making; demonstrated ability to drill down; analyze and interpret data to make sound decisions after weighing costs, benefits, risks and rewards * Planning; demonstrated ability to effectively set priorities, establish timelines, and leverage resources * Customer focus; a history of meeting or exceeding customer expectations, developing positive customer relationships and having a genuine concern for their needs * Quality control; high standards for quality and holds others accountable to a high quality of work; proven ability to establish and monitor quality measures as well as a take corrective actions * Flexible and adaptable; demonstrated ability to quickly and effectively shift priorities and a history of being open to change * Training and experience in Cad drawing + Rivitt.e * Experience with Dialux - Evo savie - for lighting calculations. * Understanding of electrical circuitry and general electrical control. * Interest in building an expertise in the Well Accreditation. * Deadline oriented and result driven with good organisational and communication skills. * Experience and an interest in the lighting industry would be an advantage as would a good working knowledge of architectural lighting.Role Responsibilities * Listening and learning from our customers to gain an understanding of their needs. * Working with the in-house design team to generate the best solutions for each individual project * Generating lighting layouts and where necessary developing 3D models to simulate light ideas. * Compiling costing workbooks and generating quotations and presentations, using our customised software package. * Project management from hand-over by sales team to delivery on site. * Quality assurance of product being delivered. * Become expert in Winks Innovative and well manufactured product portfolio in order to support customer requirements. * Post-delivery support and problem solvingCompanyOur client is one of Ireland&rsquo;s leading lighting design and supply companies, with over 30 years&rsquo; experience in the sector. Run by a renowned lighting designer, our client provides lighting solutions including LED lighting for commercial, residential, conservation, urban and hospitality projects.With vast experience in architectural lighting design and what is best practice, the company design using cutting edge lighting technologies to create lighting effects that help people experience healthier and happier environments.Why should you apply? * To join a fantastic company * To become part of a great team * To showcase your knowledge and skill setIf you&rsquo;re the ideal candidate our client is looking for, please send your CV by clicking the APPLY buttonKeywords: Lighting, Technical, Engineer, Cad drawing, Rivitt.e, Dialux , Evo savie, Electrical Circuitry, Electrical Control, LED Lighting, Commercial, Residential, Conservation, Urban, Hospitality

item.title: Technical Business Analyst
item.content: Our client is a global, dynamic and high growth fintech that is rapidly becoming a global market leader. Due to continued success and expansion they are looking to recruit a Technical Business Analyst to join their highly successful Compliance team.Technical Business Analyst have full responsibility for the business and functional solution design, technical analysis of platform capabilities, business processes analysis and end to end testing (including supporting client UAT).Working both independently and within a client aligned team, you will examine existing IT systems and business models, analyse requirements (both business and technical) and translate these into user stories and core functionality documentationThe Day-to-Day?Analysis:&#xF0FC;Develop and maintain a deep knowledge of the platform functionality and business processes related to their nominated functional area.&#xF0FC;Educate and prepare customers (external and internal) on core platform functionality.&#xF0FC;Working closely with our customer on site to develop solutions and testing these solutions to meet business and technical requirements.Test Design &amp; Preparation:&#xF0FC;Review/analyse business requirements to ensure they are quantifiable and testable.&#xF0FC;Write/Produce artefacts to support testing activities such as Test Designs, Test Matrices, Test Cases, Test Procedures, Test Scripts and Behavioural Models.Test Execution:&#xF0FC;Perform structured and context-driven (formal /ad-hoc) system, system integration and regression testing as required.&#xF0FC;Use internal defect tracking and test case management system(s) to document test cases, record defects and record test case execution results.&#xF0FC;Raise and re-test defects.Experience Required: * University Degree (desired) * Solid experience as a Business/Systems Analyst * Confident, and able to take initiative given client&ndash; and delivery-focused environment. * Independent, self-directing and delivery focused working style. * Strong analytical thinking and commercial awareness. * Intermediate computer skills essential (SQL is desirable). * Excellent organisational, administration and time management skills. * Good communication skills, confident in dealing with internal and external clients. Financial services industry knowledge desired.This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Technical Business Analyst to work for an industry leading, dynamic and forward-thinking organization, offering excellent progression and development opportunities.If you feel that you have the necessary skills and experience to succeed in the role Technical Business Analyst, then please apply now for immediate consideration

item.title: Service Desk Analyst – Contract

You will have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise work in a busy helpdesk environment.What&rsquo;s involved: * Providing technical support to roughly 700 users * Configuration &amp; installation of servers, desktops, printers * Software maintenance &amp; support * Responsible for handling escalations &amp; queries * Reporting against service levelsWhat you need: * 3+ years&rsquo; experience on a busy helpdesk * Strong troubleshooting experience * Active Directory Management * Office 365/ MS Licensing * Ability to provide mobile device support * Excellent Communication skills * Stamp 4/ EU PassportWhat&rsquo;s on offer: * Excellent Daily Rate depending on experienceApply NowIf you would like to discuss this opportunity in person or with one of our IT Resourcers please forward your CV to Vantage Resources or contact Eric Seery on (phone number removed) for a confidential discussion. item.title: Information Security Analyst

The role will include analysing, investigated, and auditing security process within the company. If you like to see your solutions come to life then this could be the next role for you! Key Responsibilities:Monitor logs and alertsWork with SOC team to analyse malicious activityAudit application security controlsJoin in vulnerability and threat assessmentsAdvise staff on security best practises Key Requirements:Excellent communication skillsExperience working in event/incident managementGood knowledge in a variety of frameworks, ISO, NIST, etcExperience working within a SOC, SEIM, SplunkIdeally a strong networking background including various firewall vendors i.e. Palo-Alto, Cisco, CheckpointStrong Sys admin knowledge, configuration, monitoringDegree educatedSecurity certifications ideally i.e. CISSP, CEH, CCNA For more information please contact Peter Raine (phone number removed)Reperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: Remote Talent Acquisition Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: PMO Analyst / Lead – Contract
item.content: PMO Analyst / Lead &ndash; Contract, City CentreDon&rsquo;t miss out on this great opportunity to work with one of Ireland&rsquo;s leading Financial Services companies.PMO Analyst / Lead Role and Responsibilities:This role will see the successful candidate work with the PMO Team and support the Project Managers with their deliverables.What&rsquo;s involved: * Manage the day to day activities of the PMO Team who are responsible for the following activities: * Internal / External Executive Level Reports (Steering) * High Level Programme Plans for Executive Level Reporting * KPI&rsquo;s * Reporting * Milestone Plan * Change Request LogWhat you need: * Experience with the following: * Working in a PMO * Monitoring program risk * Supporting the relationship between the PMO Team and Project Managers. * Compiling weekly and monthly reports and logs * Supporting the creation of Decision and Change Request Papers for relevant governance forums. * Supporting the monitoring of critical path analysis and interdependencies between programmes.What&rsquo;s on offer: * Competitive day rate depending on experienceApply NowIf you would like to discuss this opportunity in person or with one of our IT Resourcers please forward your CV to Vantage Resources or contact Marelize van der Westhuizen on (phone number removed) for a confidential discussion. Vantage Resources will not forward your details without prior discussion and approval.Vantage Resources is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse working environment by recruiting people from different backgrounds and cultures. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for engagement and/or employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity sexual orientation, national origin, culture, disability or age. An inclusive and diverse workforce is an essential part of the development of our organisation&rsquo;s culture which we believe enhances both our working environment and the service we provide to our customers
