LimerickSalary: &euro;50k+PackageAn experienced Health &amp; Safety Officer is required to join a leading main contractor on a project in the city of Limerick.This is a fantastic opportunity to work for a well-established company, reporting directly to the Project Manager &amp; Director, you will support the organisation in driving their Safety culture forward.Responsibilities:Support the Site management team with planning, coordinating and implementing of effective Health Safety &amp; Training policies, guidelines and procedures to ensure that the business objectives are met.Provide support to the Management and Operation team in all aspects of safety, occupational health, safety, Training / Development and on occasion environmental issues.Support the HR Manager in ensuring Health &amp; Safety compliance and perform regular Health and Safety auditsAssist with developing Health and Safety plans that comply with Company policies and procedures as well as Internal and external stakeholders requirementsEnsure training, tool box meetings, and drills are implemented as part of the company&rsquo;s training and Health &amp; Safety and HR program, i.e. emergency response systems, etc.Investigate and complete the process for close out of all Accident Investigation Reports and prepare/submit preventative measure initiatives for implementationManage Safety Statistic reporting within and benchmark performance with relative other industries.Assist in the development of project specific Health and Safety procedures.Ensure premises, transportation and employees are compliant with Company policies and safety standards and that there are sufficient systems in place to monitor and safeguard same.Successfully develop and implement work site Health &amp; Safety campaigns and good practicesRequirements:Must have a Qualification in H&amp;S&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4+ years&rsquo; experience in working with ContractorsKnowledge of IT Systems an advantageSet an example of enthusiasm, loyalty and hard work in the performance of all duties.&nbsp;&nbsp;Site experience essential

item.title: Maintenance System Administrator
item.content: Headcount Solutions is seeking a Maintenance System Administrator for Dublin-based projectsMain Responsibilities: * Support the technical aspects of engineering / maintenance activities * CMMS change management, data management and document collection. * Generate reports and metrics on maintenance systems management KPIs for multiple departments. * Assist with equipment record management * Uploading spare parts and Bill of Material. * Assist and comply with change control procedure. * Complete accuracy reviews of the equipment record and maintenance plans, * Collect information and write SOP&rsquo;s, route for review and approval via Documentation Management System. * Write Training Documents / Manuals with input from equipment owners, engineers and vendors. * Schedule and organise review meetings. * Liaising with Engineering Document Management and assist with the maintenance of this system.Requirements: * Strong understanding of standard software applications, MS Word Excel, Access and, ideally, Sharepoint * Experience with using SAP or similar software is advantageous * Knowledge of GMP requirements in an engineering environment * Experience with reporting on maintenance management systems is highly desirable.For further information please contact Mick on (phone number removed) or forward details in confidence to jobs@headcount.ie

item.title: Systems Engineer Technical Lead
item.content: Systems Engineering Technical Lead - R&amp;D - Medical - Infusion SystemsJob DescriptionWe are recruiting for a highly driven Technical leader in Systems Engineering with proven product development experience and technical leadership to drive new initiatives strategic to the Medication Management Solutions (MMS) business. The successful candidate will have deep technical knowledge and experience in infusion systems with demonstrated success in working with a highly interdisciplinary internal and external teams.Additionally, the Technical Lead will demonstrate a strong background of leadership that: * Ensures excellent planning and effective use of resources that will achieve organizational goals * Drives and leads problem resolution at an accelerated pace using new approaches and methodologies * Is able to deep dive into technical issues and provide technical leadership * Is proactive, able to deliver and execute * Can regularly and effectively interact with other senior leaders for briefings and technical meetings * Effectively communicate progress toward project/program goals * Uses independent judgment to develop strategies and implement operational policies and directives * Has developed leaders and direct reports for current and future needs and will positively align talent decisions to strategic plans * Has strong business acumen and customer-centricityEducation &amp; Experience: * Strong working knowledge and experience with medical devices are preferred. Experience with Infusion products or similar medical devices are a plus. * Advanced degree in a related engineering discipline (Electrical, Physics, Mechanical, Software, Systems) highly desirable * At least 10 years of increasing responsibility in R&amp;D technical engineering roles * Extensive and successful experience in product development, with a clear understanding of product development and quality management systems processes. * Regulated industry experience (MDD, FDA, Automotive, Industrial, etc.) * Familiarity with Electro-mechanical systems and Software connectivity * Direct experience with highly connected systems and systems integration * Multi-disciplinary engineering team leadership * Cross-functional team membership * Project management experience for complex systems * Experience transferring product to manufacturingWillingness to travel up to 10% (domestic and international)

item.title: Electrician
item.content: My fantastic client has an exciting opportunity for electricians to join them on various sites across ROI. The role is paying Union Rates, company vehicle, uniform, digs and travel covered.Current locations are:* North Dublin* Navan*DroghedaYou will be expected to carry out 35 Meter installs a week and anything over that you will receive a bonus.The successful candidates must have:1) ROI Level 6 Qualification2) Clean Drivers Licence3) Electrical install experienceIf you or someone you know is interested, please contact Simon on (phone number removed) or apply online ASAP for a start in the New Year.Job Types: Full-time, Contract, PermanentSalary: &euro;24.00-&euro;34.00 per hour

item.title: Senior Environmental Consultant
item.content: <div><strong>Senior Environmental Consultant</strong></div><div><br /></div><div>If you want to work on some of the largest and most complex environmental projects in the country with a client base comprising most of the Fortune 500 inward investors into Ireland, then please send us your CV for our position as Senior Environmental Consultant.</div><div><br /></div><div><strong>CORE TRAITS</strong></div><div><strong><br /></strong></div><div>1. Enthusiastic self starter comfortable working in a fast paced consultancy environment - ability to multi-task</div><div>2. Excellent report writing skills with good attention to detail</div><div>3. Excellent communication skills - comfortable liaising, meeting and dealing with clients, regulatory representatives, contractors and other team members on a day to day basis</div><div><br /></div><div><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></div><div><br /></div><div><strong>REQUIRED EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:</strong></div><div><strong><br /></strong></div><div>1. Preparation of EPA Waste/IED/IPC Licensing Applications or Waste Facility Permit Applications</div><div>2. Preparation and Co-Ordination of Environmental Impact Statements or contributing to EIAR (supporting chapters etc)</div><div>3. Preparation of Environmental Liability Risk Assessments, Closure Restoration and Aftercare Management Plans in accordance with current guidance</div><div>4. Experienced in co-ordination of environmental monitoring programmes (water, effluent, discharge licence related) and preparation of periodic compliance reports.</div><div><br /></div><div><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></div><div><br /></div><div><strong>BASIC REQUIREMENTS:</strong></div><div><strong><br /></strong></div><div>1. Minimum 5 years experience working in the Environmental sector</div><div>2. Experience of preparing EIS and EIAR Reports</div><div>3. Experience of EPA licensed sites and EPA enforcement</div><div>4. Qualification and experience in a specific technical area such as chemistry or engineering</div><div>5. Full Clean Driving Licence</div><div>6. Membership/Chartership of a recognised Environmental Professional body such as IEMA, IGI, CIWM, CIWEM etc.</div><div><br /></div><div><strong>BENEFITS:</strong></div><div><br /></div><div>We offer a class leading competitive salary plus a range of benefits including a contributory pension, discretionary company bonus, PHI & Life Insurance, up to 25 days holiday and a flexible working policy.</div><div><br /></div><div><strong>Job Types: Full-time, Permanent</strong></div><div><strong><br /></strong></div><div><div><strong>Contact</strong></div><div><strong><br /></strong></div><div><strong>Please email your resume and cover letter to: </strong></div></div><div> </div><img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?ECex30yd0aUoulPtgQw9Bwh" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Manufacturing Operations Coordinator
item.content: My Client, a growing pharmaceutical company based in North Dublin are looking for a Manufacturing Operations Coordinator to join their growing team.Your New Company;A virtual manufacturing company, you will be working with a company that is in the process of acquiring a new product range. This is an agile and flexible company that has growth plans for the future.Your New Role;As Manufacturing Operations Coordinator you will be responsible for;Post-launch Technical Troubleshooting ensuring fast resolution of technical issues and continuous process improvements in collaboration with our CMOs.Project Management of multiple cross-functional Technology Transfer projects and Life-cycle Changes, including additions of new API sources / change in manufacturing site / manufacturing technology.Ensuring effective, on-time product transfers with robust manufacturing processes and continuity of supplyProvide on-site support to CMOs during manufacture of scale up, trial and validation batches or during audits as required. Lead and support process investigations and CAPA implementation at CMOsPost Launch Technical Support to our CMOs on technical and regulatory issues. Provide process science, manufacturing technology and validation support for Manufacturing Projects. Perform gap analysis and associated risk assessmentsReview the technical documentation (batch records, specifications, product process and analytical method validation protocols and validation reports) from the manufacture of industrial batches.Participate in CMO selection process, assessing CMOs capabilities and promoting open collaboration. Build and maintain professional relationships with CMOs.Project management of the Manufacturing Projects. Responsible for the definition and adherence to project timeliness, scope and project cost. Keep Project stakeholders informed about process bottlenecks, as well as deviations from scope, budget and timeliness, suggest and implement solutions. What you need to Succeed;5 Years&#39; experience in a manufacturing role within the pharmaceutical industryExperience in manufacturing operations for injectable formulations including cleaning and sterilization, bulk manufacturing, filtration, terminal sterilization and aseptic fill finish. What you will gain;The opportunity to work with a growing company in a Senior capacity. You will work with site leadership and CMO&#39;s on the introduction of new products into the business.What to do Next?Apply below with your up to date CV!To find out more about Real please visit Real Staffing, a trading division of SThree Partnership LLP is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy| Registered office | 1st Floor, 75 King William Street, London, EC4N 7BE, United Kingdom | Partnership Number | OC(phone number removed) England and Wales

item.title: Supervising Pharmacist
item.content: Supervising Pharmacist, Ref. VAC-12517CavanFT Perm ContractExcellent Negotiable salary DOEOur client is a well-known brand with multiple stores across Ireland. At this time they wish to hire a Supervising Pharmacist to cover the Cavan area.Key Functions: (include but may not be limited to):&bull; Assist in the professional, clinical, ethical and financial running of the pharmacy in line with company and industry regulations.&bull; Work with the team to deliver complete care solutions for our customers and patients.&bull; Dispense and advise patients on POM and P medicines.&bull; Assist in the management of OTC stock control and merchandising.&bull; Execute the dispensary business plan.&bull; Assist in group healthcare and retail events.&bull; Day to day management of the dispensary.&bull; Communicate with the team on business performance, new initiatives and other pertinent issues.&bull; To partake in staff training events and encourage and support the development of the team.Experience/Qualifications/Requirements:&bull; Applicants must be degree qualified and a &quot;Registered Pharmacist&quot; with the Pharmaceutical Society of Ireland, or be eligible to register with the PSI immediately.&bull; A self-motivated, enthusiastic individual with excellent people skills, confidence and good clinical knowledge.&bull; Must have the ability to be acutely aware of customer needs while being also being a commercial thinker, with the ability to balance being a healthcare professional while being mindful of the business aims.&bull; Have a key focus on customer service and developing the customer base.&bull; A highly organised individual who has the ability to work under pressurised circumstances.&bull; A professional who takes their work very seriously and continuously strives for perfection and who is eager to surpass all expectations.&bull; Someone who is positive, committed, loyal and an excellent communicator.&bull; The ideal candidate will have previous nursing home experience.What&rsquo;s on offer?Competitive salaryExcellent staff discountDiscretionary bonusAccess to additional benefits tailored to meet your individual needsCareer progressionHow to Apply:Please send your full and up to date CV along with a cover note or email to David/Robert in our Multi-Sector team in order to apply for this role.Our team has many decades of recruitment experience and we provide our clients with a comprehensive service to supply and manage their workforce needs.Currently we have offices across Ireland and U.K, to include Derry, Dublin, Cork, Galway, and London.It is 3D Personnel&rsquo;s policy to work closely with both our clients and candidates in order to build strong, mutually beneficial and lasting relationships.For a full list of jobs we currently have available please visit https://(url removed)/jobs/3D Personnel is operating as an Employment Agency and Business.Equality is at the forefront of our operation and we provide equality of opportunity to everyone.You can review our Privacy Policy on the home page of our website

Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Electrical Site Supervisor | West Dublin
item.content: Electrical Site Supervisor | West Dublin &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose The role of the Electrical Site Supervisor is to support the Site Manager in the organization and co-ordination of site-based activities and to lead and co-ordinate teams of Electrical Engineering trade professionals on site. The Supervisor will be responsible for tracking and recording of site daily activities and progress. They will lead their teams to deliver to quality, on time and to budget in a safe and efficient manner. They will deal with obstacles and develop team capacity. &nbsp; Electrical Site Supervisor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project in line with the Kirby Way: &nbsp; Commercial: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fully understand your IFC scope of work and notify IFC variations to CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete take-offs for variations as requested. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Populate SE progress assessment form in conjunction with planners. &nbsp; Schedule: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Develop 2 week look ahead and agree it with CM at weekly meeting. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Coordinate work with other trades in your area through whiteboard and directly. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure your scope is construction complete for agreed start dates of testing and commissioning. &nbsp; Scope: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and fully understand IFC Scope of works. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and agree area site set-up with C.M. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Install area site set-up in line with agreed plan &ndash; all on wheels, nothing directly on the floor. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Appoint person responsible to maintain and clean your area. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure temp power is available for directs and subcontractors prior to required date. &nbsp; Quality: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Understand Quality objective of Project &ndash; snag free systems on time. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand Quality Control Plan which is based on 6M&rsquo;s. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement Quality Control Plan on site. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand ITP. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement ITP. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure only specified materials are used for your scope of installation. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete Weekly Quality Audits and check lists. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear quality audit actions as soon as possible. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Identify snag items as the installation progresses &ndash; stand down crew forTBT if snags are repeated. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear snag items to suit walkdown schedule. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all personnel have seen relevant FoK&rsquo;s to their task. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conduct quality TBT&rsquo;s. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure the works are adequately protected. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure Drawings are Red lined and signed in line with agreed due dates. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Collate and File all relevant documentation delivered with materials, plant and equipment. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Read and understand the manufacturer&rsquo;s instructions. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure materials, plant and equipment are installed to specification and manufacturers recommendations. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure installation is in accordance with P&amp;IDs and Isometrics. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Understand and follow the requirements associated with maintaining the correct files on site. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Advise CM if NCR is necessary. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel have the relevant training for the allocated tasks. &nbsp; EHS: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand the safety objective of the project &ndash; target Zero incidents and understand why &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel are inducted including subcontractors prior to starting any task. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Plan all tasks through identifying hazards in your work area, assessing the risk, determining and implementing control measures prior to starting any task &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Planning is particularly important for MIMO, Working at Height and Working with/around electricity &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure appropriate RAMS are in place for all tasks &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand the RAMS, advise CM of any required amendments prior to undertaking the task, do not start task until RAMS are updated &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that employees and subcontractors are properly instructed and sign up to appropriate RAMS as required. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure SPA&#39;s are in place when setting your personnel and subcontractors to work and are appropriate for the task and signed by yourself &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Coordinate work with other trades in your area (co-sign SPA&rsquo;s where possible) &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure exclusion zones and restricted zones are identified and noted on Exyte daily whiteboards &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Enforce rule that no persons to work underneath other trades working at height &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure housekeeping issuesare highlighted and noted on Exyte daily whiteboards &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; All materials and tools used while working at height must be secured, tethered or removed from location &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Large cable pulls to have an exclusion zone in the relevant area, if too disruptive to other trades then cable pulls must be done through night work. Night work needs to be agreed in advance with CM &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain a tidy workplace. Ensure that cleaning takes place regularly or as work is carried out and place of work and access routes are kept clear. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel have the relevant training for the allocated tasks. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The operation of a protective or control device is to be done by Intel or a Kirby AP, no other person is authorised to switch on or off a protective or control device &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Encourage participation by all in SBO scheme &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure prompt close out of SBO&rsquo;s &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that all plant and machinery including power and hand tools are in a good condition, defect free and that statutory, in-house inspection and maintenance procedures are carried out as required. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that any defects in plant and equipment are rectified or remove defective items as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that you complete &lsquo;Site Supervisor Safety Audit&rsquo; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear any actions from audit as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conduct &ldquo;Tool Box&quot; talks and keeps attendance records in the site safety file. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Inform the employees of their safety performance on site and any improvements needed through the behavioural notice card system &ndash; Green, Yellow and Red &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Escalate incident situations through informing CM or PM as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Participate in incident investigation &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement determined incident remedial actions to prevent reoccurrence of incident as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that adequate fire-fighting equipment is available where necessary and there is a competent person in the crew to use &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that the area first aid box is adequately stocked, maintained and there is a member of the crew competent to use it &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that all power tools are 110 volts. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Issues permits where required, ensure that the requirements for these permits are maintained and copies of all work permits are filed in the safety file e.g. hot work permit to work etc. when competent to do so. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Demonstrate safety leadership by not &ldquo;turning a blind eye&rdquo;. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that employees do not participate in horseplay or improper conduct at the place of work. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Stand down any person from the workplace deemed to present a hazard to themselves or others and report them to CM or PM. &nbsp; Procurement: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist CM with development of Procurement schedule. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Track delivery of all relevant orders to ensure delivery dates align with procurement schedule and programme. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Requisition minor materials in line the IFC requirements and track delivery. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all IR&#39;s for minor equipment are completed correctly. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement plan to ensure all deliveries are checked and verified. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all materials are correctly Stored &ndash; nothing directly on the floor. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Comply with purchasing procedure with regard to delivery docket management. &nbsp; Communications: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Deliver briefings on key project daily or weekly items, deliver safety and quality TBT&rsquo;s. &nbsp; HR and Subcontractors: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure Biometric or facial recognition clock is in operation and all operatives are instructed on its use (including subcontractors) &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Track and detail actual personnel on site daily (directs and subcontractors) for your scope of work and submit to CM daily &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete Employee assessment forms for tradesmen and apprentices. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Advise CM on performance of directs and subcontractor&rsquo;s compliance with our expectations, both good and where there are development opportunities &nbsp; General: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review relevant construction pack (specifications, schedules and drawings) for your scope of work and develop a set of familiarisation notes for Construction Manager (CM) or Project Manager (PM) to review. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Take ownership for your work area and scope of work. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Escalate when necessary (after you have done what you can) any safety, quality, schedule, coordination with other trades, personnel and commercial issues to CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attend Weekly project meeting with CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist Construction Manager is compiling Lesson&#39;s learned at the end of the project. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Site Supervisor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Senior Trades qualification or equivalent coupled with 5+ years site experience within pharmaceutical/medical device, commercial, industrial or data centre type sectors &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can interpret schematics and electrical drawings &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong understanding of site activities and how they are planned and coordinated &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Record of success as a Trade Leader &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Familiarity with materials ordering and lead times &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong client focus &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Commercial acumen &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Planner/Organised &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Influencer &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conscientious &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Decisive and action oriented &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Team player &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attentive to detail and record keeper &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Results oriented with the resilience to work under pressure&nbsp;For more information on this Electrical Site Supervisor position or other Electrical Site Supervisor / Mechanical Site Supervisor opportunities based in Ireland, UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Principal Software Engineer
item.content: Principal Software Engineer Dublin City Centre&euro;100K - &euro;120K p/a + Bonus/Stock etcWe&#39;re looking for a Principal Engineer to join one of the most exciting tech companies in Dublin, back hiring again. We need someone capable of leading a team, and contributing to code on critical projects. The company is recognised as one of the best places to work in Ireland and you can rest assured you would be working alongside some of the top talent in Dublin. Security is a huge feature, someone with a background in access management for example would be of particular interest... a SAAS background ideal, and in terms of specific language experience, they are totally agnostic (although you&#39;ll need a willingness to work with Java/Kotlin of course).StackJava, Kotlin, Kafka, Spark, AWSThe candidate we&#39;re looking for&hellip;7+ years software engineering experience.SAAS experience.Cloud experience (GCP/AWS ideal).Experience leading and mentoring dev teams.Experienced at all stages of the dev lifecycle.An advocate of best practices. If you&#39;re interested in discussing in more detail don&#39;t hesitate to get in touch with Craig McConkey at Reperio or simply hit apply. We value confidentiality and your details will not be shared with any employers without your permission. Relevant to: Principal Software Engineer, Technical Lead, Lead Software Developer, Senior Software Engineer, Kotlin, Java, AWS, Technical ArchitectReperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: Front end Developer
item.content: My client are looking for a front end developer with Vue.js experience to join their team. They are an innovative software development company based in Cork. If successful, you will be working on mulitiple exciting projects in 2021. This contract will be at least 6 months but will likely extend beyond this.Requirements5+ years experience in Front end developmentJavaScript, HTML5, CSS3.1-2 years commerical Vue.js experienceAnother JS framework is an advantage. Reperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Finishing Foreman
item.content: Vacancy: Finishing ForemanLocation: Dublin Salary: &euro;65K + Package 3D Personnel&rsquo;s client is currently seeking Finishing Foreman to be based on a project based in a Dublin city centre.The Finishing Foreman will be responsible for the day-to-day running of the project reporting to the Contracts Manager and or Site Manager and working closely with the Site Team Members and Sub-contractors.&nbsp;Duties:&nbsp;Implementation of daily and weekly programmes together with the issue of programme detail to sub-contractorsAttending weekly management team meeting&nbsp;Maintaining the site diary &ndash; recording manpower levels for each sub-contractor and keeping detailed notes of all site activitiesCompiling labour allocation sheets&nbsp;Assisting with the control of plant and equipment on siteCo-ordinating and managing subcontractorsEnsuring work is carried out to the highest of standardsDealing with all health and safety issues on siteAbility to motivate labourers and sub-contractorsRequirements:&nbsp;At least 5 years&#39; experience managing all finishing works on the construction of high spec developmentsHave previous experience with main contractor, in the Irish / UK construction industryGood longevity in your positions / companiesExcellent interpersonal skills, strong oral and written communication skillsAbility to work to strict schedules

item.title: HSEQ Officer
item.content: Building Staff Solutions (BSS) are hiring a HSEQ Officer for our client, a very well-known Main Contractor with long history of completing projects on time, within budget and to the highest standards. The role will be based on a site in Dublin and the successful candidate will be responsible for advising on overall compliance in matters of Health &amp; Safety.Your ResponsibilitiesConducting regular, formal site audits andcarrying out inspections as directed in the Safety Management SystemEnsuring that record of statutory inspections are kept for all activities and plant equipmentDelivering and completing statutory notifications to the Health &amp; Safety Authority for the project and all incident / accident reporting and to conduct inspector site visits as required by the Health &amp; Safety AuthorityDelivering Health &amp; Safety induction program&#39;sfor new employees or contractors working on siteManaging and making recommendations for Personal Protective Equipment required for all EmployeesAssisting Site Management in compiling cost records and forecasts for all issues associated with Health &amp; Safety including, but not limited to, contra charges, training, purchases, etcServing as company representative at Site meetings;Organizing and chairing the Safety Meetings for Sub-Contractors personnelEnsuring sub-contractor safety statement&#39;s andrequired Method statement are available on site and assess sub-contractor statements and method statements, assisting where requiredAdvising / assisting Site Management in drafting and communicating Method StatementsCompiling, updating and communicating site Emergency PlansConducting preliminary accident investigations and statutory notifications, while keeping Group Safety Officer updatedMaking sure First aid is available, that an adequate quantity of First Aid supplies is in stock and that all relevant Certs are updatedCollecting and collating relevant information for inclusion in the Safety File and preparing for handover to the Client at the end of the project.What you need to have3rd Level H &amp; S QualificationGood knowledge of HSEQ management systems and a strong technical writing abilityPrevious experience managing safety on siteExcellent communication, leadership, training and presentation skillsExperience in the construction industryExperience with Irish or UK contractsWhat you get in returnExcellent working environmentLatest available training to assist you in your roleCompetitive Salary - 39 Hours - &euro;40k Together with a company vehicle, phone and laptopWork for a well-structured and supported organisation that prides itself on delivery of service and customer satisfaction.If you are interested in this role, Please click apply or contact David on (phone number removed)/ today for a strictly confidential conversation.Job 36693 - INDHP BSS will process the data you have provided to help us find you suitable employment and offer you opportunities to help further your career. As we are a recruitment agency you may be considered for multiple roles that are suitable to your experience. You can review our Privacy Notice here

item.title: MES Engineer (Syncade)
item.content: Zenith Technologies is looking to hire MES Syncade Engineer to join our client&rsquo;s Biopharmaceutical site in Dublin, Ireland.Responsibilities: * Assist the Business User in defining the process * Gather and documents the requirements, via authoring the EBR Recipe Functional Specifications * Performs MES recipe authoring activities to ensure appropriate MES content/development and changes to meet the facility goals of High Product Quality and Lean Manufacturing. * Actively participate in the creation of project deliverables such as design documents, configuration, installation and validation activities as required by the project. * Actively participates in the testing and computer system validation of the MES Recipes and related configuration as required. * Responsible to develop MES recipes to design standards under the direction of the MES project manager and MES Leads. * Actively participate in the validation script creation and testing required for each MES recipe to meet site business requirements and specifications.Requirements:&bull; BS in Computer or Engineering/Sciences related discipline&bull; Experience and strong exposure to MES Emerson Syncade technology, including automated data collection, automation (DeltaV), workflow, database application, weigh and dispense and interfacing to ERP&bull; Experience of eBR/MBR design&bull; Strong knowledge of business processes used within the Pharma/Lifesciences industry&bull; 3-5 years&rsquo; experience in the biotech\pharma environment delivering MES design&bull; Strong understanding of production processes used in a drug substance - Upstream/Downstream processes&bull; Ability to constructively challenge, defend and present technical aspects of system design&bull; Experience in Databases, SQL, VB desirable

item.title: Mixed / Bovine Veterinary Surgeon
item.content: Role: Mixed Bovine Veterinary SurgeonLocation: County Limerick &ndash; IrelandHours: Full time, (6 month Spring-cover option available).Salary, Expense and Bonuses: DOE 60,000 &ndash; 80,000 Euros, inclusive.VetFinders are recruiting for our client in County Limerick, Ireland. It is a long-established country veterinary practice, searching for an additional experienced Mixed/Bovine Veterinary Surgeon. The practice is located in the Golden Vale, a region of prime farmland in the South-West of Ireland, and 10-15 minutes from Limerick City.Benefits package:Benefits of working for this successful and well-respected practice are: * There will be 20 days paid holidays and 2 days paid CVE. Professional Indemnity Insurance and registration with the Veterinary Council of Ireland will also be paid for. * Travel to Ireland paid for. * Transport available if required. * Accommodation can be sourced.About the practice:The practice is a forward thinking, established practice with an excellent reputation within the community. It focuses on providing exceptional care to its clients and their animals. It boasts modern facilities and a great team environment.There is a large animal ultrasound scanner, a bovine electro ejaculator and a callicrate bander. On the small animal side there is a microscope, an anaesthetic machine, a digital x-ray machine and a dental machine.There is a full-time veterinary nurse and experienced support staff who organise the work very well.The Role:We are looking for a compassionate and enthusiastic, Mixed/Bovine Veterinary Surgeon for immediate start; this is a permanent, full time position although a 6-month Spring Cover role is an option. The per species breakdown of the workload of the practice is as follows; 65% bovine, 30% canine/feline, 3 to 4% equine, and 1 to 2% ovine. The per species breakdown of the workload for each vet can be adjusted to suit his/her interest.The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years&rsquo; experience; this is not essential, but preferred, and there will be elements of Sole Charge.An interest in herd health would be an advantage but not essential, and the ability to cover small animal clinic would be an advantage but not essential.The out-of-hours rota, which is quiet, would be 1 in 3 from January to June; and 1 in 5 from June to January due to a shared rota with a neighbouring practice.Must haves: * Possess the qualification to work as a vet in the EU * Good communication skills * Be a team playerInterested?To apply for this vacancy or request more information please send your CV in applicationRefer a friend, family member or colleague for &pound;250Maybe this role is not suitable for yourself but you know Veterinary professional that is! If you are interested in helping them find their dream job by referring them to VetFinders. We would be very grateful and as a little &#39;thank you&#39; from us, you will receive &pound;250 for every referral that is successfully placed into a new role. Please contact us for more information.Please Note: When it come to your privacy, at VetFinders &ndash; we take it seriously.All you need to know is that when you apply, we will process your details with the utmost care, we pass on your application for the clients review for the vacancy you have applied for only. We may contact you via telephone/text/email in regards to the vacancy, but your data is held and processed in accordance of your application for the vacancy, in terms of recruitment fulfilment.If you have any pre-application questions please contact us first, just let us know the job reference, Thanks and Good luck, VetFinders

item.title: Customs Brokerage Manager Dublin €48k
item.content: Our client is a leading international shipping and logistics company who are now seeking a Customs Brokerage Manager to oversee their Customs team in Dublin.Looking after the customs needs of the client base and leading a team of 3 - the right candidate will deliver a high degree of customer service and have a keen eye for detail.This role will operate Monday - Friday - however a degree of flexibility will be required to meet the needs of the businessCandidates will have excellent knowledge inFreight Forwarding / Shipping / Imports / Exports / Customs Documentation / AEOSalary for this role will be negotiable based on experience - circa &euro;48kCandidates should be based and eligible to work in Ireland

item.title: Sales Manager (Scientific Equiptment)
item.content: Sales Manager (Scientific Equiptment)Ireland &euro;40,000 - &euro;60,000 + Autonomy + Technical Development + Bonus + Benefits Are you looking to join a highly technical, internationally recognised organisation where you will spearhead the growth of the Ireland group of companies? Do you want to join an innovative manufacturer and provider who can significant autonomy and the chance to out your stamp on the product ranges? The company specialise in the biomedical industry, therefore during this uncertain time have continued to thrive. This role is based at group level overseeing three operational companies. They are looking to grow and have plans to maximise and develop on their current product range. They pride themselves on having a fantastic working culture and friendly team environment.The role would suit someone who has sold services or capital equipment within Food, Biotech, Diagnostics or Pharmaceutical. Day to day, you will develop and close sales across the product ranges, develop business plans, oversee full sales pipeline and maximise lead generation.All in all, a fantastic opportunity to join a growing, exciting and dynamic business who can offer a chance to implement your technical expertise within a varied, autonomous role. THE ROLE: *Covering Ireland and Northern Ireland. *New business development and account management. *Promote and close sales. *Liaise across the Sales team. THE PERSON: *Experience selling services and capital equipment. *Background within Food, Biotech, Diagnostics or Pharma. *Based in Ireland or Northern Ireland. Reference Number: BBBH(phone number removed)To apply for this role or for to be considered for further roles, please click &quot;Apply Now&quot; or contact Alice Hulme at Rise Technical Recruitment. This vacancy is being advertised by Rise Technical Recruitment Ltd. The services of Rise Technical Recruitment Ltd are that of an Employment Agency. Rise Technical Recruitment Ltd regrets to inform that our client can only accept applications from engineering candidates who have a valid legal permit or right to work in the United Kingdom. Potential candidates who do not have this right or permit, or are pending an application to obtain this right or permit should not apply as your details will not be processed

item.title: Sales Specialist - Laboratory Equipment
item.content: Sales Specialist - Laboratory Equipment&euro;40,000 - &euro;47,000 (OTE &euro;55,000 - &euro;60,000) + Competitive Commission Package + &euro;3,000 Car Allowance&nbsp;Home Based - Covering Ireland&nbsp;&nbsp;The Business&nbsp; Perpetual Partnerships is currently supporting a long-standing partner who has a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Sales Specialist to join a globally established laboratory equipment manufacturer. The group specialise in the design and build of highly specialised equipment for the Pharmaceutical, Medical, Life Science and Clinical industries world-wide. They sell products into a verity of environments including but not limited to labs, universities, schools and government agencies.The Opportunity If successful you would join the business as a Sales Specialist for their Laboratory Equipment Team and be part of a global organization which can offer exceptional career development opportunities. You will work closely with current and potential customers, primarily within the Biopharma, Academic, Clinical and Industrial Sectors, to forge connections and build relationships. You will then use your in-depth knowledge of laboratory products to identify the Customer&rsquo;s specific requirements and match the companies cutting-edge laboratory products to the Customer&rsquo;s needs, helping to win new business, expand market share and drive long term sales.You will develop in-depth knowledge of the Laboratory Products market, customers and competitors and utilise this to open up sales opportunities and drive business growth. You will build and manage relationships with a wide range of key stakeholders, not only the Customer but also Distributors and Channel Managers.Key Responsibilities:Drive sales and revenue for our Laboratory Products business to meet the agreed business planForecasting, reporting and monitoring of sales performanceVisits to new and existing customers to promote the Company&rsquo;s products and servicesIdentify all decision-makers and influencers at the customer account and build relationships as appropriateMaintain comprehensive knowledge of the competitive landscapeProspecting calls to build the sales pipeline and generate leads for the wider Sales TeamUse the Company CRM to log all opportunities and campaigns and maintain Key Account plans to maximise business at major accountsMaintain up-to-date knowledge of entire product range and servicesRepresent the Company at sales meeting and industry exhibitionsThe person we need:Valid UK driving licenceLife Science Degree or equivalent experienceIn-depth knowledge of laboratory productsSales experience within the Biopharma MarketDemonstrated experience managing complex, high-value accountsA strong team player with proven ability to coordinate activities and influence actions across a Channel team of resources (not direct reports)An influencer, with excellent business acumen, negotiation and account management skillsA commercial mindset, strong presentation skills and confidence in a customer-facing roleWhat we offer you:Highly competitive salaryCommission schemeCompany car allowanceExcellent career progression as part of a global business &nbsp;If this sounds like the ideal opportunity for you please apply or contact Jamie Rafferty for more details

item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Junior Environmental Acoustics Consultant - Ireland
item.content: A graduate acoustics engineer is needed to join a world leading multidisciplinary consultancy to work from their new offices in Ireland. Previous commercial experience is required for this post, working knowledge of regulations such as BS4142 and CRTN is essential. You will have a degree in acoustics or relevant discipline. Duties will include: * Undertaking baseline surveys, analysis and computational modelling of noise emissions. * Collating data and preparing for reports. * Using specialist software to predict noise emissions. An understanding of the EIA process of building acoustics is desirable but not essential. Applicants for this post have the opportunity of joining a global team. Offering a competitive salary and flexible benefits package, the successful engineer will be starting a challenging acoustic consultancy opportunity and will be exposed to a broad range of projects. Interested in this or other roles in Acoustics please do not hesitate to contact Amir Gharaati on (url removed) or call (phone number removed). We have many more vacancies available on our website. Please refer to (url removed). This is a permanent role. Penguin Recruitment is operating as a Recruitment Agency in respect to this position
