item.title: IT Service Desk - 1st Line - 130 Euro p.d
item.content: IT Service Desk Team Member - SwordsEuro up to 130 per day depending upon experienceCandidates must be based in Dublin and not require sponsorship.6 months rolling contractWe are recruiting for full time IT Service Desk team members in Swords. We are looking for enthusiastic individuals with experience of First Line IT support.Key Responsibilities: Log incidents from phone calls and emails on the incident management systemDiagnose and resolve problems first line where possible, escalating to appropriate groups where required.Monitoring of Service Desk incident and Service Request queues. Resolver Group and customer liaison to enable effective management of incidents.Work through Incidents and Service Requests to closure.Ad-hoc duties as required Key Skills/Attributes:Must have good IT support experience in a call centre environmentDisplays a positive / can do attitude to customers and colleagues alikeA good understanding of MS Office products, PC/laptop hardwareProactive approach to problem solving.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsClient and solution focused, with analytical abilityAble to work under pressure and manage his or her own work with limited supervisionAssertive and confident in own decision making abilityHigh degree of accuracy and attention to detail Candidates must have experience of First Line IT support in a call centre environment.Project People is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy

item.title: PHP Developer - Remote Working
item.content: Join a highly successful Fintech company providing market-leading cloud-based software solutions to large multi-national organizations.Due to continuing expansion, we are now recruiting for a talented PHP DeveloperKey responsibilities are: * Continuous design, development, and delivery of a multi-tenant SaaS Fintech application. * Develop RESTful integration with third-party HRM, Finance, ERP, and Payment Systems. * Interfacing with the Product Owner, Lead Engineer, and development teams on a wide range of technical issues.Ideal Technical Profile: * 3+ Years of Development Experience with designing PHP web applications using Symfony or similar PHP frameworks. * Knowledge of RESTful patterns and API implementation. * SQL Database development experience using an ORM such as Doctrine * Good working knowledge of AWS Cloud Architecture. Multi-tenancy experience a distinct advantage. * Containerization (Docker), SSO (Okta), * Linux, Git, and CI exposure. * Experience working within Agile Methodologies (Scrum, Extreme Programming, or Kanban)

item.title: Senior Business Analyst
item.content: Senior Business Analyst, Permanent, Dublin (remote)I have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst to join a global reinsurance and insurance company who are building out their Dublin office.The successful Senior Business Analyst will report directly to the Head of Information Systems and will be responsible for implementing solutions to ensure the business is as efficient and effective as possible. The Business Analyst will lead the use and admin of your own business applications and provide day to day support to business users. Experience with SICS or a similar policy administration solution is required.Experience / skills:- Minimum 5+ years Business Analyst experience- Experience with SICS or a Similar policy administration solution.- You must have experience working within an implementation team- Ideally experience in the reinsurance or insurance sector- Experience with Salesforce implementation a massive plus- Experience with an underwriting solution preferred- Experience liaising with vendorsSalary / Benefits:- &euro;70,(Apply online only),000- Performance related bonus- Generous Pension- Private medical cover- Option to work from home (must be based in Ireland)If interested in this role give me a call on (phone number removed) or email me at (url removed)Reperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: Finishing Foreman - Kildare
item.content: Finishing Foreman - KildareICDS are currently looking to hire a Finishing Foreman for a housing project in Kildare.The Finishing Foreman:&#149; Supervising and controlling subcontractors to ensure the works are executed in accordance with the programme, including correct sequence of works, quality control, HSE management and final coordination.&#149; A high level of attention to detail is required.&#149; Ability to plan and organize a team effort for a project.&#149; 3-5 years experience with residential finishesThis is a fantastic opportunity for a Foreman to join a company that can offer long term career and progression opportunities.To register your interest please apply online or contact George at ICDSFinishing Foreman - Foreman - London - High End - Site Manager - Site Management - Knightsbridge

item.title: Electrical Site Manager - Dublin
item.content: Electrical Site Manager - Construction&euro;85,000 - &euro;90,000Dublin, IrelandA key client is expecting a very busy 2021, and are in need of support on their project based in Dublin, Ireland. They are a leading provider of high value mission critical projects within Ireland and across Europe.An excellent salary is on offer - However, no rotation or accommodation expenses will be provided, making this the ideal role for someone living in Ireland.These will be permanent positions with a scope of 5+ years&#39; work available. I am looking for Data Centre experience or similar - ie Hospital construction, Manufacturing construction.Please apply to be considered for this role

item.title: Process Project Engineer- Dublin
item.content: PROCESS PROJECT ENGINEER- DublinOur client has an urgent Process Engineering resource requirement to join their Dublin based Project Team.The project is now moving from Concept design into Front End Engineering Design on a new Building expansion to house a new synthesis suite. Following KO of FEED in June, our clients next Capital Approval Milestone is &ldquo;Implementation&rdquo; in October 2020 and the project is then scheduled to finish in 2023.This contract duration is minimum up to end Oct 2020 but assuming Implementation approval will run to end of project 2023CANDIDATE PROFILE REQUIREMENTS * Experienced in Synthesis process would be preferred but not essential. e.g. Reactors, Evaporators, Fume Hoods, Solvent Vessels, Pumps (Diaphragm/Centrifugal), Vacuum Pump, Jacket Services Heating/Cooling. * Experienced in all project phases; bringing process through Front End Engineering Design, Detailed Design, Assessing Vendor Tenders, Managing Vendor Deliverables, FAT, Commissioning, SAT and Qualification. * Experienced in Producing, Checking, Reviewing and approving of Project Documents including PFDs, Mass Balance for Process Steps, Process URSs, Vendor Submittals, Commissioning and Qualification Documentation. * Experienced in Managing Multiple Vendors to meet their deliverables and align to project schedule. * Experienced DCS systems (client uses Siemens PCS7). * Experienced using DCS Automation Systems to run Automation Equipment Phases on Process Equipment such as those listed above. * Experienced in Checking Process Calculations &amp; Critiquing P&amp;IDs

item.title: Civil Project Engineer - Power T&D - Dublin
item.content: Civil Engineer | Dublin (T&amp;D Division)Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose As part of our growing multi-disciplined engineering design and construction team, the Civil Engineer will be responsible for the management, coordination and support of all the civil elements from both tender and delivery processes through to completion of works with an emphasis on safety, civil design and quality checking to service the electrical requirements. &nbsp; Key Functions of the Civil Engineer The successful Civil Engineer will interface and work with the project team on delivery, engage with the Client&rsquo;s representatives and processes, co-ordinate with the civil sub-contractor project management team on site from mobilization through to handover and, in conjunction with the QS, the commercial management of the civil-subcontractor.&nbsp; You will play a key role in our continued growth and contribute to our reputation for engineering excellence in this area. You will deliver projects and client service that are world class. In return, you will receive professional and personal development opportunities to help you become an engineering, people and commercial leader. &nbsp; &nbsp; Civil Engineer Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows:Review tender documents and electrical requirements as defined by electrical engineers and put together a civil tender package for potential civil sub&shy;contractors Review of tender responses from a technical viewpoint in order to assist the commercial department in selecting a preferred civil sub&shy;contractor Liaise with electrical designers and civil designers to ensure civil designs meet requirements Manage and take ownership of interface with Client and Client processes in respect to civil design and works Review and quality control of civil design prior to them being issued to the Client Manage the Kirby Group input to the Client and / or Utility design review process with respect to civil designs Work with both the project PM and QS to prepare sub contract packages In conjunction with the project PM, project manage the civil sub&shy;contractor Liaise with the electrical design team &amp; electrical construction team to ensure correctness of civil installation &amp; of successful handover to electrical construction and to the end Client. Work closely with the project PM to ensure that all variations are captured and notified to the project QS in a timely manner Liaise with the civil sub&shy;contractor as required on variations and associated design / re&shy;design works Ensure that the Clients management systems are complied with as set out in the contract documentation Management of civil sub consultants and contractors. Manage projects and delivery them to quality, safely and on time. Manage, assess and develop teams and assigned individuals. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Civil Engineer3rd level qualification in Civil Engineering coupled with 3+ years engineering design/project management experience Experience in Civil Engineering design for substation or electrical power installations to the relevant design codes / standards and statutory information to ROI / NI / UK / EU jurisdictions. A proven track record of delivering projects on time and to budget An excellent influencer with the ability to partner with a dynamic professional team Possess personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and commitment to the client. Experienced and proficient in producing and presenting drawings using AutoCAD. Commercial Awareness Experience developing technical submittals, completing technical reviews and assessments. Knowledge of Health, Safety and Environmental systems and procedures &ndash; knowledge of the team, their strengths and weaknesses The ability to multi-task and manage many priorities Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills/communicates with impact Excellent record keeper and administration skills Leads and influences others. Plans and effectively manages projects. Solves problems analytically and acts decisively Is process driven and focuses on EHS and Quality Work Management Systems and Processes Mentor and Coach to junior engineers and graduates &nbsp; &nbsp; For more information on this Civil Engineer or other Project Engineer opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact Kirby Group Talent Acquisitions Team confidentially on +353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

Identifying new opportunities for growth and expansion of the account. * Liaising closely with the client and key stakeholders, providing expert advice and building strong working relationships. * Delivering and maintaining excellent standards of Risk, Compliance and Quality Management, in line with contract KPIs and Service Level Agreement.What you&rsquo;ll need to succeed: * Demonstrable experience in a management role, across both hard and soft services, within the FM industry. * Experience managing a high-profile, multi-million &euro; P&amp;L contract, with responsibility for budget and profitability. * Relevant qualifications in Facilities Management, Engineering or Technical Services would be an advantage. * Familiarity with pharmaceutical, FMCG or GMP processes. * Experience leading Facilities Management projects from start to finish. * Able to liaise with colleagues and clients to manage relationships at all levels. * Strong knowledge of SHE processes and Irish Health &amp; Safety legislation. * Health &amp; Safety Qualifications (IOSH/NEBOSH) or IWFM/CIBSE membership would be an advantage.If you&#39;re interested in this role, please apply via this advert with your up-to-date CV.If this job isn&#39;t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position within Facilities Management in Ireland, please get in touch with Marlie at Boden Group for a confidential discussion about your next move

item.title: QC Associate
item.content: Responsibilities include:Testing of raw materials, in process, stability and finished product samples. Eg Ph, Appearance, Colour, Clarity, Sub Visible Particle testing, Osmolality, Protein Concentration, Polysorbate, Moisture and Device testing. Review and authorisation of Lab Data Support Analytical Technical Transfer activity testing reports and documentation. Document review/updates when required. Monitoring of site water and Nitrogen systems. Equipment Calibration, Maintenance and Trouble Shooting. Method Validation/Verification. Training of QC Chemistry Laboratory colleagues. Laboratory Investigation support Laboratory Housekeeping and maintaining GLP standards. Assisting in regulatory audits. Commitment tracking and follow upWorking in the CAS - Chemical Analytical Sciences, 9 in team (4 perm and 5 FTEs). Close knit environment with the CAS team, everyone helps each other out and collaborate well together. Supportive team so analysts can focus on testing. Wider QC groups that support with sample management and deviations.Role will involve - Volume of samples, expelling content onto a balance, polysorbate, protein concentrate, UV, GC, Karl Fischer, some device testing. Container closures on vials and syringe. Mainly finished product and stability, high volume testing. There is a small about of raw materials, 1-2 that may come in from IQA. Candidate will start with some of the test, the CW will get involved with all areas of testing. Complete testing, right first time, candidates would need the initiative to speak up, raise issues with manager/team also ability to look at safety issues/projects, continuous improvement projects.We are looking for candidates experience with most of the methodologies called out on the JD (Ph, Appearance, Colour, Clarity, Sub Visible Particle testing, Osmolality, Protein Concentration, Polysorbate, Moisture and Device testing) GC (Gas Chromatography) testing is a good one, moisture testing, use of a UV.At least 4 of the ones called out need experience with. GMP pharma is a MUST, right first time, good documentation practices. Ideal candidate with had continuous improvement projects. Candidates needs ideal 4 years testing experience, but a solid 2 year testing experience would be considered.Our role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment

item.title: Microbiology Analyst
item.content: The Scientist 1 Micro and Scientist 2 Micro roles are responsible for assuring that non-conformance investigations, laboratory investigations and quality systems are in compliance with the good manufacturing practices and good laboratory practices as established in the code of local government regulations and company procedures. 2. Responsibilities: List main areas of responsibility: &minus; Perform routine environmental monitoring, product testing in line with company and regulatory specifications and trend associated data &minus; Perform routine testing on water purification systems in line with company and regulatory specifications and trend associated data &minus; Perform Quality Control on incoming media and test kits. &minus; Perform microbial identifications to ensure compliance with procedure and regulatory requirements &minus; Perform validation and annual re-qualification of production Sterilisers and calibration of Validation equipment and document-associated data &minus; Complete Annual re-qualification of laboratory Steriliser. &minus; Perform Process / Equipment / Facilities and Utilities Validation and document associated data &minus; When required, Review and report Steriliser Non-conformances &minus; Perform monthly run review of production sterilisers performance using statistical tools &minus; Implement improved methodologies/processes for Lab processes &minus; When required Perform microbiology assessment on engineering changes &minus; Carry out safety inspections &minus; Training of new microbiology laboratory technicians &minus; Providing Japan Distribution with Sterility Certificates for product &minus; Ensure Lab is supplied with consumables. &minus; All employees are responsible for minimizing both the Environmental and Health &amp; Safety effects of the work that they perform. &minus; Creating, implementing and assessing change requests. &minus; Sterilizing and disposing of laboratory waste. 3. Education and Experience Required for Role Essential: &minus; Minimum of Certificate level qualification preferably in Microbiology or Biological Sciences. &minus; At least 1 years industrial experience in the Pharmaceutical/Medical Devices Industry Desirable: &minus; Good knowledge of FDA and ISO requirements &minus; Good organization skills and familiarity with computer packages.Our role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. item.title: CSV Engineer
item.content: The OpportunityTeam Horizon has a vacancy for a Computer Systems Validation (CSV) Quality Engineer to work on our client&rsquo;s brand new fill-finish biologiscs expansion site in Sligo.The successful candidate will be responsible for the development and execution of the qualification for Information Systems and GxP software systems. The CSV Engineer will work as a member of the Quality Team to ensure that Quality goals and objectives are achieved. Ensure that all actions comply with current good manufacturing practice.The Role * Development of life cycle documents necessary to address the validation lifecycle for Information Systems and GxP software systems (Planning, Risk, Implementation, and maintenance of the validated state). * Ensure that Appropriate Systems are in place to evaluate changes to Validated/Qualified Systems from a Computer Systems/Software Validation perspective to ensure their continued validated/qualified state. * Review/Approval of all Computer Systems/Software Validation Documentation. * Generate 21 CFR Part11 and Annex 11 Assessments for CSV Project s. Ensure the site is in compliance with these standards. * Identify GAPs in Project delivery and report to Management * Participate as required in project activities. * Report and help resolve issues with respect to CSV Projects * Maintain and support proactive communications regarding automation related activities to ensure conformance and maintain related work schedules. * Performs effective document review to support Automation Compliance activities. * Ensure all plant personnel are fully aware of quality requirements (where relevant) by providing the necessary training. * Ensure Management is kept informed of all system failures to ensure corrective/preventive action and product containment is taken where necessary. * Ensure Quality System documentation is thorough, complete, and compliant including documents for new products. * Ensure compliance to training requirements is maintained. * Represent Quality at new product project meetingsThe Person * Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in relevant Science or Engineering * 3 years+ experience working in a highly regulated combination product/medical device / pharma manufacturing environment. * Experience of validating/testing computer systems together with good knowledge of compliance good practise (i.e. GAMP5, 21 CFR Part 11, EU Annex 11 and GxPs). * Experience of production and laboratory systems beneficial. Knowledge around MES, SAP, Plant Data Historian, Metrology Instruments and associated software. * Experience of IT infrastructure qualification as per regulatory requirements beneficial. * Experience with computer controlled equipment automation systems and Human Machine interphases beneficial

Proficient in AutoCAD software. * Develop drawings for new and existing projects. * Ability to read and understand architectural/engineering drawings. * Familiar with Microsoft Office suite of products. * Strong analytic/problem-solving skills. * Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment. * Dependable, flexible * Strong technical understanding of Timber Frame design, manufacture and supply. * Flexible approach to working. * Enthusiastic &amp; self-motivated. * Results driven whilst participating in a team environment. * Strong communication skills (oral and written). * Be a lateral thinker with a flair for design. * Excellent attention to detail.For more information on this role please contact Contact Owen Twomey or to apply, click &#39;Apply Now

item.title: Clinical Trial Start Up Manager
item.content: CLINICAL TRIAL START UP MANAGEROur client makes a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 500 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.Job descriptionThe Clinical Trial Start Up Manager leads and manages the daily operation of the clinical trial capabilities team in support of clinical development. The Manager is accountable for ensuring accurate planning, prioritization across teams and timely execution working closely with site engagement at the affiliates and across the trial capabilities teams. The scope of the work includes activities related to investigator sites readiness; maintenance and close out ensuring country specific requirements are met. The manager is responsible for ensuring inspection readiness through a complete, accurate and readily available Trial Master File.The manager provides leadership, direction and technical support to the Clinical Trial Capabilities assistants focusing on results and driving efficiency to achieve goals and objectives.Responsibilities * Accountable for meeting and exceeding goals for clinical trial operations for development programs. * Accountable for ensuring site initiation and maintenance activities comply with local/regional requirements, data privacy requirements and the company quality standards. * Manage communications/relationships and serve as the point of contact for the trial capabilities team deliverables during site initiation, maintenance, and close out representing progress to business partners. * Accountable for daily prioritisation of work to meet business needs * Provides expertise in conducting clinical research and keeping up to date with country/regional regulatory requirements. * Develop and streamline processes ensuring efficiency and improved productivity as well as meeting customer requirements * Ensure inspection readiness through a complete, accurate and readily available Trial Master FileOrganizational Leadership * Identify and ensure shared learning across the clinical capabilities organization and with other functional groups within the CDO * Build capabilities in the function through the development and improvement of processes, tools and training. * Enable a culture of continuous improvement to drive efficiency through process improvement, people skills, and shared learningPeople Management and Development * Recruit, develop, and retain a scientific and operationally capable workforce skilled and knowledgeable in clinical development * Effectively manage an agile organization that continuously meets the needs of a changing portfolio * Develop an organizational culture that fosters inclusion and innovation and demonstrates judgment-based decision making in clinical deliveryQualification Requirements: * Bachelor&rsquo;s degree preferably in a scientific or health related field, two years clinical research experience or relevant experience preferred * Understanding of the overall clinical development paradigm and the importance of efficient site initiation * Previous supervisory experience * Strong leadership skills and ability to influence others and lead across the business * Project management processes and skills * Appreciation of / experience in compliance-driven environment * Ability to learn and comply with financial and legal guidelines and policies (budget and contract) * Effective communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills * Self-management and organizational skills * Language capabilities preferredAdditional Skills/PreferencesThe GBS focuses on the following foundational pillars across the full organisation to ensure a solid and consistent approach to running our businessCompliance * Demonstrate a strong compliance-oriented mindset &amp; help to build a strong compliance culture * Familiarize with &amp; influence all applicable process documentation &amp; training materials to ensure you operate in a fully compliant mannerPeople * Actively participate in the GBS senior management team to make the GBS a great place to work for all employees and influence the strategic direction of the centre * Engage interpersonal, communication &amp; relationship building skills to interact with all levels of an organizationThe company does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

item.title: Ornithologist
item.content: Experienced Ornithologist required to join an Ecology Team in Dublin to work on their expanding portfolio of projects in Ireland and the UK. You will be based in their office which overlooks Dun Laoghaire Harbour and Dublin Bay, ideally placed for some lunchtime bird watching.You&rsquo;ll deliver a range of technical inputs, combining your ornithology expertise with analytical and reporting skills. This is a varied and exciting role which will include involvement in a range of coastal, onshore and other infrastructure projects.Candidates will have five or more years&rsquo; experience working in a consultancy / regulatory role / research in the environmental assessment field. A proven track record of working on Environmental Impact Assessment and Appropriate Assessment processes is desirable. Membership of the Chartered Institute of Ecology and Environmental Management (CIEEM) or similar is also desirable.KEY REQUIREMENTS * Degree in Ecology or a related biological/environmental science subject with an ecological component. * Ornithological expertise with accompanying skills to collate and analyse large data sets. * Excellent report writing skills and verbal communication abilities. * Familiar with relevant Irish and European legislation e.g. Habitats Directive, Birds Directive, EIA Directive, Birds and Natural Habitats Regulations. * Knowledge of Appropriate Assessment as per Article 6 of the Habitats Directive * Excellent report writing skills. * A hard working and highly motivated individual - client focused with good interpersonal skills and team approach. * Full Clean Driving Licence. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to record data efficiently and methodically.DESIRABLE * A postgraduate qualification in a relevant ecological discipline which includes practical experience. * Previous work experience within a professional ecological consultancy (or relevant eNGO or academic experience if applicable). * Excellent field skills and a keen interest and understanding of Irish wildlife. * Demonstrated field survey experience in ecology e.g. habitat classification (Fossitt), badger, otter, bat, bird and invasive species surveys. * Experience in compiling Ornithological Impact Assessment or Ecological Impact Assessment (EcIA) reports and Appropriate Assessment on the likely impacts of proposed developments, and recommending and designing appropriate mitigation measures. * Experience of licensable activities/surveys for protected species such as bat, badger or otter. * Membership of CIEEM or working towards membership of CIEEM. * Experience utilising GIS systems e.g. ArcGIS, QGIS and or others

experience in a regulated industry in a similar role is desirable. * Understanding of applicable guidelines and regulations, for example experience with ISO 10993 * Demonstrated ability to manage and execute multiple projects * Ability to work in collaborative and independent work situations and environments with minimal supervision * Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate at all levels of the organisation. * Strong knowledge of medical device quality standards ISO13485/FDA practices and GMP or similar regulated industry standards. * Good computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft&reg; Office. * Excellent organisational and team building skills. * High self-motivation.For more information and a full job spec contact Nicola on (phone number removed) or email your CV in the strictest confidence to jobs@headcount.ie

item.title: Remote Talent Acquisition Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Project Manager
item.content: Headcount is seeking to recruit a contract Project Manager to lead the management and execution of projects throughout the full project life cycle from initiation to closeout. The projects will include a diverse mix of capital and expense projects on Process, Utilities and Automation/IT (AIT) systems.Key Duties and Responsibilities: * Accountable for meeting key project deliverables for safety, financial management, schedule management and scope management across these projects. * Accountable for ensuring projects are compliant with good engineering practices, company policies, regulations and codes. * Liaise with Global Engineering/Global EHS/Global Procurement to ensure all are aligned and support project deliverables. * Accountable for strict adherence to Clients project stage-gate principles for managing the life-cycle of projects. * Concept and Business Case development in collaboration with project Sponsor and End user, working with the end user to understand and clarify end user requirements, develop scope, cost and budget estimates and present to governance for approval * Leading &amp; supporting project teams through complex and significant projects * Financial management - develop project budgets, obtain approvals for and adhere to project scope. Negotiate with contractors and suppliers to keep project within budget. * Manage project prioritization and spend to meet budgetary targets * Project Design - Design solutions in compliance with local/corporate safety standards and legislation and in compliance with corporate engineering and regulatory standards and guidelines * Planning and Scheduling - uses planning tools to hold a complex project on schedule and coordinate parallel activities. * Assure that value engineering, constructability reviews and similar processes are effectively utilized to minimize capital expenditures and maximize functional value. * Risk Management &ndash; Consider the potential impact construction and on time performance will have on the business should it cause an interruption and identify appropriate actions plans to mitigate risk. * Project execution plan &ndash; Generate and deliver a detailed project execution plan concerning the execution of all aspects of the project. * Procurement - Generate specifications for the procurement of equipment and Instrumentation, installation modification of equipment and systems, reduces equipment downtime. Collaborate with Procurement to ensure all procurement policies and procedures are followed. * Innovation - seeks innovative and novel approaches for design, function and construction using operational excellence tools in improving approaches for these activities. * Manage start-up and commissioning of all project equipment and systems as required * Coordinate engineering support of validation activities for equipment and systems as required. * Complete Project Close-out as per Stage Gate process. Qualifications, Knowledge and Skills Required: A degree in Chemical/Mechanical/Automation/Process Engineering and relevant experience the pharmaceutical industry * Five years of project management experience across the project life-cycle within a Pharmaceutical environment. * Experience managing the overall financial performance of engineering projects, including cash flow, life cycle costs, business opportunities and risks, both at a project and at a portfolio level * Demonstrated understanding of project management process; programming, scope development, design development, implementation, project closeout * Demonstrable experience of managing programs and/or managing a team of engineers to deliver projects. * Experience using SAP and budgeting tools. * Demonstrable people management skills or experience managing cross functional project teams

item.title: Senior Dynamics CRM Developer
item.content: GemPool&#39;s client is a trusted partner for end-to-end, integrated engineering, quality services and management consulting for digital transformation. They help businesses harness unrelenting technological change to successfully deliver innovations that will help them gain a competitive advantage and improve the everyday lives of people around the globe. They offer unique access to industry-specific expertise and best practice in consultancy and business agility, product design, production and in-service support, as well as continuous quality.Job ResponsibilitiesEvaluate business processes and liaise with the CRM Application Lead to scope requirements and design fit for purpose solutions via Dynamics 365Develop code using C# and integrate it within Microsoft Dynamics CRM.Advise and investigate on suitable third party components to be used in the solutionCustomer engagement - Liaise daily/weekly with customer during development cycle &ndash; as subject matter expert you will be able guide/mentor them in choosing the optimum solutionCollaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new featuresEnsure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications developedUnit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliabilitySupport Quality Assurance during test cyclesWork on bug fixing and improving application performanceJob RequirementsClient-facing skillsPeople management skills - introducing and building ways in which people can learn from each other, encouraging mentoring and the transfer of knowledge by designing and delivering learning interventions5 + years&rsquo; experience in managing solutions leveraging Microsoft Dynamics CRM - Online, On Premise and PortalsA full understanding of the Microsoft stack, including SQL Server, Azure and other relevant technologies.Scrum &ndash; Experience in Agile Scrum based environment is essential.Integration of Dynamics 365 with third party API&rsquo;s;Familiarity with SQL Server and SSRSIf interested call Cathal on (phone number removed) or email your CV to cathal.mcaliskey@gempool.ie

item.title: Trainee Network Engineer
item.content: Trainee Network Engineer - No Experience RequiredAre you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Network Engineer Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps, you can be placed into your first role in as little as 8 weeks:Step 1 - Online TrainingThe first step is completing a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised IT Support courses by CompTIA, Microsoft and Cisco. The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study from home. You will also be assigned an expert tutor to help you throughout your training.Step 2 &ndash; Practical TrainingYou will gain the practical experience by using our cutting edge Livelabs. Gaining hands-on experience is essential in today&rsquo;s IT industry for both certifications and keeping up to date with new technologies. Theory is often not enough these days, companies require hands on practical experience to make sure you&#39;re job ready.Step 3 &ndash; Official examsYou will then go on to sit the CompTIA A+ exams to give you the official certifications which will be recognised worldwide. The CompTIA A+ is the most commonly asked for certificate in entry level IT roles.Step 4 &ndash; IT Technician placement (&pound;18-&pound;25K)You will be placed into your first role as an IT Technician, with a great starting salary. You will need to gain two years experience in this role before you can progress into a Network Engineer role. While working as an IT Technician, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to move into the networking field. This will consist of online training, practical training and an official exam.Network Engineer RoleOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training in step four and have the required two years experience in the IT industry, you will be ready to move into your Network Engineer role. We have partnered with a number of large IT companies who have a massive shortage of qualified Network Engineers.At a one off cost of &pound;945, or 8 monthly payments of &pound;137, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Read through the information? Passionate about starting a career in IT? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.&lsquo;Please note that this is a training course and fees apply

item.title: Black Belt Project Lead
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Developing a portfolio of projects to deliver on waste reduction and simplification targets.</li><li> Leading and implementing waste removal projects across both Bulk production and Fill /Pack production areas.</li><li>Coaching and mentoring Green belt projects which support the waste initiative.</li><li>Reporting on status and delivering updates to Senior leadership team.</li><li>The project lead will work with key operations personnel to understand the Processes, perform deep dives to identify sources of and root cause for losses and identify and implement measures to reduce waste across the manufacturing value stream.</li><li>The project lead will identify, scope and deliver a number of black belt level projects focussing on waste reduction and also mentor associated green belt projects which contribute to the overall waste reduction initiative</li></ul> <ul><li><p> <b></b></p> <p>Third level qualification in a Scientific or Engineering discipline</p></li><li><p> At least 5 years' experience leading </p></li></ul> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?2c9mBmqBU42rQf1QUZs1kwd" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Hiring Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Microsoft Dynamics Business Analyst
item.content: Opportunity:Programmer expert requiring not only D365 functional knowledge but also real-world experience and skills in designing and building systems integrations.Key Responsibilities: * Initially as a member of the D365 implementation project, partner with the business to implement D365 successfully and efficiently across our 5 business units in Ireland and the UK. * Microsoft Dynamics D365 technical expertise and D365 functional knowledge. * Real world experience and skills in designing and building systems integrations. * Participate in the delivery of business systems support, especially as it relates to D365 to business systems users. * Actively participate in project planning, estimation, requirements analysis, solution design and change implementation. * Support as a resource for system support and other non-365 projects from time to time. * Participate in the out-of-hours emergency on-call rota. * Travel may be required to various group sites, therefore, a full clean driving license is required.The ideal candidate will have: * 5+ years&rsquo; experience in implementing and supporting Microsoft Dynamics 365, AX or NAV &ndash; a minimum of 2 years of D365. * 5+ years&rsquo; development experience using the Microsoft development stack. * 5+ years&rsquo; database design and development using MS SQL. * 5+ years&rsquo; business analysis and project management experience in the areas of ERP, CRM, BI, EPOS and optionally agribusiness applications. * Strong project management experience. * Ability to work under pressure and to demanding timelines. * Excellent oral and written communication skills.Optional: * Certification in project management methodologies. * Experience of leading and/or participating in business change initiatives. * A primary or master&rsquo;s degree in computer science or business field. * Ability to network, build strong relationships and influence effectively

item.title: Electrician
item.content: NPR Recruit on Behalf of our Fantastic Client is pleased to present the opportunity as below Electrician.This opportunity for an Electrician offers a great opportunity for long term employment with competitive earnings.The Electrician will be covering a 40-mile radius of Cork regarding Domestic works.20-30 Month ContractSalary &pound;49,000 plus BonusVehicle, Fuel, Phone, 29 DH, Pension.Qualifications:The Electrician will hold the relevant Electrical Craft Certification or FAS (Level 6).ElectricianClick Apply and start communicating with a consultant NOW

item.title: Windows Developer
item.content: Our client is a fast-growing, ambitious, highly successful and multi award-winning software security company.In order to grow, they need to expand their team, and have an urgent requirement for a Windows Developer. This is a fantastic opportunity for an energetic and passionate individual who wants to join a Company in which they can expand their technical abilities using best in class tools. You will be improving and building products to ensure they stay up to date with the newest technologies, fixing and testing software and always looking for ways to develop the products.Responsibilities * Develop agents which interface with our existing product site * Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs * Maintaining code quality, organization, and automatization * Complex problem solving and troubleshooting.Requirements * Experienced Windows Developer with at least 3 years&rsquo; experience. * Degree in Computer Science/ IT preferred but not essential. * Essential for the candidate to have at least 3 years&rsquo; experience with C# &amp;/or C++. * Good understanding of network programming. * Desirable to have previously worked with AD, Azure AD, RMM Systems, PHP, Javascript and SQL. * Strong communication skills. * Passion for automation.Benefits * Competitive Salary * 22 days annual leave * Pension * Death in Service * Sports and Social Club

item.title: Network Consultant- CCNP
item.content: Leading Global IT CompanySouth Dublin BasedCompetitive Salary +Benefits&nbsp;Summary: Infrastructure Consulting practice in the Irish marketplace with a Cisco. The ideal candidate would be comfortable working at consultancy-level on the management and configuration of Cisco Products.The candidate will be required to work as part of a multi-skilled Infrastructure consulting team working on chargeable projects, so should be open to learning new technologies, and should be prepared to work for multiple clients on a variety of infrastructure projects. Also should have a chargeable, professional services / consulting, client-facing background.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Designs and deploys routing, switching, and wireless technologies (primarily Cisco) in lead engineer roleImplements overall solution for clients, including development of designs, documentation, and plans.Works with clients to perform assessments, health checks, performance tests, and capacity planning.Provides knowledge transfer, training, and documentation to clients upon project completion.Maintains current and thorough knowledge of Cisco routing, switching (including Nexus) and Wi-FI technologies.Good knowledge and hands-on experience of enterprise class platforms is a requirement as well as a variety of other hardware platforms particularly converged systems.Assists in opportunity evaluation and leading or assisting on pursuits at new clients or within existing ones.&nbsp;Demonstrates and actively promotes an understanding and commitment to the mission of companies through performing behaviours consistent with the organisation&#39;s values.Provide support to clients on Cisco environments.Supports and conducts self in a manner consistent with customer service expectations.Supervisory Responsibilities:This job has no supervisory responsibilities.Education:Should have a minimum of CCNP with a plan to go CCIE.It would be essential for the candidate to have vendor related training in related field.It would be desireable for the candidate to have a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in related field.Desirable Certifications:One or more of following Cisco certifications:Cisco Certified Netowrk Associate (CCNA Routing and Switching)Cisco Certified Security Professional (CCNP Security)Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP Routing and Switching)Cisco Certified Wireless Professional (CCNP Wireless)ExperienceCisco technical experience including design, implementation and support of Cisco Network solutions including:Consulting background focused on Cisco solutions.Experience with Cisco ISR/ASR routers, Catalyst and Nexus switches and wireless controllers.Experience with Security products, Firewalls, IPS/IDS.Experience with design and implementation of Cisco UCS solutions advantageous.Knowledge of Cloud technologies/marketplace. Private Cloud &amp; Hybrid CloudExperience of large-scale enterprise support utilising industry best practices and mature processesExperience of latest generation compute technologyImplementing Disaster Recovery &amp; Business Continuity solutionsData centre operational knowledgeDesireable would be to have experience of Windows/Linux systems administration (OS, network, storage, application support); Network and SAN connectivity including TCP/IP, FC, MPIO, etc.Ideally should have a chargeable professional services / consulting, client-facing background.Other Requirements:Own car &amp; full drivers license essentialTo be immediately considered Apply here.#LI-GB1

item.title: Business Analyst – Permanent
item.content: Business Analyst &ndash; Permanent, DublinDon&rsquo;t miss out on this great opportunity to work with a leading Irish Multinational company operating globally in the FMCG sector. This is a permanent opportunity based in Dublin City Centre.Business Analyst Role and Responsibilities:Role reports to senior Product Manager. The successful candidate will be joining an established Software Development, Product Implementation &amp; Testing team. You will be supporting the delivery and implementation of the company&rsquo;s proprietary ERP platform and related front end applications across all its customer sites in Ireland, UK and Europe. The ERP platform manages all aspects of the customers supply chain from ordering, stock control, accounting etc.What&rsquo;s involved: * Develop an in-depth understanding of the Groups ERP platform and related systems / applications. * Work with clients, product owners and product implementation teams to develop gap analyses, gather requirements and develop these into BRDs, process maps and related requirements documentation. * Working with software development, product and testing teams to map out client system solutions, manage the data conversion process, handle system interface changes and work onsite with all client stakeholders throughout the implementation phase of the platform to ensure smooth implementation. * Provide end user training onsite including training documentation and post implementation support to all customers. * Work with product owners and software development teams on systems changes, system upgrades and new requirements. Working with use cases and documenting these as appropriate. * Undertake software testing including creation of test plans. Assist in applying software patches and updates.What you need: * Minimum 2 years Business Analysis experience preferably within FMCG / ERP system environments. * Experience in interpreting business / end user requirements and providing IT product solutions. * Highly analytical , strong communicator and organised problem solver. * Strong knowledge of the full SDLC and TDLC preferred. * Must have full working Visa to work in Ireland &amp; UK unrestricted. * Strong reporting and documentation skills and proven ability to manage and deal with client interactions.What&rsquo;s on offer:Competitive salary, performance related bonus and excellent benefits package! Tax saver travel card, secure bike parking , active sports and social club. Opportunities that come from being part of a global Multinational companyApply NowIf you would like to discuss this opportunity in person or with one of our IT Resourcers please forward your CV to Vantage Resources or contact Derek Leahy on (phone number removed) or +353 (87) (phone number removed) for a confidential discussion. Vantage Resources will not forward your details without prior discussion and approval.Vantage Resources is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for engagement and/or employment. An inclusive and diverse workforce is an essential part of the development of our organisation&rsquo;s culture which we believe enhances both our working environment and the service we provide to our customers

item.title: Junior Drawing Coordinator
item.content: Headcount Solutions is seeking a Junior Drawing Coordinator for Dublin-based projects.Responsibilities: * Manage and co-ordinate the day to day project draughting and documentation requirements. * Ensure all drawings are stored correctly in electronic format. * Manage the checking/approvals of all drawings issued by department. * Maintaining drawing register. * Collecting drawing from various vendors and storing in an efficient manner. * Developing and updating document and drawing templates &amp; layouts. * Production of parts lists for any drawing. * Supporting Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) Work Instructions (WI&rsquo;s). * Liaising with various departments. * Ensure compliance with all regulatory GMP, Safety and Environmental requirements. * Input data management, including vendor information, surveys and specialist recommendations.Requirements: * Level 7 Engineering Qualification or equivalent industry experience. * Engineering Documentation Management &amp; drafting experience. * Competent and a good working knowledge of AutoCAD and/or similar packages for the production of drawings * Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (word/excel).For further information, please contact Mick on (phone number removed) or forward details in confidence to jobs@headcount.ie

item.title: Conservation Ranger
item.content: <p><u><b>PLEASE MENTION GREENJOBS IRELAND WHEN APPLYING TO THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY</b></u></p> <div> <div> <div> Conservation Ranger </div> <div> </div> <div>There are Conservation Ranger vacancies with the Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage. Successful candidates will be employed on a full-time basis and work in a role that is challenging, diverse and rewarding.</div> <div> </div> <div>Conservation Rangers work as part of the team of regional National Parks and Wildlife Service staff of the Department. This team is responsible for implementing nature policies throughout the country. Much of the Conservation Ranger's time is spent working in the field to assist in this goal.</div> <div> </div> <div>Conservation Rangers are the public face of the Department on conservation management, monitoring species and habitats, compliance, and dealing with the general public.</div> <div> </div> <div>Successful candidates must have relevant experience in wildlife management or nature conservation. They must also have good IT and report writing skills with an ability to work on their own initiative.</div> <div> </div> <div>For more information and how to apply, visit: </div> <div> </div> <div> Closing Date is 3pm, Thursday, 14th January 2021 </div> <div> </div> <div>We are committed to a policy of equal opportunity and encourage applications under all nine grounds of the Employment Equality Act.</div> </div> </div><img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?Z711xZ5gwZNGBdYpJRaMVAf" width="0" height="0" />
