item.title: Operations Lead
item.content: Team Horizon currently has an exciting opening for an Operations Lead to work on our client site. The successful candidate will serve as primary production process owner responsible for New Product Introduction and Life Cycle Management Projects and process improvements projects. They will be operations point of contact for coordination of the manufacturing effort and will be responsible for driving process efficiencies as part of the project for operations. They will apply process, operational, scientific expertise, basic compliance knowledge, and analytical and troubleshooting skills to ensure streamlined manufacturing operations are enabled in both vial and syringe facilities.Why you should apply: * This is an excellent opportunity to join a world class manufacturing operation, with an outstanding track record of reliably delivering high-quality medicines to patients around the world suffering serious illnesses. * There is a strong culture of continuous improvement and innovation within the company to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people&rsquo;s lives. * Our client is developing the capability to produce all its medicines in Dublin, helping to ensure continuity of supply of our medicines as they expand internationally.What you will be doing: * Function as the site interface between the Product Delivery Teams (PDT&rsquo;s), and Manufacturing operations. * Develop, review and approve generic batch records and parameter value lists across Formulation, Filling and Inspection * Create, review and update Production, Engineering, Operating Procedures &amp; training materials * Assist in providing training on scientific or technical aspects of the process/project * Evaluate, plan, and implement solutions for process improvement opportunities * Assist scheduling and execution of Characterisation, Engineering and PPQ runs including ensuring all necessary pre-requisites are included on the schedule and assess process performance by observation of floor operations and review of performance data * Provide troubleshooting support throughout the project and on the floor during execution of activities * Manage people for delivery and behaviours within Product team * Perform Job Hazard Assessments and Change Control Assessments to determine impact to Manufacturing * Partner with Learning &amp; Performance to define training strategies for NPI&rsquo;s and complex projects * Liaise with Quality Assurance to ensure that GMP standards are maintained in line with current SOP&rsquo;s, batch documentation and licences * Create, review and update Protocols for manufacturing activities * Documentation and approval of protocol deviations for manufacturing activities * Work with with Process Development regarding process changes in an effective and timely manner * Manage lead change controls as required by the Project Team * Review and approve bills of materials * Develop, review and update Product Quality Risk AssessmentsWhat you need to apply: * Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in a science discipline and min of 2+ years biopharmaceutical manufacturing experience in Fill Finish or related manufacturing or GMP experience in the pharmaceutical or medical device industry. * Experience with regulatory compliance in GMP manufacturing and testing of pharmaceutical products. * Project Management and organizational skills, including ability to follow assignments through to completion * Problem solving skills: Liaises with key stakeholders, analyses and interprets information to develop solutions to technical problems of moderate complexity Negotiation and Influence skills Take initiative to identify and drive improvements * Excellent verbal and written communication skills: Strong Technical writing skills for GMP documentation (e.g. investigations, procedures, change controls) and good presentation skills * Decision Making skills and confidence to challenge others on decisions that impact the manufacturing area * Teamwork and Coaching others * Ensures compliance within regulatory environment * Demonstrated ability to work independently and deliver right first-time results under minimal direction

item.title: Finance Business Partner
item.content: Finance Business Partner County Louth &euro;50-65kINFORM3 Recruitment is looking for an experienced Finance Business Partner to support key stakeholders within our client&rsquo;s management team, providing strategic input and financial performance analysis and support the delivery of long-term strategies.The successful candidate will have a minimum of 3 years performing in a similar role with proven experience being responsible for significant income and expenditure within the manufacturing or construction sectors.Core responsibilities * Providing analytical, financial, reporting and forecasting support * Report on business performance, providing regular insight and analysis with recommendations in order to understand the potential impact of decisions. * Ensure stock and inventory management processes and procedures are robust * Facilitate the development of financial plans and ensure they are delivered, monitored and controlled. * Build, develop and maintain strong relationships with internal business departments to ensure that the objectives of the business are understood * Advise on and facilitate the implementation of new systems to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the team.Requirements * Relevant Accountancy Certifications * Experience of establishing effective relationships with and influencing senior stakeholders. * Demonstrable experience of costing goods, valuing inventory and analysing cost variances * Ability to gather and analyse internal and external data from a wide range of sources in order to drive commercial insight. * Ability to explain complex management information in written and verbal form to financial and non-financial people * Strong continuous improvement and change management skills * Experience with SAP highly desirable * Able to prioritise own workload within tight deadlinesIf this role is of interest please forward send over your CV!INFORM3 Recruitment is an equal opportunities employer. By applying to this position, you accept the terms of our privacy policy which you can find on our website

item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Test and Run Fitter
item.content: Speedy are the UK &amp; Ireland&rsquo;s leading hire provider with the widest range of tools, specialist hire equipment, plant and support services &ndash; everything for every job!The role of a Test and Run Technician is a busy and productive role in the depot, performing basic electrical and functionality testing as well as servicing and cleaning products returned from hire to ensure they are safe and presentable, ready for the next customer to take away.&nbsp; Whilst the role brings responsibility, it&rsquo;s a perfect opportunity for you to build a career in engineering with us, where you can learn from those around you and develop with our award-winning, in-house training courses.What you&rsquo;ll need:Basic electrical skills (12/24v)Basic mechanical skills and the ability to use tools effectivelyStrong communication skills both verbal and writtenPrevious experience working within the hire industry or other engineering field is desirableIn return we offer a competitive salary with contributory pension scheme, 21 days annual leave entitlement (plus bank holidays) rising to 26 days after 12 months, discretionary bonus scheme and life assurance. In addition you will be able to take advantage of our fantastic Salary Extras benefits scheme, offering&nbsp;various other discounts on a wide range of goods and services

item.title: Automation Engineer
item.content: Automation EngineerExcellent role in a growing pharmaceutical company based in Waterford City. This offers a fantasric opportunity to join a successfully growing company at a really interesting phase of growth.Reporting to the Engineering Manager the Purpose of the role is To provide Automation and Equipment engineering support to site systems and process equipment and to ensure they are operated, improved and maintained to meet Customer and compliance requirements.Responsibilities include:- * Facilitate internal resources and outside vendors in developing technical solutions for automated equipment. Interface with equipment vendors to ensure successful equipment delivery, integration and validation. * Maintain PLC automation systems in a validated state in compliance with site change control. * Understand the requirements of computer systems validation and ensure compliance is maintained. * Act as operations support for Fill Finish and Oral Dose facilities. * Interface with Operations, IT, QS and QA groups to successfully validate software systems and adherence to life cycle management and system maintenance * Provide automation requirements and implement solutions for new products and/or capacity expansions * Support disaster recovery and back up procedures and processes to ensure business impact is minimized in the event of a failure. * Provide technical and automation core competency support, including possible off-hours, remote and onsite coverage. This also includes operations / engineering training on basic troubleshooting * Management of Automation vendors during equipment troubleshooting and upgrade activitiesHealth, Safety and the Environment * Comply at all times with the Health, Safety and Environmental policy and associated procedures. * Continuously promote a positive safety culture by challenging yourself and others to prioritize safety in everything you do.Quality Compliance * Ensure all work carried out, is in compliance with the required standards, conforming to company, cGMP, cGLP, SOP&rsquo;s and regulatory guidelines. * Take ownership for quality compliance in all activities you are responsible for.The ideal candidate must have:- 1. Engineering degree in Electronics, Electro-mechanical or equivalent training/experience 2. Minimum of 5 year&rsquo;s engineering experience within Pharma Industry. 3. Experience with Siemens S7 PLCs and WinCC flexible desirable. 4. Experience with Fill Finish equipment required. 5. Experience working in a cGMP/FDA/HPRA regulated environment. 6. Experience with Industrial Ethernet and Scada systemsBy applying to RPG Recruitment, you are consenting for your details to be reviewed by RPG Recruitment and held on our database. If at any stage in the future, you would like to remove your details from our database , you can do so by requesting in writing for your details to be removed in line with our privacy policy. RPG Recruitment operate to the highest ethical standards of recruitment at all times

item.title: QC Inspector
item.content: ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES * Support manufacturing areas to achieve targets. * Implement corrective action on issues as they arise. * Disposition NC&rsquo;s, conduct &amp; determine root cause analysis including corrective actions. * Conduct area GMP/GDP audits and follow up on findings to ensure satisfactory closure. * Follow up on corrective actions for in-process and customer complaint issues. * In-process sampling and testing and subsequent report writing. * Conduct First Article Inspections on product as required. * Conduct process audits against Quality System requirements. * Support all QA related documentation activities (i.e. Raise Change plans, write procedures etc) * Support functional area validation activities. * Support fault analysis and scrap reduction activities. * Participate/drive quality improvement projects/activities. * Participate in preparing &amp; on-going maintenance of FMEAs and control plans. * Reporting function Quality metrics. * Have a basic knowledge of ISO/FDA/MDD and other product development related regulatory requirements * Have an understanding of standard metrology good practice. * Provide support for internal and external audits to ISO and FDA requirements. * Support prototype/manufacturing Operations area projects and initiatives i.e. Kaizen, CFPS etc. * Other tasks as directed by the functional area Quality Technician / Engineer in line with company goals and objectives. * Ensure all recording and cleaning logs are reviewed and approved per schedule * Work closely with all BE department to support completion of validation and process development projects * Carrying out investigations on product failures and customer complaints, reporting Non-Conformities and Out of Spec Results to the Quality Control Manager and Production Manager.EDUCATION: * Third level qualification in Science, Engineering or equivalent. * Working knowledge of cGMP and ISO standards relevant to Quality Control procedures, documentation and testing.EXPERIENCE: * One year previous quality experience in a similar work environment is essential

item.title: Foreman - Wicklow - 400 unit development
item.content: The Developer:With over multiple live construction sites across the Dublin / Greater Leinster area and more projects in the Pipeline for 2021 our client are one of Ireland&#39;s leading residential Developer&#39;s.They currently have a need for an experienced General Foreman / Foreman / Site Foreman to work on a &euro;multi-million residential project of over 400 units in North Wicklow, consisting of housing and apartments.As Site Foreman: * Manage and coordinate both site staff and sub-contractors on site * Ensure completion dates are met * Managing civil engineering and groundworks contractors * Management of H&amp;S on site to ensure highest standards are maintained * Take control of all works from house foundations through to 1st &amp; 2nd fix including external finishes, paving, boundary walls and landscaping * Ensuring quality of works * Continuous CPD DevelopmentGeneral Foreman skills: * 5+ years&rsquo; site management experience * Trade background preferable * Background in large scale, residential construction * Proven record of seeing projects through from greenfield to completion * Excellent working knowledge of latest building regulation and certification standards * An ability to achieve demanding time and quality targets. * To be good at working with people at all levels and willing to work in a team. * The ability to lead, use initiative and be self-motivated * A strong sense of ownership and responsibility for tasks/projectsThe Package:An excellent package will be put in place for the successful candidate, with a basic salary of &euro;60,000 - &euro;65,000 + bonus + pension + helathcare, depending on experience.How to Apply:If you&rsquo;re interested in this role, click &lsquo;apply now&rsquo; to forward an up-to-date CV to Eoghan McKeever or call us now on 0044 (phone number removed).The Breagh TeamBreagh Recruitment are the go to specialist construction and engineering recruitment consultants, providing qualified and experienced professionals with Construction jobs across the UK and Ireland, with an ethos based on flexibility, hard work and a bit of good old common sense. We live within these core values servicing our clients and candidates on a daily basis.Key roles we recruit for include: Health &amp; Safety managers, project managers, construction managers, site engineers, quantity surveyors, civil engineers, site agents, estimators, buyers, bid managers and site supervisors, across Ireland and the UK

experience in a QS roleA wide understanding of work contractsA working knowledge of Mechanical/Electrical Work Packages M&amp;E Quantity Surveyor Personal Skills and Qualifications relevant to the RoleThe successful M&amp;E Quantity Surveyor will be the following:Good with FiguresAble to negotiate with clients on a professional levelExperience in use of Excel a requirementExcellent Analytical and problem-solving skillsHigh level of accuracy and attention to detail To Apply for the position of M&amp;E Quantity Surveyor, or to find out what other opportunities we can offer in the critical systems construction sector, please contact Joe Raymond at Project Resource Ltd.Services advertised by Project Resource are that of an Employment Agency/Business. item.title: Civil Site Manager

item.title: Beauty Therapist - Ireland
item.content: Allstaff Recruitment are currently seeking a Mobile Retail Beauty Therapist based in Dublin Ireland for a premium skincare brand. The role will include travel and overnight stays in Galway and Cork and working within Brown Thomas and Arnott&#39;s department stores offering high end facials and beauty treatments.Candidates must have their own car and full clean driving licence, and you will need to be able to start from 7th January 2021. Training will be offered in London from 11th January all accommodation and expenses will be paid.The role&hellip;As the Mobile Retail Beauty Therapist your role will involve the following important duties: * Working in partner retail stores selling the brand products * Maximise all sales opportunities * Represent the brand image and ethos as the brand ambassador. * Achieve your daily and weekly sales targets * Sit customers down and offer them skin consultations and create a customised skincare routine. * Report all daily and weekly sales figures/KPI&#39;s and customer conversion. * Support events and in store opportunities. * Perform beauty room treatments for the brand in store in private beauty rooms. * Educate customers about the brand * Upsell the brand products at all times * Maintain excellent customer service and hygiene standards. * Fully understand the brand and key ingredients of all the product range. * Going above and beyond.The experience required&hellip;As a successful Mobile Retail Beauty Therapist you will have the following: * Irish national and hold an Irish Passport * Valid full clean driving licence * Min level 3 NVQ in Beauty Therapy * Be willing to travel to the brand retail store locations where overnight stays may be required. * Excellent grooming and hygiene standards. * Be available to start from the 7th January 2021. * Be available for training in London from the 11th January 2021.Summary of the Job role role&hellip;Salary: 15000/18000Euros per AnnumLocation: &ndash; DublinType of Contract: Permanent, Part Time (21hrs per week)Hours &ndash; Mon-Sat ( 3 days across the working week)The benefits&hellip;The business is well established, offering training and progression. Great working hours and excellent benefits. * 17 annual holidays per year plus bank holidays * Commission Bonus structure * Product allocation and staff discount scheme. * 7 annual paid sick days - upon successful 3 month probation. * Paid overtime opportunity * Travel expenditure and mileage covered. * Regular support and training from UK Retail Manager.This role would suit -**Thank you for your interest in the Mobile Retail Beauty Therapist Role role. One of our qualified Recruitment Specialists will now review your application. Due to the high volume of applications AllstaffRecruitment receive, it is with regret we are unable to respond to all candidates directly. However, if you do not hear from us within seven days, you have unfortunately been unsuccessful on this occasion.**Why choose Allstaff Recruitment?Allstaff Recruitment is an Independent Recruitment Specialist acting as an employment agency and an employment business. We specialise in Permanent, Contract and Temporary placements across a vast number of industries.If you are looking for Jobs in the Dublin then look no further than the Allstaff Recruitment! Our website offers a variety of different roles across numerous industries. When looking for recruitment in Dublin, Allstaff Recruitment has a genuine interest in both our Candidates and Clients. Our aim to find the best match for you.Our ethos is simple: to build long term relationships, by offering an exceptional recruitment service at all times. As a member of the REC, Allstaff Recruitment is committed to working to the highest possible standards.To keep up to date with all our recruitment activities, please follow us on Facebook , LinkedIn and Twitter

Experience: * Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Science, Engineering or other Technical related discipline * Minimum of 7 years&rsquo; experience (5 years if Master&rsquo;s degree obtained) within the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry * Experience with upstream cell culture and/or downstream purification of biological molecules * Experience with technology transfer, regulatory filing and commercial drug substance manufacturing of biologics is a plus * Technical operations experience in the drug substance manufacture of biological molecules at commercial-scale * Prior experience in drug substance process development, process characterisation studies, process performance qualification and validation, site readiness, batch record reviews and working with external contract organisation for development/manufacturing * Working knowledge of statistical methods for DOE design and data analysis * Working knowledge of statistical process control, multivariate analysis, and/or process analytical technologies techniques for biologics process

item.title: Remote Talent Acquisition Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

attend meeting with Main Contractor / CMT to negotiate and agree optimum build schedule &ndash; minute and circulateRevise / Develop and add agreed level of detail to scheduleAssist Main Contractor / CMT in development of an overall integrated scheduleEnsure that the schedule is &ldquo;Labour Loaded&rdquo; and aligned with the Commercial Department Budgets &ndash; highlight any weeks where large progress is forecasted to PM&rsquo;s, Lead Planner &amp; Planning ManagerProduce Build Methodology / Phasing DrawingsPresent the latest version of the schedule to the construction team to ensure there is a thorough understandingThe&nbsp;Project Planner&nbsp;will also support in risk identification &amp; mitigation&nbsp;&nbsp; Status and Performance Advisor (Controlling Phase of Project Life Cycle):Provide clear communication of early warnings to project management teams obtained from progress reports and knowledge of project field conditionsAdvise project teams on ways to improve performanceMonitor package progress and efficiency (direct and subcontract) provide &ldquo;estimate at completion&rdquo; cw. 2 week look ahead and 2 week retrospectiveSchedule management, revision and maintenanceEscalation of risk items to Lead Planner &amp; Planning &amp; Risk Manager&nbsp;&nbsp; GeneralLook for new opportunities to improve service to &ldquo;Internal Customers&rdquo;Look for new opportunities to improve processes&nbsp;&nbsp; item.title: Senior QA Operations Manager
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Recruit & lead the QP & QA Operations group, including batch release, product performance, Data Analytics, new products introduction (NPI), and interface with HPRA and FDA.</li><li>In this role, you will act as the primary delegate to the Quality Director and regularly interact with the Senior Management Team.</li><li>NPI is key to the growth of our business. As the Senior Quality Operations Manager, you will support the effective transfer of NPIs to site and into commercial manufacturing; coordinating with external global teams including, but not limited to S&T, Regulatory and CMC QA.</li><li> You will empower your team to ensure any deviations or planned changes in production or quality control have been addressed according to all relevant regulatory requirements and company policies and procedures. As manager, you will mentor and coach your QPs, building their technical expertise.</li><li>Ensure product manufacture is in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practice and meets requirements of our patients, Regulatory Authorities (FDA, HPRA etc.) and of the company</li><li>Partner with internal and external Regulatory groups, FDA, HPRA etc. while liaising with operations, technical operations, science & technology teams in relation to product filing support.</li><li>Have responsibility for the oversight of product performance process, product quality Review, complaints and product track and trend</li><li>Ensure compliance with all processes and procedures while maintaining the Quality Risk Management (QRM) program on site</li><li> Have knowledge and experience up to date on market and product (technical and scientific) progress and changes in regulations and quality management related to our range of products.</li></ul> <ul><li><p> <b></b></p> Third level qualification in a relevant science discipline with minimum 5 years' experience in the pharmaceutical industry </li><li> MSc in Industrial Pharmaceutical Science or similar course recognized by Regulatory Authority to permit Qualified Person (QP) status as per Article 49 of Directive 2001/83/EC desirable. </li><li> Minimum 5 years industrial experience gained in an FDA and EMA approved pharmaceutical environment. </li><li> Minimum 3 years' experience in an aseptic sterile fill finish manufacturing environment an advantage </li><li> People Management experience is required <p><br/> </p></li></ul> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?Uc21hCzU2uC1j8EGVC8FKAt" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Electrical Field QS | West Dublin
item.content: Electrical Quantity Surveyor | West Dublin &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. &nbsp; Role Purpose The role of Electrical Quantity Surveyor will have you working across various contracts ensuring the maximum commercial benefit for the company and will entail a cradle to grave delivery from tender stage through to final accounts and all-encompassing duties in between. &nbsp; Electrical Quantity Surveyor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Skilled and budgeting, reporting, developing BOQ&rsquo;s, profit plans. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Good communication skills. Undertake and manage interim commercial meetings with the Client and Internal Project Team. Report in detail as required for the Project Manager on the commercial status of the project. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Manage subcontractor accounts, interim valuations and final accounts. Ensure payment certificates are processed and payments are made per the agreed sub-contract and procurement terms. Retentions apply as per agreements. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As a member of the commercial team, the Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be tasked with administering the contract obligations and meet additional Client requirements. Issue interim and final accounts and progress applications per project and contract requirements.&nbsp; Monthly applications to be all inclusive of accurate remeasures, site changes, dayworks and any applicable contract claims. Identify escalations, material or labour, as appropriate. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ability to identify potential commercial risks and ensure prompt reporting of same to Senior Management. Follow direction of Senior Management in undertaking work duties. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have a practical understanding of scheduling and the associated commercial implications. Ensure close collaboration with Planning Engineer regarding accuracy of progress reporting. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be capable of costing and agreeing daily work changes to include managing the subcontractor remeasurement of contract works, site dayworks and site change orders. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain accurate records and provide necessary detailed backup to support commercial tracking and costing. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ability to work on own initiative and can prioritise without direction. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Speed and accuracy of information a priority. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Negotiate, as necessary, with clients or their representatives. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Set an example of enthusiasm, loyalty and hard work in the performance of all duties. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Quantity Surveyor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Minimum 4+ years of Quantity surveying experience essential on Electrical Projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3rd level qualification in Construction Economics / Quantity Surveying ideally coupled with a technical background as either Electrician or Electrical Engineer &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Experience working on electrical value projects in-excess of &euro;4million within the data centre, pharmaceutical, industrial or commercial sectors. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Proficient in excel. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Detailed knowledge of commercial management and QS Role within construction &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Knowledge of contract conditions and their applications &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Overall understanding of the business, client and Sub Contractor relations, and installations &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent Communication/Interpersonal Skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent Record Keeping and Administration Skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Process driven and focused on EHS and Quality Work Management Systems and Processes &nbsp; Desired Competencies / Special Role Requirements Ideally will come from an Electrician / Electrical Engineering background Ideally will possess Industrial, Data Centre, Pharmaceutical, Commercial type experience.&nbsp; &nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Quantity Surveyor/ M&amp;E Quantity Surveyor position or other Senior Quantity Surveyor / MEP Quantity Surveyor opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Sales Manager - Ireland
item.content: SALES MANAGERPharmaceutical capital equipment and servicesDue to demand and planned growth we are seeking an experienced Country Sales Manager for the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland to deliver the full range of products and services from within the group of companies. The role of the Sales Manager will have a growth opportunity further down the line to move to a Sales Director position.This is a Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland group company comprising of three operational companies:1. A UK, France and Irish distributor carrying out sales, planned maintenance, breakdown, qualification , spare parts supply for freeze dryers, rotary evaporators, homogenisers, Sepiatec fractional separation and SFC equipment and KC powder fillers. One the worlds largest providers of process development services in freeze drying and other stabilisation technologies.2. The UK&#39;s largest independent provider of airflow equipment used in the pharmaceutical, life sciences and precision engineering sectors in both commercial and academic contexts. 3. A UK manufacturer of carbon filters for all applications and manufacturer of pharmaceutical airflow handling equipment and a manufacturer of &quot;white label&quot; filters for other appliances.The Group company was formed to consolidate the Group presence in both Republic of Ireland and Ulster and currently employs four engineers, one salesperson and an office manager to deliver all of the products and services set out above. The Group presence in the Republic and Ulster comprises over 1000 active customers and has two offices in Ballycoolin and Roscrea.JOB DESCRIPTION:Expected activities:a) Promoting, developing and closing sales for the airflow product range as set out aboveb) Promoting, developing and closing sales for the range of laboratory and pharmaceutical production equipment as set out abovec) Promoting, developing and closing sales for the filter range as aboved) Developing business plans on a rolling 3 year basise) Staging promotional events for product ranges is (a) and (b) abovef) In conjunction with Group Marketing Manager agreeing an annual timetable of promotional and marketing activitiesg) To maintain full CRM and prospect recordsh) To report to the Board and group board on sales pipeline and achievementsi) To liaise with principals as necessaryj) To assist in debt recovery from customersk) To liaise with Fleet or Winchester technical experts to resolve customer queriesIf you are interested and have the right skills then please apply to this role.Gi Group Pharmaceuticals provides a tailored Account Managed Service and dedicated Pharmaceutical recruitment team and partners with many different Pharmaceutical and Biotechnology clients throughout the globe and the United Kingdom.Gi Group Holdings Recruitment Limited group of companies includes Gi Recruitment Limited, Draefern Limited, Gi Group Recruitment Ltd, INTOO (UK) Limited, Marks Sattin (UK) Limited, TACK TMI UK Limited and Grafton Professional Staffing Limited. We are committed to protecting the privacy of all of our candidates and clients. Following some recent changes to data protection laws we have updated our Privacy Policy. To view a copy and to help you understand how we collect, use and process your personal data please visit the Privacy page on our Gi Group UK website

item.title: Remote Talent Acquisition Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Senior Structural Engineer
item.content: Company Details:If you are a Structural Engineer with diverse work experience and a passion for designing projects and would like to develop your career, then this could be the opportunity for you. Our client would like you to join their team and use your expertise to help them deliver exceptional designs on a diverse range of commercial and residential projects.You will have a chance to participate in every step of the process, from initial design to final handover and you will be working with a team of dedicated professionals to finding the most innovative solutions to challenging project requirements.They currently have a requirement for a Structural Engineer to join their growing Engineering Group. The ideal candidate will be looking to further their career and gain invaluable experience in the company. There is great scope in this role for leadership and also for involvement in the company.Job Role:Design structural buildings for small, medium and large-scale projects on a regional and national levelSupport projects by analysing survey reports, zoning restrictions and client requirements to ensure specifications meet project goalsReview blueprints, plans and change orders to verify structural integrity of materials and designs, and perform complex calculations and use modeling methods to ensure correct resultsParticipate in initial planning and bidding processes, including reviewing environmental factors, government regulations, constructions costs and risk analysis reports to prepare comprehensive study on all relevant design factorsCreate and present structural overviews for upcoming projects, and develop reports that include technical detailsUse AutoCAD and other drafting software programs to create 2D design documents and 3D models for individual components and overall structural plans according to client needs and project requirements for deliverablesPrepare documentation for clients covering project plans and progress, change orders, environmental impact findings, ownership transfers and other relevant informationAt a later stage there is scope to be involved in business development and bid managementJob Skills &amp; QualificationsRequired:Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in civil or structural engineering, plus minimum of 5 years of relevant work experienceProficient with AutoCADDecisive with excellent critical thinking skillsGood written and verbal communication abilities, including preparing and giving presentationsIf you&rsquo;re interested in this role, kindly forward an up-to-date copy of your CV in a word format to rob

item.title: Senior Calibration Engineer
item.content: Senior Calibration EngineerJoin a World Class biologics services provider at their state-of-the-art Greenfield Biopharmaceuticals CMO site in Dundalk, Co. Louth.The Calibration Engineer will be responsible for operational excellence in calibrations management during site build and transitioning into full operations. You will report directly into the Plant Engineering A.D. and liaise with the calibration team made up of calibration technicians, a team lead and a planner.You will play a key role in managing budgets, initiatives &amp; cost savings on site which focus on the &ldquo;bigger picture&rdquo; and lead to significant changes site-wide.This is a client facing role and also carries responsibilities as POC for all QA and compliance matters.The successful applicant will have ownership of calibration processes and methodologies, adherence to regulatory and industry standards as well as troubleshooting, reliability management and continuous improvement of site instruments.Rotation of onsite and offsite shifts.Responsibilities: * Ensuring calibration and instrumentation adherence to site, corporate and regulatory requirements, safety regulations * Point of contact during all internal and external audits. * Providing expertise input for technical instructions, best practices and SOPs executing calibration principles on site. * Developing, maintaining and ensuring site adherence to Calibration standards and specifications. * Act as POC for change control, audits and preventative maintenance. * Site calibrations SME for investigations, CAPAs and change controls as required. * Developing and sustaining an instrument reliability program demonstrating tangible improvement initiatives reducing instrument related discrepancies / failures, contributing to cost saving initiatives, and optimizing maintenance / calibration programs for instrumentation and test equipment on site. * Developing / implementing and managing third party calibration service provider contracts. * Developing / lead upgrade projects, managing all aspects from concept justification to commissioning realisation. * Developing / maintaining operational budgets relating to calibration and maintenance of process instrumentation, calibration standards and validation test equipment and QC laboratory equipment.Requirements: * Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Automation, Instrumentation, or other relevant engineering field. (Trade&rsquo;s qualified also accepted) * 5 years&rsquo; experience in a highly regulated environment- biopharmaceutical/ pharmaceutical preferable. * 3 years&rsquo; experience as calibration/instrument engineer in biopharmaceutical/ pharmaceutical industry. * Experience working within a start-up or Greenfield site. * Demonstrable experience of budget control and management. * Experience leading site-wide instrumentation projects to completion * Previous experience in oversight of site calibration compliance * Must have significant experience in managing problems, best practice and compliance * Experience with CMMS, preferably Maximo * Strong technical knowledge with demonstration of robust problem solving and continuous improvement. * Excellent communicator and capable of working with a variety of teams * Ability to create and implement SLA&rsquo;s with external vendors for calibration activities. * Experience in management of QC Lab instrument for calibration requirements. * Engineering background (as opposed to just hands-on experience)

item.title: Junior International Finance Consultant
item.content: Junior International Finance ConsultantPlacement: Two years careers programme with first six-month placement based in Luxembourg within Investment Banking industry and the opportunity to extend + competitive salary including benefitsTraining date: January 2021, remote training from home. Deployment to Luxembourg to start on site in February 2021 (FDM Group to support with relocation)Are you passionate about launching a career in International Business?Are you eager to grow and learn within a professional environment?FDM Group is a FTSE 250 company with over 3,900 consultants placed worldwide with our clients. FDM&rsquo;s unique combination of training and commercial experience will fast-track your career progression into roles in Investment Banking and Finance. We are currently looking for ambitious graduates and young professionals to join our award-winning Graduate Careers Programme and gain international experience while working as an Anti-Financial Crime Analyst for one of our clients in the financial sector based in Luxembourg.As part of your role, you will be responsible for performing Know Your Client (KYC) due diligence activities and helping mitigate risk for an international investment bank. Successful candidates will complete four weeks of industry-recognised training on Professional Skills, Advanced Excel, Financial Industry Awareness, Regulation and Compliance as well as KYC. Once the training is complete you will join an existing team of 80+ FDM consultants currently working in Luxembourg.What we offer you: * Commercially relevant four-week training and development of employability skills * Two-years careers programme with first six-month placement at a large financial services company, with potential to become a permanent member of their team * Company benefits, including pension scheme and employee recognition awards * Individual mentoring and ongoing support throughout your entire FDM journey * Access to multiple virtual tech talks, social and networking eventsWe ask you are: * Educated to degree level (2:2 or higher), preferably with a business background, but all degrees considered * Eligible to live and work within the EU * An excellent communicator with strong interpersonal skills * Ambitious, with a client focused attitude * A strong leader with an entrepreneurial and quantitative mindset * A fast learner with the ability to work under pressure * Willing to commit to employment with FDM for a minimum of two years upon completion of the training period * Willingness to relocate to Luxembourg with the support of FDMCulture and DiversityFrom day one, FDM has always been about the people. With over 5,000 employees and 90+ nationalities working together as a team, we encourage inclusivity and celebrate diversity, in terms of background, culture and skills. We are proud to provide a range of opportunities for you to get involved, broaden your networks and help you build relationships.As the training for this role will start in January 2021, applications are currently being reviewed - don&rsquo;t miss your chance and apply now

item.title: QC Associate 30283
item.content: Orion Group Life Sciences have an exciting opportunity for a QC Associate for our Multinational Biotechnology client based in the South of Dublin area on a 12-month contract.Job PurposeUnder minimal supervision, successful candidate would be responsible for one or more of the following activities in QC including microbiological testing, method transfers and verification, sample and data management and equipment maintenance. This role is for an experienced and technically strong associate who will spend 90% of their work day performing testing. The successful candidate would contribute to team by ensuring the quality of the tasks/services provided by self and contribute to the completion of milestones associated with specific projects or activities within team.This role will support manufacturing operations, as such some extended hours, shift and weekend work may be necessary as required.Main Responsibilities of the roleEndotoxin testing of water, in-process and drug product release samplesBioburden testing of water &amp; in-process drug product samplesSterility testingWater samplingLab Support duties such as Biological Indicator testing, Growth Promotion, Media Preparation, Identifications and Autoclave.Writing technical reportsPerform analytical testing as a main priority with efficiency and accuracyWith a high degree of technical flexibility, work across diverse areas within the labPlan and perform multiple, complex routine/ non-routine methods and procedures and a large variety of assays.Report, evaluate, back-up/archive, trend and approve analytical data.Troubleshoot, solve problems and communicate with stakeholders.Initiate and/or implement changes in controlled documents.Participate in audits, initiatives, and projects that may be departmental or organizational in scope.Write protocols and perform assay validation and equipment qualification/verification.Introduce new techniques to the lab, including method transfers, reports, validations and protocols.Evaluate lab practices for compliance and operational excellence improvement on a continuous basis.Approve lab resultsDesired Experience and Background of the successful candidateBachelor&#39;s degree in a science disciplineBiopharmaceutical QC experience in a microbiology labExperience with regulatory compliance in cGMP manufacturing and testing of pharmaceutical productsExperience working in endotoxin, bioburden or sterility testingProficient in GMP systems such as LIMS Labware &amp; LMESExperience in a wide variety of microbiological techniques, including but not limited to Bioburden, Endotoxin, Sterility (in an Isolator), Environmental Monitoring, Rapid Micro techniques, Microbial Identification, Media prep, Water Sampling.Understanding and application of principles, concepts, theories and standards of GMP QC microbiology laboratories. Deepens technical knowledge through exposure and continuous learningKnowledge of related regulatory/industry considerations, compliance issues and/or scientific discovery SkillsTake initiative to identify and drive improvementsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFor more information on this role, call Ian Towler on +353 (0) (phone number removed) or email (url removed) for a completely confidential chat about this role and other opportunities using the reference number: (phone number removed)Our role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment

item.title: Underwriting Operations Lead
item.content: At Bracken Recruitment we are working exclusively with our Insurance client to recruit an Underwriting Operations Lead based in South County Dublin.Reporting to the Underwriting &amp; Portfolio Manager you will provide strong leadership to Assistant Underwriters to ensure the team consistently deliver to a high standard in terms of service, underwriting and compliance. Your role will involve working closely with the Underwriting &amp; Portfolio Manager, turning defined business objectives into implementable policies and procedures. Role modelling company values, you&rsquo;ll motivate, coordinate, coach and supervise your team whilst actively underwriting yourself.Key areas of responsibilities&#x27A2; Providing effective leadership to your team of Assistant Underwriters, including: * Coaching, knowledge sharing and taking referrals; * Clear direction regards work priorities; * Broker relationship management; * Motivation; and * Performance Management.&#x27A2; Working alongside your team to ensure Footprint consistency provides a high standard of service to our broker partners: * Assessing referrals in accordance with defined risk appetite; * Taking personal ownership of any problems including management to resolution; * Professional and effective communication of decisions; * Creating and issuing documentation, as required; and * Oversight and management of workflow, ensuring performance remains within defined service levels; * Carrying out audits as required.&#x27A2; Underwriting personal lines risks, professionally and consistently &ndash; applying your risk perception and underwriting skills to make effective decisions in line with defined Risk Appetite.&#x27A2; Supporting the Underwriting &amp; Portfolio Manager in the delivery of Portfolio strategy.&#x27A2; Contributing to technical initiatives, including supporting the research and development of new products, as required.&#x27A2; Development of resourcing plans based on activity forecasts.&#x27A2; Management and oversight of Soft Ware Houses &ndash; including logging and management of tickets to resolution.&#x27A2; Defining and implementing effective and proportionate operational and technical practices, procedures and controls.&#x27A2; Oversight and management of User Acceptance Testing and monthly test plan.&#x27A2; Creating and nurturing a high-performance culture where your team consistently strives to improve.&#x27A2; Leading a culture of technical and compliance excellence, including personal management of Complaints.&#x27A2; Leading and / or collaborating in internal projects, as required.&#x27A2; Any other activities as may be required from time to time.Key Attributes&#x27A2; Team player.&#x27A2; Enthusiastic, confident and self-motivated.&#x27A2; Great communicator with ability to influence and build strong relationships.&#x27A2; Strong organizational skills including ability to prioritise.&#x27A2; Ability to multi-task.&#x27A2; Excellent risk perception and analytical skills.&#x27A2; Working knowledge of Applied Systems.&#x27A2; Team leader and motor insurance experience &ndash; being interested in cars is a must.&#x27A2; Working knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements.&#x27A2; Ideally CIP or progressing towards.To apply for this role submit your CV and Karen will be in touch

item.title: Design Office Manager
item.content: Alucraft Limited is the market-leading company in Ireland in the design, manufacture and installation of architectural glazing systems and a key part of a growing group of companies across the UK &amp; Ireland including Alucraft Systems and English Architectural Glazing (&quot;EAG&quot;). It has the demonstrable expertise and scale to deliver projects in the commercial office, educational and residential sectors and has provided facades to many high-profile buildings in Ireland.To support our succession planning we are now seeking an aspiring Design Office Manager to lead the day to day activities, processes, and people within our design office. We are renowned for technical expertise and the efficient delivery of facade design solutions, and would expect the appointee to uphold these standards in order to maintain our reputation as a contractor of choice.With significant experience in the Construction sector ensuring that projects and programmes are delivered to time and budget, suitable candidates will have prior senior involvement with design teams and issues, and will also have the capability to lead and motivate a 50-strong team across multiple locations. A strong personal drive and appetite for hard work is a must.Based in our Dublin offices, the role will be varied and challenging, interacting with our Production, Purchasing and Construction functions and acting as senior Design stakeholder in regular management and project meetings.This is a high profile role providing a great career opportunity, and suitable candidates may come from within or outside the architectural glazing/facades industry including high calibre individuals from main contractors, consultancies, M&amp;E disciplines and the broader construction sector.Alucraft Limited is an Equal Opportunities Employer

item.title: Senior Design Assurance Engineer
item.content: Medical Engineers have been engaged by a medical device development company based in Ireland who have a requirement for a Senior Design Assurance engineer with experience in the design and development of implantable products made using NiTinol.Our clients innovative minimally invasive technology will treat symptomatic benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) which affects c50% of men over the age of 50.Based in their Dublin facility, this senior engineer position will lead the advancement of the nitinol implant and second-generation delivery system from design, manufacture, verification/validation, clinical trial, and regulatory approval.The candidate will work with quality and regulatory teams to ensure the device meets user, regulatory and ISO 13485 requirements. Candidates should have a hands-on approach to projects with a motivated attitude and strong work ethic. An ability to work and adapt in a flexible and fast-paced environment is essential.Responsibilities and Contribution: * Core part of the engineering team working on product design and development from concept stage through to regulatory approval * Liaise and support vendors during the prototyping and early stage manufacture of device components * Finite element analysis of device components * Test method design * Conduct bench testing of the device and device components * Core participation in advancement from concept/prototype to manufacturing process development, device assembly and design verification testing and clinical * Draft and compile technical documentation to support product development in accordance with the Medical Device Directive (MDD) and their ISO 13485 Quality Management SystemSkills and Experience Required: * Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in a biomedical, mechanical or materials Engineering discipline with a higher level postgraduate degree (masters or PhD) related to Nitinol and mechanical testing with 2+ years industry experience in a related role, or 5+ years industry experience in a related R&amp;D role * Experience of Nitinol material processing and technical specifications essential * Knowledge of FEA essential * Test method development experience essential * Sound understanding of mechanical design and engineering fundamentals * Strong communication and writing skills * Materials knowledge of medical device polymers an advantage * Good working knowledge of Solidworks or other CAD package an advantage * Knowledge of medical device quality &amp; regulatory systems and medical device directives (ISO13485 and FDA CFR 820) an advantage
