item.title: Quantity Surveyor/Estimator
item.content: Quantity Surveyor RoleJob DescriptionAbout usKeegan group is a well-established, leading supplier of high quality construction products within Ireland and the UK. We began by producing ready mix concrete and have now expanded into concrete block manufacturing, precast wall and floor manufacturing and most recently producing calcium carbonate.We supply our quarry products to customers in the commercial and domestic markets around Dublin, Meath, Kildare, Offaly and Louth. Our precast is supplied all over the UK and Ireland and our calcium carbonate is supplied to feed mills all over Ireland.We are currently seeking a Quantity Surveyor to join our precast division at our head office in Trammon, Rathmolyon, Co. Meath, which is home to our Limestone Quarry, our Precast design department, state of the art precast manufacturing plant, concrete block plant, concrete batching plant and lime plant.Based just 25 mins from Navan and 15 mins from Enfield this is the ideal role for a Quantity Surveyor looking to leave Dublin and secure a role in a well- established construction company. Reporting to the Operations Manager, you will also work closely with the onsite management team to ensure the timely and within budget delivery of the project.The RoleWe are seeking a Quantity Surveyor to join our company Keegan Precast Limited.The role will involve the following: * Administration of subcontractors including processing payments, obtaining final account agreements, and resolving disputed issues by negotiation, if appropriate. * Be responsible for the timely production of appropriate levels of applications for payments in accordance with the provisions of the conditions of contract. * Provide commercial advice to the site team, and management on all contractual issues. * Attend and provide input to relevant customer/client commercial meetings. * Provide input to contracts with client&rsquo;s representatives. * Provide and control strategy of commercial contracts with client&rsquo;s representatives.Requirements * Minimum of 2 years working on large scale projects * Have structural background in buildings * Familiar with Irish &amp; UK contracts * Proven client relations skills, strong written and verbal communication skills * Ability to use time productively, maximise efficiency and meet challenging work goals * Have relevant/similar experience in software such as Cubit * Possess ability to work well as part of a team and independentlyJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

item.title: Marketing & Business Development Lead
item.content: Location: Ireland (Remote) Salary: Dependent on experienceJob Type: Permanent Discipline: Marketing &amp; Business Development LeadAre you looking to start the New Year with a new role? We&#39;re hiring a Marketing and Business Development Lead to change the game of our business in Ireland. We have offices based in Cork and Galway with the opportunity to work remotely anywhere in Ireland.Who we are:We are Kelly. You could say we invented the modern recruitment industry. But that was then. Now we want to look towards the future. Towards #whatsnext. We want a Marketing and Lead Generation professional who understands the Irish market and can connect us to new business opportunities.That&#39;s where the Marketing and Customer Engagement team comes in. We&#39;re disruptors. Leaders of the pack. Innovative pioneers. Working across Kelly&#39;s key specialisms we look to expand our footprint in Ireland. How do we do this? We identify potential new clients. We create content bespoke to them, and then we communicate the content. Ultimately, we take our message to the market to attract and win the best clients out there! Who are we looking for? We&#39;re on the lookout for a Marketing and Lead Generation individual with good attention to detail, who likes the idea of being creative and doing things differently.Using a data-driven approach, you will drive our team in Ireland to expand their social media presences, build their networks and position our team as experts within their specialist fields.You&#39;ll have the opportunity to make a change and have a positive impact by getting the Kelly brand seen and recognised as a specialist recruitment company across Ireland.The role:The role has a variety of responsibilities from collecting and analysing data, creating content to generating opportunities within Ireland. You will:Collect data, data, data - we already have a foundation in place, with mailing lists for our specialist&#39;s area. What we&#39;re looking for is someone who can add to our data sets. Analysing the data as well as segmenting and targeting relevant contacts that will create new business opportunitiesIdentify and send out personalised targeted messaging to potential clients. Then when you get a hit, track your leads. Follow up with them, with even more thought-provoking contentResearch sale triggers that can be targeted by the Sales Team. Giving them as much actionable information needed to convert the data into revenue.Think outside the box. Come up with ideas that&#39;ll set us apart from our competitors in IrelandCreate and schedule fun and engaging content to increase our brand awareness - Gifs, static images, surveys, videos, infographics, blog posts&hellip;the sky&#39;s the limitManaging our Digital and Social Media platforms and campaignsCreate website contentSupport the wider Kelly Teams with captivating collateral to sell to the Irish marketSupport the UK Marketing Team with tailoring current and new B2B / B2C campaigns for the Irish marketCreate a presence through Direct and Email Marketing campaigns and TelemarketingBe part of a group of people passionate about doing recruitment how the world needs it, not just how it has always been Experience:This role is all about your mindset and attitude and we are seeking a bright, switched-on person who is looking for opportunities to take a hold of. We are after someone with:Knowledge of the Irish marketAn ability to work on and run multiple campaignsA desire to collect data and actively create sales opportunities for the business through proactive marketing activitiesWho is passionate and excited about taking on a new challenge So, what&#39;s next?If this sounds like a role, you&#39;d be interested in applying for send us a copy of your CV and we&#39;ll get in touch.Kelly Services are acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this role. Should you choose to apply, your information will be processed in accordance with Kelly&#39;s Privacy Statement. For information regarding data protection at Kelly, please visit the Kelly website and have a look into the Privacy Statement.As an Equal Opportunities employer we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age

item.title: Technical Writer - API
item.content: <p>Sage is a global company with a local heart. The market leader for cloud-based accounting, financials, enterprise management, people, and payroll software, we empower the world's business heroes-from single-person startups to large enterprises. Our people are passionate and positive. We inspire our colleagues to serve business builders everywhere and champion their success. As a FTSE 100 company with 14,000 colleagues across 24 countries, we do business the right way, while giving back to our local communities through the Sage Foundation. Sage is passionate about building a culture where our colleagues feel they can bring their whole selves to work. Where people know they'll be judged on their performance and behaviours - not their identity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on their race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.</p> <p>Want to join a small content design team as Technical API Writer? We're dedicated to furthering our mission to use the right words, at the right time, in the right place.<br /> <br /> As an API writer, you'll be working with a small team of other API writers, within a larger multi-disciplinary team across various locations. You will produce compelling copy for our developer portals and technical guidance for development partners helping them to integrate their products with Sage solutions. Ideally you will be based in our Newcastle or Manchester office.<br /> <br /> For this role, you will be working primarily within the Small Business Segment, focusing on providing API documentation for our independent software vendor and developer network.<br /> <br /> <strong>WE WOULD LOVE TO CHAT IF YOU:</strong><br /> <br /> - Have deep knowledge of REST APIs.<br /> <br /> - Are experienced using Git and GitHub.<br /> <br /> - Enjoy communicating and presenting sophisticated technical concepts in a concise and clear manner.<br /> <br /> - Have an understanding of the Docs as Code approach.<br /> <br /> - Are experienced documenting .NET client libraries.<br /> <br /> - Have experience in acquiring required information by interviewing subject matter experts.<br /> <br /> - Are familiar with OpenAPI and Swagger specifications + ReDoc.<br /> <br /> - Enjoy learning new technologies, platforms, and tools quickly.<br /> <br /> - Have insane attention to detail!<br /> <br /> <strong>WHY YOU WOULD LOVE TO JOIN US:</strong><br /> <br /> You'll work alongside highly capable UX and Content Designers, who really enjoy working collaboratively and embracing new ideas.<br /> <br /> We offer a range of benefits that complement a competitive salary, including share save scheme, bonus options and pensions plan.<br /> <br /> All colleagues get 25 days of paid annual leave with the option to buy up to another 5 days.<br /> <br /> Plus, colleagues will receive learning day to develop skills and behaviours linked to their personal or career development!<br /> <br /> Colleagues can also enjoy an additional number of family friendly benefits including the option to flex start and end times during the week and flexible working.<br /> <br /> Sage also offers numerous business resources groups that you can join or simply be supported by such as our Foundation Amabassadors, Diversity and Healthy Mind First Aiders networks.</p> <p>#LI-JL</p> <p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES</strong><br /> <br /> - Write well-structured, accurate, and concise API documentation for internal and external developers.<br /> <br /> - Improve existing documentation tools and processes.<br /> <br /> - Work with technology experts on a variety of teams to gain an understanding of the relevant technologies, platforms, and solutions.<br /> <br /> - Work with other content designers and development teams to ensure our API documentation is consistent and meets the needs of our users.</p><img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?u7kTXkXyKeyyE%2fQ8ymvgQAf" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Accounts Administrator
item.content: Our client in Castlebar is seeking an Accounts Administrator to join their team in a permanent capacity.&bull; Deal with supplier accounts including reconciliations, payments and supplier queries.&bull; Oversee aged items and following up with customers and suppliers where necessary.&bull; Liaise with the Finance team on audit matters.&bull; Get involved in upcoming finance projects.&bull; Process payments to suppliers in accordance with the agreed payment terms.&bull; Support the Finance team in meeting department KPIs and create reports to be shared with the relevant stakeholders.&bull; Prepare key reports for the Finance team to monitor the cash inflows from customers and outflows to suppliers.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES&bull; In conjunction with the key stakeholders you will function as part of a team that assumes total ownership of the Finance operations (billing, accounts preparation, customer payments, aged debtors and creditors).&bull; Support the Finance team in meeting department KPIs and report regularly to the relevant stakeholders.&bull; Prepare business financial reports for the company which will support the team in achieving important department goals and objectives.&bull; Support the departments at the company with tasks required to ensure the efficient and accurate processing of documentation.&bull; Help monitor the finance mail box for billing related queries.EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCEMust have a third level qualification in Business, Accounting, Finance or other related degree from an accredited third-level institution.The right candidate: * Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to interact cross-functionally with all levels of management and across all geographies. * Attention to detail and ability to see tasks through to completion. * Strong organisational skills with the ability to prioritise. * Self-motivated and proactive. * Ability to understand the total scope of business while executing on tasks. * Ability and desire to learn quickly in a fast-paced team environment. * Strong computer skills are critical to this role. Must be comfortable with MS Office Suite, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio. Experience with using an ERP system is essential.Contact Maria on the contact details listed via email or phone.Skills:Accounts, Administration, Accounting

item.title: Automation Engineer
item.content: Information Systems Application LeadThe IS Applications Lead will be responsible for effectively managing and leading the IS Applications, Analytics and Laboratory IT support teams, supporting site operations and promoting a culture of continuous improvement.The IS Application Lead will champion the use of data and information, play a key role identifying where, when, how and why the business uses data, and transform it into information that serves each function at the site.Essential Duties and Responsibilities * Lead and provide technical guidance to the IS Applications support team and the Laboratory IT support team, ensuring the necessary resources and skill sets are available and developed to meet current and future business needs * Develop IS strategies, plan and execute system roadmaps and support new technology deployment * Increase and maintain site Historian data collection to support existing manufaturing areas and new projects. * Deliver and present analytics / reports for key stakeholders across the site to drive decision making - champion the use of data and information evolving WuXi Dundalk into a true data-driven organization * Responsible for determining the sites data related needs and developing proposed solutions. * Responsible for the maintenance, administration, compliance and availability of the application systems and Laboratory IT systems. * Management of 3rd party suppliers/contractors/Systems integrators as required * Technical solution design and evaluation, delivery, commissioning and validation, schedule tracking, budget management for sustaining initiatives * Evolution and continuous improvement of work processes to ensure consistency, efficiency and quality, employing LEAN practices as appropriate * Definition and maintenance of clear metrics to demonstrate team performance and service delivery * Ensure appropriate and timely escalation of issues and risks * Ensuring alignment of solutions with WuXi and industry standards and regulations as they pertain to systems and system architectures * Active member of the AIS management team, contributing to and supporting the overall AIS strategy and functional deliverables * Perform all tasks with due care and attention and in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practices and WuXi requirements, policies and procedures * Be a champion for safe working practices and safety initiatives within their functional area and beyond * Travel at various times is anticipated to support AIS and Operations network alignment, knowledge share and projects.Requirements * Bachelors in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, Biotech Engineering or related computer science engineering with 5+ years experience in operations/manufacturing environment leading teams * Demonstrated leadership skills, team development, definition and implementation of organisation strategies. * Experience in the delivery and management of GMP IS Application systems such as OSI Pi Historian, TrackWise, Maximo, Document Management Systems etc. and GMP Laboratory IT Systems such as Empower CDS, LMES, Sample Manager LIMS, Laboratory Analytical Equipment and instruments will be an advantage. * Excellent data manipulation skills * Experience dealing with a large portfolio of systems, projects and initiatives in the areas of Information Systems and Operations. * Strong knowledge of databases, reporting and analytic systems and Information Systems supporting manufacturing business unit is a plus. * Strong technical and organizational communication, coordination, and meeting facilitation skills

item.title: Trainee Field Service Engineer
item.content: Do you have a strong interest for electromechanics? Are you fascinated with repairing, servicing and see how things work? Would you love to work for a market leader within the white goods industry as a Field Service Engineer?The Concept Academy are hiring Trainee Engineers to join a market leader of large domestic appliances such as washing machines, refrigerators, dishwashers, cookers &amp; tumble dryers.Who are we looking for?We are seeking keen individuals with a willingness to learn that would love to get hands on within a new industry. You will have a passion within electromechanicals with basic experience also being advantageous. Other qualifying areas or experience that may be considered are ; vehicle maintenance, coffee machines, vending machines, ticket machines, parking machines, washing machines, tumble dryers, dishwashers, microwaves fridges etc.It is important that you are able to demonstrate;Fantastic customer service skillsEnergetic, driven &amp; great attention to detailEagerness to learnProblem solving in difficult situationsGood oral and written communication skillsLong term goal to be trained as a competent engineer Our training academyFully comprehensive training including classroom, workshop and theory4 week training course in Dublin starting on 1st February then a further 2 weeks shadowing a Senior Engineer within the field.This will require you to stay overnight within the week and go home on weekends during training Life after trainingYou have completed your 4 week training, you have a shiny new van, tools and parts all loaded, you&#39;re ready to go &hellip; so what&#39;s next?Service repair and maintenance within domestic settings on a range of domestic appliancesMonitor and maintain adequate stock levelsCompleting service calls via PDAMonthly one to ones with Regional Supervisor &amp; Team quarterly meetingsOngoing training and skill set monitoringAiming for first time fix rateDay to day updates via Coordination TeamThis role is homebased, to be considered for the Cork area, it is essential that you live within 40 miles of the city centre What&#39;s on offer?&euro;26,000 per annum&euro;1,000 salary increase after 6 monthsVan &amp; fuel cardComprehensive training courses direct from manufacturer followed by 2 week shadowing on the field.20 days holiday + bank holidaysPayable through an umbrella companyQuarterly engineer reward schemeAccess to PerkboxThis is an ongoing training contract &amp; you will have the opportunity to be made permanent (based on performance)Uniform, Tools, test equipment, footwear, PPE, face masks, hand sanitiser provided The EssentialsStrong interest in an engineering disciplineFull Driving LicenseRight to work in IrelandMust be over 21 years oldAppropriate delivery point for a courier to have 24/7 access to deliver stock e.g. (garage, storage unit, ideally 50 sq foot) is essentialGood written &amp; excellent verbal communication skills across all levelsGood time management and organisation skillsMust be able to pass relevant security vetting.Happy to stay away from home training at Head OfficeConfident using Android devices What is the interview process?Initial telephone screening to discuss background, training academy &amp; the roleVideo call with Service Delivery Coordinator competency based / technical questionsFace to face / video interview with Service Delivery ManagerThis would be a fantastic role for a trainee who wants to become a field service engineer and learn a new industry. We are recruiting heavily over the next year, so if you don&#39;t see a vacancy within your area, but you want to register your interest, please email your CV with the subject - Academy Engineer Interest

item.title: Senior R&D Engineer
item.content: Medical Engineers have been engaged by a medical device development company based in Ireland who have a requirement for a senior R&amp;D engineer with experience in the design and development of implantable products made using NiTinol.Our clients innovative minimally invasive technology will treat symptomatic benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) which affects c50% of men over the age of 50.Based in their Dublin facility, this senior engineer position will lead the advancement of the nitinol implant and second-generation delivery system from design, manufacture, verification/validation, clinical trial, and regulatory approval.The candidate will work with quality and regulatory teams to ensure the device meets user, regulatory and ISO 13485 requirements. Candidates should have a hands-on approach to projects with a motivated attitude and strong work ethic. An ability to work and adapt in a flexible and fast-paced environment is essential.Responsibilities and Contribution: * Core part of the engineering team working on product design and development from concept stage through to regulatory approval * Liaise and support vendors during the prototyping and early stage manufacture of device components * Finite element analysis of device components * Test method design * Conduct bench testing of the device and device components * Core participation in advancement from concept/prototype to manufacturing process development, device assembly and design verification testing and clinical * Draft and compile technical documentation to support product development in accordance with the Medical Device Directive (MDD) and their ISO 13485 Quality Management SystemSkills and Experience Required: * Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in a biomedical, mechanical or materials Engineering discipline with a higher level postgraduate degree (masters or PhD) related to Nitinol and mechanical testing with 2+ years industry experience in a related role, or 5+ years industry experience in a related R&amp;D role * Experience of Nitinol material processing and technical specifications essential * Knowledge of FEA essential * Test method development experience essential * Sound understanding of mechanical design and engineering fundamentals * Strong communication and writing skills * Materials knowledge of medical device polymers an advantage * Good working knowledge of Solidworks or other CAD package an advantage * Knowledge of medical device quality &amp; regulatory systems and medical device directives (ISO13485 and FDA CFR 820) an advantage

item.title: Quality Control Technician
item.content: This is a fantastic graduate level opportunity for a technically focused individual to represent the company on all technical issues, liaising between R&amp;D, sales and the production area. Ensuring that all products are produced in a safe and legal manner and in compliance with Customer specifications.Ensuring that all products are in alignment with both the company&#39;s policies and the retailer&#39;s policies and strategies. Your role will be key as part of the Technical team in the delivery and efficient implementation of Technical practices and procedures.The successful candidate will be responsible for: * Having an awareness of food science with a focus on best practice and from a legislative perspective - Food safety, hygiene requirements; * Assisting with quality operations, procedures and document control; * Maintaining and updating the department files including SOPs, risk assessments, HACCP documents and quality management documents; * Carrying out audits as per schedule; * Evaluating the written SOP&#39;s being carried out; * Maintaining and managing non-conformance logs; * Logging complaints and communicating to the relevant personnel; * Assisting with close out investigations into complaints including root cause analysis; * Microbiological and chemical sampling of finished product and raw materials as per sampling schedule; * Carrying out internal audits and assisting with external and customer audits.Your role will see you tackle a wide range of business challenges in a busy Technical environment.The ideal Candidate will have or demonstrate: * A degree in a related discipline (Food Technology, Nutrition, Science); * Proficient in Microsoft word/excel/outlook etc. Decisiveness and the ability to work well as part of a team; * Strong attention to detail; * Commercial awareness; * Excellent communication skills - Oral &amp; written; * HACCP trained is an advantage. * Be self-motivated, and have the ability to work as part of a team

item.title: Quality Executive
item.content: The Quality Executive is responsible for carrying out tasks and projects related to management of Quality Assurance or Quality System activities for Legal Entity as required by Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) and Good Distribution Practices (GDP).General Scope of Responsibilities The Quality Executive/Deputy Responsible Person is responsible for supporting the maintenance of the Quality Management System for Legal Entities. These activities include change control, non-conformance investigation, supporting internal/corporate and health authority inspections, customer and supplier qualification, supply chain projects, compilation of metrics and document management. Key Role Activities: * Prepare, update and approve procedures in accordance with GMP/GDP * Manage all documents in accordance with records management * Assist in the implementation and update of internal or external standards * Identify and Log Quality Issues, perform impact assessments and lead investigations * Collaborate effectively with various internal and external partners * Ensure appropriate management of non-conformances related to GMP and GDP, internal and external change controls and CPAs. * Support the Quality Manager with monitoring and oversight of outsourced activities. * Perform allocated internal audits as required * Support and participate in local initiatives or projects to increase compliance and reduce costs/non-conformance. * Provide the necessary input to the Quality Manager for the bi-annual management review of the Legal Entities. * Support the process for intake of medicinal queries and complaints, ensuring timely case processing.In addition, the role profile of the Quality Executive/Deputy Responsible Person is to act in accordance with the requirements detailed below in the absence of the RP, ensuring to keep appropriate records of any delegated duties * Maintains the Wholesale Distribution Authorisation, ensuring compliance with the general conditions detailed, in line with European and local regulations. * To ensure compliance with the requirements of Good Distribution Practice (EU GDP). * To ensure that all aspects of the quality system are implemented and maintained. * Ensure that the quality, safety and traceability of medicinal products are maintained within the supply chain. * To ensure appropriate competence and experience as well as knowledge of and training in GDP. * To ensure initial and continuous training programs are implemented and maintained. * To have oversight of approval for return to saleable stock any medicinal products returned by a customer. * RP should have oversight of all documentation practices required. * Coordinates and performs recall operations for medicinal products. * To be involved in any decision to quarantine or depose of returned, rejected, recalled or falsified medicinal products. * To approve new customers and suppliers and periodic review of existing customers and suppliers.Essential: * Bachelor&#39;s Degree in a Scientific/Technical discipline required * A minimum of 5-8 years&#39; experience in a Quality or compliance role within the Pharmaceutical industry, most specifically in relation to GMP and GDP. * Formal certified GDP Training on Good Distribution Practice of Medicinal Products for Human Use * Up to date knowledge of relevant pharmaceutical legislation and GMP/GDP. Ability to apply GMP and GDP regulations and international guidelines to all aspects of the position. * Demonstrated knowledge and application of industry regulations as they apply to quality, including those of HPRA, EMEA, FDA and other authorities.DESIRABLE: * Previous experience working as a Deputy Responsible Person * Experience in auditing of external suppliers, contractors and vendors.Our role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment

item.title: Mechanical Supervisor

M&amp;E contractor experience in roles from construction stage through commissioning to handover preferredDuties will include:- * Overseeing works and supervising progress of MEP subcontractors on installation and fabrication of High Purity Stainless Steel Pipework, Ductwork and associated Process Equipment including gas, oil and steam boilers and all associated pipework and controls. * Monitoring and reporting progress to site and senior project management. * Conducting Site Walk downs and Progress Inspections * Attending Site Construction Coordination Meetings * Ensuring and Maintaining High Quality Workmanship and Adherence to Client Specifications. * Attendance of weekly toolbox talk with piping teams relating to all piping activities. * Oversight supervision of Mechanical, Piping and Rigging Teams during fabrication and installation of pipework, MEP Systems and Equipment.Experience and Skill Sets Required. * Management and supervision of mechanical installations on high urgency construction projects. * Supervision of all installations up to and including commissioning and handover on high purity and hygienic stainless-steel piping systems. * Problem solving, ensure all appropriate safety procedures are implemented during work execution. * Installation fabrication and welding of High Purity Pipework. * Installation of HVAC systems. * Installation and fabrication of mild steel and stainless steel brackets. * Fabrication and welding of mild steel stainless steel and copper pipework. * Industrial installation of hot and cold water systems. * Full M&amp;E system interface knowledge essential, electrical commissioning knowledge an advantage * M&amp;E contractor experience in roles from construction stage through commissioning to handover preferred * Mechanical Engineering/equivalent 3rd Level qualification, senior trades accreditation advantageous * Construction &amp; commissioning experience an advantage * Excellent people management and communication skills required * Excellent fault finding &amp; troubleshooting skills

item.title: Account Development Representative with fluent German
item.content: As an Account Development Sales Representative - we know you are results-oriented, problem solvers, target-driven and ambitious. We are looking for you to help us deliver exceptional sales experiences to customers for our multinational technology client who specializes in Internet-related products and services.Life with Our clientAs a global company, we&rsquo;re always on. When one of us is going to bed, a co worker half-way around the world has already had their coffee (or tea) and is ready to grab the baton and run with it. We work at a fast pace around here and we&rsquo;re not one for keeping the status quo. But just because we&rsquo;re busy, it doesn&rsquo;t mean we don&rsquo;t know how to have fun.We&rsquo;re passionate about throwing company events that bring us together to laugh and celebrate each other&rsquo;s achievements. We&rsquo;re also big on taking time out for professional development and giving back. If you&rsquo;re looking for a work-life full of purpose, passion and career potential, keep reading&hellip;As a Sales Professional, you&rsquo;ll enjoy&middot; Competitive annual base salary plus bonus based on performance&middot; Excellent relocation package to assist you in moving to Dublin (Including flight assistance and 7 Nights hotel accommodation)&middot; Continuous paid training on the latest technology&middot; Private Health/Medical Insurance, Dental Plan and Eye Care Reimbursements&middot; Private Pension and Life assurance&middot; Onsite Kitchen (yes when return to our site... it&#39;s pretty swanky)&middot; 20 annual leave days 9 statutory days entitlement&middot; Potential for rapid advancement in many fields and throughout 17 countriesA Day in the LifeYou will be a hunter, cold caller and tenacious individual to garner, promote and build interest in the product through excellent and timely discovery of the prospect&rsquo;s business needs, wants and challenges. You will interact with business decision makers and C-Level personnel within corporate and enterprise sectors. You will interact via telephone, email and chat on a daily basis to have conversations regarding their business and how our clients cross-platform browser can benefit them. As a business partner for Field Sales Representatives, you&#39;ll work in close collaboration with them, Regional Marketing and with Partners to identify priorities and the best engagement strategy.And to be Successful You&#39;ll&middot; Be an active listener while communicating with the customer on phone calls and refrain from personal distractions such as side conversations or cell phone use.&middot; Fluency in English &amp; German&middot; Develop accounts to grow you client database&middot; Generate sales leads to identify new business opportunities and drive pipeline&middot; Provide prospective clients a broad overview of business solutions&middot; Generate meetings for discovery and follow-up meetings for technical sales opportunities&middot; Confirm Budget, Authority, Need, and Timeline criteria before handing off leads to Field Sales Representatives&middot; Complete the required activity levels daily with the goal to have conversations conducted and meetings established&middot; Utilize, document and be an expert in Vector (CRM)&middot; Build customer relationships, learn about their business needs and position new products to upsell/cross-sell&middot; Periodically meet and collaborate with Field Sales Representatives, Partner Managers and the Regional Marketing manager&middot; What you bring to the table&middot; Exceptional bilingual verbal and written communication skills in German and English&middot; B2B Sales Experience is Required&middot; Outbound sales experience&middot; Excellent written and verbal communication skills&middot; Ability to multi- task, prioritize and manage time effectively&middot; Knowledge of the marketing technology industry&middot; Keen interest in all things tech!&middot; Target-driven and have a total focus on achieving targets and helping grow business&middot; Present a balanced approach to cold calling, relationship development, sales process and appointment setting&middot; Ability to understand complex business environments and uncover business challengesFor your safety and the safety of our employees, all recruitment will be virtual. And initially, this will be a work from home position, with the intent that the role will then be in our Dublin facility. All candidates must be Dublin residents or can relocate to Dublin on a moment&#39;s notice

item.title: Design Engineer
item.content: Design EngineerBased in DonegalSalary DOEFulltime Permanent roleOur Donegal based client has undergone steady growth in recent years given that they provide to an impressive customer base across Donegal, Ulster, Ireland and into the UK.From their premises in North Donegal, they provide commercial and residential window and door solutions to clients far and wide.Having doubled their workforce in the last few years, they continue to grow and as a result of that growth we have been tasked with assisting them recruit more team members.Core Duties:Preparation of site files for all projects;Reporting progress to Managing Director and clients;Design work including window and door structures, working components, from concept to completion;Review and select materials based on established requirements;Perform tolerance analysis;Present design in details and support design decisions;Produce detailed drawings for manufacturing and assembly.Requirements:You will be qualified to degree level in Mechanical/Industrial Engineering/ Construction Management/ Product Design or related field and have ideally 2+ years relevant experience.You will be proficient in AutoCAD and Solidworks. (2D and 3D);You will demonstrate exceptional attention to detail and be able to problem solve and be responsible for a quality finish.You will be highly motivated with strong communication skills and have the ability to work on independently or as part of a team.An exceptional communication you will be able to deal with the Main Contractor, Architects, and clients in writing and in design meetings and be able to communicate with Estimating and project managers to ensure project are completed to specification and high quality.You will have a full clean driver&rsquo;s licence.Preference will be given to those who in addition to above have Revit and BIM experience, knowledge of Logikal software, curtain walling systems and knowledge of glazing specifications.How to Apply:Please send your full and up to date CV along with a cover note or email to David/Robert in our Multi-Sector team in order to apply for this role.Please note at this time, applications can only be accepted from those who already hold legal right to work in Ireland and only suitable applicants may be contacted.Our team has many decades of recruitment experience and we provide our clients with a comprehensive service to supply and manage their workforce needs.Currently we have offices across Ireland and U.K, to include Derry, Dublin, Cork, Galway, and London.It is 3D Personnel&rsquo;s policy to work closely with both our clients and candidates in order to build strong, mutually beneficial and lasting relationships.For a full list of jobs we currently have available please visit https://(url removed)/jobs/3D Personnel is operating as an Employment Agency and Business.Equality is at the forefront of our operation and we provide equality of opportunity to everyone.You can review our Privacy Policy on the home page of our website

item.title: Electrical Site Supervisor | Connaught
item.content: Electrical Site Supervisor | Galway &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose The role of the Electrical Site Supervisor is to support the Site Manager in the organization and co-ordination of site-based activities and to lead and co-ordinate teams of Electrical Engineering trade professionals on site. The Supervisor will be responsible for tracking and recording of site daily activities and progress. They will lead their teams to deliver to quality, on time and to budget in a safe and efficient manner. They will deal with obstacles and develop team capacity. &nbsp; Electrical Site Supervisor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project in line with the Kirby Way: &nbsp; Commercial: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Fully understand your IFC scope of work and notify IFC variations to CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete take-offs for variations as requested. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Populate SE progress assessment form in conjunction with planners. &nbsp; Schedule: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Develop 2 week look ahead and agree it with CM at weekly meeting. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Coordinate work with other trades in your area through whiteboard and directly. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure your scope is construction complete for agreed start dates of testing and commissioning. &nbsp; Scope: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and fully understand IFC Scope of works. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and agree area site set-up with C.M. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Install area site set-up in line with agreed plan &ndash; all on wheels, nothing directly on the floor. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Appoint person responsible to maintain and clean your area. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure temp power is available for directs and subcontractors prior to required date. &nbsp; Quality: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Understand Quality objective of Project &ndash; snag free systems on time. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand Quality Control Plan which is based on 6M&rsquo;s. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement Quality Control Plan on site. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand ITP. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement ITP. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure only specified materials are used for your scope of installation. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete Weekly Quality Audits and check lists. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear quality audit actions as soon as possible. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Identify snag items as the installation progresses &ndash; stand down crew forTBT if snags are repeated. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear snag items to suit walkdown schedule. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all personnel have seen relevant FoK&rsquo;s to their task. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conduct quality TBT&rsquo;s. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure the works are adequately protected. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure Drawings are Red lined and signed in line with agreed due dates. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Collate and File all relevant documentation delivered with materials, plant and equipment. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Read and understand the manufacturer&rsquo;s instructions. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure materials, plant and equipment are installed to specification and manufacturers recommendations. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure installation is in accordance with P&amp;IDs and Isometrics. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Understand and follow the requirements associated with maintaining the correct files on site. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Advise CM if NCR is necessary. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel have the relevant training for the allocated tasks. &nbsp; EHS: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand the safety objective of the project &ndash; target Zero incidents and understand why &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel are inducted including subcontractors prior to starting any task. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Plan all tasks through identifying hazards in your work area, assessing the risk, determining and implementing control measures prior to starting any task &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Planning is particularly important for MIMO, Working at Height and Working with/around electricity &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure appropriate RAMS are in place for all tasks &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review and understand the RAMS, advise CM of any required amendments prior to undertaking the task, do not start task until RAMS are updated &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that employees and subcontractors are properly instructed and sign up to appropriate RAMS as required. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure SPA&#39;s are in place when setting your personnel and subcontractors to work and are appropriate for the task and signed by yourself &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Coordinate work with other trades in your area (co-sign SPA&rsquo;s where possible) &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure exclusion zones and restricted zones are identified and noted on Exyte daily whiteboards &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Enforce rule that no persons to work underneath other trades working at height &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure housekeeping issuesare highlighted and noted on Exyte daily whiteboards &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; All materials and tools used while working at height must be secured, tethered or removed from location &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Large cable pulls to have an exclusion zone in the relevant area, if too disruptive to other trades then cable pulls must be done through night work. Night work needs to be agreed in advance with CM &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain a tidy workplace. Ensure that cleaning takes place regularly or as work is carried out and place of work and access routes are kept clear. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all your personnel have the relevant training for the allocated tasks. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The operation of a protective or control device is to be done by Intel or a Kirby AP, no other person is authorised to switch on or off a protective or control device &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Encourage participation by all in SBO scheme &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure prompt close out of SBO&rsquo;s &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that all plant and machinery including power and hand tools are in a good condition, defect free and that statutory, in-house inspection and maintenance procedures are carried out as required. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that any defects in plant and equipment are rectified or remove defective items as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that you complete &lsquo;Site Supervisor Safety Audit&rsquo; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Clear any actions from audit as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conduct &ldquo;Tool Box&quot; talks and keeps attendance records in the site safety file. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Inform the employees of their safety performance on site and any improvements needed through the behavioural notice card system &ndash; Green, Yellow and Red &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Escalate incident situations through informing CM or PM as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Participate in incident investigation &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement determined incident remedial actions to prevent reoccurrence of incident as soon as possible &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that adequate fire-fighting equipment is available where necessary and there is a competent person in the crew to use &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that the area first aid box is adequately stocked, maintained and there is a member of the crew competent to use it &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that all power tools are 110 volts. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Issues permits where required, ensure that the requirements for these permits are maintained and copies of all work permits are filed in the safety file e.g. hot work permit to work etc. when competent to do so. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Demonstrate safety leadership by not &ldquo;turning a blind eye&rdquo;. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that employees do not participate in horseplay or improper conduct at the place of work. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Stand down any person from the workplace deemed to present a hazard to themselves or others and report them to CM or PM. &nbsp; Procurement: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist CM with development of Procurement schedule. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Track delivery of all relevant orders to ensure delivery dates align with procurement schedule and programme. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Requisition minor materials in line the IFC requirements and track delivery. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all IR&#39;s for minor equipment are completed correctly. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement plan to ensure all deliveries are checked and verified. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all materials are correctly Stored &ndash; nothing directly on the floor. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Comply with purchasing procedure with regard to delivery docket management. &nbsp; Communications: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Deliver briefings on key project daily or weekly items, deliver safety and quality TBT&rsquo;s. &nbsp; HR and Subcontractors: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure Biometric or facial recognition clock is in operation and all operatives are instructed on its use (including subcontractors) &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Track and detail actual personnel on site daily (directs and subcontractors) for your scope of work and submit to CM daily &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Complete Employee assessment forms for tradesmen and apprentices. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Advise CM on performance of directs and subcontractor&rsquo;s compliance with our expectations, both good and where there are development opportunities &nbsp; General: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review relevant construction pack (specifications, schedules and drawings) for your scope of work and develop a set of familiarisation notes for Construction Manager (CM) or Project Manager (PM) to review. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Take ownership for your work area and scope of work. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Escalate when necessary (after you have done what you can) any safety, quality, schedule, coordination with other trades, personnel and commercial issues to CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attend Weekly project meeting with CM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist Construction Manager is compiling Lesson&#39;s learned at the end of the project. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Site Supervisor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Senior Trades qualification or equivalent coupled with 5+ years site experience within pharmaceutical/medical device, commercial, industrial or data centre type sectors &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can interpret schematics and electrical drawings &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong understanding of site activities and how they are planned and coordinated &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Record of success as a Trade Leader &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Familiarity with materials ordering and lead times &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong client focus &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Commercial acumen &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Planner/Organised &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Influencer &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conscientious &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Decisive and action oriented &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Team player &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attentive to detail and record keeper &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Results oriented with the resilience to work under pressure &nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Site Supervisor position or other Electrical Site Supervisor / Mechanical Site Supervisor opportunities based in Ireland, UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: SAP MM Consultant
item.content: SAP MM Consultant &ndash; Ireland &ndash; Contract6 Months ContractHayward Hawk are currently recruiting for a SAP MM Consultant for their client in Ireland for a 6 month contract initially.Key Skills:1. Should have at least 8 to 10 Years of relevant experience in SAP MM/WM module2. Should have good knowledge of SAP MM/WM processes and other integrated module processes3. Should have at least 1 end to end implementation experience4. Should have experience in design, configuration and testing of core MM modules process as in below * SAP MM Master Data, SAP MM Purchasing (Various types of procurements, i.e. subcontracting, consignment, drop shipment, plant abroad etc.) * SAP MM Inventory Management, Account determination process, Invoice Verification * SAP MM Consumption Based Planning * SAP MM Materials Requirement Planning * SAP MM (IDoc) Electronic Data Interchang * SAP LSMW knowledge * SAP MM Integration experience with SD, IM, WM, PP, FICO and QM Module * SAP WM Master Data * Configuration of organization elements and required assignments * Configuration of different type of storage types, storage sections, storage bins and others * Material master data setup * SAP WM Storage unit management with relevant configuration * SAP WM different type of put away and removal process * SAP WM movement type configuration and relevant assignments * SAP WM mobile data entry (RFC process) and relevant master data setup * SAP WM Barcode processIf you meet the requirements please follow the link to apply for consideration to Katie Doyle

item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: T&D Commissioning Engineer
item.content: T&amp;D Commissioning Engineer | Ireland (HV Electrical biased)Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose The Commissioner Engineer role will involve acting as the lead commissioning engineer undertaking commissioning activities / duties on a wide range of equipment to a high level of competency, paying due regard to safety across a multitude of construction sites. &nbsp; Commissioning Engineer Responsibilities Undertake testing and final commissioning on a wide range of plant and equipment at various voltage levels including primary and secondary testing of CT&rsquo;s, VT&rsquo;s, Power Transformer&rsquo;s, Disconnects/Earthing Switches, CB&rsquo;s, Fault investigation, diagnostic activities and rectification of faults. Final testing of Protection Relay&rsquo;s to include Overcurrent, Earth Fault, Transformer Differential, Line Differential, Busbar Differential, Impedance Protection, EGIP from various Relay manufacturers utilising Omicron Power System Simulator. Provide technical support and direction, within your competence, to Kirby T&amp;D Project Team members, including the application of technical standards Undertake commissioning activities to customer specification on the range of plant and equipment within their competence including completion of appropriate test documentation and preparing a commissioning test report During Commissioning, provide design engineers with support and feedback on their designs to ensure errors and omissions are caught and do not reappear on future projects Prepare and hand over all relevant documentation in the form of a safety file at the end of each project &nbsp; Managing the projectsTo liaise with the project manager &amp; prepare the project close out report. &nbsp; &nbsp; Safety, Health, Environmental &amp; QualityEnsure that the Health &amp; Safety, Environmental &amp; Quality procedures are followed &amp; adequate records maintained Work with the project team to develop the project specific quality plan Attend company authorisation / induction courses as required by Kirby T&amp;D Ensure that personally held test equipment is maintained in good working order and within calibration and to apply for re-calibration within appropriate time scales Maintain due regard to safety for all commissioning related site activities whilst recognising and applying company specific safety rules Comply with any Client required SHEQ procedures and processes &nbsp; Managing the Client and other external relationshipsDevelop a strong &amp; maintain an excellent working relationship from the start to the completion of the project To act as an ambassador with any stakeholders involved with the project Deliver what has been promised to the client on the time safely &amp; to the highest quality &nbsp; Testing &amp; CommissioningDevelop a project specific commissioning plan, amending as required following input from the Client and / or System Operator Attend Commissioning Meetings as required Hold all the relevant authorisations appropriate to the testing activities to be undertaken Take the role of Lead Commissioning Engineer on designated projects, coordinating and managing commissioning activities, whilst acting as a focal point for the customer Prepare and collate commissioning documentation to be incorporated in to final project folders Fulfil Commissioning duties within competency e.g. production of commissioning programmes, commissioning method statements, inspection schedules etc. within specified time scales To undertake testing and final commissioning on a wide range of plant and equipment at various voltage levels including fault investigation, diagnostic activities and rectification of faults within your competence To undertake commissioning activities to customer specification on the range of plant and equipment within your competence including completion of appropriate test documentation &nbsp; Day-to-Day ControlProvide technical support and direction, within your competence, to Kirby T&amp;D Project Team members, including the application of technical standards To liaise and work with Design Engineers to resolve design related queries To undertake other activities which the Company may reasonably require to be undertaken on a temporary basis which are within an individual&rsquo;s area of competence To report progress and/or problems to the Site Manager or Project Manager/Engineer responsible for project delivery Provide reports to the project designer on design errors, omissions or short-comings so they can be addressed in future designs and to minimise the likelihood of reoccurrence &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Commissioning Engineer3rd level qualification in Electrical Engineering / Building Services Engineering Ideally the Commissioning Engineer will possess 5+ years relevant experience in a similar role. Detailed knowledge of HV Engineering, HV Equipment &amp; HV systems Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills/communicates with impact Excellent record keeper and administration skills Drives for results Leads and influences others. Innovates and leads in Testing, Commissioning /Technical activity and challenges. Plans and effectively manages projects. Solves problems analytically and acts decisively Mentor and Coach to junior engineers and graduates &nbsp; For more information on this T&amp;D Commissioning Engineer/ Electrical Commissioning Engineer position or other similar opportunities based in Ireland, the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Business Excellence Specialist
item.content: Orion Group Life Sciences have an exciting opportunity for a Business Excellence Specialist for our Multinational biopharmaceutical client based in the Cork area on an initial 12-month contract. JOB PURPOSE:Business Excellence Specialist The purpose of this role is to ensure the implementation of the Production System that will deliver Best in Class performance through a highly engaged workforce. Play a leading role in fostering a culture of continuous improvement and achieving sustainable high standards of manufacturing performance.MAIN DUTIES &amp; RESPONSIBILITIESLeading the embedding &amp; sustaining of the &#39;Managing Site Performance&#39; business process standard on site.Owning and leading the site Root Cause Problem Solving system (RCPS),and embedding &amp; improving its use within the site.Develop and Deploy plant-wide lean training modules.Develop and drive the yellow/green and black belt program on site.Drive the Lean philosophy throughout the site by supporting, mentoring and coaching employees in increasing their understanding and knowledge of Lean principles and techniquesDevelop and foster a continuous improvement cultureMaximise the involvement of employees in process improvementsEnsure all production system changes are conducted to the highest of standards in a safe, compliant, and effective mannerProvide support to various functions as required to meet the business targets and objectives; ensuring the plants processes operate at optimum KEY COMPETENCIES REQUIREDProven ability in Systems Thinking, Plan-Do-Check-Act, and Problem SolvingSuperior change management skills including the understanding of both individual change and organizational change.Excellent listening and analytical skills, facilitation skills, organized, and able to lead people and help them through the challenges of change within a complex environment.Outstanding presence and communication skills, able to inspire trust and quickly build credibility. Must have strong collaboration and influence skillsExcellent intellect, strategic and tactical thinking ability, complemented by a &quot;hands-on&quot; operational and business planning orientation.Patient under pressure but resolute in getting things done quickly and effectivelyAccountability, with a strong desire to commit, be held accountable and be rewarded for delivering results. Recognizes and builds support for change.Articulates a complex change in a way that is easily understood by others.Moral and personal integrity and the values that inspire trust in the organization.Energy, passion, enthusiasm, commitment, and courage.Strong relationship development, conflict resolution, and team building instincts. Makes the customer central to all thinking.
