item.title: Biologics Technician
item.content: Team Horizon is seeking a Biologics Technician to join our client&rsquo;s expanding team on a permanent basis.Our client are expanding their facility into a Multi-Million Euro state of the art biologics plant that will bring ground-breaking scientific research to real life solutions for our patients.Why you should apply: * Join a company that has developed a stand-out culture of innovation, inclusion and development, and consistently features as a great place to work. * Generous package with good base salary and benefits to including but not limited to health insurance, pension and bonus. * Join an organisation who uses Innovative new technologies, who embrace diversity, equality and inclusion and puts patients first. * Based in the West of Ireland the cost of living is low, meaning more disposable income. * Upgrade your work-life balance, the quality of life is amazing, less traffic more time for activities!What you will be doing: * Diagnose and resolve events or exceptions of production equipment and processes * Efficiently operate all biologics processes minimizing material loss * Assemble and inspect equipment in the manufacturing area to confirm its operational status. * Perform process tests and participate in qualification and validation activities as required * Operate Fill Line, Autoclave, Equipment Washer, Headspace Analysers, Bioreactors, Chromatography Columns, Filtration Systems, Equipment Cleaning and Sterilization, Equipment Pressure Tests, Equipment/Filters Integrity Tests, Water Baths, Isolators and Lyophiliser as required. * Disposal of domestic, biomedical, and hazardous waste from their respective area as applicable, ensuring compliance with regulations following the procedures and policies of the plant, division, and the corporation. * Keep detailed records, manual or electronic, of the operations carried out during the work shift. * Participant in the development of batch records and electronic batch records for the site. * Comply with the EHS policy and procedures and demonstrate EHS best practices in all work activities.What you need to apply: * Minimum Leaving Certificate with 3rd level Degree preferred. * Batch processing operations experience in an FDA/ HPRA regulated industry essential. * Possessing aseptic techniques and sterile fill-finish experience required. * Good knowledge of cGMP and regulatory requirements relating to the biologics/pharmaceutical industry. * Experience of operating in a highly automated environment and safe handling of dangerous chemicals. * Basic laboratory techniques knowledge

item.title: R&D Formulation Scientist
item.content: Team Horizon is seeking applications for a R&amp;D Formulation Scientist to join one of our leading client&rsquo;s R&amp;D team in Waterford. Act as a SME for the development innovative drug product formulations that meet patient needs.Why you should apply: * Join our client&rsquo;s brand new, purpose built, state of the art, R&amp;D Centre which includes a sterile fill finish suite. * Attractive salary, benefits and great career progression opportunities are on offer for the successful candidate. * Based in the South East of Ireland the cost of living is low, meaning more disposable income. * Upgrade your work-life balance, the quality of life is amazing, less traffic more time for activities!What you will be doing: * Assist the Analytical &amp; Formulation Development Manager (&amp; Head of R&amp;I) in achieving company goals with specific focus on responsibilities related to the R&amp;D Formulation Science function. * Work closely &amp; collaboratively with other members of the Formulation Science, and function along with the Analytical &amp; Process Development functions along with other members of the R&amp;D and Commercial value streams to achieve goals. * Work with the Analytical &amp; Formulation Development Manager, Innovation team and Scientific Affairs (both PMO and Regulatory/Clinical) to foster innovative thinking within the R&amp;D function &amp; to champion the development of innovative medicines in a timely fashion according to stakeholder expectations. * Execute and/or oversee the design &amp; development of formulations that are built on sound scientific, regulatory, QbD, process validation, and lean product development principles. * Assist in the improvement of existing drug product formulations within the organization by retrospective application of sound scientific, regulatory, QbD, process validation, and lean product development principles. * Champion the use of QbD and scientific thinking in the development innovative drug product formulations while maintaining a comprehensive knowledge of formulations development disciplines through research and scientific literature. * Act as SME for the interpretation of in-vitro data to predict in-vivo performance &amp; how this relates to further formulation development. * Identifying, assessing, recommending and implementing internal and external opportunities to broaden the company&rsquo;s technical/scientific capability. * Work to create an excellence/SME culture within the formulation science function that is focused on innovation, lean &amp; robust formulation development, &amp; continuous improvement. * Identification, organization and implementation of effective training programs within the Formulation Science group including this role. * Where required, represent the development group in all relevant meetings, for example pipeline steering committee meetings and R&amp;D value stream. * To ensure that all work carried out is in compliance with the required standards conforming to company, cGxP, SOPs, regulatory regulations and guidelines, safety and environmental guidelines. * Ensure contemporaneous collection of relevant data for R&amp;D Tax Credit claim purposes. * Ensure requirements of the company&rsquo;s Safety Statement are implemented. * Continuously promote a positive safety culture by leading by example &amp; drive a high EHS, 5S &amp; housekeeping standard in areas under the roles control. * Implement safety requirements as per site documentation including SOP&rsquo;s, Safety Statement and COP&rsquo;s.What you need to apply: * BSc in a chemical science related discipline such as Material Science, Industrial Chemistry, Formulation Science or related discipline, post graduate qualification highly desirable. * At least 5 years&rsquo; proven experience in a formulation development environment which significant experience in studies that include drug &amp; material characterisation and selection. * SME level knowledge of QbD and pharmaceutical development processes. * Demonstrated capabilities in project management &amp; technical leadership of complex product/process developments, at least two years is highly desirable. * Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated and focus others with respect to implementing identified improvement initiatives. * Demonstrated ability to work as part of diverse teams in an all-encompassing manner. * Have demonstrated effective research skills, including the critical review of the scientific literature. * Excellent written, oral, presentation &amp; interpersonal skills are essential. * Critical thinking, decision making and solution focused problem solving. * Planning, organising, time and project management skills

item.title: Senior Software Engineer JAVA - Kafka
item.content: About the OpportunityAs the successful candidate, you will join a well-established R&amp;D team based in Galway as they expand their team. Your ultimate goal will be to advance not only the functionality of their platform but also to solve the operational challenges around keeping the solutions reliable as they evolve in the cloud. The R&amp;D team in Galway is fairly unique in that the complete product, from conception to delivery, is managed and run from this site so you will have ample opportunity to work on challenging problems and see them through to completion.About YouIdeally, you&rsquo;ve built exciting PaaS and/or SaaS products in your previous roles and you are a DevOps enthusiast. You enjoy solving complex software engineering problems, writing clean efficient code and you are most comfortable working in JavaLet&#39;s Talk Tech; * The team adhere to agile principles * Micro-services architecture and reactive architecture principles. * Java is the language, in real-time distributed computing environments. * Docker and container management systems like Kubernetes in production. * Applications deployed to heterogeneous environments: cloud, on-prem (private cloud), and end-user (developer, car).KEYWORDS (would like to see some of these on your CV and you&#39;ll be taught the rest) * Kubernetes * Docker * Kafka (bonus points if you have experience here) * SpringBoot * Asynchronous HttpClient libraries * Websockets * Postgres * Java * Comfortable with Linux * Helm * Jenkins, Bitbucket/Git * SonarYou will join an organisation where you can grow and learn and they provide an excellent salary and benefits package to reflect your skills and contribution. They have an efficient and fast recruitment process that will also allow you to understand if this role is that you are looking for. If you are successful there is an excellent process for on-boarding that is delivered fully remotely in the current environment

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Manager
item.content: Senior Quality Assurance ManagerCompanyThe client is a multi-national medical device manufacturer whose mission is to improve the quality of life through the design, development, and manufacture of high quality, affordable medical products, for the benefit of patients and health professionals and with respect to their employees.Role summaryThe Senior Quality Assurance Manager will be responsible for assessing, improving, and maintaining the company&rsquo;s Quality System, policies, and procedures to ensure all processes, components, subassemblies, and finished products are manufactured in compliance with applicable FDA and ISO requirements.Responsibilities * Implement the ISO13485 in the company with cooperation from the headquarter from Hong Kong. * Manage and maintenance of company&rsquo;s Quality System in full compliance with ISO 13485 and FDA QSR. * Plan, recruit, develop, and manage the talents for the Quality team and the Quality Inspection Team in the company. * Lead Quality Assurance activities, including but not limited to internal and external audits, complaint handling, supplier management evaluation, NCMRs, CAPAs, management reviews, product release, and document control activities. * Develop and Manage the complaint handling process between the company and the Head-quarter in Hong Kong. * Develop and Manage the Non-conforming Materials Review (NCMR)/ Deviations program in collaboration with Operations to ensure timely reporting, analysis, and resolution of non-conforming material/ product incidences. * Conduct supplier evaluation and audit. * Develop, review, and approve validation and calibration master plan. * Interface and support audit by external regulatory bodies and follow-up activities to ensure the credentials. * Other duties/ activities may be necessary to support departmental or company goalsRequirements * 7-10 years of quality assurance/engineering experience in the Medical Device industry Minimum five years of managerial experience required. * BS in Life Sciences, Engineering or equivalent * Ability to motivate and influence people * Organizing, planning, and problem-solving skills * Good interpersonal and communication skills * Ability to work as a part of a team * Good statistical and numerical ability * Knowledge of FDA and ISO regulatory requirements and guidelines related to medical devices * Great attention to details.Attractive remuneration will be offered in line with experience and would be firmed up during the interview process. If interested to explore please apply enclosing your CV in Word format and Cover Letter

item.title: Pipette Technician - full training given
item.content: Are you bored of working in Retail or Warehousing?Are you looking to learn a brand new skill set within a world renound organisation?Do you want to work 37.5 hours per week with no evenings and weekend?Then look no further... we have the job for you!METTLER TOLEDO is a leading global supplier of precision instruments and services. We are recognized as an innovation leader and our solutions are critical in key R&amp;D, quality control, and manufacturing processes for customers in a wide range of industries including life sciences, food, and chemicals. We operate throughout the world with a culture shaped by innovation and international flair.Our Pipette Service Centre Technicians provide a prompt, efficient &amp; effective maintenance &amp; calibration to satisfy customer requirements and to enhance Mettler Toledo service profitability. In this role you will repair and maintain our best in class equipment. More specifically you will succeed in the position by: * Routine service and/or calibration of customer instruments to ensure maximum uptime and full compliance for customers. * Completion of Training to develop and refine your skills to provide a better customer experience * Adherence to all Mettler Toledo Quality and Health and Safety procedures to ensure safe, consistent work in line with SOP&#39;s. * Be a Trusted Advisor for the customer in the use and maintenance of their equipment to build the customer relationship. * To successfully complete an annual calibration competency test for a range of pipettes to ensure ongoing competence and compliance.In return, our benefits inclde: * Family friendly benefits * Sports and Social club * Health cover * Generous Contributory pension * 25 days holiday which increases with length of service

item.title: Hiring Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Health And Safety Officer
item.content: Are you a Health &amp; Safety Officer with 3 years experience looking to join a company where safety is paramount in all projects they engage in? When you work with this company you will find that you&rsquo;re part of a team that is passionate and enthusiastic. This isn&rsquo;t just something they just say in an interview, this is their culture. It&rsquo;s not always glamorous but it&rsquo;s real and it gives you the chance to create something concrete and tangible that will last the test of time.Responsibilities include: * You will carry out site safety inspections and conduct accident and dangerous occurrence investigations, within your designated area of responsibility * You will carry out Risk Assessments &amp; complete Method Statements as required. * You will liaise with Site Managers to ensure Health and Safety documentation is up to date on site * You&#39;ll drive a safety culture by being a champion of best practice; conducting training for new and existing employees on the importance of health and safety on the job; and by suggesting improvements to existing methods of work * Manage training &amp; compliance files for all colleagues &amp; sub-contractors on site * Ensure that staff have all the relevant manuals and training certifications * Review sub-contractors&#39; Safety Statements and Safety Compliance. * Lead &amp; promote a continuous improvement culture in relation to all health, safety and environmental work practices on the site. * Identify areas of risk and develop risk assessments/measures to reduce and control. * Conduct weekly audits, safety inspections and tool box talks * Ensure H&amp;S management systems are implemented and maintained across the site. * Managing the administration for the Health &amp; Safety induction &amp; training plans for all site personnel. * Regularly review and assisting the update Company Risk Assessments, Safe Operating Procedures and Safety Statement. * Investigate/report accidents and incidents on-site ensuring relevant accident information for insurance purposesRequirements: * Degree/Higher Diploma / HETAC qualification (or relevant trade experience) * 3+ years&rsquo; a Health &amp; Safety officer experience on construction projects * Knowledge of latest building regulation and certification standards * A strong sense of ownership and responsibility for tasks/projects * Accuracy, attention to detail and a methodical nature are key * The ability to lead, use initiative and be self-motivated

item.title: Infrastructure Lead
item.content: Join our Client a World Class biologics services provider at their state of the art Greenfield Biopharmaceuticals CMO site in Dundalk, Co. Louth.The Lead Automation Infrastructure Engineer will be responsible for the AIS Systems Infrastructure and will support the installation, configuration, maintenance and backup/recovery of the IT Systems and Infrastructure associated with Process Automation (DeltaV), VPE (Siemens) and Lab Systems.The ideal candidate will have strong LAN, HyperV, Windows Server, VMware, Citrix, AD, Domain Controls, IAM and Security experience.Essential Duties and Responsibilities&bull; Support critical-to-manufacturing and Laboratory systems and ensure their high availability reducing or eliminating unplaned downtime&bull; Provide subject matter expertise in the design and implementation of new or upgraded technologies within the manufacturing and Laboratory environments&bull; Work closly with corperate AIS and IT infrastructure teams to ensure continued technical alignment&bull; Responsibility for defining and implementing the maintenance of all manufacturing and laboratory system assets. Ensure appropiate monitoring, alerting and response to network and system issues affecting functionality and availability.&bull; Maintain relationships with critical suppliers, manageing esculations and resolution of technical issues&bull; Work closly with corperate security to manage cybersecurity for manufacturing and laboratory systems. Evualuate corperate standards and manufacturing/laboratory specific technologies for suitability.&bull; Manage scheduling, implementation and reporting of preventitive maintenance, OS and Application patching and upgrades on manufacturing systems network.Requirements&bull; Bachelors in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, Biotech Engineering or related computer science engineering with 5+ years experience in operations/manufacturing environment&bull; At least 4 yeards experience installing and configuring Server / Network infrastructure for Virtualsied Systems solutions in the biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry is required.&bull; In depth experience with regard to the physical installation of Server and Network Infrastructure&bull; Experience with Dell Multi-host blade systems&bull; Strong knowledge of virtualisation (VMWare and hyper &ndash; V) in an operational environment.&bull; Indepth experience with DeltaV Administration&bull; Experience with Backup and Recovery solutions for large virtualised server infrastructure.&bull; Understanding of Microsoft Licensing and Vendor package licensing&bull; Experience deploying and managing Server and Network monitoring tools.&bull; Understanding of key LAN principles in a manufacturing environment&bull; Experience with SQL Server and OSI Pi is a plus.&bull; Strong network architecture or engineering proficiencies including TCP/IP, Routing, Switching, Network IDS/IPS, Active Directory, Domain Integration and Firewalls&bull; Experience with Microsoft Windows Server 2012, 2016 and 2019&bull; Experience with Thin Client Software solutions&bull; Experience in the preparation of method statements, safe plans of action and work permits&bull; Understanding of documentation, such as Hardware Design, Network Design, FAT and SAT documentation&bull; Knowledge of cGMP particularly as it applies to biologics manufacturing and automated systems&bull; Strong technical and organizational communication, coordination, and meeting facilitation skills.&bull; Ability to apply analytical skills to evaluate and interpret complex problems using multiple sources of information.&bull; Independent, self-motivated, organized, able to multi-task in project environments and skilled in communication and collaboration

item.title: Microbiology Lab Lead
item.content: Team Horizon currently has an exciting opening for a Microbiology Lab Lead to join our client&rsquo;s brand new state of the art biologics fill-finish facility in Sligo.As the company&rsquo;s new Micro Lab Lead, you will help deliver an effective testing service for manufactured products while adhering to plant specification and schedule. Leading a talented micro team, you will take ownership of the micro lab operations and provide technical leadership to functional areas and key stakeholder.Why you should apply: * Join a company that has developed a stand-out culture of innovation, inclusion and development, and consistently features as a great place to work. * Generous package with good base salary and benefits to including but not limited to health insurance, pension and bonus. * Join an organisation who uses Innovative new technologies, who embrace diversity, equality and inclusion and puts patients first. * Based in the West of Ireland the cost of living is low, meaning more disposable income. * Upgrade your work-life balance, the quality of life is amazing, less traffic more time for activities!What you will be doing: * Ensuring laboratory documentation and computerized systems compliance with data integrity policies and regulatory requirements * Developing expertise on regulations and business processes required to maintain micro laboratory data integrity * Maintaining, approving, and reviewing all documentation relevant to the Micro Laboratory as required &ndash; advising on specification changes where necessary * Assuring all test equipment used to disposition material is maintained and calibrated correctly * Delivering sampling, inspection, and testing requirements of the lab team per the agreed schedule * Working closely with Warehouse/Planning/Manufacturing and Production Teams to achieve sampling and testing schedules/priorities. * Actively participating with internal and external audits and follow up on audit findings. * Assisting in the resolution of specific manufacturing quality problems as required. * Delivering the timely execution and completion of all phases of raw materials, in-process testing and finished products. * Working cross-functionally in the transfer of test methods for new products. * Carrying out specific tasks and projects as delegated by site management including the supervision of any personnel assigned to assist in the completion of the task. * Updating management of system failures to ensure corrective/preventive action can be taken where required. * Proving leadership for the micro team including talent management, identifying, and delivering training/support, acting as the technical lead. * Leading adherence to and supports all EHS &amp; E standards, procedures and policies for the micro lab team.What you need to apply: * Degree qualification in Biology/Microbiology (Masters/qualification preferable) * Minimum 3 years&rsquo; in a similar role within the biopharmaceutical industry * Good knowledge of QA/QC operations with detailed knowledge of specifications, test methods, lab testing equipment * Proven ability to supervise or lead a team * Experience in supporting regulatory inspections HPRA, FDA etc. * Knowledge and experience of cleaning validation desirable

item.title: R&D Scientist Chef, UK and Ireland
item.content: This is different. It&#39;s exciting and it&#39;s an opportunity any successful Development Chef or creative culinary genius needs to consider. Come on 2021!!!You are to be the owner of the culinary concept for RD&amp;A plant-based team for this business. The go-to Developer and it&#39;s not like anything we&#39;ve recruited for previously.For a start - you might have to relocate twice! If that has already got you sweating, move on. Sorry, but this role is for someone so keen, excited, and (dare I say it) passionate, about plant-based food, that you&#39;re willing to move counties and then countries to see it through.So, here&#39;s the deal; you&#39;ll be working between two sites initially&hellip; starting in the East Midlands where you will work closely with the plant-based experts within NPD, you&#39;ll be setting up home in Ireland! It sounds a little crazy and will be a whirlwind in the first year, but it&#39;ll be exciting for sure. The induction period at the first site will provide insights and training that&#39;ll be critical in you delivering your role in Ireland, 6-12 months later.A commercial mindset is needed here, as is the ability to research and develop food that goes beyond standard conventions. We&#39;re looking to you as the &#39;mad scientist&#39; when it comes to flavour and nutrition. Mad in the most professional terms of course though. We see this role as being critical to the future growth plans and strategic plans this business has for plant-based products.Here&#39;s what you need to love and live this role to the full&hellip;Problem-solving at a high level. Handling multiple data sources as you consider development strategies for new culinary conceptsComfortable working independently and cross-functionally with Chefs, Scientists, and TechnologistsCapable of creating and delivering insightful presentations, preparing culinary samples to deadlinesBeing on-top of new tech and food trends that introduce novel concepts and/or new opportunities, whilst being commercially viableUltimately being the &#39;go-to&#39; specialist for all things plant-based; research, future trends, and innovations unlocking the plant-based opportunitiesRecipe development that unlocks plant-based opportunitiesThe ability to combine strategic and creative thinking as you support concepts over a broad spectrum for long-term innovation pipelines.You&#39;re a strategic thinker, creative, and technologically savvy Chef- this position will really be a journey, but not suitable for journeymen. This will need patience, persistence, tenacity, and a will to win every single day. You might have ticked the boxes above but do consider the long-term nature of this role and the personal investment in time and energy you will make for it.Culinary expertise is non-negotiable here. You need to come from a high-end background and ideally have worked successfully over a sustained period within molecular gastronomy. New Product Development experience within a food manufacturer is hugely beneficial, but if you have genuine potential to unlock because of your molecular gastronomy experience that will be considered too.An inquisitive mind, never standing still is a must-have here. You&#39;ll really relish research and take pride in investigating new recipes and how food ingredients interact with plant-based formulation processes. &#39;Self-starter&#39; doesn&#39;t really do it justice. Your constant desire to create, explore and analyse ideas and recipes will serve you well in this position.You might not be a scientist per-se, but you will be working with Technologists and scientists within this company, so interest is key here. An ability to learn and an aptitude to understand this long-term will be a big factor in your success.It&#39;s not for the faint-hearted, and it&#39;s not for someone unsure where they want their career to go. But, if you are definite about the plant-based category and you know that you can make a genuinely positive and impactful contribution, then we want to hear from you.Ref FTL(phone number removed)Tel: +44 (0)(phone number removed)Follow Focus Management on Twitter @foodjob, Instagram @focus_recruitment &amp; Linkedin @Focus Management Consultants

item.title: Artwork Project Leader
item.content: Nicholas Howard are delighted to be recruiting for a new and exciting role as an Artwork Project Leader.Based in Dublin, the primary functions of the role are as follows: - * Create and own to closure Artwork Implementation Change Controls in Trackwise to ensure on timely implementation of artwork change. * Manage Action Items on Artwork Implementation Change Controls in Trackwise to ensure Change Controls progress on time. * Develop and publish artwork per the process for artwork development for printed packaging components. * Support the creation, maintenance and process of artwork development for printed packaging components through external suppliers for all markets. * Work with cross-functional project teams and the manufacturing vendor on development for new products and changes to existing printed packaging components. * Ensure appropriate approvals are obtained from other functions where applicable, assure communication is made with third party manufacturer/packager and all necessary proofreading are completed at all stages as per current procedure. * Responsible and accountable for process execution and adherence to required completion date. * Expedite and monitor actions required by other functions until completion. * Ensure all action items are properly closed out in electronic artwork management system. * Manage the creation and approval of Profiles from Technical Drawings in conjunction with Global Packaging Technology. * Ensure Artwork Operations is appropriately represented on cross-functional project teams for New Product Introduction with responsibility for product packaging design and artwork.Responsibilities: * Process Management / 70% * Work directly with internal design studio, external graphic houses and print vendors to coordinate artwork development &amp; publishing of new/ revised artwork as well as technical/ profile drawings and guides. * Maintain all relevant artwork projects within the electronic artwork management system, ensuring tasks are setup, progressed and completed on time. Carry out artwork approvals, proofreading and printer&rsquo;s proofs verification checks on the digital comparator. * Review and manage Artwork action items in the Change Control to ensure these are properly set up and closed out in line with set timelines. * Problem-Solving / 10% * Participate in escalation process and problem solving for issues endanger supply continuity or fulfillment of business critical goals. * Consultation / 10% * Represent Artwork Management in material/artwork projects, provide expert statements and provide training/technical consultation if required. * Relations / 10% * Establishes and maintains relationships with customers, stakeholders, partners, third parties/ vendors. * Support and mentor Artwork Technologists as required, and also represent and cover for the Artwork Manager as and when required.Education &amp; Experience:Essential: * Education in natural sciences, biotechnology or engineering: minimum bachelor degree preferred. * Experience in Artwork Management and computerized documentation control system.Desired: * Practical experience in Artwork Management, material and/or label change in GMP environment. * Knowledge of Packaging &amp; Artwork. * Knowledge of Pharma labelling regulations.To be considered for this position please apply below

item.title: RPA Consultant Lead
item.content: Our Client unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We&rsquo;re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.Automation Technical Lead will lead the technical design of systems and software to create and maintain automation solutions with a focus on the technology and quality control of the robots. The solutions will include maintaining robotic process automations (RPA) and supporting the Control Room and technical environments. This includes defining, designing, developing, implementing, and supporting all technical infrastructure for automation solutions including but not limited to robotic process automation tools.The purpose of this position within the GBS Automation COE is to develop and deliver robotic automation for the finance global business solutions teams. The GBS Automation COE is responsible for providing automation solutions through the use of robotics process automation and other automation solutions.Responsibilities / Duties * Responsible for ensuring that the design, development, testing, and implementation of RPA bot&rsquo;s meets all requirements prior to go live * Partner with Automation analyze team to review automation opportunities by analyzing processes and assessing feasibility for automation * Create solution design document as part of automation development process * Create and document test procedures and scenarios prior to launching User Acceptance Testing (UAT) * Develop process automation using automation software in accordance with automation team standards and best practices. * Conduct sprint validations with automation team and business during the development of the project * Support business teams in testing activities, including integration testing, end-to-end (business process) testing and UAT * Ensure appropriate integrations between all RPA bots and required system applications * Develop system requirements, design, prototype, and test custom technology solutions, and support system implementation * Provide on-going operational support including upgrades, defect fixes and any Process change activities * Assists developers in the development process, including constructing and maintaining efficient, reusable and reliable code with robotic process automation software and tools * Assists developers with testing activities, including integration testing, end-to-end (business process) testing and user acceptance testing * Assists developers with problem identification/error resolution process, including tracking, repairing and reporting defects * Fine tune performance and operation issues that arise with RPA Bots * Creates, edits, revises and finalizes life cycle deliverables such as requirements specifications, solution design documents, and operating instructions (i.e. SOP) * Creates and maintains process, technical, project or other documentation, as may be required, to support development, project management and training * Performs code review of service provider automations and provides constructive feedback to ensure quality of codeExperience Required * Bachelor Degree in Business or Management Information Systems or Computer Science * At least 3-5 years of experience using robotics process automation software, preferably AA. * 5 &ndash;7 years of programmer experience with supply chain/finance/administrative business processes, systems and applications of varying scope and complexity * 3+ Years of hands-on development experience in RPA, developing macros, automation tools, and advanced excel * Experience with systems development life cycle and structured programming methods (both traditional and agile), including requirements definition, solution design, program development, testing, documentation, training, deployment, operations, support and maintenance * Track record of working on projects to success within established timelines and budgets * Exposure to performance measurement, continuous improvement (Lean / Six-Sigma) * Experience in programming (Python, R, Java, Powershell, VB / VBA and PL/SQL)Additional preferences * Advanced Degree in Business or Management Information Systems or Computer Science * Experience with systems development life cycle and structured programming methods (both traditional and agile), including requirements definition, solution design, program development, testing, documentation, training, deployment, operations, support and maintenance * Experience working with third-party service providers is a plus * Good to have skills on Chatbot, OCR and other emerging technologies

item.content: FJA are working with a large water utilities company who are recruiting for experienced Leakage Technicians who will be responsible for day to day leak detection activities based in County Cork, ROILeakage Technicians must be proficient in the use of leakage detection equipment, including a correlator, pipe tracer, ground microphone and listening stick. Experience within Step Testing, Trunk Mains, Validation and Seepage would be desirable but not essentialExcellent rates of pay:Main responsibilities will be the following: * Undertake survey work/project work not normally associated with day-to-day leak detection * Assist repair gangs by providing leak detection services * Undertake survey work/project work not normally associated with day-to-day leak detection * To undertake a detailed survey to identify the type and location of water leakage on large diameter pipes * Carry out adequate and accurate completion of all paperwork (including time sheets, survey forms, leak details) and other duties as required * Performing a Step Test is one of the most effective ways of identifying high leakage within a water distribution network. It requires the establishment of zones of DMAs where water can be supplied though a single meter. * It is usually carried out at night since this is the time when consumption is lowest and most stable - it also means less disruption to consumers.Possession of the following current certification would be advantageous but not essential: * EUSR Water Hygiene Training * Unit 2 Street WorksYou are required to drive for the role and must hold a full and valid driving licence.If you are looking for a fantastic career opportunity and want to work for a forward thinking Company then apply now with your current updated CV.Due to the high volume of applications we receive we are not always able to reply to all applications. item.title: Polish Clinical Trial Associate
item.content: Job DescriptionOur client make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 500 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.The Trial Capabilities Team provides clinical trial capabilities in support of clinical development. The Associate is accountable to ensure the investigator sites meet requirements to enrol study participants into clinical trials and support ongoing activities during site maintenance and closeout. The Associate is responsible for obtaining clinical trial authorizations and ethical approvals, execution of the budget and contract, and activities related to clinical finance, records management and site training.The Associate will ensure inspection readiness through a complete, accurate and readily available Trial Master File. Additional local responsibilities may be required as needed/appropriate for the local geography and/or to cover regional differences.Key Objectives / Deliverables:Clinical Trial Capabilities Responsibilities&middot; Initiate investigator site activities, including collection and submission of regulatory documents, customization and negotiation of informed consent documents, serve as the point of contact for a site&rsquo;s ERB and Competent Authority (CA)(where applicable), communicate and negotiate budgets with site personnel and internal teams, negotiate and obtain fully-executed contract, track and ensure site compliance to required training, and effectively drive timelines aligned with company priorities&middot; Communicate directly with sites to enable start-up and maintain an active collaboration with sites during maintenance and close-out&middot; Identify, communicate, and resolve issues&middot; Ensure country specific regulatory and data privacy requirements are incorporated into submission documents and any other documents/systems&middot; Leverage previous site / review board engagements to efficiently drive new work&middot; Populate internal systems to ensure accuracy of trial / site performance&middot; Understand and comply with procurements, legal and financial requirements and procedures&middot; Populate Trial Master Files and libraries for future reference&middot; Provide feedback and shared learning for continuous improvement&middot; Leverage trial prioritization&middot; Anticipate and monitor dynamically changing prioritiesQualification Requirements:&middot; Bachelor&rsquo;s degree preferably in a scientific or health related field, three years clinical research experience or relevant experience preferred&middot; Understanding of the overall clinical development paradigm and the importance of efficient site initiation&middot; Applied knowledge of project management processes and skills&middot; Appreciation of / experience in compliance-driven environment&middot; Ability to learn and comply with financial and legal guidelines and policies (budget and contract)&middot; Effective communication, negotiation, and problem solving skills&middot; Self-management and organizational skills&middot; Language capabilities in the followings, English and Polish

This role is based in Galway and is commutable from Westmeath, Tipperary and Clare. This is an opportunity to be part of a dynamic team within the Vet Regulatory Affairs function. We are looking for individuals who will support and drive the company&rsquo;s vision to be the most valued global provider of high quality, competitively priced pharmaceutical products and to provide excellent services and support to our customers.Summary * To act as the qualified person for pharmacovigilance (QPPV) for veterinary products. * Maintaining pharmacovigilance system &amp; conducting continuous overall pharmacovigilance evaluation during the post authorisation period of products * Managing of the provision to the NCAs or the Agency of any other information relevant to the evaluation of the benefits and risks of a VMP * Managing the Logging, investigating and reporting of Pharmacovigilance complaints received and Preparation of Periodic Safety Update Reports for submission to Regulatory authorities in relation to national, MRP, DCP and centrally approved Marketing Authorisations * Managing the submission of expedited reports when necessary * Managing the maintenance of Pharmacovigilance systems (CRF&rsquo;s PSUR data base, Line Listings) * Collation &amp; Provision of Pharmacovigilance data received from sub licensees * Handling of requests for information from competent authorities, * Handling of urgent safety restrictions and Submission of safety variations * Remain informed with current pharmacovigilance requirements. * Reviewing pharmacovigilance sections in Contracts and Agreements with third parties * Identifying training needs for pharmacovigilance and implementing appropriate training plan. * Oversight of quality control and assurance procedures within the pharmacovigilance system * Oversight of SOPs within the pharmacovigilance system and pharmacovigilance audit reports * Oversight of compliance data in relation to the quality, completeness and timelines for expedited reporting and submission of PSURs within the pharmacovigilance systemCompetencies: * Organisational skills, personal efficiency, time management skills and the ability to prioritise competing demands are key communication skills. * A strong working knowledge of best practice processes, change management implementation, coaching and mentoring. * Demonstrated ability in prioritising key initiatives, driving growth and setting targets and KPIs to monitor the performance * Positive and proactive person who is energised by having great responsibility * Practical, action-orientated approach to managing priorities and teams. * The above is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. * Strong computer skills in MS OfficeQualifications: * Scientific qualification and background preferably B.Sc. Hons or higher * Minimum 5 years in a FDA/CVM regulatory/R&amp;D environment preferably with experience of pharmacovigilance. Knowledge of EU pharmacovigilance would be an advantage. * Experience in busy problem solving environment with the ability to work to tight deadlines and on one&rsquo;s own initiative. * Detailed technical knowledge of products and processes. * Strong Customer Service focus both internally and externally * Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously. * Communication skills with external and internal customers.For further information on this QPPV role in Galway please contact Clara Burke on (phone number removed)/ science@hero.ieCheck out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website &ndash; (url removed)

item.title: Associate Clinical Trial Project Manager
item.content: Medical Information Agent (French and Dutch)Our client make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 500 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.ResponsibilitiesThe role of a Medical Information Agent is to provide excellent and efficient Tier 1 Medical Information support to Healthcare professionals, patients and other customers &amp; to complete the relevant documentation for these queries. The customer queries are received either by telephone, email or web chat. The majority of queries for most markets are via telephone, thus primary responsibilities encompass phone coverage&middot; Manage customer queries regarding products/medical devices from healthcare professionals, patients and other customers in a courteous, professional manner with predefined answers/resources that are balanced, accurate and non-promotional. Escalations to product specialist may be required when the predefined answers do not answer queries.&middot; Log all queries received via email and assign accordingly between the Medical Information Agents and Analysts&middot; Accurate recording of all customer queries in the medical information database in a concise, thorough, and accurate manner in line with Good Documentation Practices.&middot; Identification of customer queries containing either Adverse Events/Product Quality Complaints and handle those in accordance with appropriate operating procedures.&middot; Maintain and enhance our clients product and organizational knowledge.&middot; Support global/regional Medical Information projects with a key focus on excellence &amp; knowledge, efficiency &amp; customer experience&middot; Support the overall Medical Information team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team members&middot; Ensure optimal Customer satisfactionSystems&middot; MS Office, Sales Force, Veeva&middot; Interaction Client Phone system&middot; Basic Qualifications Bachelors degree with relevant customer service experience. Business experience such as medical sales representative will also be considered.&middot; Fluency in French and Dutch&middot; Excellent active listening skills with effective verbal skills to respond to customers with a rational and empathetic manner&middot; Good time management skills&middot; Excellent written skills to succinctly, accurately and objectively respond to customer queriesAdditional Skills/Preferences&middot; Ability to proactively &amp; effectively analyze &amp; resolve problems&middot; Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables in a dynamic, evolving environment&middot; Able to respond succinctly, objectively, accurately and empathetically to customer needs, managing their expectations effectively&middot; Ability to work in regional/global team environment and communicate effectively with external customers and internal business partners of all levels &amp; disciplinesCompliance&middot; Demonstrate a strong compliance oriented mindset &amp; help to build a strong compliance culture&middot; Familiarise with all applicable policies, documentation &amp; training materials to ensure you operate in a fully compliant manner&middot; Ensure ownership for all applicable Operational controls for your area&middot; Support all investigations, monitoring and affiliate audits as required&middot; Ensure high levels of confidentiality to protect customer sensitive dataCustomer&middot; Demonstrate excellence in all interactions with our external customers &amp; GBS internal business partners&middot; Focus on measuring &amp; improving our customer&rsquo;s experience with the GBS&middot; Continuous Improvement&middot; Demonstrate a strong Continuous Improvement oriented approach &amp; help to build a strong Continuous Improvement culture&middot; Actively work with the core team members &amp; Regional/Global Medical Information team to drive improvements for processes

item.title: Construction Manager
item.content: Electrical Construction Manager | West DublinPermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose As Electrical Site Manager you will represent the Project Manager and Kirby Group on major construction sites and to take responsibility for all site related activities associated with the construction of a varied range of projects. The Electrical Site Manager will be expected to take the lead on all on-site activities from pre-mobilisation through to commissioning and eventual demobilisation. &nbsp; Electrical&nbsp;Construction Manager Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; Project Start-Up: Assist PM in development of construction programme, short term look ahead planning reports, equipment and materials schedules. Visit site and develop a site establishment schedule. Familiarisation with change management with PM. Assist in project validation. Put site safety starter pack in place and participate in HSEQ plan. Set up site establishment. Method statement and Risk Assessment preparation and review with sub-contractor. Review construction drawings and sign off Assist in benchmarking installation practices and Quality procedures &nbsp; Project Running Phase: Productivity Develop a daily key action plan that includes HSEQ, productivity and people management. Assist Project team in expediting of major equipment deliveries. Maintain a site diary Attend/Chair internal meetings with sub-contractors. Ensure that all variations are picked up in conjunction with PM and QS. Ensure labour allocation sheets are being completed by sub-contractors. Produce short term programmes in line with master programme. Mark up master programme each week and issues to PM. Effectively manage sub-contractor supervision to enable efficient productivity Ensure sub-contractor workforce is on site at workface on time. &nbsp; People Liaise with sub-contractors to address available work faces. Liaise with our client in co-ordination between building and services. Work closely with other supervisors to ensure effective co-ordination between M&amp;E services. Integrate with other internal and external supervisors to ensure cross co-ordination of trades and installation processes. Take ownership and responsibility of issues to drive out solutions in conjunction with Project Manager. &nbsp; Safety Ensure tool box talks, inductions and safety briefings are being carried out. Maintain plant logs and ensure weekly safety checks are carried out. Ensure operatives are working safely, wearing appropriate PPE and working to agreed method statements. Ensure compliance with Health and Safety Policy in particular to the operation of work permits, site safety audits and weekly walk arounds. Carry out daily walk around adopting a &ldquo;don&rsquo;t walk by&rdquo; approach to safety. Implement H&amp;S behaviour/culture and Golden Rules. &nbsp; Quality Plan and co-ordinate delivery of materials and plant. Mark up drawings in conjunction with inspection testing. Ensure inspection test plan is enforced by snagging works, then offering to client for inspection at various stages of the installation working to ZERO snags. Ensure that free issue equipment is checked, cared for and once accepted confirm to engineer to sign off for payment. &nbsp; Close Out Activities: Liaise with commissioning engineer in ensuring all systems are tested, demonstrated and handover. Ensure all site safety devices are proved. Ensure all life systems are complete and certified. Issue final marked up drawings are correct. Liaise with PM on site demobilisation, including plant, labour, materials and site establishment. Ensure all statutory notices, schematics, wall charts are in place on site in accordance with project completion checklist. &nbsp; Other Duties: Maintain a site diary. Assist QS in his / her duties Ensure company&rsquo;s good image is maintained at all times. Integrate with site team. Ensure your agreed training plan is enforced. &nbsp; &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Construction ManagerRecognised Electrical apprenticeship / trade cert coupled with a minimum of 5 years Site Management experience Experience in managing Electrical design and build projects in-excess of &euro;5 million. You will ideally be in possession of; IOSH certificate managing safety; IOSH certificate in environmental management and general NEBOSH certificate but not essential. Possess strong computer abilities Professional Acumen - Represent Kirby&rsquo;s at a senior level in meetings, presentations, technical workshops, etc. in a professional, competent and capable manner. Communications &ndash; A strong communicator with excellent verbal and writing proficiency. Ability to lead presentations to larger audiences. Planning and Organising - An organised and adaptable individual with a flexible approach to work. Ability to manage and prioritise when leading multiple projects.&nbsp; Deep understanding of constructability of projects. Strong Commercial awareness. Capable of building strategic relationships with third party design groups. Ability to work on own initiative and build and manage a team. &nbsp;For more information on this Electrical Site Manager/ Electrical Construction Manager position or other Electrical Project Manager / Contracts Manager opportunities based in Ireland, UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Pensions Administrator
item.content: Pensions AdministratorAn exciting position has become available for a full time Pensions Administrator to join a knowledgeable and friendly team based in Dublin (D07 E363). The successful candidate will earn a competitive salary. If you have a minimum of 3 years pensions experience ideally across the full product range of company pensions, PRSAs, PRBs, AVC arrangements and ARFs, this is a perfect opportunity to further your career and join a fantastic company.Role RequirementsAt a minimum you will be required to have completed your Leaving Certificate. Ideally you will be educated to degree level or equivalent, but this is not essential.You should hold the QFA Certificate in Professional Financial Advice and ideally the RPA Certificate in Retirement Planning Advice.A minimum of 3 years pensions experiences ideally across the full product range of company pensions, PRSAs, PRBs, AVC arrangements and ARFsExcellent communication skillsGood telephone mannerStrong customer focusA good knowledge of pensions as well as the regulations that govern themExcellent organisational skillsAbility to manage numerous tasks simultaneouslyHigh levels of accuracy and attention to detailExcellent interpersonal skillsStrong working knowledge of MS office packagesRole ResponsibilitiesActing as administrator and point of contact for pre and post retirement plans (PRSAs, PRBs and ARFs)Communicating with financial advisors and liaising with clients, investment managers, insurance companies etc. in a timely and professional mannerValidating and processing requests from Brokers in a timely manner relating to proposed investments and claims under our pension contractsDealing with maturing investmentsCompleting all regulatory compliance requirements in particular in relation to our PRSA and ARF productsMaintenance and updating of existing client recordsManaging queries from financial advisors and clients directlyDelivering a first-class service to our clients in line with our company policies and proceduresAssuming responsibility for any additional tasks and projectsSupporting the development of the team and working closely with and supporting the other team membersCompany + BenefitsOur client is one of the few providers in the market that offer a full range of pension products on a self-invested basis. This includes Personal Retirement Savings Accounts, Personal Retirement Bonds, Approved (Minimum) Retirement Funds and Small Self-Administered Pension Schemes. Their products offer clients flexibility and real choice when it comes to their pension investments.Full training and development will be provided to help you to continue to grow your pensions knowledge and to enhance your future career opportunities.&nbsp;Why should you apply? The opportunity to join a fantastic company who will help you develop and grow your careerTo become part of an excellent teamTo expand on your current knowledge and skill setIf you&rsquo;re the ideal candidate our client is looking for, please send your CV by clicking the APPLY buttonKeywords: Pension, Administrator, Pensions, PRSAs, PRBs, AVC arrangements, ARFs, Admin, Clerical, Pension Scheme

item.title: Health And Safety Officer
item.content: Providing a full range of civil engineering and construction services, specialising in Demolition projects with a value from &euro;50,000 - &euro;20 Million across the Dublin / Leinster region.With a full workbook for the next 6-12months, we have a need for a Health and Safety officer to join this well-known construction company on a permanent basis, joining their existing team in Dublin.Working across the Dublin area, on 3-4 sites at any one time, reporting to the Health &amp; Safety manager, the successful candidate will have: * 2-3 years construction, site-based Health &amp; Safety experience * Hold a Level 6 or above Qualification in Health and Safety or equivalent * Being familiar with and experienced in safety statements, safety plans, site audits, toolbox talks, method statements, etc * Member of IOSH (Institute of Occupational Safety and Health) preferred * Able to manage Health and Safety on-site using their own initiative within the scope of the management system * Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs (Excel, PowerPoint), and a general competence in using new technologies (Mobile Apps etc)The successful candidate will receive full support from the HSEQ Director, H&amp;S Manager and the commercial team, offering development and training as needed.&ldquo;A company over 50 years in business in Ireland, having worked on &euro;Multi-Million projects such as Croke Park, Bolands Mill, St James Gate, amongst many others.&rdquo;The Remuneration Package:An excellent package will be put in place for the successful candidate, with the base salary for the position ranging from &euro;30,000 - &euro;50,000 depending on experience, which will be fully negotiable + Vehicle + Package.How to Apply:If you&#39;d like to find out more about this role, click &#39;apply now&#39; to forward an up-to-date CV to Cathal McKeever, Breagh Recruitment Ltd.The Breagh Team:Breagh Recruitment, the go to specialist construction and engineering recruitment consultants across the UK and Ireland, with an ethos based on flexibility, hard work and a bit of good old common sense. We live within these core values servicing our clients and candidates on a daily basis.Key roles we recruit for include: Health &amp; Safety managers, project managers, construction managers, site engineers, quantity surveyors, civil engineers, site agents, estimators, buyers, bid managers and site supervisors, across Ireland and the UK

item.title: Facilities Manager
item.content: Are you an experienced Integrated facilities manager with excellent leadership and stakeholder management skills? Do you have a strong financial acumen and have managed a P&amp;L contract in excess of &euro;1.5m value? We might just have your next professional challenge available right here!We are looking for a Facilities Manager for our pharmaceutical client&rsquo;s site in Ringaskiddy, Co. Cork to manage cleaning, catering and maintenance service delivery and manage a team of 88 Sodexo staff.We offer a competitive salary, a bonus and Sodexo employee benefits along with development and progression opportunities withing the company.Main ResponsibilitiesProvide strategic leadership to the site &amp; contract in order to deliver significant business growth.Be an ambassador for Vested Contract behaviour on site and ensure that Vested behaviours are displayed by all members of the team.Point of escalation and issue resolution for all issues on site.Pro-actively develop and build the Client relationships at site.To implement and maintain business improvement, process standardisation and improvement in all areas.To provide thought leadership on all IFM service delivery and act as an SME for service delivery of a total IFM offer.Responsible for delivery of business targets and maximising the profitability of the contract and deliver the required results.Liaison and co-ordination with in-country &amp; regional management and operational teams.Lead, develop, manage and motivate a high performing team to the agreed standards ensuring that the Client receives services of the highest quality.Support the ROI operations lead in the development of business strategy in line with current and emerging Client needs.Responsible for the day to day delivery of services to Johnson &amp; Johnson in line with a consistent approach across the ROI.To actively work across the ROI with other site leads and as part of our ROI operation.Interface and collaborate with the country team and SME&rsquo;s.Ensure a safe, compliant environment for our teams and customers by ensuring processes are followed and gaps identified and escalated to resolution.Ensure consistent and effective governance at each site vs agreed Vested Contract criteria.Responsible for all operational problem resolution and issue escalation.Ensure forecasts are completed and track performance against budget taking appropriate actions to manage P&amp;L in line with contract to maximise profit and control of costs.Measure KPI&rsquo;s and service standards against agreed and obligated levels.Be an informed and authoritative point of contact for the key stakeholders at site to address any performance or operational issues.Full understanding of contractual MSA, LSA, guiding principles applicable to site under new Vested Contract agreement and delivery of content to site.Management of Health, Safety and Environmental Legislation relating to the building portfolio ensuring that: all statutory requirements and Sodexo policies and process are met; all associated records are maintained up to date; and with all relevant staff are trained and aware in its requirements and operation. In addition to foster and set goals that drive the QEHS culture for staff towards proactive rather than reactive systems.To work collaboratively with all central teams/SME&rsquo;s to ensure a standardised, consistent and compliant approach is implemented in all service lines across all sites within micro region whilst delivering a fully compliant operation to our client.The Ideal CandidateEssentialProven experience in managing large site with multi-disciplined teams.Exceptional Client relationship management skillsDevelopment of commercially viable solutions based on rigorous techniques to understand Client and contractual needs.Ability to manage multiple workloads and shifting priorities in a fast-paced dynamic environment.Ability to interpret and utilise complex and varied financial and commercial information.Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with customers, Clients and employees at all levels.Ability to achieve set standards and operate to performance criteria; for example, health and safety, hygiene.Self-motivated and able to work on own initiative within a team environment.Proven track record of initiating and leading demanding business change programmes.Excellent communication, negotiating, influencing and facilitating skills.Challenges the status-quo, innovative, willingness and with a &lsquo;can do &amp; improve&rsquo; attitude.DesirableExperience of Hard and Soft FM contracts.Proven experience in managing P&amp;L accounts in excess of &euro;1.5m.Facilities, Engineering, Technical or Business qualification.Experience in a pharmaceutical industry or large Blue Chip company.About The CompanyIn the UK and Ireland, Sodexo employs some 36,000 employees to deliver integrated facilities management services to clients at over 2,000 locations in the energy, corporate, healthcare, education, leisure, defence and justice sectors. With an annual turnover of over &pound;1bn, we provide everything from catering, cleaning and reception to security, laboratory and grounds maintenance services, enabling our clients to focus on their core business.&nbsp;At Sodexo we are committed to a leading role in promoting equality opportunities and valuing diversity and inclusion. We seek to create a work environment based on mutual respect for all individuals, building a culture that appreciates and values the experiences and skills brought by each person to benefit our organisation and work hard to ensure that all people, whatever their race, colour, sex, gender identity&#x202F; disability, nationality, national or ethnic origin, religion or belief, marital/partnership or family status, sexual orientation, age, social class, educational background, employment status, working pattern, are welcome to and included within our organisation.&nbsp;&nbsp;We&rsquo;re a Disability Confident Leader employer. We&rsquo;re committed to changing attitudes towards disability, and making sure disabled people have the chance to fulfil their aspirations.&nbsp;We are building on our support to the Armed Forces community through the development of specific pathways within our recruitment process to&#x202F; support ex-forces personnel and reservists, those applying for jobs with us who meet the ideal candidate criteria for the role advertised are guaranteed to progress to the selection process

item.title: Graduate Quantity Surveyor | Ireland
item.content: Graduate Quantity Surveyors | IrelandPermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp;&nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. &nbsp;&nbsp; Role Purpose Kirby are looking to recruit graduates from top-tier Universities and Institutes of Technology &ndash; talented individuals with a natural flair for quantity surveying and a real interest in developing into technical people and commercial leaders. We are keen to hear from both Quantity Surveying Graduates in addition to those whom have a Mechanical, Electrical or Building Services Engineering Degree that wish to be trained as a Quantity Surveyor. Fast track your career by learning from the best and contributing towards the successful completion of high-profile prestigious projects within the following sectors;Data Centres;&nbsp;&nbsp;Life Sciences / Pharmaceutical;&nbsp;Industrial;&nbsp;Power Generation;&nbsp;Petrochemical;&nbsp;Commercial &amp;&nbsp;Substations What will you recieve upon successful appointment: Competitive Salary and fast track towards professional development Opportunity to travel throughout Ireland, UK &amp; Europe to gain international experience and to work on large and exciting projects. Structured 18month program comprising of site &amp; office-based learning and working. Quarterly interactive sessions with Senior Business Leaders Assigned Company Lead Expert in the relevant functional area you are assigned to. 12 CPD days, covering 6 periodic training modules spread out over 18-month term; Technical &amp; Commercial Development and People Leadership Building Practical &amp; Technical Competence Personal Leadership Commercial Acumen Project Engineering / Technical Excellence Effectiveness &nbsp;&nbsp; Graduate Quantity Surveyor Responsibilities Ensure close co-operation with Planning Engineer as regards assessment of progress, accounting for day works undertaken and identification and evaluations of variations and additions to the original contract work. Provide necessary back up in any follow up to claims and assist in negotiations on the finalization of these accounts.&nbsp; Ensure certificates of payment are issued promptly. Graduates with a Mechanical, Electrical or Building Services Qualification will be strongly considered. Prior work placement experience would be advantageous Proficient in excel. Knowledge of contract conditions and their applications Excellent Communication/Interpersonal Skills Excellent Record Keeping and Administration Skills &nbsp;&nbsp; For more information on this Graduate Quantity Surveyor/ Junior Quantity Surveyor position or other Quantity Surveyor opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Senior Product Owner
