item.title: Quarry Plant Fitter
item.content: Quarry Plant FitterAn exciting position has become available for a full time Quarry Plant Fitter to join a friendly team based in Co. Carlow. This role will welcome candidates from County Carlow and all surrounding areas such as Co. Laois, Co. Kilkenny, Co. Wexford, Co. Wicklow and Co. Kildare. The successful candidate will earn a competitive salary. The successful candidate will need to demonstrate they have the drive and ambition to fulfil the roles responsibilities and carry out the duties, which may require working long periods and unsociable hours from time to time. A flexible, proactive hand on approach to the role is essential.Role Requirements Qualified in mechanical engineering (fixed plant / mobile plant) burning, welding and fabricationQuarry Fitting activitiesProven experience of repairs and maintenance to fixed and mobile plantHealth and Safety knowledgeExperience of forklifts, MEWP&rsquo;s, and cranes.Possible specialist skills (e.g., electrics and electrical maintenance)Good time keepingSelf-motivatedReliableAbility to adaptAbility to work as a team and under own initiativeRole ResponsibilitiesRoutine maintenance and repair of all company plant equipment as requiredTo facilitate and co-ordinate the repair and maintenance of quarrying plant and machinery i.e. carrying out any repairs/maintenance for mobile load and haul equipment, crushers, screeners, conveyor systems and hydraulic equipment in addition to fixed plant such as asphalt, concrete plants as required.Contribute towards effective &ldquo;preventative maintenance&rdquo; programsEnsure workshop facilities, equipment and tools are kept clean, tidy and maintained &#xF0A7; To provide supervision of others and third party&rsquo;s assisting in the works being carried out. &#xF0A7; To assist quarry management in the programming of scheduled maintenance aligned to production requirementsTo eliminate preventable plant breakdownsTo support the cost effective and timely ordering and supply of spares and critical equipmentEnsure Health and Safety is adhered to and safe working practices followed at all times. &#xF0A7; To undertake risk assessment and associated paperwork, where required, of the relevant activities to ensure a suitable and effective safe system of workTo liaise daily with management and quarry operatives to ascertain any repair and maintenance requirement that arise, or need specific prioritisationTo provide flexibility to undertake emergency repairs where and when these ariseTo carry out other appropriate duties as assigned by your line managerCompany Our client is a family run business.The family has been synonymous with quality and quarrying in the southeast region for 3 generations.Our client started quarrying in Ballycrogue Co.Carlow in the 1930&#39;s and the business has grown and developed exponentially since.Why should you apply? item.title: Senior Ecologist
item.content: Seeking a Senior Ecologist to join a busy Ecology team in South Dublin. The Ideal candidates will have six years plus experience in a consultancy environment/ regulatory role in the environmental assessment field. A proven track record of working on Environmental Impact Assessments and Appropriate Assessment processes is essential.Key Requirements * Degree in Ecology or a related biological/environmental science subject with an ecological component. * Excellent field skills and a keen interest and understanding of Irish wildlife. * Demonstrated field survey experience in ecology e.g. habitat classification (Fossitt), badger, otter, bat, bird and invasive species surveys. * Familiar with relevant Irish and European legislation e.g. Habitats Directive, Birds Directive, EIA Directive, Birds and Natural Habitats Regulations. * Knowledge of Appropriate Assessment as per Article 6 of the Habitats Directive. * Excellent report writing skills. * A hard working and highly motivated individual - client focused with good interpersonal skills and team approach. * Full Clean Driving Licence. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to record data efficiently and methodically).Desirable * A postgraduate qualification in a relevant ecological discipline which includes practical experience. * Previous work experience within a professional ecological consultancy (or relevant eNGO or academic experience if applicable). * Experience in compiling Ecological Impact Assessment (EcIA) reports and Appropriate Assessment on the likely impacts of proposed developments, and recommending appropriate mitigation measures. * Experience of licensable activities/surveys for protected species such as bat, badger or otter. * Membership of CIEEM or working towards membership of CIEEM * Experience utilising GIS systems e.g. ArcGIS, QGIS and or others

item.title: Paint Sprayer
item.content: Paint&nbsp;Technician - Automotive Accident Repair Centre - Cork, Republic of Ireland - Up to 35,000&euro; Basic salary, plus bonus and overtime (&pound;31,810 @ current exchange rate) - Benefits: On-site parking, Company events &amp; social hours, Company pension, Employee discounts, and Wellness programmes With house prices excellent, if you&rsquo;re looking to buy; the way of life relaxed and amazing countryside. Now might be the time to relocate to the &lsquo;emerald isle&rsquo;. Ireland has remained a popular expat destination. In fact, Ireland was recently ranked joint sixth place in the top 10 places to live worldwide by the Human Development Index (HDI). Moving to Ireland will reinvigorate your weekends. From stunning coastlines to breath-taking countryside, Ireland has it all. Being a small country with an excellent network of roads, exploring this beautiful country will become your new weekend passion. If work-life balance is important: Because work life balance is important to the Irish, many employers have introduced policies in order to provide flexible workplaces. Full time hours are generally between 35 and 40 hours per week and all employees that have worked at least 1365 hours per year are entitled to a minimum of four weeks paid holiday per year. This includes full time, part time, temporary or casual employees. There are also eight annual Irish public holidays to enjoy!!Our client is a large and well respected Accident Repair Centre in the centre of Cork. They are currently suffering from their own success, loads of work stacking up, and only getting busier and no local talent to take on the work. As such they have approached Perfect Placement to bring them talented Paint Sprayers, Panel Beaters and Estimators from the UK, who want to live and work in the Emerald Isle. This is an amazing opportunity for not only a new job, but a new life!Apply today for a chat about the opportunity.Please send a copy of your CV to Jimi Matthews, quoting 97434, Paint Sprayer or give us a call for more information on this role.&nbsp;&copy; Perfect Placement UK Ltd &ndash; See our website for details

item.title: Mechanical Site Supervisor | Connaught
item.content: Mechanical Site Supervisor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose The role of the Mechanical Site Supervisor is to support in the organization and co-ordination of site-based activities and to lead and co-ordinate teams of Mechanical Engineering trade professionals on site. The Supervisor will be responsible for tracking and recording of site daily activities and progress. They will lead their teams to deliver to quality, on time and to budget in a safe and efficient manner. They will deal with obstacles and develop team capacity. &nbsp; Mechanical Site Supervisor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure safe workplace, safe systems of work, competent personnel and safe working practices and culture &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Supervise activity/work package delivery &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Record daily activity logs for all site activity &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Liaise with the various trade professionals to organize new work areas and ensure smooth co-ordination &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Liaise with sub-contractors on materials orders &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Management of direct site staff and direction to designated work areas &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attending regular site meetings with site management to update on progress &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Technical support to the trade teams &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensuring all work areas are clear and ready to be handed over &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Develop teams &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Mechanical Site Supervisor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Senior Trades qualification or equivalent coupled with 5+ years site experience ideally within pharmaceutical/medical device, commercial, industrial or data centre type sectors. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong understanding of site activities and how they are planned and coordinated. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; General knowledge of Mechanical, HVAC, Building Serivces, Utilities, Process Piping Systems etc. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Can interpret schematics &amp; Mechanical Drawings &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Record of success as a Trade Leader &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Familiarity with materials ordering and lead times &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strong client focus &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Commercial acumen &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Planner/Organised &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Influencer &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conscientious &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Decisive and action oriented &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Team player &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attentive to detail and record keeper &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Results oriented with the resilience to work under pressure &nbsp; For more information on this Mechanical Site Supervisor position or other Mechanical Site Supervisor / Electrical Site Supervisor opportunities based in Ireland, UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

From time to time, you will&nbsp;assist the project manager on electrical projects and to carry out work such as completion of O&amp;M manuals, As-Built Drawings, RFI Schedules, Technical Submittals, Design, Procurement Register and Progress Reports.Key Roles/Tasks/Responsibilities of the Senior Electrical EngineerLead projects from concept stage to completionLiaise with clients, architects and project managersAs a&nbsp;Senior Electrical Engineer&nbsp;you will lead the Electrical Services design for a range of projectsDesign and specification of electrical services for various types of buildings and sectorsProduction of detailed SchematicsDevelop the electrical design standards within the organisationMentoring of junior engineering staffThe&nbsp;Senior Electrical Engineer&nbsp;will be tasked with Providing fully detailed tender packages and monitor installation/quality on site until project completionTender report / analysis / recommendationsDevelop project scope with design team / clientProduce budgets and reports for clientsPreparation of design drawings covering all aspects of High &amp; Low voltage equipment.Liaise and co-ordinate with members of the design team, contractors and in-house project team on technical and commercial issues.Creation of installed drawings and O&amp;M manuals.Attend technical meetings with members of the design team, contractors, and in-house project team.Assist with the preparation of technical documentation for issue of tenders and construction.Prepare tender, construction and as-built design drawings using AutoCAD.Prepare project programs using MS project.Prepare wiring schematics for electrical services such as fire alarm, nurse call, intruder alarm, door access, emergency lighting.Carry out lighting design calculations.Carry out cable sizing and cable containment sizing calculations.Ensuring all latest building and electrical design standards and regulations are adhered to.&nbsp;&nbsp; Necessary Requirement:The Senior Electrical Engineer will ideally possess a 3rd level qualification in Electrical Engineering / Building Services EngineeringYou will possess LV design experience specific to Data Centre environments ideallyThe Senior Electrical Engineer will possess 8+ years experience in the construction industry of which 5+ years will have ideally been spent in a Design role.Some experience of working on a construction sites will be advantageous however not mandatoryExperience managing and mentoring a team of engineersExperience coordinating/interfacing with other disciplines within the organisationProficient in the use of Microsoft Office, Autocad, Dialux, Amtech, REVIT an advantageSpecification and design of Electrical Building Services systems for the Data Centre sector or similarExcellent Microsoft Office SkillsPosition requires thorough knowledge of electrical design and engineering techniquesDeep knowledge of ETCI, CIBSE, IEC, BS, IS and EN StandardsExperience in working as part of a teamVery good proactive communicatorThe role will be primarily office based but will involve some site attendancesBe capable of taking the lead on projects with minimal input from management team

Projects.Proven experience in management of P&amp;L accounts in excess of &euro;3mExperience of mainly Technical or Hard FM but also soft service contracts.Exceptional client relationship management skillsDevelopment of commercially viable solutions based on rigorous techniques to understand client and contractual needs.Manage multiple workloads and shifting priorities.Ability to interpret and utilise complex and varied financial and commercial information.Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with customers, clients and employees at all levels.Achieve set, standards and operate to performance criteria.Self-motivated and able to work on own initiative within a team environment.Proven track record of initiating &amp; leading demanding business change We&rsquo;re committed to changing attitudes towards disability, and making sure disabled people have the chance to fulfil their aspirations.&nbsp;We are building on our support to the Armed Forces community through the development of specific pathways within our recruitment process to&#x202F; support ex-forces personnel and reservists, those applying for jobs with us who meet the ideal candidate criteria for the role advertised are guaranteed to progress to the selection process

item.title: UI Software Developer
item.content: Remote working opportunityGempool are looking to recruit a Software Engineer (UI) for our client who is in the aviation sector. We are seeking a talented and motivated individual, who will be a proactive and collaborative member of a Product team and will nurture the Agile principles and values within that team. This candidate will be focused on delivering innovative, high quality, all-encompassing solutions for the front-end interface of our client&#39;s website.Ideal CandidateThe ideal candidate has extensive understanding of JavaScript and the Angular framework and is proficient in crafting interfaces for a positive and cohesive web user experience on mobile and desktop devices.Job Description * Implement and deliver high-quality UI solutions for our client&#39;s website within their Product teams. As part of this role, the candidate will manage and have responsibility for their tasks as part of a cross-functional Agile team. * Develop well-structured production level JavaScript/HTML/CSS, utilising a variety of frameworks for front-end web development. * Act as technical advisor to business owners, project management, and backend development teams regarding front-end development standards and processes * Collaborate with technical teams to instil CI &amp; Development best practices * Develop POC&rsquo;s and perform code reviews with a focus on design principles, simple testable code and quality at the fore.Key requirements * Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent formal training. * 2-4 Years of Professional experience in JavaScript; experience with AngularJS/Angular 2+ and other JavaScript libraries * Experience with NodeJS and build tools such as Grunt/Webpack etc. * Experience with JavaScript testing tools such as Jasmine, Chai etc. * Continuous build/integration mindset and experience reducing lead time to market for feature development (Jenkins, Gradle, BitBucket) * Demonstrable design knowledge, including API design principles, SOA, event driven systems and similar design patterns and techniques * Experience working with RESTful Web Services * Professional experience in coding HTML and CSS * Experience working with Agile frameworks and processes * Eligible to live and work in the EU * Desirable: AWS Certification and/or experience of solutioning for Cloud * Seniority Level Mid-Senior level * Industry * Information Technology and Services * Airlines/Aviation * Computer Software * Employment Type Full-time * Job Functions * Engineering * Information

item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Health and Safety Consultant - Field based
item.content: The Portfolio Group are delighted to be recruiting on behalf of Peninsula, an award winning international organisation providing Business Support, Employment Law, Health &amp; Safety and Employee Wellbeing services to a range of clients.Job OverviewThe Health &amp; Safety Department are looking for hardworking professional Health &amp; Safety Consultant with a high level of technical knowledge and experience, gained within the construction sector. You will have the ability to build strong relationships with your clients and deliver a high quality, cost effective consultancy service. Ideally you will be a chartered member of The Institution of Occupational Safety &amp; Health or equivalent.Day-to-Day ResponsibilitiesConduct yourself in a professional matter at all times (including appearance, use of PPE, communication etc.) ensuring that you comply with both company and departmental policies, procedures and protocolsTo visit clients premises for the purpose of carrying out agreed contractual workUndertake health and safety visits to client&#39;s premises in accordance with departmental protocols and contract requirements, in particular where SLA&#39;s are in placeSubmit any relevant reports or other such associated documents in accordance with client demand and departmental protocolsAdvise and instruct clients in the use of Health and Safety Management systems.Liaise with the HSE and other Enforcing Authorities on behalf of clients when required to do soAdvise clients on matters of Health and Safety standards and best practice affecting their business. Assist clients with accident or other special investigations as requiredAttend company meetings, courses etc. when required to update and maintain professional skills/knowledgeSupporting the client through effective crisis management where requiredPeninsula have a great reputation for providing high quality consultancy services and working as part of the Health and safety team will offer a role with great challenge and variety to develop your career with industry leading training.We seek applications from Health &amp; Safety professionals who can demonstrate excellent skills in managing client relationships, able to offer practical solutions to clients utilising your extensive technical knowledge of Health and Safety. Successful candidates will hold one of the following professional memberships; GMIOSH, GradIOSH, MIIRSM, CIEH, whilst candidates with associate memberships or NEBOSH National Diploma or equivalent will also be considered. (phone number removed)CT3INDIRE

item.title: Senior Regulatory Affairs Executive
item.content: Senior Regulatory Affairs Executive - Team Lead - Agrochemical / Agriculture - Dublin - Salary CompetitiveWe have a fabulous opportunity for an accurate and performance driven Senior Regulatory Affairs Executive, with experience in the Agricultural or Agrochemical sectors, to lead a small team of regulatory affairs executives at a fast-growing, international company in Dublin.The Regulatory Affairs team is responsible for obtaining and maintaining product registrations for the company&rsquo;s products, based on exacting regulatory requirements across international markets. The team liaises with regulatory bodies in particular countries to ensure understanding of what is required in order to compile dossiers for products to comply with each country&rsquo;s legal standards.This role is a fundamental part of the R&amp;D team and the successful candidate will be responsible for key deliverables, fundamental to the company&rsquo;s long-term strategies in European and global markets.You, in a nutshell: Suitable candidates will need to have an excellent academic record, qualified to at least primary degree level in Chemistry, biochemistry or equivalent. You will also need to possess demonstrable experience in a regulatory affairs role (approx 3-5 years), preferably within an industrial setting.The ability to present clear and concise written arguments to support a specific regulatory or scientific position on a topic is fundamental to the role.Opportunity: This is a technically demanding but very rewarding role for a scientist looking to utilise their academics and experience in a growing, cutting-edge environment.Key responsibilities as the Senior Regulatory Affairs Executive / Team Lead will include: * Lead and mentor a team of Regulatory Affairs Executives to complete the preparation of regulatory documentation and submissions to relevant regulatory authorities to obtain product authorisations for the product portfolio * Providing updates on changes to regulatory guidance or legislation to the R&amp;D team * Developing, in partnership with project management, project plans and budgets * Maintaining regulatory compliance for relevant products in the portfolio * Developing, supporting and training the regulatory affairs team * Preparing and reviewing guidance notes * Confidential management of sensitive and technical information and collating and communicating data to team members * Plus more!What we&rsquo;re looking for: * Excellent academic record, qualified to at least primary degree level in Chemistry, biochemistry or equivalent * Previous experience (3-5 years+) in regulatory affairs, ideally within an industrial setting * Previous team leader experience is beneficial * Ability to present clear and concise written arguments to support a specific regulatory or scientific position on a topic * Ability to perform tasks in an accurate and timely manner * Excellent attention to detail * Ability to critically evaluate a wide range of data/information and make recommendations and to implement non-standard solutions to complex problems * Highly organised self-starter * IT literate including MS Office * Ability to work calmly when under pressure and juggle demands * Proactive team player * Proficiency in an EU language would be highly advantageous (French, German, Spanish or Italian)Interested?If you have the academics and experience we&rsquo;re looking for then we want to hear from you ASAP! Please ensure your CV showcases you fully and submit it now, quoting &lsquo;LO- Senior Regulatory Affairs Executive

item.title: Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor | Electrical Estimating Dept
item.content: Senior Quantity Surveyor | Electrical Estimating Dept. (Dublin, Galway or Limerick)Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp;&nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose As Senior Quantity Surveyor you will play a key role in our continued growth and contribute to our reputation for estimation excellence in this area. You will aspire to lead and will deliver estimation services that are world class. In return, you will receive professional and personal development opportunities to help you become a technical, people and commercial leader. &nbsp;&nbsp; Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor Responsibilities In conjunction with your team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of the Estimation process including the following:Initial review of tender documents with Lead Estimator &amp; agreeing bid strategy with Estimating Manager &amp; Commercial Lead &amp; agreeing estimating team activities. Assisting and liaising with Engineering Support in design development, liaising with Lead Estimator. Interpreting specifications and drawings, liaising with Lead Estimator. Attending site surveys or liaising with Site Managers/Lead Estimator. Liaising with Estimating Manager &amp; other Departments/Business Units. Managing the preparation of the bid, including coordination with Lead Estimator to ensure quantities/descriptions/materials &amp; norms are correct. Liaising with Estimators in validating suppliers of quotes. Managing the final preparation of the tender adjudication, including liaising with Lead Estimators. Managing the preparing product substitution &amp; Value Engineering options, &amp; liaising with Lead Estimators. Managing the preparation of Prelims requirements for project costs, liaising with Lead Estimator &amp; Project Sponsor. Reviewing overall tender with Estimating Manager and interpretations taken. Preparations of detailed BOQ&rsquo;s supporting tenders Preparing the full tender documentation for presentation to clients. Managing post tender clarifications. Training and mentoring of Kirby Group Staff who are unfamiliar with Estimating procedures. Attending Post tender meetings. Attending handover meetings for successful tenders. &nbsp;&nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor3rd level qualification in Electrical Engineering, Building Services Engineering, Construction Economics, Quantity Surveying or similar Ideally will possess 5+ years&rsquo; experience in the construction industry of which 2 years has been in a similar Senior Electrical Estimator/ Quantity Surveyor position. Experience working on tenders in-excess of &euro;10million electrically within the pharmaceutical, industrial, data centre or commercial sectors. Innovates and leads in electrical/technical activity and challenges. Experience with the Microsoft Suite, especially Power Point &amp; Excel Ability to work independently and as part of a team Ability to manage, develop &amp; retain a large team Excellent attention to detail The ability to multi-task and manage many priorities Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills/communicates with impact Excellent record keeper and administration skills Solves problems analytically and acts decisively &nbsp;&nbsp; For more information on this Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor position or other Electrical Quantity Surveyor opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact Kirby Group Talent Acquisitions Team confidentially on +353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Process Safety Engineer
item.content: Orion Group Life Sciences have an exciting opportunity for a Process Safety Engineer for our Multinational Pharmaceutical client based in the Cork region on an initial 12-month contract.Job PurposeAssists with the design, implementation, maintenance, and review of Environmental, Health, Safety and Sustainability (EHS&amp;S) programmes to ensure compliance with regulatory, corporate and industry requirements. Acts as an SME and advisor to all teams on site in relation to PSM &amp; other EHS matters.GENERAL SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITIES:Provide PSM &amp; general EHS support for the Cork site:Support equipment / capital project HAZOP assessments and other process safety related risk assessments e.g., SIL / LOPA, ATEX.Co-ordinate &amp; support HAZOP Revalidation programmeAssess changes / projects from process safety perspective as part of site Change Control processSupport Pre-Start Up Safety ReviewsSupport site to trouble shoot related process safety issues,Ensure compliance with SEVESO III regulations.To propose, develop and implement improvements to the Process Safety Management System (PSM) as requiredEnsures that systems are in place to maintain 100% site compliance with all relevant legislation &amp; J&amp;J EHS standards related to area of responsibility.Develop, support and delivery of process safety training programs as deemed necessaryResponsible for generation of process safety metrics &amp; trends &amp; presentation e.g., EHS&amp;S management ReviewParticipate in incident / accident investigations &amp; root cause analyses (RCA)Completes / assists in completion of periodic Self Assessments &amp; audits of the EHS Management System.Perform periodic walkdowns / audits / programme reviews to ensure compliance with safety and environmental permits, plans, policies, and regulatory requirements.Assist in the preparation, implementation, and review of EHS Procedures and other EHS documents appropriate to the scope of site activities and in compliance with J&amp;J requirements.Provide technical support for the site risk assessment / JSA programme / PTW and assist in implementing appropriate control measures for identified risks.This is not an exhaustive, comprehensive listing of job functions. May perform other duties as assigned.She/he will have a strong EHS general/technical knowledge and experience in the Pharma industry or equivalent, be a strong effective communicator with all stakeholders. She/he will be a strong collaborator with a proven track and a strong networker able of leveraging EHS&amp;S expertise on and off site. QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:Previous experience working to ISO14001 and OSHAS 18001 international standards, preferably within a pharmaceutical or related environment is required. ESSENTIAL:3rd level degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, or other related discipline.At least 5 years&#39; experience, preferably in a pharmaceutical environmentSound knowledge of EHS legislation and standards, particularly those applicable to SEVESOGood written, oral communication &amp; interpersonal skillsHighly proactive, mature judgement and decision-making abilityStrong analytical and problem-solving abilitySelf-directed &amp; demonstrated efficient work methods, problem solving skills &amp; ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environmentProficient in use of Microsoft packages including Word, Excel &amp; PowerPoint DESIRABLE:A post graduate qualification in Process SafetyHAZOP ChairpersonLOPA / SIL trainedGreen BeltKnowledge of SEVESO regulations KEY INDIVIDUAL LEADER COMPETENCIES:A strong communicator &amp; influencer who is credible, self-assured, and highly capable of negotiating successful outcomes with site stakeholders (managers, leads, contractors, front line workers).Demonstrates ability to work with teams and individualsProven track record of delivering agreed-upon expectations.Builds strong productive lasting relationshipsS/he will have strong technical skills and the ability to explain complex issues and requirements in an easily understood mannerExcellent problem-solving skills and the necessary capabilities to understand and find solutions for complex technical/regulatory issuesAsserts personal ideas and opinions using persuasion to influence othersSeeks opportunities to grow and develop professionallyUses best practices to improve business operationsHolds self-accountable for compliant and flawless executionTakes personal responsibility for decisions that successfully build customer valueEffectively manages and adapts to changeDemonstrates the courage to stand alone on ideas and opinions that differ from othersListens effectively and remains open to other&#39;s ideas.Works effectively with people that have diverse styles, talents, and ideasMaintains the highest standards of ethical behaviourTreats people with dignity and respect For more information on this role, call Dan on (phone number removed) or email (url removed) for a completely confidential chat about this role and other opportunitiesOur role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment

item.title: Preconstruction Manager
item.content: My client are a growing construction company who work on largescale projects across education, healthcare and residential sectors. Due to company expansion they are now looking for a Preconstruction Manager to join their team!In return they are offering: * Competitive salary * Car Allowance * 31 days holiday (including bank holidays) rising to 34 with service * Healthcare * Pension Scheme * Regular Opportunities to work from home * Life AssuranceTheir ideal candidate will have: * Previous experience working on largescale new build projects. * A background working for a main contractor. * Previous experience working as a Design Manager, Estimator or Planner. * Excellent relationship building skills. * Strong problem solving skills.Duties will include: * Supporting work winning and managing pre-construction activities for the company. * Defining and embedding a process to support preconstruction phases. * Working alongside the Estimator, Planner and Design Manager. * Ensuring the pre-construction phase is managed in line with clients requirements with particular focus on the development of the contract sum, the master construction programme and a coordinated design solution. * Defining and managing the production of logistics solutions for project execution, including site establishment, security, welfare, access, traffic management, storage, material handling, working hours, and temporary works solutions, for a wide range of locations and environments.To apply for this role please submit a copy of your CV.V7 Recruitment are an equal opportunities employer who are acting as an employment agency in relation to this vacancy

item.title: Analytical Development Chemist
item.content: Analytical Development ChemistOur client a fast growing pharmaceutical company based in Waterford are recruiting for an experioenced analytical Development Chemist to join their Research &amp; Innovation Department.The overall purpose of this role is to support Product Development and Clinical Supply and to troubleshoot, develop, transfer or validate of analytical test methods as applicable.Responsibilities include: * To troubleshoot, develop, transfer and validate robust, sound analytical methods. * To draft/ review test methods, validation protocols and reports as applicable * To prepare submission documentation in support of license applications. * To take part in/lead laboratory investigations. * To liase directly with customers and contract laboratories and attend conference calls as required. * To attend internal project review meetings as required. * To assist in the preparation for customer/ regulatory inspections. * To identify and make recommendations for improvements as part of a team within or outside the department in order to ensure continuous improvement. * To analyse all raw materials, in process samples and finished products in a timely and efficient manner to ensure quality and efficacy of the product. * To ensure that all work is carried out is in compliance with the required standards conforming to company, cGxP, SOPs, regulatory regulations and guidelines, safety and environmental guidelines. * To complete all documentation correctly, in line with data integrity guidelines, free from errors, omissions or defects in order to achieve a high level of customer service and cGMP. To peer review documentation as required. * To perform additional team tasks as agreed to support effective running of the Business. * To support all other on-going laboratory functions &amp; requirements.Health and Safety * To ensure the requirements of the company&#39;s safety statement are implemented. * To continuously promote a positive safety culture by leading by example. * To implement safety requirements as per site documentation including SOP&rsquo;s, Safety Statement and COP&rsquo;s. * To report any defects/hazardsThe Ideal candidate * Qualified to a minimum of degree level in chemistry, pharmaceutical science or a related discipline. * At least two years&rsquo; experience working in a related technical environment

item.title: Clinical Project Manager
item.content: Associate Clinical Trial Project ManagerResponsibilitiesThe Clinical Trial Project Manager (CTPM) Associate leads the cross-functional study team in the development and execution of clinical trials and is accountable both regionally and globally to deliver trial(s) with quality, on time, and within scope and budget. The CTPM Associate leverages project management, regional operational knowledge, clinical trial process leadership and expertise, and scientific expertise to drive actions and coordinate efforts to achieve or exceed these trial deliverables.Primary Responsibilities: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the job requirements at the time it was prepared. The job requirements of any position may change over time and may include additional responsibilities not specifically described in the job description. Consult with your supervision regarding your actual job responsibilities and any related duties that may be required for the position.Project Management and Regional Operational Knowledge&middot; Use project management skills, processes and tools to develop and execute local, regional and/or global clinical trials as described below:&middot; Scope - Understand the scope of work required to complete the clinical trial successfully. Monitor the status and make changes (per change control process) as needed to meet the deliverables of the trial.&middot; Timeline &ndash; Develop and track global trial enrollment plan by gaining alignment and integrating inputs across functions and geographies.&middot; Risk - Assess, identify and monitor trial-level risks. Incorporate scientific knowledge, trial process, and regional expertise to create one integrated trial-level risk mitigation and contingency plan.&middot; Budget - Understand the cross-functional, trial-level budget components. Create and monitor the overall budget and assumptions using financial tracking tools. Routinely network with appropriate business partners, on trial-level budget status and changes.&middot; Partner with other organizations to coordinate and actively participate in affiliate, site, and investigator training&middot; Drive and coordinate local, regional and global, cross-functional study team throughout study implementation, execution, and closure, empowering them to meet the clinical trial deliverables, including issue management, contingency planning and issue resolution.&middot; Be accountable for trial/regional enrollment strategy and execution starting from country allocation through Last Patient Entered Treatment (LPET).&middot; Manage relationships and serve as a single point of contact and central owner for trial communication to and from the Clinical Development, CDDA, and Third Party Organization (TPOs).&middot; Apply problem-solving skills to daily issues with cross-functional study team (including with vendors, affiliates/regions, global team members and other business partners).&middot; Identify and assist in developing continuous improvement activities based on important trends such as industry, regulatory, new technology, etc.&middot; Manage TPO qualification process, selection, and oversight.Clinical Trial Process Leadership and Expertise&middot; Demonstrate understanding of drug development process. Acknowledge inter-relatedness of cross-functional activities and understand the impact of project decisions on the overall clinical trial. Look for opportunities to expand and deepen clinical trial process expertise.&middot; Be knowledgeable of the global and regional operating model; coordinate and facilitate geographic and functional input to provide to the study teams.&middot; Accountable for ensuring a state of inspection readiness of the TMF records created, maintained, finalized, and owned by Clinical Development&middot; Network and leverage expertise to anticipate trial and regional issues, identify areas of process breakdown, assess situations and propose proactive approaches that reduce and/or mitigate risks that impact ability to deliver the clinical trial.&middot; Demonstrate ability to lead and influence in the midst of ambiguity and coach peers, cross-functional team members and TPOs on aspects of clinical trial process and regional specificities.&middot; Report, manage and interpret information for the clinical trial(s), including completeness and accuracy across multiple business systems and tools from study implementation through closure.&middot; Apply expertise and knowledge of global/regional regulations, Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and standards of operation in the conduct of clinical trials. Liaise with affiliates and other appropriate resources to understand local regulatory requirements.\Scientific Expertise&middot; Leverage scientific and regulatory knowledge to prepare and/or provide technical consultation for clinical and regulatory documents, prepare for meetings with regulatory agencies and draft responses to questions from regulatory agencies, TPOs and affiliates.&middot; Combine scientific, regional, and operational knowledge as well as process expertise to impact clinical trial design, feasibility and implementation.&middot; Utilize clinical development knowledge, problem solving and critical thinking skills to support the scientific needs of the business.Basic QualificationsBachelors or University degree (scientific or health-related field preferred) or an advanced degree.Additional Skills/Preferences&middot; Applied knowledge of project management methodology, processes and tools&middot; Demonstrated ability to work cross-culturally with global colleagues and with TPOs&middot; Ability to influence without authority&middot; Strong leadership and networking skills exhibited while working in cross-functional and cross-cultural teams (internal &amp; external) and on projects&middot; Effective and influential communication, self-management, and organizational skills&middot; Demonstrated ability to manage complex situations through problem-solving, critical thinking and navigating ambiguity&middot; Flexibility to adjust to altered priorities&middot; Clinical trial experience with a strong working knowledge of the clinical research process.&middot; Proficiency in use of project management tools and techniques (e.g., Critical Chain, MS Project, MS, Excel, MS Powerpoint)&middot; Ability to travel periodically

item.title: Controls Engineer
item.content: Controls Engineer.Job Summary:Our client is seeking a Controls Engineer located in Galway, Ireland. This Controls Engineer will work as a member of the Systems Architecture Design &amp; Controls Team.This role will support the execution of embedded controls development projects, working with hardware, software, validation test and system integration functions.Core Job Responsibilities: * Develop controller models for system level control algorithms that provide superior performance, enhance reliability and diagnostics. * Execute model-in-the-loop simulations to verify control behavior and performance. * Support system and sub-system level integration testing to ensure control system behavior meets functional and non-functional requirements. Review and analyze system test data. * Work with software development teams to integrate model-generated software into application software. * Adhere to model development standards and processes. * Collaborate with System integration teams. * 5% travel anticipated.Minimum Qualifications: * Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science required. Other technical degrees may be considered with relevant work experience. * 4 years experience in controls, electronics, systems or software engineering.Key Competencies: * Experience with model based design processes and modeling &amp; simulation of complex systems. * Understanding of control system design. * Classical control knowledge is preferred (PID control, linear control, digital filtering). * Proficiency with Simulink and Stateflow is preferred. * Understanding of optimization techniques is preferred. * Experience in automating processes is preferred. * Knowledge of MAAB, J-MAAB, IEC 62304 standards or equivalents is a plus. * Knowledge in Refrigeration, HVAC, or Thermodynamics is a plus. * Knowledge in compressors, engines or power electronics is a plu

item.title: Civil Design Engineer
item.content: Location: CorkCompany Details:An award winning company that practices and continually strives to provide award winning design and service to their clients. As a company, they have achieved major awards from all of the Engineering Institutions which are evidence of their quality control, skill and dedicated service.An excellent opportunity has arisen for a Civil Design Engineer to join this dynamic and developing consultancy. They have a great team environment and they nurture and develop their employees, so they can continuously develop their skills.This role would suit an ambitious and evolving Civil Design Engineer who is open to bringing new ideas &amp; technologies and someone that is hungry for success.Responsibilities: * Your role will be focused on the design and project management of a number of large scale infrastructure projects. * Prepares design elements and design plans for highway/road and utility/drainage design using MX or Microdrainage or Civil 3D * You will be managing the projects from start to finish and you will be working within a multi-disciplinary group of professionals. * You will have access to their network of professionals to ensure that the projects are produced to the highest possible standard. * Your role will involve full design and co-ordination of design working on major developments and will require creativity and imagination, to ensure that all projects exceed the expectation of the client. * High level of client service and focus is essential and regular client briefings is very much part of the role. * Assists with other duties assigned by Project Engineers and/or Project Managers.Requirements: * A minimum of 5 + years relevant experience in a design environment * A recognised Bachelor of Engineering Degree (FETAC Level 8) * Be progressing toward Chartership Status * Be proficient in the use of MX Roads or Microdrainage or AutoDesk Civil 3D or equivalent * Experience designing roads with first-hand knowledge of DMRB and the NRA Manual of Contract Documents for Road Works. * The ability to communicate design intent and philosophy to allied team members and non-technical interested parties. * Excellent communication skills with English as a first language is essential. * Excellent focus on client service is essential. * Desire to be the best in your field and prepared to be professionally challenged.If you&rsquo;re interested in this role, kindly forward an up-to-date copy of your CV in a word format to Andy.For suitable candidates, you will receive an email containing the Initial Questions

item.title: Process Engineer
item.content: Process EngineerOur client, a medical device company is seeking to hire a Process Engineer for their site in Clare.Project Management:&bull; Leading team(s) of project reports on a project by project basis.&bull; Co-ordinates the introduction of new processes, equipment and materials including installation, calibration, EHS assessment debug, and all associated process and quality system documentation requirements including technical and process work instructions.&bull; Liaises with Engineering team or external equipment/tooling or material vendors in the selection, design &amp; development of new (or upgrades to existing) equipment, tooling and materials.Process Engineering:&bull; Leads the development and execution of experimentation and testing to enable characterisation, optimization and troubleshooting of key processes and equipment.&bull; Completes or leads the writing and release of process validation documentation including FMEA&#39;s, Validation Plans, protocols and reports.&bull; Co-ordinates execution and documentation of validation builds, co-ordinates testing of validation units and the compilation, analysis and reporting of the validation results.&bull; Provide strong technical support on process/product technologies to support production.Customer Focus:&bull; Sales support through leading/supporting quotation and proposal activities with the sales team, customers/ clients, and appropriate vendors&bull; Owning and running Internal and External project (incl Development &amp; NPI projects). To include schedule, resourcing and budget management.&bull; Customer management &ndash; kick-off &amp; regular meetings, minutes, issue logs/ escalations, change management, and expectation management.&bull; Vendor management &ndash; including new mould builds, BOM outsourcing / pass through sales setupContinuous Improvement:&bull; Continuous improvement focus, demonstrating strong knowledge of Six Sigma methodologies and applies these tools in the characterization, optimization and troubleshooting of process equipment and technology performance&bull; Demonstrates strong knowledge and application of Lean methodologies, and process improvement tools in identification and elimination of &quot;waste&quot; process steps and development of efficient, cost effective equipment and processes.Ad hoc:&bull; Own and complete CAPA&rsquo;s and NC&rsquo;s in role related issues.&bull; Demonstrates a primary commitment to H&amp;S and product quality within the manufacturing environment.&bull; Understands and complies with all the regulations governing the quality systems.Education &amp; Experience Required:&bull; A degree in a relevant engineering subject is required or diploma with relevant additional industrial experience&bull; Minimum of 3 years&rsquo; experience in a manufacturing environment required.&bull; NPI project experience&bull; Project engineering and project management experience&bull; Experience and knowledge of injection moulding machines, process set up and optimization.&bull; Experience in Blow Moulding would be a distinct advantage.&bull; Technical Writing Experience would be desirable.For further information on this Process Engineer role in Clare please contact Ciaran Fahy on (phone number removed)/ connect@hero.ieCheck out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website &ndash; (url removed)Please Note: Under its obligation under the Data Protection legislation, HERO Recruitment will not forward your details to any company without your prior approval

item.title: Senior Contracts Manager
item.content: Senior Contracts Manager &ndash; DublinEuro Executive Recruitment has been retained by one of Ireland&rsquo;s largest civil and building contractors to recruit a Senior Contracts Manager, covering the civil aspects of their current and upcoming projects in the Leinster region. This role presents a fantastic opportunity for the successful candidate to progress their career with a highly respected employer.Supported by the Directors of the business, this is great opportunity to join a highly successful developing business in Ireland with excellent opportunities for career advancement.The Role: * Lead one or multiple project teams to ensure that contracts are completed on programme. * Manage the compliance of company and current health &amp; safety legislation. * Supporting the project surveyor in the management &amp; control of contract costs &amp; variations with regular reporting of cost projections &amp; status to the Operations Director. * Develop strong relationships with clients. * Management &amp; assessment of subcontractor&rsquo;s quality of work &amp; their ability to maintain scope programme. * Management of programme risk &amp; experience of early interaction with design teams to ensure design deliverable dates &amp; details are achieved. * Maintain an excellent relationship with the management team, subcontractors, and clients. * Planning/scheduling of works. * Must be an excellent communicator, both verbally and in writing. * IT Fluency and familiar with MS packages and MS Project (or similar scheduling packages). * Strong commitment &amp; ownership for all Health and Safety, Quality and Environmental systems throughout the project.Requirements: * Third level qualification in a construction related field coupled with at least 10 -15 years post graduate experience, 5-10 years in the role in a managerial role with a recognised Main Contractor. * Proven record of delivering large scale Civil projects also Commercial, Industrial or Pharmaceutical projects will be advantageous. * Experience in delivering projects (value &euro;10m - &euro;30M) * Candidates must be capable of taking responsibility for a number of projects concurrently, as required.Salary: * There a salary of &euro;100,000 - &euro;120,000 (D.O.E.) on offer for the successful candidate.* For more information on this role please contact Kevin Hallissey or to apply, click &#39;Apply Now&#39;* All Applications will be dealt with in the strictest of confidence. Also note, CVs will not be forwarded to our clients without prior formal consent

item.title: Process Engineers X 3
item.content: Working on the construction project for the expansion of a pharmaceutical plantAs part of a significant expansion of the Company site, an exciting opportunity has come to be part of the technical transfer of key products for the new facility presently in construction.As part of the Technical Transfer team you will be responsible for the transfer of a syringe and/or vial product from the existing Carlow line to the newly expanded facility, and a formulation process for the syringe filling process from a US site to Carlow. .The role will include helping to build and execution of the technical transfer plan for the product. Early engagement with the construction team ensuring that process requirements will be embedded during the construction phase of the project (equipment and facility). Ultimately working towards the goal of completing the Product and Process Qualification batches in 2022.Reporting to the Technical Transfer Lead and the role will include &ndash; * Execute process engineering activities to support the technical transfer of products to site. This includes but is not limited to: cycle development, Equipment PQ, PPQ&rsquo;s, Cleaning, PCM, CTU mapping, filter validation, etc. * Engage in the early stages of the project, giving input into design by working with equipment vendors and global engineering teams to ensure that the process and product requirements are met. * Providing technical and product guidance to the process, design and project delivery teams. * You will be required to Author and review procedures and technical reports required as part of the technical transfer. * You will be Technical review and approval of Validation protocols executed by vendors, cross functional groups and/ or validation counterparts. * You will be leading or supporting component criticality assessments for the process. * Executing activities as part of the Change Management process for the product introduction. * Effective application of LeanSixSigma and Change Management tools. * Represent the site in internal collaborations through Manufacturing Division Validation Communities of Practice to include sharing of best practices. * Keep up to date with scientific and technical developments, best practices and attend seminars as required. * Maintain continuous focus on quality and safety compliance and unflinching focus on the customer.THE QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE * Minimum of 3 years directly related experience in academia, pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry &ndash; along with a working knowledge of current regulatory requirements and current Good Manufacturing Practices. * A self-starter and results-focussed, the successful candidate will have strong contemporary knowledge, and the ability to work independently and on multidisciplinary teams. * Process or technical transfer experience. * Working knowledge of ASTM E2500 / Eudralex / FDA / ISPE guidelines * Experience with liaising with other departments &ndash; engineering, technical, operations, QA and Regulatory Affairs. * Experience with sterile processing and sterilisation technologies * Prior experience in drug product processing equipment, PQ, Process Performance Qualification and Validation, site readiness, batch record reviews, authoring documents subject to regulatory inspection.Desirable but not essential * Experience with cleaning and process validation, technology transfer, regulatory filing, and commercial drug product manufacturing of biologics is a plus. * SME on Equipment within a sterile fill finish environment; e.g. CIP &amp; Parts Washer / SIP / Autoclaves / DHT &amp; Electron Beam sterilisation / Vaporised Hydrogen Peroxide Sterilising Isolators / Clean Utilities Transfer Panels &amp; Formulation Vessels * Vial / Syringe processing technologies; drug product filling, glass handling, tray handling, stoppering, capping and CCI. * New facility brown/ green field facility experience * Small equipment qualification and validation; FITs, Scales, Tube Sealers/ Welders, Headspace analysers, Flowmeters, Mobile Vessels &amp; Single Use Technologies

item.title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer - AWS/Azure
item.content: Join a fast-growing, ambitious, highly successful and multi award-winning software security company , who identify more than 100,000 new malware sites every single day via their threat intelligence database of 650 million users.You will be an active contributor to a high performing team as part of the agile delivery process and enabling success by improving and building cloud infrastructure for our products to ensure a highly available, scalable and performant customer experience.This is an exciting opportunity to join our friendly and self-motivated team who offer a great working environment and excellent development opportunities.Responsibilities &ndash; What will I be working on? * Lead the Design and Monitoring of deployed clouds and internal infrastructure, automated deployment of clouds, infrastructure and alerting. * Develop cloud-management monitoring and tools and improve all aspects of automation associated with cloud performance, scaling and availability * Review and advance infrastructure design and consumption for efficiencies as part of broader product team design initiatives. * Work with product development team and architecture as part of product architecture evolution and transition to microservices and containers / serverless technology. * Work closely with Production support team on strategies to prevent / quickly address customer impacting incidents and take the lead on designing and implementing automation strategies to improve overall customer experience. * Complex problem solving and troubleshootingSkills &ndash; What we need you to bring to the table * At least 3 years&rsquo; AWS experience * Degree in Computer Science/ IT preferred but not essential. AWS certifications desirable. * Essential to have experience with AWS EC2, S3, Cloudwatch and core AWS technologies * Essential to have experience working with Terraform or similar * Knowledge of Prometheus, python or go, and scripting * Hands on skills with containers and / or serverless technologies (e.g. Kubernetes, Fargate, EKS, Lambda) a big plus * Any experience with other cloud providers (Azure / Google) a plus * Passionate about automation and monitoring * Strong communication and technical writing skills * Excellent attention to detail and organisation skills * Ability to work well within a team in addition to working remotely

item.title: Commercial Project Controls Surveyor
item.content: Commercial Project Controls Engineer | LimerickPermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. &nbsp; Role Purpose The role of Commercial Project Controls will have you working across various areas of the organisation supporting the process map advancement for Kirby Way (internal process structure) when new developments and procedures are integrated into the live environment. &nbsp; Commercial Project Controls Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows:Assisting Commercial Managers and Project Controls Manager when required to examine the status of projects in distress Monitor and report on the use of processes and procedures Plan daily activities around the business requirements Greater focus primarily on higher risk issues that may impact the business High personal motivation with proven ability to work on own initiative Be resilient when examining projects while taking an impartial view to ensuring that the Quantity Surveyors are using agreed procedures Analysis of the tender and validated bids to confirm that the correct budgets are presented within the Kirby ERP system Reviewing the frequency of forecasting to align with the Kirby Way procedures Probing the latest forecasts, identifying probable overspends against the submitted budgets, and challenging the Quantity Surveyor with the discoveries if required Confirming that the Quantity Surveyor adheres to the Kirby Way process through the Client Application submissions and that deviations are communicated to inform of the necessary remedial actions Assessment of Client Applications to ensure that the project preserves a positive cash position throughout its lifecycle Evaluation of margins for change orders and identifying possible deficits in the estimated approach Reviewing the variation lists to identity lack of updating by the Quantity Surveyor and providing feedback Assessing the status of the project specify Subcontractor contracts and reporting on open items Inspecting the subcontractor account to ensure that all risks are removed, and likely claims are mitigated Provide guidance to the Quantity Surveyor when assessing Subcontractor tenders to ensure value for money Validating the Risks attributed to projects are accurate and propose recommendations/strategies to reduce commercial exposure to the company Contribute to Kirby Way development, processes, strategies, spend v earned, forecasting, and risk analysis Treating project assessments with discretion Maintain accurate records and provide necessary details from project assessments on critical deliverables Attention to detail when developing Trackers and Reporting templates Assisting with other ad-hoc duties as they arise Attend meetings as required Look for new opportunities to advance commercial procedures &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Commercial Project ControlsMinimum 3+ years of Quantity surveying / ERP experience essential on M&amp;E Projects. 3rd level qualification in Construction Economics / Quantity Surveying ideally coupled with a technical background as either Plumber/Pipefitter (or similar) or Mechanical Engineer Prior experience working in a similar capacity within the construction industry preferred. Proficient in excel. Detailed knowledge of commercial management and QS Role within construction Knowledge of contract conditions and their applications Overall understanding of the business, client and Sub Contractor relations, and installations Excellent Communication/Interpersonal Skills Excellent Record Keeping and Administration Skills Process driven and focused on EHS and Quality Work Management Systems and Processes &nbsp; For more information on this Commercial Project Controls position or other similar Commercial Project Controls / Project Controls Manager opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence
