item.title: QA Engineer
item.content: I have an excellent opportunity available for a QA Engineer with one of Ireland&#39;s leading eCommerce companies. They are looking for a QAs with strong technical skills to join their team, multiple roles availableIn this role you will work on a mix of manual and automated testing and have a big input on all QA processes, strategy etc. This role is fully remote for now and can be done 80% remotely even after the pandemic RequirementsComputer Science Degree (or similar)At least 5 years&#39; experience in a QA Engineer roleExperience with test automation tools like Selenium, AppiumContinuous Integration experience would be a plus - Jenkins or similarExperience in an Agile environment BenefitsCompetitive SalaryBonusAnnual Salary reviewPensionUp to 80% remote work available If this sounds like the right role for you, apply by sending your CV through the link or contact Seamus at Reperio for more infoReperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: RF Radio Telecommunications Engineer
item.content: RF Radio Telecommunications Engineer (141ww) - Dublin - Competitive SalaryOur Client is a major supplier of deployable UHF/VHF two-way Digital Mobile Equipment and Systems, their customers return year after year to hire or purchase the most advanced two-way radio equipment at the best prices, along with their high-tech accessories such as headsets and earpieces.Manufactured by the most reputable names in the industry, such as Motorola, Kenwood and ICOM, the radio equipment they supply is proven, resilient and easy to use.Our Client is looking for a RF Radio Telecommunications Engineer to join their growing team,This role requires an enthusiastic, organised and dedicated individual who is comfortable working from ladders, scaffolding or a cherry picker may need to take on additional tasks such as goods in/ goods out temporarilyThe ideal candidate may be required to work occasionally at weekends depending on the needs of the business. You may be put on a call out rota. You may be required to work overseas and stay in various locations across the UK.DUE TO THE NATURE OF THIS RECRUITMENT CONSULTANCY, WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO REPRESENT INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE EX MILITARY.Key Responsibilities- Attend customer sites to carry out site surveys, ascertaining what equipment fits with their requirements- Confirm quantities and customer requirements, providing full and detailed reports of equipment and tools required to carry out the installation- To plan distributed antenna systems (DAS) and deploy systems for UHF/VHF two-way digital mobile- Complete RAMS when required- Attend customer sites to perform installations, including crane and vehicle installations and de-installations in any building and location required- Ensure all installations are completed on time and to a high standard- Reprogram radios at customer sites as required, liaising with customers as and when required to help diagnoses any problems- Complete all relevant paperwork in the required time, e.g. job sheets- Ensure the van is kept clean and tidy, remembering that you are representing the company whilst out in the van. Report and damages or defects to the Logistics Manager.- Manage time to achieve the key performance indicators for the role and prioritise workload.- Appraise own performance and contribute towards own development of the knowledge &amp; skills required to achieve results- Help and support in other departments within the building when required.- Ability to work in a swift, efficient manner even while under pressure- Always maintain responsibility for own Health and Safety, adhering to all company policies- Report all accidents, injuries and near misses to the office immediately- Carry out a thorough site test with the customer before leaving site after installations, obtaining a signature to confirm the original spec has been fulfilled (including taking photos pre and post installation)- Ensure you have all equipment and tools required for your days&rsquo; work, attending site on time, liaising with purchasing to order stock accordingly when needed- Contact the customer the day prior to install when you are lead engineer on a job. If you are working alone, you are the lead engineer.- Maintain own knowledge and skills relevant to your role and the industry by attending suitable courses relevant to your role.- Put customers and people at the heart of all activity ensuring the customers are always treated as people and people as customers- Represent the company by own appearance and behaviours in line with the delivery of world class standardsSkills &amp; Experience:- Organised with an exceptional eye for detail- Radio installation in all different types of buildings and vehicles- Report writing, method statements and risk assessments.- Knowledge of Microsoft office packages- Excellent communication skills- Confident working from heights- Full driving licence, and full access to a vehicle- Working within the RF spectrum (system planning, use of test equipment, spectrum analyser) (desirable)- STEM background (desirable)- Customer care knowledge (desirable)- Maintain professional working relationships with colleagues- Utilise the support available from other departments to maximum effectCorporate Responsibility- Engage with business wide initiatives that support charity, community and socially responsible business activity.For more information, please contact Warren Wright, at Ex-Mil Recruitment Ltd on (phone number removed)

item.title: Remote Talent Acquisition Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: It Support Engineer
item.content: Professional Services Engineer Dublin &euro;45-50kMy client, an IT Managed Service Provider based in Dublin is seeking an experienced IT Professional Services Engineer to join their team. The day to day responsibilities will be a mixture of project work, both design and implementation, and business as usual support for their expanding client base.The successful candidate will have at least 3 years experience providing technical support in a similar fast-paced environment with a friendly and proactive approach to their work.They are looking for someone with a mix of technical and administrative skills to include, * Support the specification and implementation of new systems and services including new applications, new/upgraded hardware and software, system upgrades and rollouts * Incident/escalation management and resolution * Provide first class support across Windows environments * To remain current with technologies and offer high quality guidance and advice resolutionThe essential requirements for this role include, * Strong knowledge of Windows System Administration * Ability to configure, deploy and Support Windows physical and hosted servers * Exchange / Office 365 Implementation, Configuration and Administration * Network Topology, VPN, Firewalls, IP (incl. DHCP, DNS), LAN, WLAN and WAN * Cloud Technologies/Azure * VMWare * Experience working within an MSP highly desirable * Exceptional communication skills able to interact confidently with technical and non-technical users * Customer focused, with experience of providing advice and guidance over the telephone, e-mail and Internet with a proven track record of service delivery * Enthusiastic, self-motivated team player with the ability of working within a demanding environment and be able to demonstrate a logical approach to problem solving * Patience and ability to remain calm under pressure, whilst showing initiative at all times and an ability to apply a lateral thought process to problem * Driving license and own car is essentialFor an ambitious, tenacious, confident, self-motivated team player with a genuine desire to work with cutting edge technologies this is an excellent opportunity to work with senior staff in making a real difference to this already high-achieving organizationINFORM3 IT Recruitment is an equal opportunities employer. By applying to this position, you accept the terms of our privacy policy which you can find on our website

item.title: Electrical Projects Engineer
item.content: Malone Group is an established engineering and safety services company specialising in delivering complex projects for companies in the food &amp; beverage, pharmaceutical and utilities sectors in Ireland, UK and CanadaThe Electrical Engineer will be a key project role within the Company&rsquo;s operations, working within the Engineering Department. The position requires a broad knowledge of, and experience in the range of technical roles and responsibilities carried out by this department. The individual will be involved in multi-faceted projects involving change management, building compliance, electrical design (LV &amp; MV), space management and advising on more efficient energy managementReports to: Operations Manager.Key relationships: Group Engineering Director, project managers, project engineers, CAD DepartmentResponsibilities * Defining project scope including budgets to ensure projects are fully developed at concept stage * Providing technical support for information requests prior to, and during construction phases * Design and collaborate with other disciplines to create a construction set of documents and work with regional vendors and manufacturers to specify the appropriate electrical equipment * Design of equipment and infrastructure associated with MV &amp; LV electrical systems * Design of electrical systems associated with life safety and security systems * Design &amp; development of control panel layouts, electrical schematics, instrument and control loop drawings, assembly drawings and bill of materials * Adherence and monitoring of project programmes to include regular progress tracking * Working with local utilities to understand and define site utility requirements * Reviewing and approving equipment submittals * Providing technical support for information requests prior to, and during construction phases * Overseeing the installation of projects on Customer sites, to include all elements of Quality, Health and Safety and Technical compliance * Working with commissioning teams to properly test and validate installation, operation, and performance of electrical systems * Effective management of all financial and commercial aspects of site related contracts, including variation orders and related Customer/Sub-contractor negotiations * Work with a team of engineers to ensure tasks are allocated and achieved in accordance with project requirements and in line with the Company&rsquo;s values, quality standards and business objectives * Operating as an Ancillary Certifier for the purpose of BC(A)R and undertaking inspections prior to BC(A)R project certification.Candidate Profile * Degree in Electrical Engineering with a minimum 5 years&rsquo; post qualification experience * Chartered Engineer desirable but not a requirement * Excellent understanding of the European Electrical Codes * Knowledge of building codes and regulations. * Fundamental understanding of critical LV electrical equipment * Working with multiple electrical software including- Autocad, Dialux, Amtech, REVIT, etc * Possess leadership and problem-solving skills * Be a motivated, highly dependable individual with solid communication skills, attention to detail, and an ability to maintain high quality standards * Ability to mentor electrical project engineers as required * Demonstrate leadership qualities to maintain relationships with internal and external customers. Ability to quickly identify and remove roadblocks * Proactively organises and plans ahead to ensure optimum resource allocation and project timelines are met * Ability to carry new design concepts through exploration, development and into deployment/construction * Ability to work on multiple projects of different scale and complexity at any one time * An ability and willingness to think outside of the box to find creative and innovative solutions to reduce costs with no impact on quality, reliability or maintainability * Enjoys solving problems, interacting with customers, suppliers and contractors and eager to maintain strong constructive relationships

item.title: Foreman - Major Road Works - Cork
item.content: Package: &euro;60,000 - &euro;70,000 + Vehicle + FuelHighways &amp; Infrastructure Projects Co CorkPermanent opportunityWe&#39;re recruiting for an experienced General Foreman to work on a major new Highway / Road project, based in co Cork - 15+ years experience.An opportunity for someone who is conscientious and hardworking, with sound IT skills and meticulous record keeping, experienced in people management and team motivation.Already experienced as a General Foreman with previous experience in highways, infrastructure, or structures, you will have 15+ years relevant industry experience and qualifications as an experienced Foreman, having previously worked with a major main contractor on large heavy civil projects. * Well versed in measuring works, implementing and interpret construction plans and safety policies and practices * Reporting to and working alongside the Project Director &amp; a number of Project Managers, taking responsibility for large section&rsquo;s of road, managing the work of operatives and sub-contractors. * Plan and order materials and plant to achieve programmes * Keep daily records of work carried out * Ensure that works proceed in accordance with site programmes * Ensure all plant on site is suitable for the task and conforms to current legislation * Ensure all work complies with quality, safety and environmental policies and the requirements of the company procedures. * Ensuring high quality standards are consistently met. * Experienced in day to day use of Electronics (phone, tablet, email etc.)&ldquo;An ideal opportunity for long term work across the Munster region, working on large infrastructure projects.&rdquo;The Package:This is a full-time, permanent position with a salary range of &euro;60,000 - &euro;70,000 + Vehicle + Fuel + excellent pension.The Breagh TeamBreagh Recruitment are the go to specialist construction and engineering recruitment consultants across the UK and Ireland, with an ethos based on flexibility, hard work and a bit of good old common sense. We live within these core values servicing our clients and candidates on a daily basis.Key roles we recruit for include: Design Engineers, Health &amp; Safety managers, project managers, construction managers, site engineers, quantity surveyors, civil engineers, estimators, buyers, bid managers and site supervisors, across Ireland and the UK

item.title: Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer
item.content: Company Details:An award winning company that practices and continually strives to provide award winning design and service to their clients. Garnered major awards from all of the Engineering Institutions which are evidence of their quality control, skill and customer service.An excellent opportunity has arisen for a Senior Mechanical Design Engineer to join this dynamic and developing consultancy. They have a great team environment and they nurture and develop their employees, so they can continuously develop their skills.This role would suit an ambitious and evolving Senior Mechanical Design Engineer who is open to bringing new ideas &amp; technologies and who is always ahead of curve.Responsibilities: * Lead Engineering Design and Design Management tasks on Projects as part of an integrated project team. * Design and specification of Mechanical Engineering Solutions to current regulations and design standards. * Work directly with clients and project engineers to define project requirements and develop technical solutions. * Lead Pre-Construction Engineering activities and the production of information including, design development, construction details, services coordination, technical submittals, sub-contracts, etc. * Provide technical support to the estimating, procurement, commercial, and project bid teams. * Provide off site technical support to construction teams on projects.Requirements: * Strong technical ability in all aspects of Mechanical Engineering Services &amp; Design. * Third level diploma / degree in Mechanical or Building Services Engineering. * 10 yrs + relevant experience, ideally in a design consultancy environment. * Knowledge &amp; experience of CIBSE an Ashrae Design Guides, Building Regs, EN Standards and IEC Standards. * Experience in Dialux &amp; Amtech. * Experience of client, vendor &amp; contractor interaction &amp; management. * Proactive, a good communicator with the ability to work well with others in a multi functional project team. * Excellent level of attention to detail and accuracy.If you&rsquo;re interested in this role, kindly forward an up-to-date copy of your CV in a word format to Rob

item.title: Senior Systems Administrator
item.content: My client a major multinational is currently recruiting for a Senior Systems Administrator to join their Technology team.Summary * Maintain and support locally installed infrastructure. * Technologist, subject matter expert and product owner for core technologies comprising European Technology Platforms landscape, with focus on those technologies used in the company. Expert knowledge of one/many technologies and good understanding of a range of others. To include: - * Server technologies and Operating systems, including VMWare, Windows Server, Unix/Linux * Storage (EMC and NetApp) and Backup technologies. * Directory and Access Management services, including Active Directory. * Network services, including WAN/SDWAN, LAN, WLAN * Responsible for relationship with technical SMEs in technology partners. * Support the creation and maintenance of strategies and roadmaps for technology platform services, in conjunction with Strategy / Enterprise Architecture and others. * Promote and assure adherence/alignment to technical standards. * Design and architecture for Technology Platform services. Define best practice approach for design and architecture and ensure services are designed, delivered and transitioned to a sustainable operating model. * Provide technical Subject matter expert level 3 support for incident, change and problem management processes to ensure service availability.Principal Responsibilities and Accountabilities * Be familiar with the architecture, technologies and devices employed throughout the Group&rsquo;s IT network, with particular focus on those technologies used in the company. * Work with the other Systems &amp; Network Administrators, and other IT personnel, as well as vendor representatives to assist in the on-going maintenance and development of the Group&rsquo;s IT infrastructure. * Participate in the evaluation, recommendation, and selection of hardware and software solutions. * Assist in ensuring that the Group&rsquo;s network and systems are at no time exposed to access by unauthorised users. * Assist in the efficient management of disk space available on all networked systems, monitor disk utilisation, and make timely recommendations for the deployment of storage resources. * Be an active resource in the thorough testing, installation and configuration of new systems software and hardware versions and components. * Be actively engaged in troubleshooting, and liaising with third party technicians in fault determination and efficient problem fixing as and when required. * Be involved in systems development projects from time to time as directed by IT Management * Continuing self-development in the area of technical network expertise and developments in IT generally.Knowledge and SkillsRequired * Strong VMware Experience. * Linux/Unix Administration skills. * Windows &amp; Active Directory administration skills. * Strong networking &amp; security skills, preferably Cisco. * Storage Area Network experience, preferably EMC &amp; NetApp. * Excellent documentation and communications skills. * Experience working in a medium-large enterprise.Desirable * Certification in multiple relevant technologies, to demonstrate experience and capability to expert level. * Certification in ITIL. * Experience in managing vendors and service providers

item.title: Trainee Field Service Engineer
item.content: Do you have a strong interest for electromechanics? Are you fascinated with repairing, servicing and see how things work? Would you love to work for a market leader within the white goods industry as a Field Service Engineer?The Concept Academy are hiring Trainee Engineers to join a market leader of large domestic appliances such as washing machines, refrigerators, dishwashers, cookers &amp; tumble dryers.Who are we looking for?We are seeking keen individuals with a willingness to learn that would love to get hands on within a new industry. You will have a passion within electromechanicals with basic experience also being advantageous. Other qualifying areas or experience that may be considered are ; vehicle maintenance, coffee machines, vending machines, ticket machines, parking machines, washing machines, tumble dryers, dishwashers, microwaves fridges etc.It is important that you are able to demonstrate;Fantastic customer service skillsEnergetic, driven &amp; great attention to detailEagerness to learnProblem solving in difficult situationsGood oral and written communication skillsLong term goal to be trained as a competent engineer Our training academyFully comprehensive training including classroom, workshop and theory4 week training course in Dublin starting on 1st February then a further 2 weeks shadowing a Senior Engineer within the field.This will require you to stay overnight within the week and go home on weekends during training Life after trainingYou have completed your 4 week training, you have a shiny new van, tools and parts all loaded, you&#39;re ready to go &hellip; so what&#39;s next?Service repair and maintenance within domestic settings on a range of domestic appliancesMonitor and maintain adequate stock levelsCompleting service calls via PDAMonthly one to ones with Regional Supervisor &amp; Team quarterly meetingsOngoing training and skill set monitoringAiming for first time fix rateDay to day updates via Coordination TeamThis role is homebased, to be considered for the Limerick area, it is essential that you live within 40 miles of the city centre What&#39;s on offer?&euro;26,000 per annum&euro;1,000 salary increase after 6 monthsVan &amp; fuel cardComprehensive training courses direct from manufacturer followed by 2 week shadowing on the field.20 days holiday + bank holidaysPayable through an umbrella companyQuarterly engineer reward schemeAccess to PerkboxThis is an ongoing training contract &amp; you will have the opportunity to be made permanent (based on performance)Uniform, Tools, test equipment, footwear, PPE, face masks, hand sanitiser provided The EssentialsStrong interest in an engineering disciplineFull Driving LicenseRight to work in IrelandMust be over 21 years oldAppropriate delivery point for a courier to have 24/7 access to deliver stock e.g. (garage, storage unit, ideally 50 sq foot) is essentialGood written &amp; excellent verbal communication skills across all levelsGood time management and organisation skillsMust be able to pass relevant security vetting.Happy to stay away from home training at Head OfficeConfident using Android devices What is the interview process?Initial telephone screening to discuss background, training academy &amp; the roleVideo call with Service Delivery Coordinator competency based / technical questionsFace to face / video interview with Service Delivery ManagerThis would be a fantastic role for a trainee who wants to become a field service engineer and learn a new industry. We are recruiting heavily over the next year, so if you don&#39;t see a vacancy within your area, but you want to register your interest, please email your CV with the subject - Academy Engineer Interest

item.title: Joist Designer (Timber Frame)
item.content: Joist DesignerEuro Executive Recruitment has been retained to recruit a Joist Designer for a leading manufacturing company based in Longford or Arklow. Reporting to the Head of Timber Frame, the successful candidate will be responsible for the design of Metal Web Joists for residential buildings, timber frame and concrete build structures while working closely with the client, client representatives and internal production team.Responsibilities: * Estimating: Complete Joist design layout and quotation from enquiries and existing customers * Enquiry Call Backs: Complete follow up phone calls/correspondence on quotations issued to win the contract * Design: Using dimensions from site or from architect&rsquo;s plans design the joist layout for client approval for manufacture. * Manufacture: Creating accurate production drawings and site issue drawings. * Prepare material schedules, providing technical specialist information where required. * Liaising with client design team in relation to live projects * Assist in general day to day running of the design office. * Liaising with the estimating team in the production of estimates, coordinating and distributing design information to the production coordinator. * Manage all technical questions and queries from internal and external stakeholders. * Coordinate and manage all design amendments in line with construction drawings, legislative requirements and customer specifications.Essential Skills &amp; Experience * Residential Construction experience * Proficient in AutoCAD software. * Ability to read and understand architectural/engineering drawings. * Experience of timber engineering software - Wolf Systems, MiTek, ITW Alpine or Gangnail software * Familiar with Microsoft Office suite of products. * Strong analytic/problem-solving skills. * Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment. * Dependable, flexible * Strong technical understanding of Timber Frame design, manufacture and supply. * Flexible approach to working. * Enthusiastic &amp; self-motivated

item.title: Document Controllers - QA
item.content: Headcount Solutions is seeking 5 Document Controllers to join our team in providing document control support on pharma / medical device projects.These Coordinators will provide support in the area of document control processes and systems, document archiving and ancillary support processes and systems.Principal Responsibilities: * Reconcile and file documents returned for archiving * Maintain document repositories and archive * Create certified copies of documents, including scanning and management of related workflows * Assist with tasks in relation to the moving of documents to offsite storage location * Preparation of controlled documents following standard procedures * Coordinate review and revision of controlled documents * Review documents for accuracy and completeness while maintaining document workflows * Provide guidance to users in correct use of document management systems to ensure consistency of system usageEducation and Experience: * BS/BA preferred with 2+ years relevant work experience to support responsibilities of position. * Additional related work experience will be substituted for educational requirement.For further information please contact Michael McElduff on (phone number removed) or forward details in confidence to jobs@headcount.ie

item.title: Python Software Engineer (SRE)
item.content: Python Software Engineer (SRE) This role will sit on the development side of my clients infrastructure reliability department. The primary responsibility will be focused on back-end python development with some movement over time towards front end (React) or data analysis. My client operate in the global financial markets and this role will play a crucial role in ensuring any infrastructure issues are solved and automated as quickly as possible. You&#39;ll be working on large scale projects focusing around latency, monitoring and other crucial issues whilst also keeping a key focus on automation. The ideal candidate will be someone from a python engineering background with experience developing production APIs in Python. They will also be interested in exploring React and Data analytics to deliver end to end solutions within my clients infrastructure environment. There will be a clear career path with excellent opportunities for training and progression. Desired Skills/Experience: 1-3 years hands on python experience. Exposure to React. Experience with Docker/Kubernetes. Exposure to AWS environments. Experience with CI/CD pipelines. Exposure to Kafka/Spark would be a big bonus!If this sounds like the right role for you, send across your CV immediately or contact Adam Whitehurst at Reperio for more information! item.title: Radiographer - Mammographer
item.content: The company: * Our client is a leading provider of high quality Diagnostic Imaging across Europe. They invest heavily in the technology and their people to ensure that they retain a highly qualified and competent team. Their mission is to carry out screening tests and identify those with a risk marker for a disease and ensure early treatment. Being part of this team is not just about doing a good job, it is about saving lives and everyone that works for this company share the same passionate team spirit.The position:Key responsibilities include: * Demonstrate competent knowledge, expertise and skill in delivering consistently high quality mammography images with optimal client care and safety, and working within established guidelines. * Promote a message of a caring, friendly and professional client-centred service for breast screening. * Lead in the provision of radiography services in a professional manner thereby upholding the reputation of the department and the service. * Participate in quality and service improvement activities to continuously improve patient/client care, including the development of clinical practices, procedures and protocols within the work environment. * Establish and maintain the standards for quality improvement and ensure adherence to existing standards and policies. * Qualifications / ExperienceEssential * CORU Registered * Have successfully completed a BSc or Diploma in Diagnostic Radiography * Certificate Of Competence in Mammography would be an added advantage * Strong leadership and management skills and excellent interpersonal and communication skills * 3 years fulltime (or an aggregate of 3 years) post qualification clinical experience.Desirable traits * Excellent communication skills, team working skills and technical ability. * Someone who has a patient-focused attitude ensuring that patient care is delivered to the highest standards of quality and efficiencyHow to applySend your recent CV in word doc formatFor suitable candidates, you will receive an email containing the Initial Questions

item.title: Senior QC Microbiology
item.content: My Client a Global biopharmaceutical company are looking to hire a Senior QC Microbiology. This is a 11 month contract.As a QC Microbiology, you will be responsible for one or more of the following activities in QC including microbiological testing, method transfers and verification, sample and data management and equipment maintenance. This role is for an experienced and technically strong associate who will spend 90% of their work day performing testing.As a QC Microbiology, you will contribute to team by ensuring the quality of the tasks/services provided and contribute to the completion of milestones associated with specific projects or activities within team. This role will support manufacturing operations, as such some extended hours, shift and weekend work may be necessary as required.Responsibilities:Endotoxin testing of water, in-process and drug product release samplesBioburden testing of water &amp; in-process drug product samplesSterility testingWater samplingLab Support duties such as Biological Indicator testing, Growth Promotion, Media Preparation, Identifications and Autoclave.Writing technical reportPerform analytical testing as a main priority with efficiency and accuracyPlan and perform multiple, complex routine/ non-routine methods and procedures and a large variety of assays.Report, evaluate, back-up/archive, trend and approve analytical data.Troubleshoot, solve problems and communicate with stakeholders.Initiate and/or implement changes in controlled documents.Participate in audits, initiatives, and projects that may be departmental or organizational in scopeWrite protocols and perform assay validation and equipment qualification/verification.Introduce new techniques to the lab, including method transfers, reports, validations and protocols.Evaluate lab practices for compliance and operational excellence improvement on a continuous basis.Approve lab resultsparticipate in lab investigations.ExperienceBachelors degree in a science disciplineBiopharmaceutical QC experience in a microbiology labExperience with regulatory compliance in cGMP manufacturing and testing of pharmaceutical productsExperience in a wide variety of microbiological techniques, including but not limited to Bioburden, Endotoxin, Sterility (in an Isolator), Environmental Monitoring, Rapid Micro techniques, Microbial Identification, Media prep, Water Sampling.Understanding and application of principles, concepts, theories and standards of GMP QC microbiology laboratories. Deepens technical knowledge through exposure and continuous learningKnowledge of related regulatory/industry considerations, compliance issues and/or scientific discovery Skillso Strong Technical writing skills for GMP documentation (e.g. investigations, procedures, change controls)Technically strong background in microbiology and aseptic manufacturingExperience in LIMS, Change Control, Trackwise, SAP and CDOCS an advantageFlexibility - the role often encounters changing priorities (also required to work weekend on call - Rota system)Experience with Regulatory inspectors and interacting with inspectors desirableDemonstrated ability to work independently and deliver right first time resultsTake initiative to identify and drive improvementsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsPreferred QualificationsExperience working in endotoxin, bioburden or sterility testingProficient in GMP systems such as LIMS Labware &amp; LMESIf you feel the above is something you would be interested in hearing more about, please get in touch with me today by applying today with your most up to date CV and I will be in touch very soon for a confidential discussion.Please click to find out more about our Key Information Documents. Please note that the documents provided contain generic information. If we are successful in finding you an assignment, you will receive a Key Information Document which will be specific to the vendor set-up you have chosen and your placement.To find out more about Computer Futures please visit Computer Futures, a trading division of SThree Partnership LLP is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy | Registered office | 1st Floor, 75 King William Street, London, EC4N 7BE, United Kingdom | Partnership Number | OC(phone number removed) England and Wales

item.title: Service Manager
item.content: The Opportunity:Due to continued growth and success, a major leader in the security and automation arena is looking to appoint a service manager, you will have a strong engineering background, including installation of Intruder Alarms, CCTV, Access Control, Door and Gate Automation.The service manager will in time be reporting directly to the owner, so it is imperative the service manager can operate at this level or quickly grow into the role. Established in the 1980s and is the largest security company in the area, registered with the Private Security Authority and Installs to the NSAI standards.The business is based on providing quality Installations followed by providing maintenance and monitoring contracts, operating out of two offices which currently have a team of 17, this is expected to grow in the immediate future.Job Description * The day to day running of the service department * Planning and Scheduling all work * Arranging an efficient work process to ensure sales margins are achieved * Managing both site and workshop engineering processes * Managing Breakdowns and Emergencies * Ordering of stock and ensuring efficient delivery to site * Processing of Purchasing orders Using in house EZ management system. * Management of all engineers Hours, Paperwork, Performance, and quality of installations * Preparing quotations for repair work * Complying with all Health and safety legislation, Risk Assessments, Safe systems of work, PSA installation regulations and NSAI standards. * Weekly reports to management.The Person:You may have worked as a service coordinator/project manager and looking to take that next step, or as a security engineer and want to come away from the tools into a service manager&#39;s role.Essential: * A highly qualified candidate with high-level security installation experience &amp; technical background from within the security industry. * PSA membership essential along with current Garda Vetting. * The essential requirement is knowledge of the main manufacturers, product ranges and installation/ maintenance standards and best practices. * Experienced running a service department and planning all scheduled works a distinct advantage * Costing &amp; quoting or surveying jobs * Experience of managing engineers * Knowledge of quoting for all types of security equipment.Benefits Package: * A basic salary that reflects your experience, talent and value * Performance Bonus * Company vehicle fully expensed with agreed allowance for private mileage * 20 days annual leave * Laptop and mobile telephone are provided. * Contributory pension after 1 years&rsquo; service * Excellent company working practices * Training &amp; development opportunities, to progress your skills in other areas of the businessTo apply for this role or to be considered for future roles, please call our recruitment team, upload or forward your CV and someone will be in touch shortly

item.title: Automation Technical Lead
item.content: About the Role:Zenith Technologies is looking to hire Automation Technical Lead who will be responsible of overall coordination of applications on site of our global biotech client in Dublin West. Reporting to the overall Automation Manager, the successful candidate will be responsible for the integration of Level 2 and Level 3 systems (DeltaV, OEM, PI, MES).Contract duration: This role is initially 6 months in duration with the potential of being a longer term.Responsibilities: * Project execution plan * Day to day management of system integrator * Allocation of weekly objectives against project schedule * Definition of Data Integrity Strategy * Preparation for Request for Proposal to PAS suppliers * Preparation of Functional Requirement SpecificationsQualifications &amp; Requirements: * Proven experience as an Automation Lead in a Pharma/Biotech environment * Experience designing, implementing and supporting automation solutions for clients in the Pharmaceutical and/or Biotechnology industries * Excellent knowledge of DCS (Emerson DeltaV), MES, OSI-PI, PLCs systems * Good knowledge of GAMP lifecycle and quality management processes employed in the pharmaceutical sector * Leadership abilities, works well in a team environment * Excellent communication skills * Self-starter who can get the job done despite obstacles * Requires a Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or foreign equivalent in Chemical, Electrical or Bio-Process Engineering, or related field*Further details on role available to short listed candidates**Shortlisted applicants who fit the requirements outlined above will be contacted for screen call before being presented to Engineering Management and / or client for technical consideration

item.title: Garage Supervisor/Foreman
item.content: Job DescriptionAbout UsKeegan group is a well-established, leading supplier of high quality construction products within Ireland and the UK. We began by producing ready mix concrete and have now expanded into concrete block manufacturing, precast wall and floor manufacturing and most recently producing calcium carbonate.We supply our quarry products to customers in the commercial and domestic markets around Dublin, Meath, Kildare, Offaly and Louth. Our precast is supplied all over the UK and Ireland and our calcium carbonate is supplied to feed mills all over Ireland.We are currently seeking a Garage Supervisor/Foreman to join our expanding team at our head office in Trammon, Rathmolyon, Co. Meath, which is home to our Limestone Quarry, our Precast design department, state of the art precast manufacturing plant, concrete block plant, concrete batching plant and lime plant.This is a rare opportunity to join a well-established leading construction company outside of Dublin and would be ideal for anyone seeking to reduce their daily commute.The RoleWe are seeking a Garage Supervisor/Foreman to take control of the maintenance of our fleet of lorries and machines.Reporting directly to the Managing Director your duties would include the following: * Manage all routine maintenance operations of the fleet. * Manage a team of mechanics ensuring that the relevant procedures are adhered to at all times. * Ensure timely execution of all maintenance activities ensuring that all lorries/machinery are returned to service in a timely manner and to the required standard. * Maintain vehicles records by recording services, repairs and inspection checks. * Replenishment of parts ensuring that there is adequate stock to meet all maintenance requirements. * Ensure that all health and safety requirements are being adhered to in the garage. * Other ad-hoc duties as they ariseRequirements * Mechanic/Fitter background * Experience in a similar role * Self-starter * Good IT skillsJob Types: Full-time, Permanent

item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Trainee IT Security Engineer
item.content: Trainee IT Security Engineer- No Experience RequiredAre you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Cyber Security Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee upon completion.Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps, you can be placed into your first role in as little as 8-12 weeks:Step 1 - Online TrainingThe first step is completing a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised IT Support courses by CompTIA, Microsoft and Cisco. The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study from home. You will also be assigned an expert tutor to help you throughout your training.Step 2 &ndash; Practical TrainingYou will gain the practical experience by using our cutting edge Livelabs. Gaining hands-on experience is essential in today&rsquo;s IT industry for both certifications and keeping up to date with new technologies. Theory is often not enough these days, companies require hands on practical experience to make sure you&#39;re job ready.Step 3 &ndash; Official examsYou will then go on to sit the CompTIA A+ exams to give you the official certifications which will be recognised worldwide. The CompTIA A+ is the most commonly asked for certificate in entry level IT roles.Step 4 &ndash; IT Technician placementYou will be placed into your first role as an IT Technician. You will need to gain two years experience in this role before you can progress into a cyber security analyst role. While working as an IT Technician, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to move into the cyber security field. This will consist of online training, practical training and an official exam.Cyber Security RoleOnce you have completed all of the mandatory training in step four and have the required two years experience in the IT industry, you will be ready to move into your Cyber Security Analyst role. We have partnered with a number of large IT companies who have a massive shortage of qualified cyber security staff.At a one off cost of &pound;945, or 8 monthly payments of &pound;137, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.Read through the information? Passionate about starting a career in IT? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.&lsquo;Please note that this is a training course and fees apply

item.title: Facilities Manager
item.content: Facilities Manager&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Dublin Up to &euro;70,000 plus bonus and benefits &nbsp;&nbsp; Are you an experienced Facilities Manager who has managed high-profile IFM sites? Are you ambitious and motivated by helping your team succeed? Interested in working for a business who are a world leader in their field? If this sounds like you, we want to speak with you! Boden Group are working with a global Facilities Management and outsourcing business, who are looking for a Facilities Manager to oversee a prestigious client site in West Dublin. The successful candidate will be an established manager with a background in technical services. You&rsquo;ll need to be experienced managing large multi-discipline teams (c. 100 staff), with a people-focused approach to management. Experience in FMCG or pharmaceuticals would be great but not essential.Key Duties and Responsibilities: Leading the day-to-day delivery of all Integrated Facilities Management operations &ndash; including planned and reactive maintenance, catering, cleaning and landscaping &ndash; across a busy client site. Delivering against the contractual financial and operational targets, managing budgets and financial forecasting for the coming year. Leading the team by example, developing staff and ensuring they are performing to the best of their ability. Identifying opportunities for development and ensuring the team have all relevant training to carry out their jobs correctly. Strategic management of the account, ensuring plans are set up to deliver against strategic goals and outcomes. Identifying new opportunities for growth and expansion of the account. Liaising closely with the client and key stakeholders, providing expert advice and building strong working relationships. Delivering and maintaining excellent standards of Risk, Compliance and Quality Management, in line with contract KPIs and Service Level Agreement. &nbsp;&nbsp; What you&rsquo;ll need to succeed: Demonstrable experience in a management role, across both hard and soft services, within the FM industry. Experience managing a high-profile, multi-million &euro; P&amp;L contract, with responsibility for budget and profitability. Relevant qualifications in Facilities Management, Engineering or Technical Services would be an advantage. Familiarity with pharmaceutical, FMCG or GMP processes. Experience leading Facilities Management projects from start to finish. Able to liaise with colleagues and clients to manage relationships at all levels. Strong knowledge of SHE processes and Irish Health &amp; Safety legislation. Health &amp; Safety Qualifications (IOSH/NEBOSH) or IWFM/CIBSE membership would be an advantage. &nbsp;&nbsp; If you&#39;re interested in this role, please apply via this advert with your up-to-date CV. If this job isn&#39;t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position within Facilities Management in Ireland, please get in touch with Marlie at Boden Group for a confidential discussion about your next move

item.content: We have an immediate requirement for IT Laboratory Systems Engineer to provide IT support for Quality and Information Systems on site of our global biotech client based in Dublin.Responsibilities: * Manage any required contracts with vendors or third parties and ensure all parties are aware of their responsibilities * Manage Vendor and Staff Access requests. * Perform Annual User Access reviews and post vendor Maintenance Reviews. * Ensures that systems are robust, reliable and available to meet business demand * Ensures that systems are maintained in a compliant manner according to the quality system * Ensures systems have appropriate disaster recovery plans and processes including contingency plans * Troubleshoot Operating System and Software issues if required * Proactively engage with Quality and Laboratory teams to encourage the use of technology to maximize efficiency, capacity and reliability or operations * Develop innovative approaches to solve business challenges with current or new technology * Plan and execute Quality &amp; Laboratory information systems projects including the building configuration of PC&rsquo;s for use in a GLP environment according to GAMP 5 and CFR 21. * Coach system users in the complaint and efficient use of their systemsQualifications &amp; Requirements: * Bachelors&rsquo; degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or the Life Sciences. * Min of 3 years&rsquo; experience supporting Quality and/or Laboratory information systems in the biotechnology or pharmaceutical industries * Demonstrated experience in the delivery and management of information systems * Working knowledge of GAMP software development lifecycle, and appropriate development methodologies for information systems * Knowledge of technical diagrams, process flowcharting and project management using MS Office applications, including MS Project and MS Visio and similar applications * Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision * Technical, Project and interpersonal skills, including but not limited to the following: client interfacing and resolution of client concerns, project definition and business case development, proactive support and resolution of issues, technical guidance from concept to delivery, system delivery, commissioning and validation.*Further details on role available to short listed candidates**Shortlisted applicants who fit the requirements outlined above will be contacted for screen call before being presented to Engineering Management and / or client for technical considerationZenith Technologies, now a Cognizant Company is a world leader in delivering digital transformation solutions to Life Sciences. Through our knowledge and expertise in Automation, MES &amp; Digital, we deliver stable manufacturing systems that are optimised to improve operational efficiencies, whilst maintaining compliance. Our specialist engineering teams have the aptitude to deliver and support Pharma 4.0 architectures and solutions covering all IT, OT and IoT applications, infrastructures and services. Operating across 5 continents and with over 850 skilled employees, Zenith partners with the leading Life Sciences companies globally to provide performance improvements, reduced costs and improve time to market

item.title: Hiring Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Supplier Engineer
item.content: Supplier EngineerA leading medical device company located in Limerick is recruiting for a permanent Supplier Engineer to join their team. The primary function of this position is to manage the company&rsquo;s Irish suppliers and supplier changes, from an engineering perspective, and to lead opportunities for the reduction of cost, yield or quality improvements with existing or new vendors.Responsibilities&#149; Liaise with Sustaining Engineering, and other departments, to develop and introduce new products, components and processes in key supplier sites.&#149; In conjunction with Sustaining Engineering and Supplier Quality engineering, support and advise suppliers on validation requirements as necessary.&#149; Work with internal groups to review and assess the impact of supplier change requests, and responsibility for implementation and approval of same. Become an SME of supplier processes.&#149; Establish and develop good working relationships with the company&rsquo;s suppliers.&#149; Support the assessment of non-conforming raw materials received from suppliers.&#149; Liaise with Purchasing and Supplier Quality Engineering to improve the Quality Systems procedures relating to suppliers.&#149; Identify and capitalise on opportunities for the reduction of cost, yield or quality improvements with existing or new vendors, via process improvement or transfer.&#149; Assess current internal supplier processes to streamline and optimise.&#149; Liaise with the Purchasing group to identify new suppliers as needed.&#149; Liaise with Supplier Quality Engineering and Sustaining Engineering (CAPA) to ensure the effective completion of Supplier Corrective Actions (SCA&#39;s)&#149; Collaborate with Purchasing and Legal to ensure the development and implementation of effective supply agreements with suppliers.&#149; Ensure effective reporting to the Engineering Management team.&#149; Provide technical support and input when required to the Suppler Audit process.&#149; Liaise with supplier and regulatory to obtain the supplier related information required for regulatory submissions.&#149; Responsible for operating general internal quality systems and documentation.Experience&#149; Production/Engineering qualification and relevant experience in as least one of the following areas:&#149; Manufacturing, Engineering/Device Design &amp; Development/CAPA.&#149; Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate at all levels of the organisation.&#149; Strong knowledge of medical device quality standards ISO13485/FDA practices and GMP or similar regulated industry standards.&#149; Proven Project Management and problem-solving skills.&#149; Good computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft &reg; Office.&#149; Excellent organisational skills.&#149; High self-motivation.&#149; Willingness and availability to travel on company business.For further information on this Engineer role in Limerick, please contact Caroline Kingston on (phone number removed)/ caroline@hero.ieCheck out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website &ndash; item.title: Project Manager
item.content: Mechanical Project ManagerPermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose As Mechanical Project Manager you will be responsible for a number of construction projects across the Kirby mechanical business unit. The project manager plans, organises, leads, coordinates and controls all activities concerned with the construction of Mechanical Piping / HVAC Projects. The Project Manager participates in the conceptual development of an engineering construction project and leads its organization, scheduling and implementation. He/she is the key point of contact with the client and builds and creates strong, assertive and positive relationships. They ensure that the site meets and exceeds environmental, health and safety standards. They ensure a quality focus and quality outcomes so that the Kirby Group vision, mission &amp; values are fulfilled.&nbsp;Mechanical Project Manager Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; Project Start-Up: Arrange and chair handover of project from estimating department to construction team Liaise with OM in staffing of project Validate project and in doing so develop business plan, cost control system, cashflow and billable schedules, etc. As Project Manager you will be tasked with producing procurement plan, drawing / design plan, construction programme, s-curve and histogram Liaise with client and design team on procurement and engineering issues Develop project safety and quality plans Mobilise sub-contractors and labour in accordance with business plan Mobilise site establishment &nbsp; Project Running Phase: Agree a training plan for staff and operatives particular to your site in conjunction with the OM Manage your site team in the effective day to day running of site activities Ensure compliance with programme, materials deliveries and engineering, quality and safety issues Attend meetings with Clients Hold weekly progress meetings with sub-contractors and ensure that safety and training are discussed Ensure effective cost and sales control in conjunction with Q.S Advise client in good time of current sales plan Ensure productivity at work face is measured on a weekly basis also maintain project progress control Submit monthly internal reports to the OM &nbsp; Project Completion:&nbsp; Ensure testing and commissioning is carried out in accordance with the Quality Plan Ensure final design audit (if applicable) is carried out by the EM Complete and certify all &lsquo;life systems&rsquo; in good time for handover date Ensure all systems are demonstrated to Client and District Surveyor Handover O&amp;M manual and record drawings Prepare final account with the QS, submit and agree with client in line with company objective Demobilise site team and establishment in conjunction with the OM Produce a project close-out report and submit to the OM Archive project Maintain contact with client for warranty period and thereafter when retention monies are collected &nbsp; Other Duties:&nbsp; Maintain a site / day book Attend and participate in monthly project managers meetings Develop your skills in line with agreed training plan Put forward idea&rsquo;s for continuous improvement of company Maintain contact with your client base Maintain excellent working relationships with the client from project start up to project completion &nbsp; &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Mechanical Project ManagerBuilding Services Engineer / Mechanical Engineer or Senior Trades qualification or equivalent Significant Project management experience 10 years+. Previous record of delivering small to medium mechanical pharmaceutical projects Pre-commissioning &amp; system turnover experience Piping/HVAC and building services experience Commercial Awareness Experience in Process Piping, BMS Systems, HVAC, Clean &amp; Dirty Utilities Piping, is desirable. Excellent communicator/strong interpersonal skills/communicates with impact Excellent record keeper and administration skills Drives for results Leads and influences others. Identifies and achieves commercial value. Innovates and leads in mechanical/technical activity and challenges. Plans and effectively manages projects. Solves problems analytically and acts decisively Mentor and Coach to junior engineers and graduates &nbsp; &nbsp; For more information on this Mechanical Project Manager/ Piping Project Manager position or other Mechanical Project Manager / Contracts Manager opportunities based in Galway/Connacht or elsewhere&nbsp;within Ireland or the UK contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence
