item.title: French and Dutch Customer Service Agent
item.content: Medical Information Agent (French and Dutch)Our client make a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that we do are our talented and motivated professionals, circa 500 of whom are based at our Global Business Solutions centre in Little Island, Cork. There we boast vibrant workforce made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.ResponsibilitiesThe role of a Medical Information Agent is to provide excellent and efficient Tier 1 Medical Information support to Healthcare professionals, patients and other customers &amp; to complete the relevant documentation for these queries. The customer queries are received either by telephone, email or web chat. The majority of queries for most markets are via telephone, thus primary responsibilities encompass phone coverage&middot; Manage customer queries regarding products/medical devices from healthcare professionals, patients and other customers in a courteous, professional manner with predefined answers/resources that are balanced, accurate and non-promotional. Escalations to product specialist may be required when the predefined answers do not answer queries.&middot; Log all queries received via email and assign accordingly between the Medical Information Agents and Analysts&middot; Accurate recording of all customer queries in the medical information database in a concise, thorough, and accurate manner in line with Good Documentation Practices.&middot; Identification of customer queries containing either Adverse Events/Product Quality Complaints and handle those in accordance with appropriate operating procedures.&middot; Maintain and enhance our clients product and organizational knowledge.&middot; Support global/regional Medical Information projects with a key focus on excellence &amp; knowledge, efficiency &amp; customer experience&middot; Support the overall Medical Information team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team members&middot; Ensure optimal Customer satisfactionSystems&middot; MS Office, Sales Force, Veeva&middot; Interaction Client Phone system&middot; Basic Qualifications Bachelors degree with relevant customer service experience. Business experience such as medical sales representative will also be considered.&middot; Fluency in French and Dutch&middot; Excellent active listening skills with effective verbal skills to respond to customers with a rational and empathetic manner&middot; Good time management skills&middot; Excellent written skills to succinctly, accurately and objectively respond to customer queriesAdditional Skills/Preferences&middot; Ability to proactively &amp; effectively analyze &amp; resolve problems&middot; Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables in a dynamic, evolving environment&middot; Able to respond succinctly, objectively, accurately and empathetically to customer needs, managing their expectations effectively&middot; Ability to work in regional/global team environment and communicate effectively with external customers and internal business partners of all levels &amp; disciplinesCompliance&middot; Demonstrate a strong compliance oriented mindset &amp; help to build a strong compliance culture&middot; Familiarise with all applicable policies, documentation &amp; training materials to ensure you operate in a fully compliant manner&middot; Ensure ownership for all applicable Operational controls for your area&middot; Support all investigations, monitoring and affiliate audits as required&middot; Ensure high levels of confidentiality to protect customer sensitive dataCustomer&middot; Demonstrate excellence in all interactions with our external customers &amp; GBS internal business partners&middot; Focus on measuring &amp; improving our customer&rsquo;s experience with the GBS&middot; Continuous Improvement&middot; Demonstrate a strong Continuous Improvement oriented approach &amp; help to build a strong Continuous Improvement culture&middot; Actively work with the core team members &amp; Regional/Global Medical Information team to drive improvements for processes

item.title: Senior Manager Clinical Trial
item.content: Our Client makes a difference for people the world over by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help people live longer, healthier and more active lives. Central to all that they do is their talented and motivated professionals, circa 800 of whom are based in Cork. There they boast vibrant workforce made up of over 44 nationalities, speaking over 27 languages.Purpose:The Clinical Development Senior Manager (CDM) is responsible for the recruitment, retention and resource assignment of the Consultants, Associates, and Assistants (study managers) managing trials in the Clinical Development (CD) organization. The CDM provides leadership, direction, and technical/ process expertise to the study managers. This position provides strategic input, focuses on results, thinks critically, and emphasizes and drives Clinical Design, Delivery, &amp; Analytics (CDDA) team collaboration to the achievement of goals and objectives. The CDM leads the clinical teams responsible for the execution and delivery of the clinical package. The CDM supports execution of the integrated clinical development plans (i.e. compound/indication-level) and clinical trial packages that are aligned with the asset team. To achieve this goal, the CDM uses their clinical development expertise and effectively partners with the Clinical Development Advisor (CDA), Asset Team and broader Clinical Design, Delivery, &amp; Analytics functions.Primary Responsibilities:People ManagementRecruit, develop, and retain a diverse and highly capable workforceEnsure robust individual training plans and timely completion of required training for direct reports.Support and enable talent identification and career development that reflects an end-to-end mindset and demonstrates judgement-based decision making.Ensure study manager competencies are present and continuously improving.Manage study manager workload based on portfolio prioritization, regional requirements, and individual level of expertise, and address implications to overall resource management and strategies.Supports and encourages a culture of innovation and the learning that comes from new/novel approaches to clinical development and models inclusivity to ensure diverse voices and ideas are heard and consideredServes as mentor for study managers and others in the CDDA.Clinical DeliveryAs applicable, support clinical development of assigned asset(s) from strategy and profile development through submission, inspection, approval and post-launch support.Demonstrate strong business acumen, problem-solving skills, and learning agility to help teams plan for contingencies, and adjust to change.Manage program-level activities including management of risk plans and oversight of budget planning, monitoring, and control, and supports the accountabilities of the CDAWorks closely with the CTPMs to ensure efficient and on-time execution of trials and enables aggregation / roll-up of key trial metrics to track the status of the portfolio.Understands and applies core project management capabilities, including impact chain methodology and usage of its functionality to manage program/trialPartners across the CDDA to ensure effective transition of the complete clinical trial package (scope, timeline, budget and risk management) through trial execution and clinical delivery.Manage global cross-functional communication and issue escalations to ensure alignment on delivery and execution.Utilize regulatory and process knowledge to drive decision-makingEstablishes and manages expectations of external partner relationships, performance and delivery (i.e. CRO, Alliances and Joint Ventures).Effective ManagementAlign CDDA resources based on portfolio prioritization while demonstrating flexibility across therapeutic areas.Ensure a compliance culture and state of inspection readiness of TMF records created, maintained and finalized by CD personnel.Models judgement-based decision making to navigate compliance and quality requirementsResponsible for continuous improvement and shared learning in the following clinical development areas: study development, start-up, delivery, maintenance, and close-out processes, and collaborates with process owners in the spirit of streamlining, efficiency, and effectiveness of conducting clinical trials and non-trial work.Requirements:Bachelors Degree, preferably in a scientific or health-related fieldPrevious experience, at least 5 years in a lead role in the pharmaceutical industry and/or clinical developmentMust understand clinical development processes and the interdependencies of various tasks that require coordination among cross-functional team members and third partiesDemonstrated core project management skills through management of complex/cross-functional projects, and/or clinical trials with a strong knowledge of regulations and guidelinesStrong communication skills; able to communicate clearly and succinctly with team members and leadershipMust be capable of managing staff virtually and across geographies/culturesProven ability to coach and develop others.Ability to embrace the diversity of thought to model innovative behaviors (e.g., reaching across boundaries, inspire and empower others and lead decisively in the midst of ambiguity)Other Information/Additional Preferences:Project Management certification (e.g., PMP)Prior experience in working with external business partners (e.g., CRO, Alliance, Joint Venture)Prior submission and inspection experiencePrior experience with the management of business plansStrong self-management and organizational skills; able to manage workload, set personal and team priorities and adjust as neededAble to influence others without direct authorityStrong item.title: Senior Quantity Surveyor - Electrical - Galway
item.content: Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor | GalwayPermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. &nbsp; Role Purpose The role of Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor will have you working across various contracts ensuring the maximum commercial benefit for the company and will entail a cradle to grave delivery from tender stage through to final accounts and all-encompassing duties in between. &nbsp; Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows:Skilled and budgeting, reporting, developing BOQ&rsquo;s, profit plans. Good communication skills. Undertake and manage interim commercial meetings with the Client and Internal Project Team. Report in detail as required for the Project Manager on the commercial status of the project. Manage subcontractor accounts, interim valuations and final accounts. Ensure payment certificates are processed and payments are made per the agreed sub-contract and procurement terms. Retentions apply as per agreements. As a member of the commercial team, the Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be tasked with administering the contract obligations and meet additional Client requirements. Issue interim and final accounts and progress applications per project and contract requirements. Monthly applications to be all inclusive of accurate remeasures, site changes, dayworks and any applicable contract claims. Identify escalations, material or labour, as appropriate. Ability to identify potential commercial risks and ensure prompt reporting of same to Senior Management. Follow direction of Senior Management in undertaking work duties. Have a practical understanding of scheduling and the associated commercial implications. Ensure close collaboration with Planning Engineer regarding accuracy of progress reporting. The Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be capable of costing and agreeing daily work changes to include managing the subcontractor remeasurement of contract works, site dayworks and site change orders. Maintain accurate records and provide necessary detailed backup to support commercial tracking and costing. Ability to work on own initiative and can prioritise without direction. Speed and accuracy of information a priority. Negotiate, as necessary, with clients or their representatives. Set an example of enthusiasm, loyalty and hard work in the performance of all duties. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Senior Electrical Quantity SurveyorMinimum 5+ years of Quantity surveying experience essential on Electrical Projects. 3rd level qualification in Construction Economics / Quantity Surveying ideally coupled with a technical background as either Electrician or Electrical Engineer Experience working on electrical value projects in-excess of &euro;4million within the data centre, pharmaceutical, industrial or commercial sectors. Proficient in excel. Detailed knowledge of commercial management and QS Role within construction Knowledge of contract conditions and their applications Overall understanding of the business, client and Sub Contractor relations, and installations Excellent Communication/Interpersonal Skills Excellent Record Keeping and Administration Skills Process driven and focused on EHS and Quality Work Management Systems and Processes &nbsp; &nbsp; For more information on this Senior Electrical Quantity Surveyor/ M&amp;E Quantity Surveyor position or other Senior Quantity Surveyor / MEP Quantity Surveyor opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Sales Executive
item.content: Military Autosource (MAS) are currently recruiting for sales positions in Germany and Italy. The positions are located on US military bases throughout the region. No previous experience necessary.Sales Representative - experienced and trainees.Is your current job standing in the way of achieving your goals? If you aren&#39;t where you feel you should be, then you owe it to yourself to explore a career with Military Autosource.The Role:The key purpose of the role is to understand and meet American military service members&rsquo; personal transportation needs and turn them into satisfied customers.All representatives undergo a world-renowned and extensive 3-6 month training programme, ensuring you are given the best opportunity and tools to develop into a highly successful Independent Sales Representative. You will be supported by a member of the Senior Sales Team who will mentor you to achieve success and offer you continual development throughout your career.We give all representatives a chance for personal and professional growth and potential management opportunities, as well as substantial financial rewards and incentives.The Candidate:We are looking for highly driven and passionate individuals who are looking for not just a job but a future career!Essential Criteria: * Due to the nature of the role, all successful candidates will have a valid British, Irish or EU passport and full driving license by start date * No previous criminal convictions * Be in a position to re-locate overseas within 4-6 weeksDoes this sound like you?If you are interested in working for an exciting and pioneering company, then this could be the role for you.All candidates must possess the following attributes to be considered: * Enthusiasm * Competitive * Ambitious * Hard working * Highly drivenWe will be in touch within 7-10 days to make you aware of the next steps.Salary: Guaranteed training allowance, followed by a great commission package with OTE in excess of &pound;45,000 with no upper limit.The Company:Military Autosource is the world-leading, exclusive distributor for many major car and motorcycle manufacturers, including Ford, Lincoln, Chrysler, Jeep, Dodge, Ram Trucks and Harley-Davidson operating throughout Europe and the Middle East. For over 50 years, MAS has been providing service directly to U.S. military personnel who are serving outside of the United States. Military personnel can order a brand new car, truck or motorcycle and take delivery either overseas or upon their return to the United States. This is considered a quality of life program by the U.S. military and is part of a Department of Defence program, which provides preferred pricing and exclusive guarantees to those serving their country.To apply for this position, please complete the short application form on our website by clicking the apply button below.Please Note: You don&#39;t need to fill out the work history section as we will obtain this information from your CV

item.title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist/Manager
item.content: We are seeking applications for an experienced Regulatory Affairs Manager for our client, who is a leading pharmaceutical company based in Athlone.Why you should apply: * This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing international company whose culture centres on making lives better. You would be working within a vibrant, entrepreneurial environment alongside passionate team members who share a vision to discover, develop &amp; commercialise pioneering technologies and solutionsWhat you will be doing: * Preparation and delivery of high-quality CMC regulatory submissions and submission management plans for global regulatory agencies. * Independently prepare regulatory assessments and contribute to global regulatory strategies for projects across all aspects of drug development or manufacturing lifecycle and work to support the product portfolio. * Serving as CMC representative on a core project(s), managing project activities, assessing regulatory risks &amp; development plans to develop global regulatory strategies. * Managing regulatory issues, maintaining submission information in relevant systems, tracking regulatory commitments &amp; timelines for specific projects/products/markets with minimal supervision. * Presenting and articulating issues for resolution, communicating regularly with key stakeholders to ensure alignment, providing consultation as a scientific/technical resource for assigned projects, mentoring and sharing experience with colleagues. * Authoring and/or coordinating submission activities for new registrations, post approval changes, renewals, annual reports and line extensions to meet filing requirements. Coordinating and contributing to responses to agency queries and performing quality review of regulatory submissions. * Maintenance of existing global regulatory approvals. * Prioritizing and independently completing assigned workload appropriately. * Developing effective relationships with local and global internal partners * Managing and contributing to regulatory affairs-related projects, initiatives and actions. * Mentoring colleagues within focused area of expertiseWhat you need to apply: * Bachelor&#39;s degree or equivalent/graduate degree preferred in a science (Biology, Chemistry, Pharmacy or related science) and/or technical discipline * Minimum of 3+ years of hands-on Regulatory/CMC authoring experience preferable (initial registrations or post-approval variations) * Advanced skills in written and oral communications are required * Computer literacy with Microsoft Office applications * Experience managing projects is preferable * Action and results-orientated to achievement of goals and objectives * Experience with leading and participating in several projects concurrently * Ability to accurately scope projects and consider the full impact of decisions and actions taken * Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to participate with cross functional teams in projects and innovation * Strong presentation skills, able to engage people in technologies, products &amp; services * Functional expert in regulatory affairs with a passion for excellence * Attention to detail and accuracy &ndash; essential * Manage personnel directly or indirectly to achieve the objectives of the applicable strategic project * Maintains direction &amp; focus through proactive planning &amp; organized approaches to work * Resilient to objections, pressure and change in a fast-moving industry

DOE)&nbsp;3D Personnel currently has&nbsp;vacancies for experienced Structures Foremen on civil projects in Ireland, UK and Europe.Our client is&nbsp;a leading civil engineering main contractor with an extensive portfolio delivering some of the most complex&nbsp;civils projects nationwide and beyond.Responsibilities:Liaise with the Project/Construction Manager, Sub Agent, Engineers, for the plant and material requirements for the week/day. He/she will act on the surveillance report received from the Safety Consultants, where corrective action is required.&nbsp;Ensure materials are delivered to the right location, on time, and inspect/arrange inspection of materials for compliance to specification, drawings or instructions prior to incorporation into the works. He/she may seek assistance from the technical staff for this purpose.The Structures Foreman will be aware of contract programme, work procedures and method statements to ensure compliance.&nbsp; &nbsp;The Structures Foreman will provide input for &lsquo;fine tuning&#39; of procedures, instructions, method statements etc. to reflect current practices and safe working methods. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose As Electrical Project Manager you will be responsible for a number of construction projects across the Kirby Electrical Business Unit. The Project Manager plans, organises, leads, coordinates and controls all activities concerned with the construction of Electrical (LV, MV &amp; HV) Projects. The Project Manager participates in the conceptual development of an engineering construction project and leads its organization, scheduling and implementation. He/she is the key point of contact with the client and builds and creates strong, assertive and positive relationships. They ensure that the site meets and exceeds environmental, health and safety standards. They ensure a quality focus and quality outcomes so that the Kirby Group vision, mission &amp; values are fulfilled.&nbsp;Electrical Project Manager Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; Project Start-Up: Arrange and chair handover of project from estimating department to construction team Liaise with OM in staffing of project Validate project and in doing so develop business plan, cost control system, cashflow and billable schedules, etc. As Project Manager you will be tasked with producing procurement plan, drawing / design plan, construction programme, s-curve and histogram Liaise with client and design team on procurement and engineering issues Develop project safety and quality plans Mobilise sub-contractors and labour in accordance with business plan Mobilise site establishment &nbsp; Project Running Phase: Agree a training plan for staff and operatives particular to your site in conjunction with the OM Manage your site team in the effective day to day running of site activities Ensure compliance with programme, materials deliveries and engineering, quality and safety issues Attend meetings with Clients Hold weekly progress meetings with sub-contractors and ensure that safety and training are discussed Ensure effective cost and sales control in conjunction with Q.S Advise client in good time of current sales plan Ensure productivity at work face is measured on a weekly basis also maintain project progress control Submit monthly internal reports to the OM &nbsp; Project Completion:&nbsp; Ensure testing and commissioning is carried out in accordance with the Quality Plan Ensure final design audit (if applicable) is carried out by the EM Complete and certify all &lsquo;life systems&rsquo; in good time for handover date Ensure all systems are demonstrated to Client and District Surveyor Handover O&amp;M manual and record drawings Prepare final account with the QS, submit and agree with client in line with company objective Demobilise site team and establishment in conjunction with the OM Produce a project close-out report and submit to the OM Archive project Maintain contact with client for warranty period and thereafter when retention monies are collected &nbsp; Other Duties:&nbsp; Maintain a site / day book Attend and participate in monthly project managers meetings Develop your skills in line with agreed training plan Put forward idea&rsquo;s for continuous improvement of company Maintain contact with your client base Maintain excellent working relationships with the client from project start up to project completion &nbsp; &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Project Manager3rd level qualification in Electrical Engineering, Building Services Engineering or Strong Trades background. You will ideally possess 10+ years relevant experience in a similar role of which the last 2-3 years have been on Data Centre environments. Experience working on large data centre/Pharmaceutical/Industrial project environments working under main contractor Worked as the P.S.C.S. (main contractor) Detailed knowledge of the Project Manager role Detailed knowledge of Engineering Commercial knowledge and understanding Health, Safety and Environmental systems and procedures Ability to juggle and manage many priorities Ability to plan and programme Prioritise and allocate time according to priority Assess relative risk and allocate time according Lead and motivate the team Manage performance: monitor, give feedback, and confront issues. Effective communication skills Ability to estimate Using resources at disposal to best effect Desired Competencies / Special Role Requirements Data Centre experience required &nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Project Manager/ M&amp;E Project Manager position or other Electrical Project Manager / Contracts Manager opportunities based in Ireland, UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Project Manager in Clinical Trial English & 2nd EU language
item.content: Associate Clinical Trial Project ManagerResponsibilitiesThe Clinical Trial Project Manager (CTPM) Associate leads the cross-functional study team in the development and execution of clinical trials and is accountable both regionally and globally to deliver trial(s) with quality, on time, and within scope and budget. The CTPM Associate leverages project management, regional operational knowledge, clinical trial process leadership and expertise, and scientific expertise to drive actions and coordinate efforts to achieve or exceed these trial deliverables.Primary Responsibilities: This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the job requirements at the time it was prepared. The job requirements of any position may change over time and may include additional responsibilities not specifically described in the job description. Consult with your supervision regarding your actual job responsibilities and any related duties that may be required for the position.Project Management and Regional Operational Knowledge&middot; Use project management skills, processes and tools to develop and execute local, regional and/or global clinical trials as described below:&middot; Scope - Understand the scope of work required to complete the clinical trial successfully. Monitor the status and make changes (per change control process) as needed to meet the deliverables of the trial.&middot; Timeline &ndash; Develop and track global trial enrollment plan by gaining alignment and integrating inputs across functions and geographies.&middot; Risk - Assess, identify and monitor trial-level risks. Incorporate scientific knowledge, trial process, and regional expertise to create one integrated trial-level risk mitigation and contingency plan.&middot; Budget - Understand the cross-functional, trial-level budget components. Create and monitor the overall budget and assumptions using financial tracking tools. Routinely network with appropriate business partners, on trial-level budget status and changes.&middot; Partner with other organizations to coordinate and actively participate in affiliate, site, and investigator training&middot; Drive and coordinate local, regional and global, cross-functional study team throughout study implementation, execution, and closure, empowering them to meet the clinical trial deliverables, including issue management, contingency planning and issue resolution.&middot; Be accountable for trial/regional enrollment strategy and execution starting from country allocation through Last Patient Entered Treatment (LPET).&middot; Manage relationships and serve as a single point of contact and central owner for trial communication to and from the Clinical Development, CDDA, and Third Party Organization (TPOs).&middot; Apply problem-solving skills to daily issues with cross-functional study team (including with vendors, affiliates/regions, global team members and other business partners).&middot; Identify and assist in developing continuous improvement activities based on important trends such as industry, regulatory, new technology, etc.&middot; Manage TPO qualification process, selection, and oversight.Clinical Trial Process Leadership and Expertise&middot; Demonstrate understanding of drug development process. Acknowledge inter-relatedness of cross-functional activities and understand the impact of project decisions on the overall clinical trial. Look for opportunities to expand and deepen clinical trial process expertise.&middot; Be knowledgeable of the global and regional operating model; coordinate and facilitate geographic and functional input to provide to the study teams.&middot; Accountable for ensuring a state of inspection readiness of the TMF records created, maintained, finalized, and owned by Clinical Development&middot; Network and leverage expertise to anticipate trial and regional issues, identify areas of process breakdown, assess situations and propose proactive approaches that reduce and/or mitigate risks that impact ability to deliver the clinical trial.&middot; Demonstrate ability to lead and influence in the midst of ambiguity and coach peers, cross-functional team members and TPOs on aspects of clinical trial process and regional specificities.&middot; Report, manage and interpret information for the clinical trial(s), including completeness and accuracy across multiple business systems and tools from study implementation through closure.&middot; Apply expertise and knowledge of global/regional regulations, Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and standards of operation in the conduct of clinical trials. Liaise with affiliates and other appropriate resources to understand local regulatory requirements.\Scientific Expertise&middot; Leverage scientific and regulatory knowledge to prepare and/or provide technical consultation for clinical and regulatory documents, prepare for meetings with regulatory agencies and draft responses to questions from regulatory agencies, TPOs and affiliates.&middot; Combine scientific, regional, and operational knowledge as well as process expertise to impact clinical trial design, feasibility and implementation.&middot; Utilize clinical development knowledge, problem solving and critical thinking skills to support the scientific needs of the business.Basic QualificationsBachelors or University degree (scientific or health-related field preferred) or an advanced degree.Additional Skills/Preferences&middot; Applied knowledge of project management methodology, processes and tools&middot; Demonstrated ability to work cross-culturally with global colleagues and with TPOs&middot; Ability to influence without authority&middot; Strong leadership and networking skills exhibited while working in cross-functional and cross-cultural teams (internal &amp; external) and on projects&middot; Effective and influential communication, self-management, and organizational skills&middot; Demonstrated ability to manage complex situations through problem-solving, critical thinking and navigating ambiguity&middot; Flexibility to adjust to altered priorities&middot; Clinical trial experience with a strong working knowledge of the clinical research process.&middot; Proficiency in use of project management tools and techniques (e.g., Critical Chain, MS Project, MS, Excel, MS Powerpoint)&middot; Ability to travel periodically

item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Mechanical Project Engineer
item.content: We are currently looking to support our client with a contract requirement for a Mechanical Project Engineer to be based in the Republic of Ireland - Dublin 12 - but with frequent travel requirement supporting gas facilities and customer sites across the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland. This will be on a 12 month contract basis starting in early January 2021. Further extensions are likely but cannot be confirmed at this stage.A standard description is given below - but candidates should be Degree qualified in Mechanical or Chemical engineering, plus a Chartered engineer (or working towards Chartered qualification). Due to the travelling nature of the role, candidates living in Ireland would be highly preferred.They must possess evidenced project management skills, engineering background, and experience of onsite work. Preferred background - Oil and Gas, Pharmaceutical industries, Cryogenics.The Candidate will be working autonomously in Ireland, with the support of the UK based team, and will manage projects to set budgets and timeframes - around 15-20 projects currently).Rates have not been stated and candidates will need to provide their negotiable expectations given the current coronavirus pandemic and difficult market circumstances. If this role could interest please contact me with an updated copy of your CV and information on your availability and day rate expectations (10 hours) in Euros.Work schedule: basic 5 days per week (10 hours per day), must be flexibleII. POSITION SUMMARYThe UK&amp;I Senior Project Engineer is part of a team responsible for the financial and technical delivery of all allocated project activities associated with the customer engineering business product offerings. This will include, food, industrial and medical grade installations of cryogenics tanks 2000L upwards, typically in N2, Argon, CO2, O2 and H2 service and all associated gas control/application equipment including but not limited to food-freezing tunnels, gas generators, and medical panels.This responsibility includes the control of design, installation and commissioning of pressure systems and ancillary equipment provided within the scope of Air Products commercial contractual terms in line with all current quality, safety, prevailing statutory and all other company Procedural requirements.Responsibility for this role also extends to budget management for all allocated project activities using SAP as well as maintenance of any performance / KPI&#39;s set for the project. The senior project engineer will also take the lead with respect to allocated projects for adherence to, maintenance of and where appropriate actively driving the safety culture during installation as required to meet the business requirements. They must also ensure that all activities are undertaken in compliance to both company standards and those national statutes that apply as well as adherence to quality and service standards required by the business.Success in the role will require clear direction, planning and maintenance of key relationships with the IG UK&amp;I safety, regional services, logistics and commercial representatives to ensure delivery of the most operationally suited solutions.PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIESThis position is accountable for:1. Effective and efficient management of projects allocated in support of core engineering products within the UK&amp;I business, generally liquid installations of 2000L tanks and above H2, Food &amp; Cryogenics and GGG.2. Ensuring effective development for and communication of functional objectives and performance to meet or exceed commercial needs.3. To proactively review and challenge the business processes utilized to manage and deliver the core engineering offerings, ensuring these processes deliver optimal solutions.4. The safety performance of all allocated projects to maintain and develop the commitment to improve and embrace Company safety approach and culture.5. Direct support to the UK&amp;I IJ Major project team lead of the financial performance of the project engineering department core functions in line with budgeted requirements.6. The execution as required of projects contained within the UK&amp;I IG stack as requested by the UKI Merchant Projects Manager.7. Recognize and participate in Hazop methodology process where identified for Medium and high risk projects.8. Assist UK&amp;I Merchant projects manager in audit functions for quality and legislative compliance if required9. Liaise with UK&amp;I maintenance manager on handover of installations.10. Any other reasonable task as requested by an appropriate authority within the UK&amp;I Supply Chain Structure.KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREDDegree qualified (or equivalent) Chemical/Mechanical EngineeringChartered Engineer ideallyMinimum 5 years&#39; experience in Industrial Gasses Engineering applicationsGood system understandingGood compliance understandingGood communication skillsExcellent understanding of safety

item.title: Hardware Technician
item.content: Hardware Refurbishment Technician &ndash; Warehouse AssistantEuro Executive Recruitment has been retained to recruit a Hardware Refurbishment Technician by a leading Communications Group for their Dublin office. Reporting directly to the Warehouse Manager, the Hardware refurbishment Technician / Warehouse Assistant will be responsible for the bench testing and refurbishment of recovered hardware as well as assisting with the general warehouse duties. The candidate may also be requested to assist other projects that are essential to the growth of the business.The Role: * Hardware testing/ refurbishment of recovered hardware. * RMA of faulty units. * Pre-Configuration of units for upcoming projects. * Pick and complete sales orders, wrap deliveries, complete warehouse paperwork for each dispatch. * Unload, record and put away of stocks. * Keep a clean and safe working warehouse. * Periodic stock taking. * Communicate and co-operate with fellow staff members. * Comply with company rules and standards of work. * Updating of inventory systems. * Delivery to contractors and customers premises when required.Requirements: * Experience on configuration of Ceragon, Ciena, Juniper and Radwin. * Previous Warehouse experience desirable. * Be willing to work as part of a team or on your own initiative. * Have a good level of written and spoken English. * A full clean driving license

item.title: Java Developer
item.content: GemPool is currently recruiting for a Senior Java Engineer for a client located in Dublin City Centre.The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years&rsquo; experience.Our Client is striving in the area of speech recognition.The ideal candidate will have a deep interest in cloud computing, data analysis, and algorithms. You will be working in a high-performing engineering team that enjoys solving extremely challenging problems.Technical Skills: * Java * Spring or Spring boot * Relational or non Relational database * Javascript * RabbitMQ or MQTTNice to have: * AWS certificationsSkills: * 5+ years&rsquo; experience working in a role using Java or similar Object-oriented language. * Past experience using a NoSQL database (MongoDB, Redis, Neo4j, Cassandra, etc.) * Knowledge of Web services (REST, SOAP) * Experience working in an iterative agile development environment.Other Skills: * Excellent verbal and written communications * Hands-on work ethic &ndash; take responsibility, show initiative, get things done.This is an exciting opportunity to join a cutting edge company with excellent career potential, you will get the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and work with a strong team of Engineers and Developers. If you would be interested please submit your CV to the link provided or call Robert on (phone number removed)

item.title: Cleaner
item.content: This role is for a cleaner in a retail store in Kilkenny, to work as part of a team to follow a specification to provide a safe and clean environment. General cleaning duties required and an induction will be completed on site

item.title: Project Manager
item.content: We are working on behalf of an established building contractor to source a Project Manager for a &euro;7M commercial project in Dundalk, Co Louth.The Project Manager will be responsible for the project from start to completion, with the support of a visiting Contracts Manager and full site team.Role:&bull; Overall responsibility for the management and successful delivery of the Project.&bull; Ensure the highest standards of health and safety, and quality are achieved and maintained.&bull; Provide leadership in the areas of Health &amp; Safety, QA/QC, Constructability, and Project Controls.&bull; Management of the site team.&bull; Ensure that project design solutions are delivered to the highest standards and meet programme and budgetary constraints.&bull; Planning project resources and monitoring against budgets.&bull; Monitoring and updating the project programme to ensure the project progresses is in line with the programme schedule.&bull; Maintaining an excellent client relationship.Requirements:&bull; Degree level qualification in Engineering, Construction Management or related discipline&bull; At least 5 years&#39; site or project management experience. &nbsp;&bull; Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.&bull; An in-depth knowledge of the construction industry and project execution.The salary and benefits package offered will depend on experience

item.title: Timber Frame Designer
item.content: Timber Frame DesignerEuro Executive Recruitment has been retained to recruit a Timber Frame Designer for a leading manufacturing company based in Longford. The successful candidate will be responsible for the design of timber frame structures while working closely with the client, client representatives and internal production team.Key Result Areas * Design timber frame structures. * Creating accurate production drawings in line with project requirements. * Creating accurate site issue drawings in line with project requirements. * Liaising with client design team in relation to live projects * Assist in general day-to-day running of the design office. * Prepare material schedules, providing technical specialist information where required. * Liaising with the estimating team in the production of estimates, coordinating and distributing design information to the production coordinator. * Manage all technical questions and queries from internal and external stakeholders. * Coordinate and manage all design amendments in line with construction drawings, legislative requirements and customer specifications.Essential Skills &amp; Experience * Minimum 3-year post qualification experience in Timber Frame design. Proficient in AutoCAD software. * Develop drawings for new and existing projects. * Ability to read and understand architectural/engineering drawings. * Familiar with Microsoft Office suite of products. * Strong analytic/problem-solving skills. * Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment. * Dependable, flexible * Strong technical understanding of Timber Frame design, manufacture and supply. * Flexible approach to working. * Enthusiastic &amp; self-motivated. * Results driven whilst participating in a team environment. * Strong communication skills (oral and written). * Be a lateral thinker with a flair for design. * Excellent attention to detail

item.title: Front end Web developer
item.content: My client are looking for multiple front end web developers to join their team for at least 6 months. You will be joining a growing company based in the fintech industry. You will be working on an exciting project using both Angular and Angularjs. Requirements:5 years experience in software developer3 years Angular experienceExperience in both Angularjs and Angular 2+experience in Material DesignAvailable on the 4th of JanuaryThe right to work in Ireland for the foreseeable future Reperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: Senior MES Engineer
item.content: About the role:Zenith Technologies are currently looking to hire Senior MES Engineer (Werum PAS-X) to be based on site of our biotech client in Dublin.Responsibilities: * Create business process flow diagram for pharmaceutical product recipes based on the paper batch record or source documents * Gather MES Site specific requirement analysis to develop URS and FRS * Logically breakdown the recipes/Mfg. process to configure the recipe in to Werum PAS-X * Develop/create MBR design elements (building blocks) and workflows in Werum PAS-X for repetitive use in MBR creation to expedite the process * Gather master data and configure in Werum PAS-X Development/Quality/Production Environment. * Integrating Werum PAS- X with SAP and other automation systems using standard interface component of MBR design. * Lead the recipe design session with business process SMEs * Design MBR/recipe, equipment workflow/ status diagram based on the Business process flow * Create solution design and configuration document * Prepare key user training documents and impart key user training * Provide assistance in business SOP creationQualifications/ Requirements: * A Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, or a related field (Technology Management; Chemical Engineering) * Senior level Werum PAS-X experience desired * Total 5+ years of hands-on experience on MES Product, Min 2+ years in MBR designing role * Werum PAS-X product hands-on experience for Full application configurations including interface with SAP and automation systems * In-depth of knowledge of Bio Pharma processes * Creation of business process flow diagram * Master Batch Record creation in Werum PAS-X * Knowledge on Industry Standards S88 and ISA S95 * Pharmaceutical validation concept * cGMP and GDP standards and GAMP Standards * Good verbal, written communication

item.title: Manager
item.content: As Head of Restaurant, you’re passionate about connecting with Team Members and Guests. Our win-together atmosphere rewards teamwork, and a willingness to go above and beyond is always recognized and celebrated. Our Restaurant Heads are hungry for top business results but also know how to have fun along the way. From leading the team through a high-energy shift to exceeding Guest expectations on every occasion to ensuring we meet our financial responsibilities, Managers are the critical link to making it all happen.

And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Clinical Affairs Manager
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Together with the Head of Sceintific Affairs and in collaboration with the Regulatory Affairs Manager, actively plan the Veterinary Clinical function requirements ensuring major milestone targets for each product are visible to all team members and key stakeholders to achieve on time market entry.</li><li>Together with the Head of Scientific Affairs and in collaboration with the Regulatory Affairs Manager, determine tasks and resources required to deliver each project milestone and deliverable.</li><li>2. Clinical Studies</li><li>Design and manage all clinical trials associated with the Veterinary projects including target animal safety and efficacy studies in collaboration with external experts and Clinical Research Organisations.</li><li>Identify and manage external resources required to ensure completion of the necessary studies to achieve the target milestones. Travel to clinical sites may be required to ensure Sponsor oversight of the studies.</li><li>In collaboration with the Regulatory Affairs Manager, manage the preparation of relevant dossier sections to support Veterinary license applications including the relevant sections of Modules 2, 4 and 5.</li><li>Managing a small team of clinical experts to support the Veterinary portfolio development.</li><li>Coaching/mentoring - support members of team with problem solving and skills development to aid learning and early problem resolution</li><li>Manage applicable clinical affairs budget and cost centre activities required for veterinary clinical activities.</li><li>Veterinary Business Strategy</li><li>-Together with the Business Development Manager and relevant technical experts, support existing veterinary partnerships with external partners as well as working to identify new development opportunities for the development of veterinary medicines.</li></ul> <p> <b></b></p> <ul><li>Bachelor of Veterinary Medicine</li><li>Significant clinical practice experience in companion animal space, ideally to include clinical research and in a cGxP environment.</li><li>Familiarity with cGxP in pharmaceutical manufacturing</li><li>Familiarity with concepts of Regulatory Approval process for veterinary pharmaceutical products</li><li>Technical knowledge of clinical research in the Veterinary space, with emphasis on small animal practice</li><li>Multi-tasking- ability to manage conflicting deadlines</li><li>Good planning and organizational skills</li><li>Working knowledge of EDMS (Electronic Document Management System)</li><li>Planning and organising - effectively develop and implement plans to accomplish project objectives.</li><li>Communication - write, speak and present information effectively across communication settings.</li><li>Adaptability - maintain effectiveness in varying environments and with different tasks, responsibilities and people.</li><li>Problem Solving/Analysis - secure relevant information and identify key issues and relationships from a base of information; relate and compare data from different sources, identifying cause-effect relationships.</li><li>Teamwork and Collaboration - working effectively with team <em>I </em>work group or those outside the formal line of authority (e.g. peers, senior managers) to accomplish organisational goals; taking actions that respect the needs and contributions of others, contributing to and accepting the consensus; subordinating own objectives to the objectives of the organisation.</li><li>Initiative - making attempts to influence events to achieve goals; self -starting rather than accepting passively; taking action to achieve goals beyond what is required; being proactive.</li><li>Ability to understand complex clinical terminology and aptitude to learn new skills in the area of clinical research though working with external experts and CROs.</li></ul> <p><br/> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?O%2fqbHi45SjeIOo1gaRCjvAq" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: General Operative (Fork Lift Certified)
item.content: General Operative (Fork Lift Certified)Ashbourne, Co Meath&euro;11.50 &ndash; 12.50 per hourBoden Group are working with a global Facilities Management business who are looking to take on a General Operative for a site in Ashbourne, Co Meath. You&rsquo;ll be responsible for delivering hygiene and waste services to an excellent standard, and carrying out any tasks on-site that require Fork Lift Truck training. This is a full-time permanent position working 39 hours a week Monday-Friday, with immediate interviews and start.You&rsquo;ll need to have experience in an industrial setting, preferably food manufacturing or similar, with knowledge of working to GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) processes. The successful candidate will also need to hold a Fork Lift Truck licence.Key Duties and Responsibilities: * Delivering all hygiene and waste services on site to an excellent standard. * This will include bin gathering and waste removal, keeping truck and loading bays clear, emptying bins and ashtrays around the site, and working with external suppliers to coordinate waste collections. * During winter months you will also be required to ensure all roads, walkways and loading bays on site are fully gritted and safe to use. * Supporting the Supervisor and on-site team with any tasks that require Fork-Lift use * Make sure yourself and the team are wearing correct uniform and PPE, and following company Health &amp; Safety policies at all times * Follow good Manual Handling practice at all times * Ensuring any accidents or incidents are logged and recordedWhat you&rsquo;ll need to succeed: * Must hold a FLT (Fork-Lift Truck) licence * Valid SafePass * Full clean driving licence * Excellent verbal and written communication skills * Experience working in a manufacturing environment (knowledge of GMP would be useful) * Able to work alternative hours, shifts and unsociable hours where required * Great team-working skills, able to meet challenging targets and multi-taskIf you&#39;re interested in this role, please apply via this advert with your up-to-date CV.If this job isn&#39;t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position within Facilities Management in Ireland, please get in touch with Marlie at Boden Group for a confidential discussion about your next move

item.title: Fire Safety Engineer
item.content: Job Ref Number: 624 LGPosition: Fire Safety EngineerLocation: Ireland or UKTemporary/Contract/Permanent: PermanentCompany Details:A combination of structural engineering and the latest in construction technology puts this company ahead of the curve in terms of opportunity and career development. Seeking to expand their existing team, they are looking for strong Fire Engineer expert seeking to grow and develop in this fast moving environment. The company has operations in Cork, Ireland as well as the UK and they have a consistent stream of work ahead of them. They work predominantly with the manufacturing and pharmaceutical companies who enjoy their efficiency of work. Further to continuing success and growth, the team is now ready to expand operations with the addition of Fire Engineer who can bring a wealth of experience, drive and strategic leadership to develop this specialist discipline in the region. This role could be based either in the UK or Ireland.Responsibilities: * Provide expert knowledge and guidance on UK and Ireland building regulations to clients specifically in relation to fire engineering. * Support Structural Engineering and Building Physics teams in all fire related issues. * Provide technical advice to clients on Light Gauge Steel, modular and other innovative building systems and their ability to meet legislative requirements. * Project Management of testing on behalf of Clients. This includes Fire Testing, BS 8414 Testing, etc. * Develop innovative construction products and building systems the clients to meet their brief. * Proactively engage and manage Client expectations at all time during projects. * Assist clients achieve certification of their products/building systems with the relevant certification bodies e.g. BBA, BOPAS, SCI and NSAI * Review test reports to ensure they are in line with client&#39;s expectations and requirements.Requirements: * Good knowledge and understanding of Technical Guidance Document B, Approved Document B, and relevant Standards and Codes of Practice. * Degree in Fire Engineering * Minimum 3 years of relevant post-graduate experience. * A familiarity with Modern Methods of Construction (MMC)/Offsite Construction technologies would be advantageous.If you&rsquo;re interested in this role, kindly forward an up-to-date copy of your CV in a word format to Lou.For suitable candidates, you will receive an email containing the Initial Questions

item.title: SQL Server DBA
item.content: My Client is a Fleet Management Services company and part of one of the largest telecomms businesses in the world. To give you an idea, they will fleet manage millions of vehicles concurrently through their cutting edge telematics systems.We have a contract opening for at least 6 months (high likelihood of extension) to support the DBA team&#39;s efforts in delivery of multiple projects over the next 6 - maybe even 12 months. You&#39;d be expected to start this role around mid January to early february.The role offers a day rate of circa &euro;500 per day and maybe more if your experience ticks all the boxes.It also offers a chance to work for a global and prestigious flagship company that will undoubtedly open doors to terrific opprtunities further on in your career.As is usual in th world of contract, we&#39;ll need someone to hit the ground running and for that you&#39;ll need to know what to expect and have the experience to demonstrate itYour background will likely be with businesses of a similar infrastructure footprint looking after partitioning, performance tuning and automation etc of multiple servers handling terrabytes of data.This DBA role requires a service oriented mentality, high sense of ownership of the problems and requests assigned, focus on managing and resolving issues in a prompt &amp; efficient manor, establishing and maintaining communication to ensure the smooth transition of database changes from development to production environments in adherence with the development lifecycle.Please provide your CV ASAP and apply through this channelPosition Requirements:SQL Server&bull; Advance knowledge of SQL Server data stores: row store and column store, optimisations.&bull; Advanced knowledge of indexes, index management, index design, index optimisations and index statistics.&bull; Advanced knowledge of SQL Server partitioning and file and filegroup design.&bull; Advanced Knowledge of SQL Server performance tuning, especially around stored procedures&bull; Advanced knowledge of SQL Server database upgrades (DB Engines &amp; Compatibility levels)&bull; Advanced knowledge of SQL Server H/A Solutions&bull; Good knowledge of query and query parallelism in SQL Server&bull; Good knowledge of Change Data Capture&bull; Good knowledge of Column Store index and Column Store query optimisations&bull; Good knowledge of SQL Server DMO&rsquo;s especially around statistics, data store and performance&bull; Good knowledge of SQL Server settings and database setting and the impact on performance&bull; Experience with Database Administration in general for MSSQL Server on both om-premise &amp; cloud platforms (AWS preferred).&bull; Experience in troubleshooting and resolving general database problems in a high transaction VLDB platform&bull; Experience with database design &amp; data modelling (experience with Erwin or similar data modeller tools is an advantage).&bull; Experience in database source control and deployments. Examples: SVN, CVS, Git, TFS&bull; Experience in testing/validating database components.&bull; Experience with monitoring either native or via 3rd partyPostgreSQL&bull; Good knowledge of provisioning environments in AWS on RDS Aurora PostgreSQL using automation&bull; Good knowledge of PostgreSQL Monitoring &amp; Alerting&bull; Good knowledge of troubleshooting &amp; performance reviewing issues with PgSQL&bull; Experience in up-skilling/training team members is a considerable advantage.MySQL&bull; Good knowledge of provisioning environments in AWS on RDS Native &amp; Aurora MySQL usingAutomation.&bull; Good experience in Partitioning &amp; Partition Maintenance on RDS MySQL.&bull; Good knowledge of MySQL Monitoring &amp; Alerting.&bull; Good knowledge of troubleshooting &amp; performance reviewing issues with MySQL.&bull; Experience in up-skilling/training team members is a considerable advantage.Projected activity:Index Maintenance solutionMigrating DB&rsquo;s from Simple to Full recovery ModelTaking the Index maintenance solution above, we need to migrate the same set of databases from Simple Recovery Model to Full Recovery Model &amp; ensure that the above solution can operate to effective levels of performance. This work is required to support our migration to AWSSQL 2017 DB Compatibility levelsTo enhance last year&#39;s hardware migrations we moved from SQL 2012 to SQL 2017. The next step in that project is to carry out the upgrades of the database compatibility level from 2012 to 2017 on this infrastructure.Automation of AG Failover to support Infrastructure patchingPostgreSQLThe engineer will be required for general day to day support of our AWS RDS Aurora PostgreSQL DB instance.MySQLThe engineer will be required to assist a wider development project team with the design &amp; monitoring review of a new RDS Aurora MySQL platform

item.title: Senior Electrical Engineer
item.content: Role: Senior Electrical EngineerLocation: Dublin - or surrounding counties commutable to DublinSalary: 70 000 Euros - 85 000 Euros + Pension + Phone and LaptopTerm: PermanentTimely Recruit is recruiting for a Senior Electrical Engineer due to rapid growth of a Smart Grid company who optimise the use of customer&#39;s Energy resources. The client is a Technology leader in Smart Grid, Demand Response and Frequency Response services. The smart grid is the next generation electricity network.The Senior Electrical Engineer will be part of the technical delivery team by designing, optimizing and implementing projects that will primarily focus on battery installations, smart switchgear upgrades and transformer upgrades .Summary of duties:Senior Electrical Engineer you will be responsible for: * Identifying technical solutions to meet the needs of customers and requirements. * Developing and designing electrical solutions to allow large electrical loads across every industry avail of grid schemes. * Preparing designs of high speed Industrial Transformers, Battery, Solar, EV and Hybrid systems using CAD. * Generating suite of CAD drawings as required / Ability to create practical AC / DC Designs. * Generate suite of CAD drawings as required * You will be responsible for all technical solutions and designs must meet technical, electrical standards and CDM (where applicable) regulations. Ensure quality of design meets company standards. * As the Senior Electrical Engineer you review Electrical Drawings for methods of interconnection. * Focus on battery installations, switchgear, transformer upgrades. * Lead project and construction management for large scale battery installation&rsquo;s, transformer upgrades, switchgear upgrades and other electrically biased developments.. * The Senior Electrical Engineer will be writing reports following installations. * Become in house expert in key industries in terms of finding electrical solutions to deliver large energy using assets to market for the different grid schemes. * Using computer-aided design and engineering software to create project plans and circuit diagrams.Qualifications, Attributes and ExperienceAs the Senior Electrical Engineer you must poses the following: * Electrical craft certificate with a minimum of 10 years&rsquo; experience as an Electrical Engineer. * As a Senior Electrical Engineer you must have a high level knowledge of high voltage (220kV,110kV, 150kV, 22kV, 20kV) substation design, mission critical power distribution, UPS, PDU, Earthing, generator systems and Building Management System. * Develop and design electrical solutions to allow electrical loads across every industry avail of grid schemes. * Ability to read and understand electrical schematics and wiring diagrams. * Battery installation, Switchgear, Transformer upgrade experience * High Voltage Electrical Engineering * Ability to produce detailed electrical designs using CAD. * Battery/ batteries experience * Swithgear experience * Design Experience, Transformer experience, Technical Lead experience * Utilities and Smart Grid experience * Ability to conduct electrical calculations, cable sizing, earthing calculations. * Automation and process knowledge of different industries is beneficial. * Basic network IP configuration is beneficial. * The Senior Electrical Engineer must be a strong communicator. * The Senior Electrical Engineer must be organized, energetic and self-motivated. * The Senior Electrical Engineer will be expected to travel 20% of the time

item.title: Site Operative (Datacentre)
item.content: Our client a leading power organisation is looking to recruit a site operator to join it&rsquo;s team working in the datacentre market in Dublin. This role controls, operates, maintains and services electrical plant and equipment to generate electric power (includes gas generators, diesel generators, transformers and auxiliary equipment). Maintains accurate and detailed records relating to the running of the plant and equipment.Responsibilities: * Monitor and inspect power plant equipment and indicators/alarms to detect evidence of operating problems. * Start or stop generators, auxiliary equipment, and other power plant equipment, as required. * Take readings from charts, meters and gauges at established intervals, and take corrective steps as necessary. * React to outages and call in necessary personnel during power outages and emergencies. * Keep site clean and tidy and support with basic housekeeping and site maintenance duties.Equipment * Clean, top up coolant/oil levels on generators, and maintain equipment, in order to prevent equipment failure or deterioration. * Collect oil, water, and electrolyte samples for laboratory analysis. * Regulate equipment operations and conditions such as water/oil levels, based on data from recording and indicating instruments or from computers SCADA systems. * Assist as and when required in the faultfinding, service, maintenance and repair of the generators, transformers and associated auxiliary equipment under the supervision of qualified technicians.Administration * Record and compile operational data, completing and maintaining forms, logs, and reports
