item.title: Senior MSAT OSD Analytical Chemist
item.content: Team Horizon is seeking a Senior MSAT OSD Analytical Chemist to join one of our leading client&rsquo;s R&amp;D team in Waterford. The successful candidate will support the MSAT Team Lead and MSAT OSD Manager to deliver the team goals in the area of supporting the business for Contract Manufacturing projects, Transfer projects between R&amp;D and Commercial Operations (OSD) and to support QC and Regulatory Affairs for delivery of specific projects relating to existing commercial products.Why you should apply: * Join our client&rsquo;s brand new, purpose built, state of the art, R&amp;D Centre which includes a sterile fill finish suite. * Attractive salary, benefits and great career progression opportunities are on offer for the successful candidate. * Based in the South East of Ireland the cost of living is low, meaning more disposable income. Upgrade your work-life balance, the quality of life is amazing, less traffic more time for activities!What you will be doing: * Delivering analytical activities associated with transfer of products between functions and for contract manufacturing projects, including where appropriate method transfers/verifications, stability studies and support to formulation activities. * Executing and on occasion, management of analytical projects associated with supporting the QC function as well as responses to regulatory deficiencies for commercial products involved in territory extensions. * Preparing documentation associated with the analytical activities including protocols and reports. * Completing investigations (OOSs, incidents and deviations etc.) associated with own work and where required for other members of the MSAT team. * Training / Coaching / Mentoring - support members of team with problem solving and skill development, with responsibility for problem resolution. * Assisting team leaders in scheduling and prioritization of laboratory testing and deputizing for team leaders as required. * Helping the team leaders and manager in achieving company goals and attending meetings on behalf of the Team Lead if required. * Creating MSAT Investigations, deviations and change controls. * Representing MSAT OSD team on projects undertaken in collaboration with QC or Regulatory Affairs in the Analytical space. * Working with the Project Management Office, representing MSAT team as a work package owner in the Analytical space. * Representing the MSAT OSD team on CMO Projects and acting as the point of contact with the customer on Analytical transfer activities. * Collaboration with R&amp;D Analytical team for product transfers and for sharing of expertise and product experience to facilitate smooth transition of projects from R&amp;D to QC (OSD). * Supporting all other on-going laboratory functions &amp; requirements. * Preparing and review stability summary sheets where required. * Making sure that all work carried out is in compliance with the required standards conforming to company, cGxP, SOPs, regulatory regulations and guidelines, safety and environmental guidelines. * Finding and making recommendations for improvements as part of a team within or outside the department in order to ensure continuous improvement. * Checking your own work and that of others for accuracy. * Helping in the preparation for internal / customer/ regulatory inspections. * Drafting, reviewing or revising documentation within the documentation management system. * Implementing health and safety requirements as per site documentation including SOPs, Safety Statement and COPs and report any defects.What you need to apply: * Honours Degree in Analytical Chemistry, Pharmaceutical science or related discipline. * At least three years&rsquo; experience working in a related technical environment. * Experience in scheduling, mentoring, and problem resolution in an MSAT/Technical Services or R&amp;D Laboratory is preferable. * Mentoring, people development skills and experience with Project Teams. * Be able to use of HPLC &amp; associated problem solving. * Dissolution testing experience. * Technical/R&amp;D Orientation. Strong analytical ability. Time management skills and strong attention to detail. The ability to multi-task and manage conflicting deadlines. Problem- solving abilities. Excellent organisational skills. Excellent Communication skills, both verbal &amp; written. Proficient in technical report writing. Safety Awareness

The main objective is to reduce the risk of financial loss to the Company. * Be seen as a &ldquo;go-to&rdquo; information resource for O2C AR credit management queries * Effectively analyse all customer financial statements, payment trends &amp; financial ratios to recommend credit limits to the affiliate process owner * Analyse account discrepancies to ensure the customer account is enabled for payment * Manage the monthly Aged Debt review for your affiliate including the underlying analysis &amp; the overall presentation &amp; follow ups * Prepare &amp; present Quarterly Credit Committee data for Global Treasury and Affiliates CFO&rsquo;s. * Execute Sales Order credit release in a compliant &amp; timely manner on a daily basis * Review key metrics &amp; communicate to stakeholders to ensure KPIs are being met &amp; improved * Support global/regional O2C projects with influence on excellent credit management * Support the overall O2C AR team by demonstrating flexibility in providing cover for team members and training of new team membersPersonal Attributes * Ability to handle complexity and utilize analytical skills, with attention to detail * Ability to proactively &amp; effectively analyse &amp; resolve problems * Ability to effectively prioritize and complete key tasks and deliverables * Ability to respond flexibly and empathetically to customer needs, managing their expectations effectively * Ability to work in global team environment and communicate effectively with both internal business partners of all levels &amp; disciplines as well as external Business Process Outsourced team membersSystems * Experience with SAP O2C Module * Experience in Business Warehouse or Business Objects, * MS Excel, Word and PowerPointQualifications * 2-3 years&rsquo; experience in O2C or Finance function, preferably with knowledge of credit management &amp; customer service and experience in identifying and delivering process change * Degree in Business and/or Accounting (or equivalent work experience) * Fluency in English &amp; Dutch languageThe GBS focuses on the following foundational pillars across the full organisation to ensure a solid and consistent approach to running our businessCompliance * Demonstrate a strong compliance oriented mindset &amp; help to build a strong compliance culture * Be familiar with all applicable process documentation &amp; training materials to ensure you operate in a fully compliant manner * Ensure ownership for all applicable Sox &amp; Operational controls for your areaPeople * Actively work with the core team members, internal customers/business partners, and LSP team members to build effective working relationships * Coaching and mentoring the O2C AR AssociatesCustomer * Demonstrate excellence in all interactions with our GBS internal customers &amp; business partners * Focus on measuring &amp; improving our internal customer&rsquo;s experience with the GBS * Build and maintain a strong knowledge of Lilly&rsquo;s product lines within the marketContinuous Improvement * Demonstrate a strong Continuous Improvement oriented approach &amp; help to build a strong Continuous Improvement culture * Actively work with the core team members &amp; Global O2C team to drive improvements for processesAdditional Information*Travel Percentage &ndash; item.title: NOC Engineer - Entry Level
item.content: Noc Engineer- Entry Level (Stamp 1G Visa)Dublin BasedGreat Base Salary + Shift Allowance %Our Client are rapidly expanding service provider delivering advanced managed hosting and data centre services across 40+ locations spanning 3 continents all connected onto a global private network backbone providing a truly global service capability, regardless of geography.The company has a significant market share in its primary sector and is seeking to broaden its customer base across other industry sectors and geographies. We are a dynamic and technology-driven company who value our people, their passion and their knowledge.Our Client is a Global Team who are dedicated and focused on delivering quality support &amp; services to our customers. They are a professional, hard-working and fun bunch of people to work alongside. In this role you will be surrounded by approachable and helpful colleagues who have a wealth of skills and expertise in a multitude of technologies.As part of our continued expansion we are looking for SMC Engineers to join our 24/7 Service Management Centre Team. Based in Dublin, Ireland, the successful individual will join a support organisation currently spread across Europe &amp; North America &amp; Asia.Working under the direction of a team lead, as an NOC Engineer your responsibility will be to analyze, troubleshoot and resolve critical support cases raised large customer base. Our customers are global like us and they rely on the global network, hosted infrastructure and cybersecurity suite of services to be successful.This position will require high quality support through responsiveness to incident management, business change control, standard customer provisioning, development of new service levels and improvement initiatives.The RoleAs an NOC Engineer, you will be responsible for:Daily operational support and maintenance of all Continent 8 infrastructure.&bull; Monitoring of system availability and performance to minimize downtime and optimize customer services. &bull; Support customer&#39;s requirements targeting a 99.9% continuous service level.&bull; Troubleshoot any network related issues and perform root cause analysis.&bull; Collaboration with level 3 technical teams supporting DC, Hosting and Network services. &bull; Participation in technology projects across datacentre, network, cloud domains.&bull; The creation and maintaining support &amp; operational documentation. &bull; Participation in a 24/7 shift rotation.Experience Required&bull; A minimum of 2-5 years of experience working within a technical operations &amp; support environment. &bull; Strong customer service orientation is a must.&bull; Experience in IP service management such as change and incident Management.&bull; Knowledge of the following technologies, Cisco Meraki, ASA firewall, Juniper hardware, VMWare solutions, Nutanix hardware, MS enterprise suite etc.&bull; Familiar with Networking monitoring and resource management Tools (Cacti, MRTG, SolarWinds etc).&bull; Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in computer science or engineering or equivalent.&bull; Excellent organisational and communication skills.&bull; Strong technical and problem resolution skills with the ability to work under pressure.&bull; Experience monitoring large international networks while working within a global business with multiple locations is advantageous.&bull; ITIL, CCNA, JNCIA, VCA, Microsoft certification is desirable.To be instantly considered Apply&nbsp;Below#LI-GB1

item.title: Senior Engineer
item.content: You will likeWorking in Dublin region, for this leading Construction Contractor, majoring on civil engineering and operating across the UK and Ireland. They have balanced portfolio across civil and structural projects and cover commercial, residential, infrastructure, utilities and specialist jobs including demolition, asbestos removal &amp; waste management. They have an impressive order book with varied projects from &pound;1M &ndash; &pound;20M+. Culture wise they care about employees and are passionate about delivering quality projects and client satisfaction.You will likeThe job as Senior&nbsp;Engineer / Senior Site Engineer as part of the experienced site management team delivering on a traditional build terraced housing and apartment scheme within central Dublin. This is a live project, set to run until July 2021.This is a fixed-term contract with the possibility of extension/permanent employment.The Project:&nbsp;A large scale multi-contract social housing scheme (2/3 story Houses &amp; 4 Storey Apartments) from foundations through construction and handover.The role includes managing parts of the construction project, providing expert technical advice and using developed skills in interpreting engineering information and surveying/setting out. More specifically:&bull; Workforce engagement with the site team inc. subcontractor supervision for landscaping, drainage and first fix building trades&bull; Procurement, monitoring and recording of materials, plant and logistics&bull; Implementing QA procedures including M&amp;E sign off, drainage testing, concrete pre/post pour checks &amp; compiling subcontractor snag lists&bull; Record keeping and reporting inc. compiling information for O&amp;M manuals, as-built drawings&bull; Health &amp; Safety, Environment and Sustainability, inc. acceptable practice (CDMs &amp; RAMS) and behaviours&bull; Keeping to programme, scope of works.&bull; Ideally&nbsp;assisting with Setting Out/Dimensional Control (groundworks &amp; structural) inc. use of GPS, total station &amp; automatic levels if requiredThis is a site-based job,&nbsp;7.30 am to 5.30 pm Monday to Friday.You will haveAs Senior&nbsp;Engineer / Senior Site Engineer, you will have Ste Manager/Engineer experience in civils/structures ideally within general/civils contractor and including residential/housing projects.&bull; An Honours or Masters degree in Civil or Structural Engineering, accredited by the ICE (preferred)&bull; (or) BTEC level 4/ HNC in Civil Engineering as a minimum; other Built environment degrees or Level 4/5 qualifications will be consideredYou will get&bull; Direct fixed term contract at a solid salary equivalent of E 60K-70K+ EURO Neg +&nbsp;benefits&bull; 25 days holiday per annum + Bank Holidays&bull; You will enjoy the kudos and credibility of working for a civil construction market leader.&bull; Ongoing training &amp; development, and opportunities for promotion &amp; progression.You can applyTo the Senior&nbsp;Engineer / Senior Site Engineer job by pushing the button on this job posting (recommended), by sending CV in confidence to (url removed), or give me a call at (phone number removed).AOSJ_MS

human resources. * Provide a high level of technical competence and leadership to the shift to ensure that operational issues are identified and managed to achieve challenging KPI&rsquo;s and higher operational performance * Promotion of decision making at the operative &amp; technician level through effective development and fostering of a strong team working culture * Promote a quality culture and act to ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements including FDA and cGMP * Execute communications within the unit and to other departments within the company * Plan and manage team members&rsquo; attendance, timekeeping * Establish and maintain high standards in relation to Environmental Health &amp; Safety work practice * Meet budgetary targets set in relation to output and spend * Work closely with the overseas product development team for product realization.Requirements * Bachelor Degree (HETAC level 8) in Industrial engineering/Science/Engineering/ Manufacturing or a relevant field * Clean Room experience * A minimum of 5 years&rsquo; Guide and develop direct reports, and if applicable, drive those practices throughout their organization. * Encourage and develop a diverse workplace that enables all participants to contribute to their full potential in pursuit of organizational objectives. * Cleanroom management experience is required. * Open-minded, willing to work in a different cultured environment is ideal.Attractive remuneration will be offered in line with experience and would be firmed up during the interview process. item.title: R& D Formulation Scientist
item.content: R&amp; D Formulation ScientistNew role for an R&amp;D Formulation Scientists role in a fast growing pharmaceutical company. The overall purpose of this role isto Act as a SME for the development innovative drug product formulations that meet patient needs.Responsibilities will include:- * Work closely &amp; collaboratively with other members of the Formulation Science, and function along with the Analytical &amp; Process Development functions along with other members of the R&amp;D and Commercial value streams to achieve goals. * Work with the Analytical &amp; Formulation Development Manager, Innovation team and Scientific Affairs (both PMO and Regulatory/Clinical) to foster innovative thinking within the R&amp;D function &amp; to champion the development of innovative medicines in a timely fashion according to stakeholder expectations. * Execute and/or oversee the design &amp; development of formulations that are built on sound scientific, regulatory, QbD, process validation, and lean product development principles. * Assist in the improvement of existing drug product formulations within the organization by retrospective application of sound scientific, regulatory, QbD, process validation, and lean product development principles. * Champion the use of QbD and scientific thinking in the development innovative drug product formulations while maintaining a comprehensive knowledge of formulations development disciplines through research and scientific literature. * Act as SME for the interpretation of in-vitro data to predict in-vivo performance &amp; how this relates to further formulation development. * Identifying, assessing, recommending and implementing internal and external opportunities to broaden the company&#39;s technical/scientific capability. * Work to create an excellence/SME culture within the formulation science function that is focused on innovation, lean &amp; robust formulation development, &amp; continuous improvement. * Identification, organization and implementation of effective training programs within the Formulation Science group including this role. * Where required, represent the development group in all relevant meetings, for example pipeline steering committee meetings and R&amp;D value stream. * To ensure that all work carried out is in compliance with the required standards conforming to company, cGxP, SOPs, regulatory regulations and guidelines, safety and environmental guidelines. * Assist the Analytical &amp; Formulation Development Manager (&amp; Head of R&amp;I) in achieving company goals with specific focus on responsibilities related to the R&amp;D Formulation Science function.Ensure contemporaneous collection of relevant data for R&amp;D Tax Credit claim purposesHealth &amp; Safety: * Ensure requirements of the company&#39;s Safety Statement are implemented. * Continuously promote a positive safety culture by leading by example &amp; drive a high EHS, 5S &amp; housekeeping standard in areas under the roles control. * Implement safety requirements as per site documentation including SOP&rsquo;s, Safety Statement and COP&rsquo;s.The ideal candidate will have * BSc in a chemical science related discipline such as Material Science, Industrial Chemistry, Formulation Science or related discipline, post graduate qualification highly desirable. * At least 5 years&rsquo; proven experience in a formulation development environment which significant experience in studies that include drug &amp; material characterisation and selection. * SME level knowledge of QbD and pharmaceutical development processes. * Demonstrated capabilities in project management &amp; technical leadership of complex product/process developments, at least two years is highly desirable. * Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated and focus others with respect to implementing identified improvement initiatives. * Demonstrated ability to work as part of diverse teams in an all-encompassing manner. * Have demonstrated effective research skills, including the critical review of the scientific literature

item.title: Product Owner
item.content: THE OPPORTUNITYAlready a highly successful and multi-award-winning organisation, have now secured a significant investment to expand the team and help them achieve their ambitious growth targets. You will bring your creative skills and experience to lead requirements definition and suggest features and functionality to their product platforms. As part of an agile delivery process, you will contribute high-quality analysis, requirements and design ideas to the SCRUM team which will deliver a best in class experience for customers.YOUR PATH TO SUCCESS * Work with the various business heads to refine priority features for the product backlog * Provide requirements, test, and acceptance criteria to the Scrum team * Undertake competitive analysis to ensure customer adoption and best in class user experience/functionality * Deliver through consultation, process maps, functional requirements, user stories and acceptance tests. * Participate in workshops to refine and develop requirements * Champion quality throughout the product development process * Support the product scrum teams to deliver the solutions you have initiated. * Collaborate with other product analysts and product owners to drive successful outcomes * Refine and improve the overall process of requirements definition (documentation, methodologies etc.)Requirements * 5+ years of experience as a business/product analyst in an agile development environment * Demonstrated ability to gather required information and produce deliverable requirements * Track record in managing and facilitation workshops that produce actionable outputs (internal and external customers) * Jira, Gitlab use for story and requirements management * Experience working with Agile methodologies and Scrum teams * Data analysis and BI tools experience would be a distinct advantage

item.title: Mechanical Superintendent - Dublin, Ireland
item.content: This is an opportunity to work with a specialist international EPC Contractor. They need of a Mechanical Superintendent to work on a 12 month contract based at the Intel site in Leixlip Near Dublin Ireland.The successful applicant will have mainly mechanical background but with some E&amp;I experience, as the role will be to install and commission skid mounted equipment to the back pad within the complex that processes chemicals and gases. The incumbent will be expected to supervise contractors, being responsible for their safety, productivity, technical performance and conformance to procedures. Will have a broad knowledge of equipment, techniques and processes. Be able to demonstrate the ability to suggest and implement cost effective modifications to maintenance techniques and/or equipment changes, to improve reliability, having considered all the relevant technical aspects of the change.You will be educated to a formal Mechanical Apprenticeship, BTEC Level 3 / ONC. With 5 -10 years of experience with reciprocating and rotating machine maintenance, familiarity with precision measuring equipment, materials of machinery, lifting and rigging, schematics and layout drawings and understand maintenance manuals. Previous experience in supervising others in the team. A full driving license and passport are also required. An increased knowledge of SAP is also expected, such as having the ability to find maintenance work orders to book time to and how to find and reserve spare parts.To apply please forward your resume in word format with a covering email stating your availability, current rate and preferred project locations.Job Ref: (phone number removed)Role: Mechanical SuperintendentType: Contract - 12 monthsLocation: IrelandRate: Negotiable Hours: 5 days a week 10 hours a dayRHL Recruitment Limited act as an employment agency and technical recruitment consultancy

item.title: Clinical Nurse Specialist
item.content: Orion Group Sciences have an exciting opportunity for a Clinical Nurse Specialist for our multinational medical devices client based in the Cork area on an initial rolling contract. - CNS Nurse Key Duties and Responsibilities. To manage the clinical deployment of Respiratory Breathing DeviceS in a timely and professional manner by delivering training in line with product guidelines, clinical, and site requirements as required.This typically takes the form of liaising with the specifiers and all purchasing stakeholders to deliver a workforce trained in the safe use of the Respiratory system within 4-8 weeks from commencement to handover.Follow on support of sites will include monitoring, managing evaluations &amp; trials as required and mentoring on site as required.In addition to working as the main contact between the customer and the company, there is a requirement to maintain relevant documentation, reporting in the required period and develop mentoring and development programmes for the site and individuals.To act as a brand ambassador as required elsewhere in the site. Qualifications A current registration or licence to practice in a relevant clinical discipline with experience of respiratory care in an acute setting.A peer-to-peer training qualification or demonstrable experience and experience of developing relevant training material as required. Knowledge, Skills and Experience An understanding of clinical vital signs, early warning scoring, respiratory compromise, respiratory therapy in acute care and respiratory compromise.Familiarity with i-OS devices, Bluetooth and Wi-Fi ConnectivityThe ability to work with information in database formats if requiredClinical understanding of the interpretation of vital signsAble to present digital material and new concepts fluently and competently, both face to face and virtuallyAbility to manage a project to agreed milestonesExperience of using standalone and integrated medical devices and software Other Requirements Business and Clinical English to minimum level four for written and spoken communicationEligibility to work in the specified countryAble to travel independently to customer sites at all timesAble to work as required across a 24-hour, 365-dayshiftpattern to meet the needs of the customer.Be conversant with and able to comply with relevant clinical data, infection control and general policies that may be mandated by customers as well as those of the company. item.title: Clerk of Works
item.content: Exciting opportunity Clerk of Works to join a leading Architectural design practice based in Belfast with an impressive portfolio of projects to their name. Due to on-going requirements, they are seeking to add a Clerk of Works to their growing team on a contract basis. For the right person, this could turn into a permanent opportunity.As Clerk of Works, you will be based on-site to monitor, inspect and report on the quality of the design and construction provided by the contractor. Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:Inspecting and reporting on the delivery of new build construction project works in accordance with the employer&#39;s requirements and the building contract.Monitoring the work of the contractors and sub-contractors ensuring work is carried out to the required standards.Taking measurements and samples to ensure the required quality standards are being met.Keeping detailed records of various aspects of the work, collating and providing regular reports in conjunction with the compliance team.Carry out duties to meet health and safety regulations, including CDM regulations on-site and to monitor the contractor health and safety practices.Regular site visits to prepare Health and Safety reports.Inspection finished work.Scheduling defects of all internal building fabric prior to and after commissioning and at completion.To be considered for this role you will have the following:Previous experience in a similar Clerk of Works / Site Architect / Construction Manager position on large scale construction projects.Thorough knowledge of CDM, Fire legislation, Asbestos regulations, scaffolding regulations and Planning and Building regulations.Strong IT skill to include Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.If you feel this &quot;Clerk of Works&quot; role is something you may be interested in and you would like to be considered please apply via the button shown and we will contact you upon receipt of your application to discuss your suitability and the role specifics in more detail.To hear more about this role, please call Wellington Professional Recruitment.This vacancy is being advertised by Wellington Professional Recruitment Ltd. item.title: Senior Product & Marketing Manager
item.content: CompanyThe client is a multi-national medical device manufacturer whose mission is to improve the quality of life through the design, development, and manufacture of high quality, affordable medical products, for the benefit of patients and health professionals and with respect to their employees.Role summaryReporting to the Chief Executive Officer, this is an all-encompassing Product Management opportunity serving as a connection point between the company and distributors across the Western European territory. Aligned to the regional nature of the position, the role holder can be based remotely throughout the specified countries in Western Europe.ResponsibilitiesImplement the Regional Marketing Action Plan related to the product line in order to reach the Growth Objective in the region.1. Define priorities for his/her product line in the Region, through:*Market analysis* Targeting &amp; positioning adjustment within the region* Pricing* Business case development2. Develop and implement regional marketing initiatives related to his/her product line, especially related to digital activities* Identify needs for localized marketing collaterals in coordination with different vendors.* Define and implement regional product launch planning* Maintain NPI updates and communications for product line* Develop and cultivate a regional KOL network for respective product lines* Maintain ownership as product line point of contact for Western Europe3. Preparation of Marketing Plan for Europe* Create monthly &amp; Quarterly Reports under the supervision of the Senior Manager Marketing Europe,* Maintain market watch including trends respective for product line responsibility including competitive intelligence.4. Share information with other stakeholders within the company* Coordinate information exchanges between the manufacturing managed by the company and the distributors in Western Europe, with a focus on clear and concise information to maintain forecast and orders.* Coordinate monthly calls with the marketing and order processing team in order to maintain visibility of product line status, needs, issues, and market intel.* Routinely share updates with the marketing and NPI of the company to support the main product line.* Work with the product engineering team to handle the customer complaints and feedback and report back to the customers.5. Schedule calls &amp; meetings to review product status and updates with the distributors in the region.6. Develop effective communication and operation in the marketing within the company.Requirements* Solid scientific background in Biology or Medical Education (BSc, MSc, PhD, MD, Pharm D) with a marketing/business training (Master in Marketing, MBA) beneficial but not required* Proven experience in the medical device industry with a strong understanding of endoscopy products, technically and medically* Experience in a commercial product launch in the healthcare industry* Skilled in Marketing, especially downstream marketing and marketing mix* Familiar with Digital Marketing and CRM processes* Skilled in clinical and demand generation marketing in the medical device area.* Experience with product life cycle management in disposable medical device* Proven listening, negotiating, and influencing skills* Experience in selling as a field sales representative account manager is beneficial* Experience in working in a multicultural environment* Excellent communication &amp; presentation* Fluent English, other languages beneficialRemunerationAttractive remuneration will be offered in line with experience and would be firmed up during the interview process. If interested to explore please apply to enclose your CV in PDF format and Cover Letter

item.title: Microservices Lead, Remote
item.content: Microservices Lead, RemoteA fast pace and rapidly globally expanding Software House in Ireland is seeking to add a Microservices Lead to their growing team. My client are about to start the design and development of a brand new product built on Microservices architecture and we&#39;re looking for a capable and enthusiastic Lead Developer to come on board, get this project off the ground quickly and drive things forward. My client are a C# .Net house but if you&#39;ve got a strong Microservices background in another relevant language and are happy to cross train on the role this would also be suitable.You&#39;ll be liaising with internal teams and playing an technically very influential role in the design and development of this new product. You&#39;ll be tasked with leading the architecture of the new product and expected to come up with innovative solutions to try and pull all the pieces of the puzzle together throughout the SDLC.Requirements:Experienced with API driven developmentExperience designing solutions bearing in mind performance and security limitationsUnderstanding of Message Bus architectureExperience with Microservices architectureExperience working with Big data and good data manipulation skills (SQL/noSQL etc)Strong track record of leading and driving technical products from scratchIdeally a background with C# .Net development but experience with another relevant tech stack and a willingness to cross train would sufficeStrong English communication skills both verbal and writtenBenefits:Salary 60-70kGreat benefits packageOpportunity to work remotely as long as located within the EUKey Words: Microservices, Microservices Developer, Microservices Architect, Microservices Lead, Microservices Lead Developer, Product, Software House, Greenfield, C# .Net DeveloperReperio Human Capital acts as an Employment Agency and an Employment Business

item.title: Qc Analyst
item.content: Team Horizon is seeking a QC Analysts to join our client&rsquo;s Quality Team in Sligo. In this role, you will ensure that all raw material, in-process and finished product testing, and method transfer testing is carried out per schedule, and records are maintained to appropriate requirements. Working, in the quality control labs, you will be equipped with the latest design technology for chemical and microbiological analytical testing to meet customers&rsquo; needs.Why you should apply: * Join a company that has developed a stand-out culture of innovation, inclusion and development, and consistently features as a great place to work. * Generous package with good base salary and benefits to including but not limited to health insurance, pension and bonus. * Join an organisation who uses Innovative new technologies, who embrace diversity, equality and inclusion and puts patients first. * Based in the West of Ireland the cost of living is low, meaning more disposable income. * Upgrade your work-life balance, the quality of life is amazing, less traffic more time for activities!What you will be doing: * Maintain and comply with Laboratory Documentation and Computerized Systems Data Integrity requirements. * Understand Regulations and business processes required to maintain Laboratory Data Integrity. * Responsible for housekeeping duties in the lab. * Responsible for the timely completion of chemical testing of raw material. * Ensure that all test equipment is used and maintained correctly. * Responsible for raising change requests and data verification as assigned. * Ensure all in-process sampling and testing is completed on time. * Maintain up-to-date, complete, and precise records of all tests performed. * Adhere to cGMP and GLP requirements. * Assist in the resolution of quality problems as required. * Developing and changing in-house laboratory procedures as appropriate. * Aid in the training of new analysts. * Supports the transfer of new products. * Adheres to and supports all EHS &amp; E standards, procedures, and policiesWhat you need to apply: * 3rd level degree qualification in relevant scientific discipline. * 2 years&#39; post-qualification experience of HPLC and/or GC analytical methods. * Relevant industry experience preferred. * Strong computer skills utilizing a Microsoft environment (e.g. Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint) * Good oral, written, and presentation skills * Sound decision making and problems solving skills to assure business unit compliance * Strong analytical skills, ability to analyze data and trends and draw conclusions * Good mathematics background with an understanding of basic statistical concepts

item.title: Senior Sustainability Consultant/Engineer
item.content: We are looking to onboard a Senior Sustainability Engineer for a well respected MEP Building Services Consultancy that have offices across the UK.Environmental and sustainable designs are the key factors within my clients approach to work which has separated them from other consultancies and allowed them to deliver a number of Excellent and Outstanding BREEAM rated buildings.You will never find yourself being bored of the projects you are involved with due to the diverse range &ndash; Leisure and Hotels, Retail, Mixed-use and residential. They are looking for someone who is technically sound, but the larger focus is on the client facing skills as they need someone who can front up projects, lead meetings with clients and external teams, be a clear communicator and manage/mentor a team of junior engineers. My client has put a great emphasis into their training and development plan making sure that your career never goes stale keeping you engaged and enthusiastic for years to come. There is a great sense of engagement with an open door policy allowing you to express your ideas throughout the company.Your day-to-day role will involve a range of duties such as: * Providing strategic low-energy design advice * Liaising with key client stakeholders to develop their sustainability strategies * Identifying sustainability risks and appropriate mitigation measures and highlighting any opportunities to increase the organisation&rsquo;s sustainability credentials * Creating models to illustrate your plans, processes and designs * Producing evidence requirements for BREEAM/LEED credits * Undertaking a gap analysis report should the desired rating not be achievable * Monitoring the design process to ensure that the scheme design objectives are being followed and the design meets the clients&rsquo; requirements * Preparing low and zero-carbon technology feasibility studies and energy statements for local authority approval as part of planning applications * A range of additional ad hoc duties to support the wider teamKey responsibilities * Identify feasible sustainable design concepts on behalf of your company or for clients * Manage client projects and keep them up-to-date on progress * Keep up-to-date with the latest Energy Compliance and Environmental Accreditation Schemes * Use CAD tools to create models * Use IES modelling software for the creation of models * Collect and collate qualitative and quantitative data to help communicate and support your sustainable engineering designs * Build portfolios for companies and clientsKey skills * Strong technical engineering knowledge * Good understanding of low-carbon building solutions * Apt product design skills and product assessment skills * Good report writing skills * Strong communication and project management capabilities * Sound knowledge of mapping, thermal and energy modelling and life cycle assessment tools * Good understanding of the circular economy&rsquo;s impact on sustainable engineering * CAD skills * IES skillsQualificationsSustainability engineers are required to have at least a degree in a relevant engineering or sustainability subject. A master&#39;s degree in a relevant subject is preferred.To find out more information on the role, please get in touch with George Martin @ Streamline Services

item.title: Mechanical Construction Project Lead
item.content: Mechanical Construction Project LeadEPCM Engineering Consultancy requires a senior Mechanical Construction Project Lead to Supervises and manage site mechanical staff including construction superintendents, trade supervisors and sub-contractors on large scale capital Pharmaceutical construction projectsRoleThe Mechanical Construction Lead is assigned to a project as a senior member of Construction Team with responsibility for proper and timely construction of mechanical scope in accordance with Client safety and quality standards, detailed design, control estimate, contract, SOP&rsquo;s, WI&rsquo;s, standards etc.Responsibilities extend to all element of Mechanical Construction (HVAC, Piping, Sprinkler etc.) depending on project. Mechanical Construction Lead will also provide input for development of Mechanical Construction department which will include improving execution procedures, liaising with Mechanical Design department leads, and managing and developing Mechanical Construction resources across projects.Responsibilities * Assists CM with Constructability Reviews and Interactive planning sessions with Client and Design Team * Ensures construction phase of projects are adequately provided with suitably capable, qualified and experienced personnel, together with all necessary plant, tools, temporary facilities and other resources * Engages with Design, Commissioning and Client teams throughout project to ensure system turnovers are achieved to scheduled milestones * Develops best in class site execution SOP&rsquo;s as guidance to the Field Supervisors * Complies with the Client construction methods, procedures and practices in all respects, particularly those relating to safety, quality assurance, personnel and industrial relations; where these are found to be inadequate immediately reports deficiencies and suggests solutions * Ensures that applicable statutory and other legal requirements are properly observed * Understands implications of Health and Safety at Work Act and Regulations as they affect the responsibilities of employees * Keeps abreast of developments in the construction industry and assists in ensuring that the Client capability continues to develop and excel * Ensures that the projects are constructed to the drawings, specifications, applicable standards, good construction practices, to schedule and in accordance with the cost budget * Directs and controls the activities of the assigned staff and their functions * Determines needs for supervisor training for proper execution of projects under construction and makes recommendations accordingly * Ensure Client are utilising the best technology available and ensuring innovative ideas are encouraged * Ensuring lessons learned on projects are recorded and shared * Adheres to Client policies for employment of labour and ensures all matters concerning labour relations are dealt with in accordance with labour agreementsExperience Required * Biopharma, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device or Semiconductor facility and process services construction projects * Capital Projects * Prior career experience working for large EPCM Consultancy / Multinational Engineering or large M&amp;E Contractor or Tier one Construction firm * Previous Senior Level Construction Management roles held

item.title: Application Manager
item.content: Application Manager / Lead PE Global are seeking to identify an Application Lead to join one of our key clients, global specialist manufacturing life science solutions provider with a major presence in Ireland and sites across EU, US and Asia. The role will see the newly appointed Lead become an active member of the global AIS management team to contribute to and support the overall AIS strategy and functional deliverables across the international locations.The objective of the role:&#149; To assess business process requirements, analyses the structure and flow of the business&rsquo; work to identify possible application solutions.&#149; To Manage application software implementation and upgrades and lead a team of IT specialists responsible for implementing and upgrading system hardware and application software.&#149; Oversee Troubleshooting problems and provide technical support and problem resolution related to business application software systems.&#149; Maintain responsibility to oversee the creation and development of protocols and procedures for application software systems and its usage.&#149; To manage and lead all IS Applications requirements across analytics, Lab and IT support teams, site operations&#149; Promote a culture of continuous improvement across all applications initiatives&#149; As part of a wider company initiative, play a central role in championing and facilitating the use of data &amp; information to transform and guide a variety of business units and functions across multiple global sitesThe role shall entail day to day:&#149; Lead and provide technical guidance to the IS Applications &amp; Lab IT support teams&#149; Ensure the resources and skill sets are available and developed to meet business needs&#149; Develop IS strategies, plan and execute system roadmaps and support new technology deployment&#149; Increase and maintain site Historian data collection to support existing manufacturing areas and new projects.&#149; Deliver and present analytics / reports for key stakeholders across the site to drive decision making&#149; Champion the use of data and information to help evolve the company into a truly data-driven organization&#149; Determine the sites data related needs and developing proposed solutions.&#149; Oversee the maintenance, administration, compliance and availability of the application systems and Laboratory IT systems.&#149; Management of suppliers, contractors, systems integrators and similar 3rd parties&#149; Technical solution design and evaluation, delivery, commissioning and validation, schedule tracking, budget management for sustaining initiatives&#149; Ensuring alignment of solutions with industry standards and regulations as they pertain to systems and system architectures&#149; Perform all tasks with due care and attention and in accordance with GMP&#149; As an active member of the AIS management team, contributing to and supporting the overall AIS strategy and functional deliverablesThe role requires some of the following Experience, Knowledge, Expertise:&#149; Strong knowledge of databases, reporting and analytic systems and Information Systems&#149; Ability to apply analytical skills to evaluate and interpret complex problems using multiple sources of information.&#149; Strong level of demonstrated experience in operations/manufacturing environment leading teams&#149; Experience in the delivery and management of GMP IS Application systems&#149; Exposure to and experience with a some of the following; OSI Pi Historian, TrackWise, Maximo, Document Management Systems,&#149; Exposure to and experience with a some of the following GMP Laboratory IT Systems such as Empower CDS, LMES, Sample Manager LIMS, Laboratory Analytical Equipment and instruments will be an advantage.&#149; Experience dealing with a large portfolio of systems, projects and initiatives in the areas of Information Systems and Operations.&#149; Experience and ability to constructively challenge and present technical aspects of system design&#149; Bachelors in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science, Biotech Engineering or related computer science engineering is idealNote: The role will allow for Remote working needs and/or facilitate relocation post travel restrictions if desired. Salary and package reflect the level of responsibility and PE Global will discuss confidentially and individually with each successful applicant. Contact: Brian Crimmins, PE Global, (phone number removed) or (url removed)Although it is not possible for us to respond to all applications, we at PE Global will do our upmost to give you feedback on your application. You have sent your Cv into us as a company and even though you have sent your CV to a particular position, we are making the reasonable assumption that you are active on the job market and as part of our normal recruitment service we will discuss other suitable positions with you. You are free to opt out of this so please specify in your application to us if you just want to be contacted in relation to a specific vacancy. Your Cv is sent to a central recruitment inbox which a number of people in the applicable PE Global division have access to and so this means that you might not be contacted by the named person in this advert

item.title: Production Supervisor Night shift
item.content: Production Supervisor - Night ShiftOur client, a medical device company in Clare are currently looking to recruit a Production Supervisor for their site.The Production Supervisor has overall responsibility for a Product Builder group in meeting its requirements in terms of Quality, Cost, Delivery, Supply, Safety and People. Strong communication, leadership and organizational skills are essential as well as a full understanding of the manufacturing process. Leads lean-manufacturing, productivity and quality- improvement initiatives and always looks for opportunities to reduce product-cost.Principal Duties and Responsibilities&bull;Supervision of production teams to ensure targets for Quality &ndash; Costs - Delivery &ndash; People are achieved.&bull;Ensures manufacturing-volume requirements are met, On Time in Full, within budget and with the correct schedule mix.&bull;Effectively manages employee performance, including coaching, counseling, developing and monitoring employee&rsquo;s and taking the appropriate performance management action where required.&bull;Facilitating open two-way communications regarding individual, team and company objectives and performance through weekly team meetings and daily interaction on the line.&bull;Develop Operational plans in conjunction with the Business Unit Leader to ensure alignment with overall Site and Operations functions strategy.&bull;Leads problem-solving initiatives and takes an active role in driving cross-functional collaboration with Manufacturing, Quality, Engineering, Maintenance &amp; Supply Chain groups with a view to reducing waste across the business.&bull;Establish and support a work environment of continuous improvement that supports the Quality Policy, Quality System and the appropriate regulations for the area they support. Ensure employees are trained to do their work and their training is documented.&bull;Ensures compliance with all company H &amp; S policies and is responsible for all H &amp;S issues on the shift&bull;Develop a training program to achieve optimum cross training versatility and flexibility while maintaining all H &amp; S requirements.&bull;Administration duties which include updating metrics, Time and Attendance system, Holiday planning etc.Education/ Experience Requirements&bull;Minimum of a level 7 in a Bachelor of Science / Engineering or relevant qualification.&bull;3/4 years&rsquo; experience in a supervisory capacity in a manufacturing environment.&bull;Previous experience of people-management and demonstrated ability in people motivation, organising and team building would be a distinct advantage&bull;Metrics and Continuous improvement experience&bull;Excellent communication and influencing skills with proven ability to deliver results in a cross function team based environment&bull;Proven experience and knowledge of process improvements with the use of lean tools&bull;Proven ability of leadership within a change management environment.&bull;Good knowledge of GMP / FDA regulatory requirements, housekeeping, health and safety.For further information on this Production Supervisor role in Clare/Limerick please contact Fiona Keane on (phone number removed) or email fiona@hero.ieCheck out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website &ndash; (url removed)Please Note: HERO Recruitment will not forward your details to any company without your prior approval

item.title: It Field Engineer
item.content: IT Field Engineer Dublin &euro;50-70kMy client based in Dublin has an immediate requirement to recruit a technically capable IT Engineer to join their busy team who is able to bring projects in on time and to client expectations.You will be in direct contact with end users over the telephone, via remote support and face to face for their customers based predominantly around the Dublin area. Above all, it will be expected that you help to ensure that defined service levels are consistently delivered to customers, requiring excellent personal communication skills and the ability to work on your own and as a member of a team.The successful candidate will need to have an excellent knowledge of all aspects of desktop and network technical support with proven commercial experience providing 3rd Line Support in a client facing capacity.Responsibilities * Project Delivery from initial scope to handover * Providing 3rd Line Support both remotely and on client site * Incident/escalation managementRequirements * Excellent knowledge of Windows Operating Systems and supporting technologies * Windows Server 2016 and ideally 2019 * Virtualisation: VMWare * Cloud technologies: Azure, Office 365 * Networking, LAN and WAN, DHCP, DNS, Firewalls * Storage: SAN * Able to liaise confidently with both technical and non-technical users * Driving license and own car essentialWe are looking for a self-motivated Support Engineer who is used to working to tight deadlines ideally. My client offers a friendly and enthusiastic working environment at a company that values its staff and their career progression.INFORM3 IT Recruitment is an equal opportunities employer. item.title: Remote HR Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Process Sciences Team Lead
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>The successful candidate will demonstrate a high level of technical leadership, collaboration, and coaching to facilitate the team in becoming a high-performance organisation</li><li>Supervision of area personnel. Develop an effective, focused and strong team by understanding: their abilities, unique contribution and broadening their skill set to be agile and prepared for any future business requirements.</li><li>Supervision and responsibility of the laboratory area. Ensuring adherence to the highest EHS standards and other business compliance regulations. Lead/participate in risk assessments, audits and incident investigations</li><li>Responsible for the maintenance of a high throughput laboratory though implementation of best practises and driving a culture of continuous improvement initiatives by deploying Six Sigma tools</li><li>Recruitment, training and integration of new team members</li><li>Contribute to site management operational and strategic initiatives.</li><li>Central to this objective will be the active engagement and communication with all internal and external stakeholders.</li></ul> <p> <b></b></p> <ul><li>At least 5 years' experience in the Pharmaceutical industry or a similar operating environment which includes significant leadership roles with experience in a front-line supervisory role in operations environment (laboratory or manufacturing).</li><li>Knowledge of and experience in applying Six Sigma and Lean methodologies into an operational area.</li><li>Demonstrated leadership and change management skills with a continuous improvement focus.</li><li>Degree or 3rd level qualification (Science/Technical/Engineering). Masters/PhD preferred.</li><li>Evidence of Continuous Professional Development.</li><li>Demonstrates the capability to lead a technical team</li><li>Demonstrates the ability to hold team members responsible for results</li><li>Realize improvement initiatives</li><li>Demonstrated successes in a team environment such a project teams, Six Sigma team, etc.</li><li>Demonstrated high level of problem solving and facilitation skills</li><li>Advanced PC skills such as MS Office , MS Project</li><li>Advance chromatography skills: experience with HPLCs, ASTRA, Empower software.</li><li>Stakeholder management of multi-decision makers, colleagues, peers and cross functional teams</li></ul> <p><br/> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?sAgKCRK9GUoNdiayjNVaQQn" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Senior Cloud Engineer – Permanent
item.content: Senior Cloud Engineer &ndash; Permanent, Co. GalwayDon&rsquo;t miss out on this great opportunity to work with one of Ireland&rsquo;s leading Software Security companies. This is a permanent opportunity based in Galway.Senior Cloud Engineer Role and Responsibilities:The successful candidate will be joining a pre-established team which is continuously expanding. As a Senior Cloud Engineer you will lead the growth, support, security and evolution of the AWS platform in support of our client&rsquo;s products.What&rsquo;s involved: * Lead the Design and Monitoring of deployed clouds and internal infrastructure, automated deployment of clouds, infrastructure and alerting. * Develop cloud-management monitoring and tools and improve all aspects of automation associated with cloud performance, scaling and availability * Review and advance the current infrastructure designWhat you need: * 3 + years&rsquo; AWS experience * Essential to have experience with AWS EC2, S3, Cloudwatch and core AWS technologies * Essential to have experience working with Terraform or similar * Knowledge of Prometheus, python or go, and scripting * Hands on skills with containers and / or serverless technologies (e.g. Kubernetes, Fargate, EKS, Lambda) a plus * Any experience with other cloud providers (Azure / Google) a plusWhat&rsquo;s on offer:Competitive salary and excellent benefits!Apply NowIf you would like to discuss this opportunity in person or with one of our IT Resourcers please forward your CV to Vantage Resources or contact Derek Leahy on (phone number removed) for a confidential discussion. Vantage Resources will not forward your details without prior discussion and approval.Vantage Resources is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse working environment by recruiting people from different backgrounds and cultures. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for engagement and/or employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity sexual orientation, national origin, culture, disability or age. An inclusive and diverse workforce is an essential part of the development of our organisation&rsquo;s culture which we believe enhances both our working environment and the service we provide to our customers

item.title: Facilities Manager - Pharmaceuticals
item.content: Our Facilities Management client seeking an experienced Integrated Facilities Manager with outstanding leadership skills. This exciting vacancy offers an opportunity to manage a portfolio of cleaning (GMP and non-GMP), catering, landscaping and technical services.Main ResponsibilitiesLeading the Contract - providing confident, visible leadership, ensuring standards are set and delivered, talent and resources are utilised optimally, client relationships are nurtured and developed and all opportunities for best practice and capability growth are leveraged.Delivering on Financial and Operational Targets - Ensuring that committed targets are met or exceeded and that costs and revenues are closely managed over the course of the financial years to ensure clarity on performance and provide the means to respond rapidly to any threats to financial performance. item.title: IT Engineer
item.content: The Portfolio Group are delighted to be recruiting on behalf of the Peninsula Group a Service Desk IT Engineer to join their busy and proactive department. Peninsula Business Services is the leading UK&#39;s Employment Law and Health &amp; Safety specialist consultancy across the UK &amp; Ireland and the demand on the business to provide this integral service to its customers has never been more in demand.This is a great opportunity to join the business and be part of the Service Desk team. You will be working in a team-based environment on the Service Desk, providing second line support to users in all our offices. Your main responsibilities include being the initial escalation point for the first line team providing first time fixes where possible, commissioning and building user equipment and triaging and escalating tickets when required.A broad technical knowledge is required, alongside ITIL experience in Incident, Request, Change, Problem, Release, Event and Knowledge management.Your key responsibilities and duties will include:Responsibility for being the first point of contact on the Service Desk.New Starters and Leavers administrationResponsibility for supporting and maintaining the company&#39;s IT systems and for providing efficient desktop support to all business users.Provide application support to our internal and external users.Responsible for resolving any IT related faults quickly and efficiently.Setting up and configuring new laptops, desktops and mobile devices.Installing authorised software to laptops, desktops and mobile devices.Reporting faults and maintaining logs on desktops and laptops.The ideal candidate will need following technical experience:ITIL experience.Experience in 1st and 2nd line support.Experience with supporting customers over the phone and in person.Experience of ticket management.Windows Server 2008 / 2012 / 2016Windows 7 / 10.MS Exchange 2010 / 2013 mailbox managementMicrosoft Office applications including Exchange.Active Directory and group policies.Setting up new users and disabling expired accounts.Patching of network and phones.Undertaking small- to medium-sized IT moves and projects.Experience in Office365, Mac OS, Mimecast and Airwatch would be highly desirable.We are looking for a forward thinking, results orientated individual with a strong customer service focus who is able to liaise with staff at levels through to the Senior Management Team and CEO with the ability to be flexible and work well under pressure. If you are looking for a forward thinking business constantly looking to drive ideas and innovation forward this is a great opportunity!!What you bring to the TeamDriven and results orientatedPositive outlook and a focus on high quality deliveryStrong communicatorMust have the ability to communicate complex concepts and ideas easily to the teamMust be motivated to ensure work is complete and according to the requirements on schedule and to a high quality.Must be reliableIs able to work under pressure in all situationsThe ideal candidate will ensure that correct decisions are made and issues acted on in a timely manner.A dedication to getting the task done within any deadlinesWhat&#39;s on offer?Generous basic salary up to &pound;35k DOEThe role is a permanent position with a 6 month probationary period. The working week is based on 37.5 hours.25 Days Holiday + Bank HolidaysProfit Share SchemeBreakfast provided each Monday morning &amp; monthly drinksContributory company pension schemeChildcare voucher schemeAccess to the Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)Utilising cutting edge software along with the latest technologies backed by huge investment and infrastructure, where else would you want to develop your career as an IT professional?Must have a valid driving licence and car as travel between Cork, Belfast and Dublin offices will be requiredIf this sounds like the right opportunity for you, click on the link to apply today.(phone number removed)LC1INDIRE

item.title: Senior Program Manager
item.content: POSITION DUTIES &amp; RESPONSIBILITIES: * Provide program leadership to instil trust and influence with key stakeholders * Consistently support the PMO (Project Management office) to continuously raise the standard of project leadership and upgrade methodologies * Accountable for the successful delivery of multiple simultaneous projects, spanning multiple functional areas and locations. * Responsible of clear definition of project scope and deliverables, milestones and timeline, project risks and contingency plans. * Collaborates with enterprise-wide business leads to build and execute well-structured program/project plans. * Use expert communication and leadership skills to establish a common understanding of the project timelines, milestones and expectations on delivery. * Provides direction to project resources, monitors efforts, assembles key project deliverables and identifies issues and risks requiring escalation when reporting project status. * Schedules and facilitates project status meetings and advises management on project status, risk and mitigation including executive reporting. Facilitates problem resolution. * Communicates project implementation options, schedule, quality and risk to stakeholders, as well as offer recommendations based on these elements. * Develop full-scale project plans and associated communication documents. * Plan, schedule and track project timelines using appropriate tools. * Know and follow all laws and policies that apply to one&#39;s job, and maintain the highest levels of professionalism, ethics and compliance at all times. * Diligently participate in our compliance program-related activities as denoted by your supervisor or our Chief Compliance Officer. PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: * 10+ years experience managing operations or business projects (ideally experience gained in blue chip multinationals, supporting global teams, virtual team and virtual working). * Experience in a regulated, compliance or quality assurance environment * Proven exceptional written and oral presentation skills, particularly at leadership levels * Demonstrated ability to lead across multiple business organizations, including global and enterprise-wide projects. * Experience in an regulated, compliance or quality assurance environment EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: * Master&#39;s degree in engineering, business, information systems or related discipline * Certificates in Program/Project Management will enhance candidacy but are not a requirement OTHER REQUIREMENTS: * Strong knowledge and skills in MS Office * Must be highly organized, creative, articulate and analytical * Strong interpersonal and diplomatic skills * Ability to multi-task independently with minimal supervision in a virtual global team * Must have solid understanding of project management methodologiesOur role in supporting diversity and inclusionAs an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. item.title: Dispatch Coordinator
item.content: Keegan group is a well-established, leading supplier of high quality construction products within Ireland and the UK. We began by producing ready mix concrete and have now expanded into concrete block manufacturing, precast wall and floor manufacturing and most recently producing calcium carbonate.We supply our quarry products to customers in the commercial and domestic markets around Dublin, Meath, Kildare, Offaly and Louth. Our precast is supplied all over the UK and Ireland and our calcium carbonate is supplied to feed mills all over Ireland.Job DescriptionThe Role: * Dispatching orders from our Plant * Taking orders &amp; responding to sales enquiries from customers and potential customers. * Coordination of all deliveries and shipping. * Daily management of the plant, ensuring sufficient supply of materials required. * Liaising with the maintenance team to ensure necessary routine and non-routine maintenance is carried outThe Ideal candidate will: * Have experience working in a busy shipping/dispatch environment * Have good attention to detail, be very organised and an excellent multitasker * Good phone manner and customer service skills. * Have a positive and proactive approach * Have good IT skillsA good knowledge of Quarry Products would be a distinct advantage.Full Training will be provided to the successful candidate
