item.title: Remote Recruiter
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Technical Lead / PHP Developer
item.content: PE Global are seeking to identify a candidate to join one of our key clients as a Technical Lead / PHP to take ownership of all web development and management activities and initiatives as they bring this inhouse.This is a global company with a HQ based in Ireland specialising in the constantly evolving competitive IOT and Wireless Telecommunications solutions sector.With a necessity to utilise their website as an agile marketing tool to frequently launch new products into new territories and engage new and existing customers, the newly appointed tech lead will be a key hire to ensure continued growth and success in this area.The objective of the role will entail:&#149; Liaise with a variety of internal/external stakeholders (Marketing, Sales, Finance, Board, IT, HR, key customers&hellip;) and articulate and implement the best solution to bridge business, tech and customer&#149; Define a road map to achieve the targeted vision of how the company positions itself in the marketplace whilst maintaining a user-friendly customer experience and optimum market exposure.&#149; Communicate the best technological solution for the problem at hand and proactively recommend and implement new technologies as part of continuous improvement goals.&#149; As a newly created role, there is a need to be hands-on with the development whilst building a team as necessary to ensure the collective vision is realised.&#149; Manage and monitor deliverables within budget and scope.Technical goals:&#149; Oversee the full project life cycle and take ownership for the management and delivery of a variety of projects in line with business requirements&#149; Write and review high-quality code with readability, efficiency and maintainability in mind&#149; Develop and maintain complex applications and Implement complex features&#149; Improve internal tools, libraries and standards&#149; Analyse user story acceptance criteria to ensure technical feasibility and point out potential issues&#149; Architect and develop new backend features and plugins, custom functionality, and theme integration&#149; Work with your project team to diagnose and resolve backend bugs and support requestsKnowledge &amp; Experience &amp; Tech&#149; Full Stack Development experience in a senior, tech / team lead capacity (5+ years experience)&#149; Experience working for a global company across strong UI/UX, web development, product launch / marketing digital practices&#149; Strong stakeholder engagement experience and confidence to guide the business technically&#149; Current Tech Focus: Wordpress / PHP &ndash; PHP 7, Laravel, Symfony, Composer, PSR, OOP&#149; Maintaining an eye and keen to stay on top of the latest and emerging tech&#149; Note: Company is able to offer fully remote OR onsite/remote options available Contact: Brian Crimmins, PE Global, (phone number removed) or (url removed)Although it is not possible for us to respond to all applications, we at PE Global will do our upmost to give you feedback on your application. You have sent your Cv into us as a company and even though you have sent your CV to a particular position, we are making the reasonable assumption that you are active on the job market and as part of our normal recruitment service we will discuss other suitable positions with you. You are free to opt out of this so please specify in your application to us if you just want to be contacted in relation to a specific vacancy. Your Cv is sent to a central recruitment inbox which a number of people in the applicable PE Global division have access to and so this means that you might not be contacted by the named person in this advert

item.title: Project Manager
item.content: At Bracken Recruitment we are exclusively working with our Dublin City Tech client who are recruiting for an enthusiastic, reliable and qualified Senior Project Manager with IT Service Delivery Manager experience to join their team.Working directly with their client, assuming responsibility for the delivery and management of both IT Projects and Services incorporating business as usual support and will play a big role in the evolution of their systems and processes to facilitate growth and efficiency.Responsibilities of Role * Proactively manage the planning and start-up of projects * This is a hands-on role where you will manage projects through the full software development lifecycle by carefully monitoring and controlling the project from requirements gathering through to live implementation * Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path * Facilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables * Effectively communicate project plans, risks, expectations to, customers, team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion * Track project milestones and deliverables for your projects to your manager * Determine the frequency and content of status reports from the team leaders, analyse results, and troubleshoot problem areas * Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals * Proactively manage changes in project scope identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans * Work closely with the QA team to ensure the quality of deliverables meets required standards * Accountable for delivering a robust, scalable IT infrastructure * Manage external suppliers and internal resources * Incident management and resolution acting as an escalation point for user and supplier queries * Identifying areas for improvement, implementing change and supporting the service transition of a vast range of project work * Ensure security of data, network access and backup systemsRequirements * Experience in managing multiple projects concurrently * Experience in producing detailed project schedules, resource requirements and tracking to schedule. * Project Management Tools proficiency * Analytical Skills with ability to truly understand the full scope and impact of the project requirements * Experience in Requirements Gathering &amp; Documentation, Risk &amp; Issue Management * Experience working with Technical Teams, with exposure to the following technologies, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, .Net, MS SQL, Windows O/S, Servers, Networks, Office365, Cloud Technologies * Project Reporting, Ability to present to Customers &amp; manage Customer relationshipsProven experience in Test &amp; Delivery Management * Experience in the operational management of suppliers and outsourced vendor * Understanding of development languages such as PHP and Java * Ability to be flexible in the technology or methodology used to deliver great service depending on the requirements and timescalesEssential and Desirable Skills * Exposure to Project Management of Web based systems development * Project Management Certification is highly desirable * Experience working with different development languages, especially PHP and Java. * Service Delivery, IT Manager, Windows, Azure, Office365, AWS, Networking, ServerTo apply for this role please submit your CV and we will be in touch

item.title: Manufacturing Team Lead (Biologics)
item.content: Team Horizon currently has an exciting opening for a Manufacturing Team Lead to join our client&rsquo;s brand new state of the art biologics fill-finish facility in Sligo.As the Manufacturing Team Lead, you will guide and support a team of skilled Biologics Technicians across filling, lyophilization, equipment preparation, formulation, buffer preparation and processing activities in the biologics fill-finish facility to meet clearly stated operating objectives.Why you should apply: * Join a company that has developed a stand-out culture of innovation, inclusion and development, and consistently features as a great place to work. * Generous package with good base salary and benefits to including but not limited to health insurance, pension and bonus. * Join an organisation who uses Innovative new technologies, who embrace diversity, equality and inclusion and puts patients first. * Based in the West of Ireland the cost of living is low, meaning more disposable income. * Upgrade your work-life balance, the quality of life is amazing, less traffic more time for activities!What you will be doing: * Manage, motivate and develop the manufacturing team and provides technical expertise for investigation and resolution of process deviations, root cause investigation, CAPAs, process improvements, review, and approval of change controls * Instil a culture of contamination control and compliance with aseptic best practice * Deliver daily reporting on the status of all operations and support activities * Manage verification and updating of manufacturing control system transactions accurately and in a timely fashion * Act as a key point of technical contact for aseptic fill-finish activities including communicating departmental goals to biologics technicians and providing cost-effective quality compliant products in a safe, effective manner * Liaise with program management, supply chain, technical operations quality and engineering groups to ensure effective planning, scheduling and execution of commercial and NPI clinical manufacturing * Resolve operations/project issues by working with team members, project customers, and others as appropriate * Promote operations excellences culture and Key operations targets including OEE where applicable * Provide direct interface as a subject matter expert with QA department to interaction with HPRA, FDA and applicable health authority and internal audits * Ensure the execution of fill-finish, lyophilization, equipment preparation, buffer preparation and formulation processing activities to meet clearly stated operating objectives * Ensure successfully review, amendment and implementation of changes to SOPs * Promote a culture of Right First Time, Behavioral Based Safety, Always Audit Ready and Human Error Reduction within their team * Develop direct reports by securing appropriate training, assigning progressively challenging tasks, and managing mid-year and annual reviews * Schedule human and material resources within a department or section in conjunction with near-term plans to ensure their availability; carries out operations within an established budget * Provide required technical guidance and approval for manufacturing batch record * Compile data from manufacturing, performing statistical analysis to trend and track process performance * Comply with the EHS policy and procedures and demonstrate EHS best practices in all work activitiesWhat you need to apply: * Degree qualified (masters/PHD preferred) in Process, Biopharmaceutical, Chemical Engineering, or other relevant discipline required * A minimum of 5 years&rsquo; experience in batch processing, automation, commissioning, and validation in an FDA/HPRA regulated industry A minimum of 1-year team direct supervisory experience essential * Detailed knowledge of cGMP and regulatory requirements relating to the biopharmaceutical industry is required for this role * Comprehensive understanding of the principles of contamination control and regulatory expectations for aseptic processing * Technical knowledge of Biologics/Aseptic Fill-Finish manufacturing process * Experience of start-ups and/or new product introductions to biopharmaceutical/pharmaceutical facilities (Biologics Preferred). Must be able to lead &amp; project manage these activities * Demonstrated project management skills, including the ability to deliver projects on schedule, within budget, and meeting the predefined quality and safety requirements. * Possess a strong technical knowledge and application of concepts, practices, and procedures. Experience in working on problems of complex scope where analysis of situations or data involves multiple competing factors. Exercise judgment and advises management as to the appropriate actions

item.title: Lead Controls Engineer
item.content: Lead Controls Engineer.Job Summary:Our client, is seeking applications for a Lead Controls Engineer located in Galway, Ireland. This Lead Controls Engineer will work as a member of the Systems Architecture Design &amp; Controls Team. This role will support the execution of embedded controls development projects, working with hardware, software, validation test and system integration functions.Core Job Responsibilities: * Develop controller models for system level control algorithms and logic that provide superior performance, enhance reliability and diagnostics. * Execute model-in-the-loop simulations to verify control behavior and performance. * Support system and sub-system level integration testing to ensure control system behavior meets functional and non-functional requirements. Review and analyze system test data. * Mentor and supervise team members. * Work with software development teams to integrate model-generated software into application software. * Adhere to model development standards and processes. * Collaborate with System integration teams and Product management. * 10% travel anticipated.Minimum Qualifications: * Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Engineering or Computer Science required. Other technical degrees may be considered with relevant work experience. * 12 years experience in controls, electronics, systems or software engineering is required. * Master&rsquo;s Degree in Control Theory is strongly preferred.Key Competencies: * Experience with model based design processes and modeling &amp; simulation of complex systems. * Understanding of control system design. Classical control knowledge required (PID control, linear control, digital filtering). Advanced control knowledge preferred (modern control theory, model predictive control, non-linear control, adaptive control, fuzzy logic). * Advanced proficiency with Simulink and Stateflow is required. * Understanding of optimization techniques is preferred. * Experience with MAAB, J-MAAB, IEC 62304 standards or equivalents are preferred. * Experience in automating processes is preferred. * Proficiency in SVN, Jenkins or Dymola beneficial. * Knowledge in refrigeration, vapor compression or thermodynamics/fluid dynamics is a plus. * Knowledge in compressors, engines or power electronics is a plus

item.title: IT Business Systems Analyst - Labeling & Manufacturing
item.content: IT Business Systems Analyst - Labeling &amp; Manufacturing &ndash; 12-month contractWould you like to work in a company who is the global leader in medical technology?Now you will have a chance to work on the global, challenging project in a medical devices company in Galway. It will be an initial 12-month contract with the possibility for extension.The candidate will be working from home but may require occasional on-site in Galway.IT Business Analysts communicate with numerous functional areas and support business needs related to technology, operational processes, and data relationships/configurations to sustain operations. They align processes across business units/geographies and develop solutions to issues while facilitating process development and improvement activities.Our Client is looking for an IT Business Analyst with a labelling system implementation experience to support the Global euMDR (Medical Device Regulation) project.Responsibilities: * Reporting into euMDR IT lead * Collaborate with IT lead to undergo fit/gap analysis for system readiness across sites * Collaborating cross-functionally with designated subject matter experts (SME) * Expected to aid IT Lead to run projects using project management tools and methods this includes kick-off meetings, project plan development and management, risks and issue logs, mitigations, status updates and metrics * Represents the IT Department to the business and escalates as appropriate to requests and inquiries from the business * Proactive participation and communication within teams to include inputs of euMDR labelling project line items to the broader project plan, identification of risks, mitigations and solutions to ensure the success of achieving overall project goals and timelines * Collaboration with peers across the global project team to support continuous improvement in processes and executionSkills Required: * Experienced system integration/labelling system integration analyst with the ability to work autonomously * Strong working knowledge of a number of labelling systems and their integration including with SAP ECC, SAP ME * Experience in supporting the delivery of labelling system projects in large organizations * Minimum 2 years&rsquo; (or 2 implementation projects) experience in labelling system implementation/labelling system management * Experience with at least with one of these systems: Prisym R3, Prisym 360, LEGI, APLS, Bartender and etc.Clicking the &ldquo;Apply Now&rdquo; button means that you agree to the processing of your personal data for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes, carried out by QPTech in accordance with the provisions of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (EU) 2016/679. You also agree to share your personal data with other entities of QPTech and potential employers for purposes related to the recruitment process. QPTech may also contact you from time to time to inform you of events we are hosting that you may find interesting.Providing data is voluntary, you have the right to inspect, correct or request deletion of your data at any time. A request to delete data means withdrawal from any further engagement in QPTech&rsquo;s recruitment processes and will result in the immediate deletion of your data. If you do not agree, please do not click the &ldquo;Apply Now&rdquo; button.Please visit QPTech&rsquo;s website to read the full Privacy Policy ((url removed)

item.title: Setting Out Engineer
item.content: You will likeWorking in Dublin region, for this leading Construction Contractor, majoring on civil engineering and operating across the UK and Ireland. They have balanced portfolio across civil and structural projects and cover commercial, residential, infrastructure, utilities and specialist jobs including demolition, asbestos removal &amp; waste management. They have an impressive order book with varied projects from &pound;1M &ndash; &pound;20M+. Culture wise they care about employees and are passionate about delivering quality projects and client satisfaction.You will likeThe job as Setting Out Engineer as part of the experienced site management team delivering on a traditional build terraced housing and apartment scheme within central Dublin. This is a live project, set to run until July 2021.This is a fixed-term contract with the possibility for extension/permanent employment.The Project:&nbsp;A large scale multi-contract social housing scheme (2/3 story Houses &amp; 4 Storey Apartments) from foundations through construction and handover.The role includes managing parts of the construction project, providing expert technical advice and using developed skills in interpreting engineering information and surveying/setting out. More specifically:&bull; Setting Out/Dimensional Control (groundworks &amp; structural) inc. use of GPS, total station &amp; automatic levels&bull; Workforce engagement with the site team inc. subcontractor supervision&bull; Procurement, monitoring and recording of materials, plant and logistics&bull; Implementing QA procedures including M&amp;E sign off, drainage testing, concrete pre/post pour checks &amp; compiling subcontractor snag lists&bull; Record keeping and reporting inc. compiling information for O&amp;M manuals, as-built drawings&bull; Health &amp; Safety, Environment and Sustainability, inc. acceptable practice (CDMs &amp; RAMS) and behaviours&bull; Keeping to programme, scope of works.This is a site-based job,&nbsp;7.30 am to 5.30 pm Monday to Friday.You will haveAs Setting Out Engineer, you will have Ste Manager/Engineer experience in civils/structures ideally within general/civils contractor and including residential/housing projects.&bull; An Honours or Masters degree in Civil or Structural Engineering, accredited by the ICE (preferred)&bull; (or) BTEC level 4/ HNC in Civil Engineering as a minimum; other Built environment degrees or Level 4/5 qualifications will be consideredYou will get&bull; Direct fixed term contract at a solid salary equivalent of E 40K-50K+ EURO Neg +&nbsp;benefits&bull; 25 days holiday per annum + Bank Holidays&bull; You will enjoy the kudos and credibility of working for a civil construction market leader.&bull; Ongoing training &amp; development, and opportunities for promotion &amp; progression.You can applyTo the Setting Out Engineer job by pushing the button on this job posting (recommended), by sending CV in confidence to (url removed), or give me a call at (phone number removed).AOSJ_MS

item.title: EHS Specialist
item.content: Join our Client, a World Class biologics services provider at their state of the art Greenfield Biopharmaceuticals CMO site in Dundalk, Co. LouthThe Environmental Health and Safety Specialist will provide technical support on environmental, occupational health and safety, ergonomic management and other relevant environmental, health and safety areas. This role will support all EHS aspects to ensure successful completion of the capital site build while also playing a key role in developing the EHS Safety Program for Client sustaining operations.Responsibilities: * Support the establishment of an EHS management system to support the Client&rsquo;s two manufacturing suites. * Support and continue to work closely with current site contractor management programme. Ensure process in place to identify all high-risk work and associated risk assessments and permit to work program are in line with agreed processes and procedures. * A key element of the role particularly in start up phase will be the initiation and conducting of risk assessments across the site and ensuring appropriate control measures are in place. * Be a site champion in EHS practices and develop, promote and drive the maintenance of a strong, proactive health &amp; safety culture on the project. * Lead EHS management of the corrective action program (CAPA) process, providing regular guidance and measurement to all associates to ensure all corrective actions / preventative measures are addressed in a timely manner. * Support the licensing process and ensure compliance with statutory legislation and internal policies and procedures. * Coordinate site environmental waste management programme, reporting regularly and driving continuous improvement initiatives. * Implement and update EHS control procedures detailing programme for Working at Height, Confined Space mgm, Work Permit programme, ERT among others as required. * Assess training needs analysis and support the development of training programme. Participate in and deliver associated training where required. * Coordinate activities regarding procurement, supply, provision and maintenance of safety equipment ensuring compliance to relevant standards and processes. * Coordinate EHS related meetings and provide information and training as a recognised EHS expert. * Play an important role in the implementation and development of the site ERT team for Operations start up. * Complete risk assessments to determine relevant occupational health surveillance programs and coordinate same. * Conduct thorough incident and accident investigations as required and report as per policies and procedures. * Review and approve other functional SOP&rsquo;s and URS&rsquo;s and other safety documentation to support site EHS activities.Qualifications, Skills &amp; Experience: * Diploma or Certificate in Health and Safety or equivalent is essential * 3+ years&rsquo; experience in an Occupational Health and Safety role in an API / Biological manufacturing environment * Experience in a start-up and commissioning environment. * Experience in working in a GMP / Clean room environment and familiarity with these systems. * Experience of EHS management systems including ISO14001, OHSAS18001 &amp; ISO45001 * Strong ability to conduct risk assessments in a manufacturing environment.Desirable: * IOSH membership * Experience working in a Bio Safety Level 1 manufacturing environment is preferable * Experience in IPC licence and environmental management * Experience in waste management

item.title: Health and Safety Consultant - Field based
item.content: The Portfolio Group are delighted to be recruiting on behalf of Peninsula, an award winning international organisation providing Business Support, Employment Law, Health &amp; Safety and Employee Wellbeing services to a range of clients.Job OverviewThe Health &amp; Safety Department are looking for hardworking professional Health &amp; Safety Consultant with a high level of technical knowledge and experience, gained within the construction sector. You will have the ability to build strong relationships with your clients and deliver a high quality, cost effective consultancy service. Ideally you will be a chartered member of The Institution of Occupational Safety &amp; Health or equivalent.Day-to-Day ResponsibilitiesConduct yourself in a professional matter at all times (including appearance, use of PPE, communication etc.) ensuring that you comply with both company and departmental policies, procedures and protocolsTo visit clients premises for the purpose of carrying out agreed contractual workUndertake health and safety visits to client&#39;s premises in accordance with departmental protocols and contract requirements, in particular where SLA&#39;s are in placeSubmit any relevant reports or other such associated documents in accordance with client demand and departmental protocolsAdvise and instruct clients in the use of Health and Safety Management systems.Liaise with the HSE and other Enforcing Authorities on behalf of clients when required to do soAdvise clients on matters of Health and Safety standards and best practice affecting their business. Assist clients with accident or other special investigations as requiredAttend company meetings, courses etc. when required to update and maintain professional skills/knowledgeSupporting the client through effective crisis management where requiredPeninsula have a great reputation for providing high quality consultancy services and working as part of the Health and safety team will offer a role with great challenge and variety to develop your career with industry leading training.We seek applications from Health &amp; Safety professionals who can demonstrate excellent skills in managing client relationships, able to offer practical solutions to clients utilising your extensive technical knowledge of Health and Safety. Successful candidates will hold one of the following professional memberships; GMIOSH, GradIOSH, MIIRSM, CIEH, whilst candidates with associate memberships or NEBOSH National Diploma or equivalent will also be considered. item.title: IT Solution Architect
item.content: A unique opportunity has arisen with one of our Limerick based clients. They currently looking for a technically passionate IT Solution Architect to become a central part of the technical sales teams to identify and the solutions that will enhance the performance of existing and prospective client&rsquo;s infrastructure. As an IT Solution Architect, you will work closely with the sales and operations teams to plan and execute account coverage to secure new sales opportunities.This is a company that takes great pride in the quality of the solutions and service it provides to their clients. They have gained their industry leading status from delivering a best in class service consistently, combined with a hunger to continually strive to improve.As a IT Solution Architect, you will be responsible for: * Architecting, designing, and presenting best in class solutions to clients with the account manager, with a primary focus on cloud solutions * Proactively reviewing existing clients and liaising with the operational teams on tiered accounts to find opportunities. * Work strategically to remove technical and business sales roadblocks and innovate to improve business development practices. * Develop a thorough understanding of solutions and relevant business pains and become proficient conducting high-level demos of primary selling scenarios. * Liaising with the operations team on solution deliverables and act as an escalation for clarifications. * Liaising with Subject Matter Experts (SME&rsquo;s) on the operations team for additional input on solution architecture and design. * Liaising with vendors to evaluate new technologies and their potential as viable solutions for customers. * Provide training and knowledge transfer to sales and operations teams for new technologies and solutions which have been successfully evaluated. * Develop adoption strategies for new technologies evaluated to allow the operations team to upskill and provide support services. * Delivering pre-sales workshops for new and existing clients: * Evaluate the business operational challenges and current state impacts * Demonstrate understanding * Present findings, with risks and recommendations and anticipated benefit * Continuous professional development is expected in all areas of the roleKey Qualifications: * Minimum of 7 years&rsquo; experience in solution architecture/IT consultancy * Deep knowledge of architectures in the areas of:* Microsoft Azure Services * Cloud Migrations * Security * Virtualisation * Storage * Networking * Backup/Disaster Recovery/Business Continuity* Relevant up to date industry certification in the above is desirable but not essential. * Excellent proposal and technical writing skills, including MS Visio, Excel, Word, PowerPoint. * Strong presentation and communication skillsTo be considered for this position applicants must be eligible to work and reside in Ireland (holder of an EC Passport or a Current Stamp 4 Visa)

item.title: Animal Technician
item.content: The University of Medicine and Health Sciences are looking to recruit an Animal Technician to provide technical support and assistance for research projects conducted in their rodent facility. The successful candidate will have significant experience performing experimental procedures and colony management.This post is being advertised by Agenda Life Sciences on behalf of The University of Medicine and Health Sciences.The closing date for applications is 9th December 2020.Basic Requirements: * Minimum of IAT level 3 diploma, or equivalent animal care qualification * Hold a Home Office Personal Licence * Experience with husbandry and colony management of non-GM and GM laboratory rodents * Proven experience related to performing experimental procedures, euthanasia and anaesthesia/analgesia * Up to date knowledge of laboratory animal technology, care, accommodation, husbandry and welfare.Duties and Responsibilities: * Daily husbandry duties with a strong commitment to animal care and welfare checks * Management of GM and non-GM rodent colonies and proactively coordinating with researchers to assist with pairing, weaning, identification and record keeping * Competency on animal management software to assist the establishment on legal compliance * Training of research staff in relation to animal care and welfare, animal procedures and euthanasia * Animal clinic records follow ups, administration of animal remedies and performing euthanasia as indicated by the Designated Veterinarian * Ordering, receipt and sterilization of equipment and consumables, and stock management * Reception and packing of animals * Reporting and problem solving of environmental conditions, equipment, laboratories use, animal welfare and animal colony management * Assist the Unit Manager on the development and updating of Standard Operating Procedures * Any other duties in accordance with the qualification that may be assigned by the Unit Manager

item.title: CSA Site Manager | Galway
item.content: CSA Site Manager | Galway &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose As CSA Site Manager you will be tasked to represent the Project Manager and Kirby Group on major construction sites and to take responsibility for all site related activities associated with the construction of a varied range of projects. The CSA Site Manager will be expected to take the lead on all on-site activities from pre-mobilisation through to commissioning and eventual demobilisation. &nbsp; CSA Site Manager Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; Project Start-Up: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist PM in development of construction programme, short term look ahead planning reports, equipment and materials schedules. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Visit site and develop a site establishment schedule. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Familiarisation with change management with PM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist in project validation. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Put site safety starter pack in place and participate in HSEQ plan. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Set up site establishment. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Method statement and Risk Assessment preparation and review with sub-contractor. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review construction drawings and sign off &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist in benchmarking installation practices and Quality procedures &nbsp; Project Running Phase: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Productivity &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Develop a daily key action plan that includes HSEQ, productivity and people management. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist Project team in expediting of major equipment deliveries. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain a site diary &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Attend/Chair internal meetings with sub-contractors. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that all variations are picked up in conjunction with PM and QS. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure labour allocation sheets are being completed by sub-contractors. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Produce short term programmes in line with master programme. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mark up master programme each week and issues to PM. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Effectively manage sub-contractor supervision to enable efficient productivity &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure sub-contractor workforce is on site at workface on time. &nbsp; People &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Liaise with sub-contractors to address available work faces. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Liaise with our client in co-ordination between building and services. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Work closely with other supervisors to ensure effective co-ordination between M&amp;E &nbsp;&amp; CSA services. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Integrate with other internal and external supervisors to ensure cross co-ordination of trades and installation processes. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Take ownership and responsibility of issues to drive out solutions in conjunction with Project Manager. &nbsp; Safety &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure tool box talks, inductions and safety briefings are being carried out. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain plant logs and ensure weekly safety checks are carried out. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure operatives are working safely, wearing appropriate PPE and working to agreed method statements. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure compliance with Health and Safety Policy in particular to the operation of work permits, site safety audits and weekly walk arounds. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Carry out daily walk around adopting a &ldquo;don&rsquo;t walk by&rdquo; approach to safety. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement H&amp;S behaviour/culture and Golden Rules. &nbsp; Quality &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Plan and co-ordinate delivery of materials and plant. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mark up drawings in conjunction with inspection testing. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure inspection test plan is enforced by snagging works, then offering to client for inspection at various stages of the installation working to ZERO snags. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure that free issue equipment is checked, cared for and once accepted confirm to engineer to sign off for payment. &nbsp; Close Out Activities: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all site safety devices are proved. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all life systems are complete and certified. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Issue final marked up drawings are correct. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Liaise with PM on site demobilisation, including plant, labour, materials and site establishment. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all statutory notices, schematics, wall charts are in place on site in accordance with project completion checklist. &nbsp; Other Duties: &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain a site diary. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Assist QS in his / her duties &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure company&rsquo;s good image is maintained at all times. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Integrate with site team. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure your agreed training plan is enforced. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the CSA Site Manager &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Recognised Carpentry/Plaster/Fitout/Civil worker etc. apprenticeship / trade cert coupled with a minimum of 5 years Site Management experience &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; item.title: Management Systems Auditor - ISO 9001, CPR
item.content: Company DescriptionSGS is the global leader and innovator in inspection, verification, testing and certification services. Founded in 1878, SGS is recognized as the global benchmark in quality and integrity. Trusted all over the world, SGS is a market leader because we put 100% passion, pride and innovation into everything we do. We encourage new ideas. We welcome people who challenge the way we do things. And we will be 100% committed to helping you reach your full potential.At SGS, we have an open corporate and international culture, we offer a dynamic work environment in a leading global company. Our high professional standards and our sustainability approach guarantee you a future-oriented work environment. We invest in our employees for the long term and we are committed to supporting your development within the company.Job Description * Job Title: Auditor * Job Type: Permanent * Hours: Full time * Job Location: Field based - Essex / South Region * Company car provided * Travel required: Yes - 75 % of the time * Remuneration: As an Auditor, you&rsquo;ll receive a competitive salary in line with industry experience and qualifications. In addition, you&rsquo;ll benefit from a 10% annual performance bonus, private health cover, a contributory pension scheme and life cover.As an SGS Auditor you&rsquo;ll be supporting organisations by using your industry expertise to assess whether their procedures and processes meet the relevant management systems standard and applicable legal requirements, delivering business assurance and consumer confidence.You&rsquo;ll plan and conduct audits in line with SGS procedures, guide clients through the certification process, and will provide specific technical support to expand SGS&rsquo; capability to offer value added services to customers.Your role will be field based, and you&rsquo;ll be working on-site with different clients each day, getting to know their business, and assessing their products, processes, systems or services, ensuring compliance with national and international regulations and standards.This is a regional role primarily covering the Home Counties and the South East of England. Travel time is taken into consideration to ensure a positive work/life balance when planning audits, and all audits will be scheduled within a reasonable commute from your location. The role will involve a combination of office, client site and home working, and the successful candidate must therefore hold a full clean driving license.QualificationsThe competence of a Certification Assessor / Auditor is vital for the delivery of an effective audit, and in providing clients with the confidence that the management system being certified meets the highest standards.The successful candidate for this role must therefore; * have held positions with significant Quality Management System (QMS) responsibility. * demonstrate strong working knowledge and experience of the ISO 9001 management system standard, compliance and auditing techniques. * have a varied breadth of industry sector experience, ideally across the manufacturing / construction / waste management industries. * be qualified to ISO 9001 Lead Auditor status, and qualified to the latest version of the standard. * have experience in Construction Products Regulation (CPR) and National Highway Sector Schemes (NHSS)Auditing of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), Energy Management (ISO 50001) or Asset Management (ISO 55001), would be desirable but not essential.Additional InformationTo find out more about our Global products and services, please click here.APPLY NOW for full consideration, you can be sure that your application will be treated confidentially and impartially, and you will always receive an update within 10 business days

item.title: Seasonal Bat Ecologist
item.content: <p><strong>Seasonal Bat Ecologist</strong></p><p>MKO is a Galway‐based planning and environmental consultancy providing services to both the private and public sectors. The company provides an extensive range of specialist services in the fields of Planning, Ecology, Ornithology, Planning and Estates and Project Management. </p><p>MKO is seeking to recruit <strong>Seasonal Bat Ecologists</strong> to join the Ecology team. The successful candidates will be working on projects including the wind energy and road and built infrastructure sectors. Experience within these sectors will be an advantage to prospective candidates. </p><p>The positions available will offer the successful candidates the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects utilising the various skills they may have acquired through formal training, personal interest and previous work experience. Due to the nature of bat survey work, there will be a requirement to work outside normal office hours. </p><p>The successful candidate will be expected to:</p><p>• Have a minimum of a third level honours degree or higher, in ecology, environmental science or another equivalent discipline. </p><p>• Work as part of a multi‐disciplinary team of staff members to deliver project requirements. </p><p>• Have a high level of overall ecological field skills, highlighting any specialist ecological expertise (either academic or interest) in their application. </p><p>• Have experience in the use of GIS, Kaleidoscope Pro, BatExplorer, Ecobat and Microsoft Office. </p><p>• Have a full driver's licence. </p><p>The key responsibilities associated with the role will include:</p><p>• Undertaking background research, desk studies and ecological fieldwork, to best-practice guidelines and methodologies;</p><p>• Compiling, organising and analysing large datasets; </p><p>• Ensuring the correct setup, maintenance, deployment and management of equipment;</p><p>• Reporting </p><p><strong>Candidates interested in the available position should apply by emailing an up to date Curriculum Vitae and Cover Letter/Email to -</strong> . </p><p><strong>A full driver's licence is an essential requirement for carrying out survey work. As part of their application, candidates should also specify their particular abilities in the range of ecological field skills, including botanical, ornithological, vertebrate, invertebrate, aquatic and marine surveying. </strong></p><p><strong>The closing date for applications is 22nd January 2021. </strong></p><p></p><img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?nwS37fZcSVP98c9Nlgn2%2bgg" width="0" height="0" />

Cycle Time&middot; Continuous Improvement &amp; Lean initiatives to include, cost effectiveness through automation &amp; process optimization.&middot; Ability to analyse &amp; resolve engineering issues of a broad scope using independent judgment&middot; their application in a manufacturing environment&middot; Automation, PLC / Software experience&middot; FDA, ISO13485 or equivalent experience preferred&middot; Project Management training and experienceFor EU roles, candidates must be eligible to work and live in the European Union.Proof of eligibility will be required with your application.Office Locations: Stratford-upon-Avon, Amsterdam, Barcelona, Cape Town, Dubai, D&uuml;sseldorf, Istanbul, Lyon, G&ouml;teborg, Milan, Mumbai, Shanghai, Singapore, Sydney and Washington.PLASTICS - PETROCHEMICALS - PACKAGING - CHEMICALS - ENERGY &ndash; item.title: Bodyshop Estimator
item.content: Estimator / Vehicle Damage Assessor- Automotive Accident Repair Centre - Cork, Republic of Ireland - Up to 30,000&euro; Basic salary, plus bonus and overtime (&pound;27,277 @ current exchange rate) - Benefits: On-site parking, Company events &amp; social hours, Company pension, Employee discounts, and Wellness programmes With house prices excellent, if you&rsquo;re looking to buy; the way of life relaxed and amazing countryside. Now might be the time to relocate to the &lsquo;emerald isle&rsquo;. Ireland has remained a popular expat destination. In fact, Ireland was recently ranked joint sixth place in the top 10 places to live worldwide by the Human Development Index (HDI). Moving to Ireland will reinvigorate your weekends. From stunning coastlines to breath-taking countryside, Ireland has it all. Being a small country with an excellent network of roads, exploring this beautiful country will become your new weekend passion. If work-life balance is important: Because work life balance is important to the Irish, many employers have introduced policies in order to provide flexible workplaces. Full time hours are generally between 35 and 40 hours per week and all employees that have worked at least 1365 hours per year are entitled to a minimum of four weeks paid holiday per year. This includes full time, part time, temporary or casual employees. There are also eight annual Irish public holidays to enjoy!! Our client is a large and well respected Accident Repair Centre in the centre of Cork. They are currently suffering from their own success, loads of work stacking up, and only getting busier and no local talent to take on the work. As such they have approached Perfect Placement to bring them talented Paint Sprayers, Panel Beaters and Estimators from the UK, who want to live and work in the Emerald Isle. item.title: Legal Counsel
item.content: This is a fixed term 12 month roleMain purpose of the jobThe main purpose of the job is to work closely with the Head of Research Contracts and to assist in ensuring that adequate due diligence, compliance and negotiation is undertaken on all research contractual matters and that final agreement and related advice is reached/presented in a more responsive and efficient manner. This will require the performance of role related administrative work by both the incumbent solicitor and the successful candidate.Main Duties and Responsibilites:Provide high quality and pragmatic legal advice to support the research activities undertaken within the University. In this regard:o Support the drafting, reviewing and negotiation of contracts and other research related documentation to meet the needs of the Office of the Vice-President for Research. A non exhaustive list of such documentation includes: EU Consortium Agreements; EU, international and/or national Grant Agreements; collaboration agreements; consultancy agreements; clinical research agreements; etc.;o Review matters in an all-encompassing fashion, for example bearing in mind risk and reward, and subsequently provide legal advice that is in the University&#39;s best interest;o Finalise said agreements with other Universities and/or commercial entities;Essential * Qualified as a Solicitor or Barrister; * At least 4 years post qualification experience; * A proven ability to provide practical, solution focused advice across a broad range of legal areas / issues, including for example: commercial contracts; intellectual property; information technology; indemnity provisions; limitation of liability provisions; insurance etc.; * Measurable experience of contract drafting and negotiation; * Commercial acumen; * Excellent interpersonal, time management and communication skills; * Sound professional judgement; * A proven ability to manage a multitude of matters concurrently; and * Willingness to learn, perform administrative tasks and show initiative. * Self-motivated and capable of working on own initiative * Proven ability to work well in a team and develop collaborative relationships with a broad range of stakeholdersDesirable: * Experience of dealing with clients in both public sector (including research performing organisations) and industry; * Knowledge of compliance legislation and its practical implications - for example, some experience in advising on issues pertaining to Data Protection, Procurement, Clinical Research etc

item.title: Process Engineer (Software Applications)
item.content: Position OverviewThe Applications Developer role will be responsible for building bespoke applications, including anything from back-end services to their client-end counterparts. The responsibilities will include designing and developing these applications, and to coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. The role requires proficiency in one of C# development, VB.NET, Python or JavaScript. Experience with HTML, JavaScript, and web development frameworks (e.g. AngularJS, Bootstrap, jQuery would be an advantage). Additionally, experience with SQL Server, device data collection (e.g. PLCs), batch manufacturing/traceability system would be a plus.KEY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES * Project manages software centered projects, whilst ensuring robust verification &amp; validation. * Translate User Requirements into functional applications. * Design, build, test and maintain efficient, reusable and reliable code. * Identify bottlenecks and bugs and apply fixes to ensure application robustness. * Maintain source control using GIT and TFS, to ensure proper documentation and tracking. * Integrate new and existing applications to external vendor systems including databases and Industrial devices. * Apply operational excellence tools and techniques to continuously improve our processes and eliminate waste. * Support and implement Plant of the Future work stream initiatives.FUNCTIONAL COMPETENCIES: * A minimum of 6 years relevant experience is essential in programming systems support. * Ability to work independently and proactively. * Well-structured methodical approach to work. * Good judgement and decision-making skills. * Strategic in approach.PREVIOUS WORK EXPERIENCE &amp; SKILLS * Proficient in C# and the .Net Technologies (ideally including Windows Presentation Framework). * Strong understanding of object-oriented programming. * Proficient with a database technology essential, preferably Microsoft SQL Server (Apply online only). * Experience with Web Application frameworks and windows Web Services (for example JavaScript, HTML5 and the IONIC framework). * Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (such as Git, VSS, TFS). * Familiarity with Relational Databases and the SQL query language. LINQ, XML and JSON would be an advantage. * Experience with industrial manufacturing software for example Batch, SCADA, HMI PLCs or similar an advantage. * Experience with Microsoft Server (Apply online only) OS. * Demonstrated experience of delivering projects in a complex systems environment.EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS * A recognized Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related discipline required

item.title: Hiring Specialist
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: NoSQL Developer – Contract

growth opportunities, great compensation, and benefits.Key Deliverables: * Install, configure, patch, and upgrade database software (NoSQL, MySQLm MySQL cluster, MongoDB) * Manage the operations for both development and production databases * Create and configure monitors to establish the health of servers and the databases running on them * Troubleshoot NoSQL issues and performance bottlenecks * Design, implement, maintain and automate the appropriate backup and recovery architecture as required * Submit service requests to software vendors and drive resolution through to completion * Work with internal teams to plan and schedule application upgrades * Manage day-to-day replication processes * Work with customers to help determine and deploy the best datastore technology and data model strategy for their needsSkills and experience: * Previous working experience as a NoSQL Developer for 3 years. * BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS or similar relevant field * Deep understanding of NoSQL and relational databases and database fundamentals, including data storage, data modelling, and data access patterns * Hands on experience with MongoDB * Outstanding organizational and time management skills * Analytical thinker with problem solving aptitude * Attention to detailWhat&rsquo;s on offer: * Excellent daily rate depending on experiencePerks/Extras: * Competitive packageApply NowIf you would like to discuss this opportunity in person or with one of our IT Resourcers please forward your CV to Vantage Resources or contact Clare Grogan on (phone number removed) for a confidential discussion. item.title: Construction Planner

item.title: Team Member
item.content: As a crew member, you can be the smiling face that greets and serves the customers or a cook who makes things happen in the kitchen. Working with us will give you the flexibility to be whatever the customer needs you to be. You'll learn new things, get recognized for your efforts and learn skills that last a lifetime.What are we looking for?The good news is that your training will teach you everything you need to know to succeed on the job. But there are a few skills you should have from the get-go:You're a fun and friendly person who values customers and takes absolute pride in everything you do. Communication skills are key – you’re not going to be able to text message customers back and forth. In other words, you should be comfortable talking to strangers.You've got attitude - the right kind of course - and understand the need to be on time, all the time.With loads of energy, you understand that work is easier – and more fun – with some teamwork.

item.title: System Handover Coordinator
item.content: A new and exciting contract opportunity now exist at our clients Dundalk Site for a Change Control Coordinator across the Utilities and Engineering Departments. Reporting to the Associate Director of Engineering as change control coordinator you will manage the change controls from initiation to closure, keeping track of all change controls for the group.PURPOSEThe Change Control Coordinator will also include coordination between M&amp;E and associated trades contractor companies and engineering services suppliers engaged on Process Utilities improvement and capital projects across multi-disciplined functions. The selected candidate will typically have prior related change control experience; ideally in manufacturing, preferably GMP Setting with engineering and/or validation experience in a sterile manufacturing environment and have a proven track record in change control management and services coordination.The change control coordinator will work in conjunction with Project engineers to support manufacturing operations to remain operational, continuously improve and innovate. With our clients extensive range of facilities and environments, this is an excellent opportunity to work across many diverse areas including Biological, Chemical, Automation, Capital Projects, Maintenance, Safety, Process Development, Technical Services, Utilities and Validation.DUTIESThe person will be responsible for:&#xF0A7; Change Control Coordinator for the group &ndash; keeping up to date with all updates&#xF0A7; Process Change Controls on Trackwise Change Management Software&#xF0A7; Progressing change controls from initiation through to approval ensuring compliance.&#xF0A7; Stay up-to-date with reports to react accordingly and ensure metric compliance&#xF0A7; Keeping track of all change controls metrics for the group&#xF0A7; Partnering with colleague&rsquo;s cross-functionally to ensure change controls are progressed in advance of project start.&#xF0A7; Coordinating with Project Engineer to manage change control Work Stream from approval to closure.&#xF0A7; Driving collaboration between groups within the Engineering function proactively looking for synergies and innovative ways of doing work.&#xF0A7; Constantly assessing systems and processes to see what improvements can be made to work smarter and more efficiently while all the time being compliant&#xF0A7; Complying with Global Policies, Procedures and Guidelines, regulatory requirements and execute current Good manufacturing Practices (cGMP) in the performance of day to day activities.&#xF0A7; Compliance via documentation completion, risk assessments, closing out corrective action, participate in audits and inspections and proactively highlighting any issues around compliance&#xF0A7; Working collaboratively to drive a safe and compliant culture.&#xF0A7; Collaborating with multiple partners e.g. company network groups, third parties, vendors, quality, Supply chain.&#xF0A7; Assisting with management of EHS documentation associated with projectsEDUCATION&#xF0A7; Bachelor Degree Diploma; ideally in a Science, Engineering or Technical discipline. Trades background idealEXPERIENCE&#xF0A7; Experience of working in a Trades /Contractor Construction Project Environment&#xF0A7; Experience in a similar role /pharmaceutical multidisciplinary projects.&#xF0A7; Engineering and/or CQV experience in a sterile manufacturing environment&#xF0A7; Excellent Coordination/ Site Communication skills&#xF0A7; Proven track record in management of change controls.&#xF0A7; Experience in leading through change would be an advantageTECHNICAL COMPETENCIES:&#xF0A7; TrackWise / Excel experience an advantage&#xF0A7; Knowledge of regulatory/code requirements to Irish, European and International Codes, Standards and Practices&#xF0A7; Proficient understanding / experience of Sterile processes and equipment. Aseptic processing an advantage&#xF0A7; Proficiency in Microsoft Office and job-related computer applications required&#xF0A7; Have a proven record of project management of change in a commercial site&#xF0A7; Having a strong safety ethosBusiness Competencies:&#xF0A7; Excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills, to interface effectively with all levels of colleagues and with external suppliers and stakeholders in a team orientated manner&#xF0A7; Understand the specific responsibilities of all Dundalk functions as they relate to WuXi Engineering /Utilities department as well as associated groups (QA, Operations, CQV etc)&#xF0A7; Excellent people management skills&#xF0A7; Strong influence skills&#xF0A7; Demonstrate analytical and systematic problem-solving skills&#xF0A7; Effective time management and multi-tasking skills&#xF0A7; Trouble shooting skills&#xF0A7; Goal/results orientated&#xF0A7; Excellent attention to detail&#xF0A7; Self-motivated&#xF0A7; Flexible approach&#xF0A7; Strong change management skills&#xF0A7; Effective conflict resolution skills&#xF0A7; Negotiation skills&#xF0A7; Strategy planning and development&#xF0A7; Risk management skills&#xF0A7; Excellent facilitation and assessment skills
