Instrumentation Industry and international Discipline, Safety Codes and Quality StandardsAbility to read an interpret electrical, instrument and P&amp;ID drawingsCAD Proficiency (BIM Revit, AutoCAD an advantage but not essential)Management and supervision of Electrical installations on high urgency construction projects.Full E&amp;I system interface knowledge essential, BMS commissioning knowledge an advantageE&amp;I contractor experience from construction through commissioning to handover preferredElectrical Engineering/equivalent 3rd Level qualification, senior trades certs advantageousExcellent people management and communication skills requiredExcellent fault finding &amp; troubleshooting skillsCan interpret schematics and electrical drawingsStrong understanding of site activities and how they are planned and coordinatedRecord of success as a Trade LeaderFamiliarity with materials ordering and lead timesExcellent communicator/strong interpersonal skillsResults oriented with the resilience to work under pressureAttentive to detail and record keeperDecisive and action orientedPlanner/OrganisedConscientiousTeam playerStrong client focusCommercial acumen

item.title: Facilities Manager
item.content: Facilities ManagerDublinUp to &euro;70,000 plus bonus and benefitsAre you an experienced Facilities Manager who has managed high-profile IFM sites? Are you ambitious and motivated by helping your team succeed? Interested in working for a business who are a world leader in their field?If this sounds like you, we want to speak with you!Boden Group are working with a global Facilities Management and outsourcing business, who are looking for a Facilities Manager to oversee a prestigious client site in West Dublin.The successful candidate will be an established manager with a background in technical services. You&rsquo;ll need to be experienced managing large multi-discipline teams (c. 100 staff), with a people-focused approach to management. Experience in FMCG or pharmaceuticals would be great but not essential.Key Duties and Responsibilities: * Leading the day-to-day delivery of all Integrated Facilities Management operations &ndash; including planned and reactive maintenance, catering, cleaning and landscaping &ndash; across a busy client site. * Delivering against the contractual financial and operational targets, managing budgets and financial forecasting for the coming year. * Leading the team by example, developing staff and ensuring they are performing to the best of their ability. Identifying opportunities for development and ensuring the team have all relevant training to carry out their jobs correctly. * Strategic management of the account, ensuring plans are set up to deliver against strategic goals and outcomes. Identifying new opportunities for growth and expansion of the account. * Liaising closely with the client and key stakeholders, providing expert advice and building strong working relationships. * Delivering and maintaining excellent standards of Risk, Compliance and Quality Management, in line with contract KPIs and Service Level Agreement.What you&rsquo;ll need to succeed: * Demonstrable experience in a management role, across both hard and soft services, within the FM industry. * Experience managing a high-profile, multi-million &euro; P&amp;L contract, with responsibility for budget and profitability. * Relevant qualifications in Facilities Management, Engineering or Technical Services would be an advantage. * Familiarity with pharmaceutical, FMCG or GMP processes. * Experience leading Facilities Management projects from start to finish. * Able to liaise with colleagues and clients to manage relationships at all levels. * Strong knowledge of SHE processes and Irish Health &amp; Safety legislation. * Health &amp; Safety Qualifications (IOSH/NEBOSH) or IWFM/CIBSE membership would be an advantage.If you&#39;re interested in this role, please apply via this advert with your up-to-date CV.If this job isn&#39;t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position within Facilities Management in Ireland, please get in touch with Marlie at Boden Group for a confidential discussion about your next move

item.title: Electrical Project Commissioning Lead | Data Centre Exp
item.content: Electrical Project Commissioning Lead &ndash; Data CentrePermanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best. Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations. &nbsp; &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to several &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance.Role Purpose An exciting opportunity for an Electrical Project Commissioning Lead has arisen for an energetic individual who would enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. To work with the best.&nbsp;Key Functions and Responsibilities of the Electrical Project Commissioning Lead Understand the project scope, commissioning scope and co-ordinate our commissioning activities in line with the overall commissioning strategy. Ability to set up equipment schedules and commissioning trackers. Develop online platforms for commissioning activities Assign commissioning checklists to equipment and monitor closeout. Perform QAQC walkdowns with the projects representatives. Co-ordinate a project commissioning team. Setup, monitor and issue project testing certification. Create lookaheads for weekly/bi-weekly Commissioning activities Co-ordinate vendor commissioning and start-up processes Generate commissioning reports for commissioning activities Attend off-site testing if required Co-ordinate and report on QAQC issues. Monitor and track the project issues and close out. To compile the turnover dossiers in the required format. Develop bespoke overarching project commissioning documentation. Report to the Project Manager and Regional Commissioning Lead on project progress and any commissioning issues. Good understanding of Data Centre systems and controls. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Project Commissioning LeadElectrical Trade Background and/or a Third Level qualification in either Electrical or Building Services Engineering preferred Ideally will possess 5+ years of relevant experience Ideally has electrical testing experience - Safe Electric / NICEIC or similar &lsquo;City &amp; Guilds&rsquo; Inspection &amp; Testing trained and qualified Data Centre experience and knowledge. Technical Knowledge and experience of Low Voltage systems and regulatory requirements &ndash; ETCI, British Standards, EN standards is desirable. Understanding of the CIBSE commissioning codes. Familiar with MS Office, BIM360F platform and other portals for commissioning activities. Understanding of commissioning schedules and commissioning tracking Good communication skills &nbsp; &nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Project Commissioning Lead position or other similar opportunities based in Ireland, the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: Data Centre Engineer
item.content: We are looking for talented Data Centre Engineers for a leading financial company based in Amsterdam &amp; Dublin.They have Data Centres based all over the world with their Data Centre based n Amsterdam. They believe a well-planned and well-orchestrated cabling and racking infrastructure is just as important as well-engineered trading software.We are looking for an Engineer who has a drive for improvement and a want to bring new ideas to the table always considering what and why they are doing a particular action. Deep thinking is critical for the role and seeking out new ideas in order to keep the company at a technical advantage. This is a chance to take ownership of the physical part of our trading infrastructure across multiple data centres and thousands of servers, all the while striving for simplicity and operational excellence.You will be in charge of maintaining our co-locations and on-site data centre, including but not limited to the following: * Installing and cabling switches, servers, and appliances in our onsite data centre * Replacing hard drives/memory/transceivers and other hardware related tasks as required by our server and network teams * Getting equipment to and from remote colocations including packing/shipping * Facilitating installation of servers and network equipment with smart hands in remote co-locations * Managing power and space including monitoring and capacity planning * Maintaining a consistent and clean cable management philosophy * Managing equipment inventory * Assisting with planning moves or new build-outs * Build out and maintaining our office infrastructure environment, including our trading floorWhat are we looking for? * Experience working in a modern, large-scale data centre * Attention to detail and cleanliness * Ability to identify basic parts of network equipment &ndash; SFPs, line cards, chassis * Ability to identify basic parts of servers &ndash; memory, network card, hard drives * Knowledge of structured cabling systems using cat 5, cat 6, multi-mode and single-mode fiber * Strong experience around improving latency and understanding latency from an Engineers perspective * Familiarity with both power and communications cabling standards * Experience configuring and using cable testers for both fiber and copper to troubleshoot cabling issues * An understanding of change control processes * Strong documentation and logistics mentalityWhat&rsquo;s in it for you?You will work in an energetic and collaborative work culture with ambitious and talented Data Centre colleagues. There is a great salary and excellent benefits (including a very attractive bonus structure, excellent training opportunities, pension, health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sports and leisure activities, you will get the support and tools to develop your skills on the job so that you feel empowered to be at your best, both personally and professionally. We also provide relocation assistance

item.title: Areas Sales Manager Ireland & Northern Ireland
item.content: Areas Sales Manager Ireland &amp; Northern IrelandAn exciting position for a full time Area Technical Sales Manager to join a friendly team based in Ireland. The salary for this role will be &euro;45,000 - &euro;55,000 plus commission. As the UK and Ireland division of an international specialist manufacturer and distributor of chemical construction products, we have an exciting opportunity for an outstanding individual to help drive us further toward being the preferred market choice by delivering outstanding salesmanship, technical and customer service for our industry partners.Role RequirementsTechnical product and industry knowledgeSales skills and process expertiseICT literate, flexible and able to adapt to zoom/online meetings due to current climateHardworking/ConscientiousCustomer focusRespectfulHonestTeamworkSafeTrustworthyRole ResponsibilitiesTo sell Remmers products within the defined area, achieving or exceeding set sales targets.Develop and maintain relationships with end-user clients, distributors, architectural and conservation practices, engineering houses, main contractors and resin flooring installers.To represent, promote and position Remmers in the marketplace.To identify opportunities within the area through local research, networking and relationships, social media etc.To provide professional, technical advice/support for all parties during the sales and installation process.To carry out technical training, CPD seminars, open days etc to raise awareness of Remmers products and produce project specifications. (including Remmers Technical Training Centres in Germany and The Netherlands)To provide technical &ldquo;after sales&rdquo; support to clients.To maintain an up to date CRM sales system as well as pipeline/forecast.To maintain and keep available accurate current records of all relevant project information, client details/contacts, activities, quotations, technical submittals etc.To be professional in your conduct at all times with both internal and external contacts.To achieve sales in the geographical area in line with targets agreed/set upon commencement.To act as the key account manager for customers, specifiers and end user clients in both industrial and commercial settings within the area.To work as part of a dedicated team within Remmers Group to ensure the best results for the group.Company + BenefitsRemmers UK Limited manufactures chemical products to customers in the construction industry. The company provides products for cleaning, concrete protection and repairs, stone and masonry restoration, internal insulation, waterproofing and damp-proofing, flooring, and liquid roofing. It also offers specialist renders, joint sealants, stains, paints and wood treatments, and industrial wood coatings. The company was incorporated in 1989 and is based in Crawley, United Kingdom. Remmers UK Limited operates as a subsidiary of Remmers AG.The successful candidate will receive the following benefits:Company vehicle or equivalent allowance.Pension and HealthcareWhy should you apply? item.title: Electrical Quantity Surveyor | Dublin
item.content: Electrical Quantity Surveyor | Dublin &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Permanent position available with a considerable portfolio of works for the next 5+ years &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To build your career by assisting in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with a vibrant, agile and multi-functional team in delivering projects on time, safely, to budget and to the required quality standards. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To benefit from Kirby&rsquo;s Career Development Programmes that will enhance your leadership capability. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; To work with the best. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent package on offer with room for negotiations &nbsp; About Kirby Group Engineering Kirby Group Engineering is an international multi-disciplinary engineering services contractor and leading provider of high-value engineering services to a number of &lsquo;blue chip&rsquo; companies. Operating across Ireland, the UK and Europe, Kirby has become the engineering service provider of choice in growth segments such as pharmaceuticals, data centres and power transmission and distribution. Our culture is innovative, collaborative and performance focused. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a company committed to developing talent and rewarding performance. &nbsp; Role Purpose The role of Electrical Quantity Surveyor will have you working across various contracts ensuring the maximum commercial benefit for the company and will entail a cradle to grave delivery from tender stage through to final accounts and all-encompassing duties in between. &nbsp; Electrical Quantity Surveyor Responsibilities In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project as follows: &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Skilled and budgeting, reporting, developing BOQ&rsquo;s, profit plans. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Good communication skills. Undertake and manage interim commercial meetings with the Client and Internal Project Team. Report in detail as required for the Project Manager on the commercial status of the project. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Manage subcontractor accounts, interim valuations and final accounts. Ensure payment certificates are processed and payments are made per the agreed sub-contract and procurement terms. Retentions apply as per agreements. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; As a member of the commercial team, the Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be tasked with administering the contract obligations and meet additional Client requirements. Issue interim and final accounts and progress applications per project and contract requirements.&nbsp; Monthly applications to be all inclusive of accurate remeasures, site changes, dayworks and any applicable contract claims. Identify escalations, material or labour, as appropriate. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ability to identify potential commercial risks and ensure prompt reporting of same to Senior Management. Follow direction of Senior Management in undertaking work duties. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Have a practical understanding of scheduling and the associated commercial implications. Ensure close collaboration with Planning Engineer regarding accuracy of progress reporting. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Electrical Quantity Surveyor will be capable of costing and agreeing daily work changes to include managing the subcontractor remeasurement of contract works, site dayworks and site change orders. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintain accurate records and provide necessary detailed backup to support commercial tracking and costing. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ability to work on own initiative and can prioritise without direction. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Speed and accuracy of information a priority. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Negotiate, as necessary, with clients or their representatives. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Set an example of enthusiasm, loyalty and hard work in the performance of all duties. &nbsp; Necessary requirement of the Electrical Quantity Surveyor &nbsp; &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Minimum 4+ years of Quantity surveying experience essential on Electrical Projects. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3rd level qualification in Construction Economics / Quantity Surveying ideally coupled with a technical background as either Electrician or Electrical Engineer &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Experience working on electrical value projects in-excess of &euro;4million within the data centre, pharmaceutical, industrial or commercial sectors. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Proficient in excel. &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Detailed knowledge of commercial management and QS Role within construction &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Knowledge of contract conditions and their applications &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Overall understanding of the business, client and Sub Contractor relations, and installations &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent Communication/Interpersonal Skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Excellent Record Keeping and Administration Skills &middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Process driven and focused on EHS and Quality Work Management Systems and Processes &nbsp; For more information on this Electrical Quantity Surveyor/ M&amp;E Quantity Surveyor position or other Senior Quantity Surveyor / MEP Quantity Surveyor opportunities based in Ireland the UK or Europe contact the&nbsp;Talent Acquisition Team in Kirby Group confidentially on&nbsp;+353 (phone number removed) or apply in confidence

item.title: VP of Product Growth
item.content: About the roleOver the past few years, my client have built an incredible foundation for growth through the delightful B2C product experiences they&rsquo;ve developed, the robust platform infrastructure they&rsquo;ve invested in, and their strong partnerships with leading global brands.They are now looking for an experienced, and growth-focused product leader to own the customer experience of their platform and lead user growth strategy. The ideal candidate will have a thorough understanding of the Product Delivery Life Cycle, and can dive into the details on product, product marketing and merchandising, as a player/coach. Using your deep knowledge of product marketing, network effect, and leveraging platforms, you will identify and capitalise on activation, engagement, and resurrection opportunities for their app.You will sit on the leadership team, work collaboratively with the Head of Product (who owns the B2B side of the platform), and lead three multi-disciplinary teams focused on activation, engagement, and merchandising. To help you to realise your vision, you will have the cross functional support of a high-performing and data-informed team of data scientists and engineers.You will inspire a culture of growth across the company, one that encourages experimentation and curiosity as well as a constant desire to improve in any and every area we can. You have built high performing and cohesive teams, and know how to mentor and coach product and growth professionals - including managers - to fulfil their potential.In your 10+ year career, you have repeatedly driven successful user growth strategies through a customer-centric, data-driven approach, focusing on activation, engagement and resurrection in mobile (augmented by the web), so you have plenty of success stories and cautionary tales to share.This is a leadership position that reports directly to the CEO, and in that capacity the ideal candidate will be comfortable working on a strategic, executive level one minute and on a hands-on project level the next.Responsibilities * Leverage the product and the platform to scale, ultilizing activation, retention, engagement, and resurrection strategies to ensure that the company is where people go out of habit. * Define, communicate and execute the growth strategy, using quantitative and qualitative insights, to increase platform users by orders of magnitude. * Build and mentor a brilliant team and foster a healthy and collaborative culture that embodies the company&rsquo;s values. * Define and analyze key metrics for product features and initiatives which contribute to the company&rsquo;s long term vision, whilst delivering value for our users today. * Cultivate a data-informed mindset and culture of experimentation and continuous improvement with the help of growth and experimentation frameworks. * Drive the expansion of growth tooling to allow us to scale and cater to the needs of millions of users. * Ensure that we have the data capabilities needed to make decisions.Required skills * Bias to action, ownership, and an honest and blame free approach to problem solving. * Communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, with the power to build cross-functional consensus and shared vision. * Excellent people management skills, with the ability to inspire teams to do the best work of their careers. * Empathy for the user and a passion for building customer-centric products. * Entrepreneurial mindset strengthened by strategic insight. * Project management skills, and comfort in working on multiple time-sensitive project streams simultaneously.Required experience * 10+ years in product or growth marketing at fast-scaling startup companies, with at least 5 years&rsquo; experience in an activation, engagement, resurrection product role for a mobile app product. * 5+ years&rsquo; experience leading, recruiting and motivating high-performing teams. * Proven experience building growth models from scratch, with a strong understanding of how micro and macro growth loops, reinforced by network effects, work together to deliver compounding growth. * Extensive hands-on experience conducting product usage, cohort and retention analysis using tools like Amplitude or Mixpanel. * Deep expertise in user lifecycle management, journey mapping, persona identification, pain statements and user research methodologies. * Good knowledge of product marketing and merchandising. * Understanding of the technical architecture of complex mobile applications.Desired skills and experience * Experience with subscription services and monetization and pricing strategy. * A history of driving growth from programmatic, large-scale SEO initiatives. * Experience with content merchandising

item.title: Contracts Manager
item.content: Location: Naas, Co. KildareCompany Details:If you are looking to join a company that will nurture and develop your career this could be the company for you. Our client is looking for a Contracts Manager to join their expanding team. The company is one of Ireland&#39;s leading structural steel fabricators in Ireland and the UK.They work hand in hand with building developers, Consultant Engineers and Architects as well as construction companies and all elements of frameworks or programme partners. Their projects demonstrate their professionalism and ability to create the highest quality steelworks. If you are seeking a role that can challenge you professionally whilst working in a great team environment, please read on.Job Role: * Overseeing day to day running of medium to large scale projects. * Agree programme requirements with Main Contractor and Design Team. * Management and supervision of site foremen, steel erectors and other subcontractors. * Sourcing Sub Contractors and Suppliers. * Ensuring that Management are updated with site progress and commercial issues. * Maintain accurate records and documentation for variations and additions.Requirements: * Site Project Management preferably/but not necessarily working with structural steel * Excellent written and verbal communication to communicate with all internal and external partners * Knowledge of construction software such as StrucCad, Strumis, AutoCAD or Tekla will be an advantage. * Knowledge and experience in technical elements of structural steel fabrication and erection. * Knowledge of ISO 9001, ISO 18001 &amp; CE Marking and Word, Outlook and excellent Excel skills. * Ability to read and understand technical specifications and drawings. * Eligible to work in Ireland.If you&rsquo;re interested in this role, kindly forward an up-to-date copy of your CV in a word format to Andy

Delivery Manager experience to join their team.Working directly with their client, assuming responsibility for the delivery and management of both IT Projects and Services incorporating business as usual support and will play a big role in the evolution of their systems and processes to facilitate growth and efficiency.Responsibilities of Role * Proactively manage the planning and start-up of projects * This is a hands-on role where you will manage projects through the full software development lifecycle by carefully monitoring and controlling the project from requirements gathering through to live implementation * Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path * Facilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables * Effectively communicate project plans, risks, expectations to, customers, team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion * Track project milestones and deliverables for your projects to your manager * Determine the frequency and content of status reports from the team leaders, analyse results, and troubleshoot problem areas * Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals * Proactively manage changes in project scope identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans * Work closely with the QA team to ensure the quality of deliverables meets required standards * Accountable for delivering a robust, scalable IT infrastructure * Manage external suppliers and internal resources * Incident management and resolution acting as an escalation point for user and supplier queries * Identifying areas for improvement, implementing change and supporting the service transition of a vast range of project work * Ensure security of data, network access and backup systemsRequirements * Experience in managing multiple projects concurrently * Experience in producing detailed project schedules, resource requirements and tracking to schedule. * Project Management Tools proficiency * Analytical Skills with ability to truly understand the full scope and impact of the project requirements * Experience in Requirements Gathering &amp; Documentation, Risk &amp; Issue Management * Experience working with Technical Teams, with exposure to the following technologies, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, .Net, MS SQL, Windows O/S, Servers, Networks, Office365, Cloud Technologies * Project Reporting, Ability to present to Customers &amp; manage Customer relationshipsProven experience in Test &amp; Delivery Management * Experience in the operational management of suppliers and outsourced vendor * Understanding of development languages such as PHP and Java * Ability to be flexible in the technology or methodology used to deliver great service depending on the requirements and timescalesEssential and Desirable Skills * Exposure to Project Management of Web based systems development * Project Management Certification is highly desirable * Experience working with different development languages, especially PHP and Java. * Service Delivery, IT Manager, Windows, Azure, Office365, AWS, Networking, ServerTo apply for this role please submit your CV and we will be in touch

item.title: Head of Finance
item.content: Nicholas Howard Limited are delighted to be recruiting for a new and exciting role as a Head of Finance.As a key member of the finance team, this role provides the opportunity to work with the MD of the Irish Business to act as a Finance Partner and also to improve the various operational finance activity throughout the Business. The role will also take responsibility for monthly production of management and financial accounting (with support from the Group Finance team) and also the day to day operational finance activity including cash management and handling, banking and reporting.The role is based in Dublin while working with the Group Finance team based in Cambridge, London and Sheffield respectively and may involve travel to these locations.As an entrepreneurial and high growth business, our client is seeking a candidate who not only has a strong background in operational finance but is happy to operate in a dynamic environment which may change and evolve with rapid pace as the business takes advantage of market opportunities which arise.Core Responsibilities: * Responsibility for reconciliation of all portfolio and account level financial processes, including customer payment processing, cash reconciliation and portfolio transaction reporting. * Portfolio transaction ownership ensuring all BOSS processes complete correctly and that all end of life processes are in place and up to date. * Investigating any reporting / balance differences or abnormalities with a view to correction and prevention of same. * Management of daily / weekly / monthly transaction and portfolio reporting into Corporate and Trust finance teams. * Development of payment processes to third party service providers. * Overall responsibility for end to end processing and reporting of account level transactions into trust / corporate finance teams, data integrity, reporting automation and system interfaces. * Project related activity to upgrade current systems including: * Business analysis of requirements to upgrade core systems and produce reporting to be used by the lending businesses and Finance team. * Working with IT development, BA &amp; Servicing teams to make necessary changes to the systems and undertaking necessary testing. * Embedding new updated processes into the business. * Oversight of key operational banking relationships including banks and intermediary service providers. * Handling of documentation of processes and procedures manuals. * Identifying further process improvements and refinements to drive out efficiencies and cost savings. * Act as Finance Partner for the business, analysing financial performance vs budget / forecast and providing insight and understanding to the management team.Skills &amp; Requirements:Essential: * Experience of managing and owning operational finance activity including cash processing and reconciliation, financial / management accounting and reporting requirements. * Strong interpersonal and influencing skills, ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organisation. * Ability to interact with business units and staff based in remote locations. * Strong process design and implementation skills. * Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses. * High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and a results driven approach to challenges, with a customer service orientation.Desirable: * Relevant accounting qualification. * Experience in financial services, either banking or non-bank financial institutions.To be considered for this position please apply below

item.title: Tax Manager
item.content: Tax ManagerFantastic opportunity for Tax Manager to gain experience working in a global pharmaceutical company based in Waterford City. This is a 12 month maternity cover role. Our client is looking for a Tax Managerfor the Irish group of companies within the International Headquartered Group. The Tax Manager is responsible for managing the Irish group&rsquo;s tax function; managing tax compliance and tax risk, providing tax technical advice to colleagues, managing relations with tax authorities and ensuring internal and external reporting requirements are met.Key Responsibilities * Promote a strong tax compliance culture throughout the organization * Manage all Irish tax aspects including corporate income tax, transfer pricing, and specific projects * Responsible for tax reporting including tax provisioning and preparation of tax notes under local and US GAAP * Advising other business partners on the tax implications of various transactions and assisting with all ad-hoc tax queries * Identify tax planning opportunities and presentation of same to stakeholders * Responsible for liaising with Tax Authorities and external tax advisors * Maintain up to date knowledge of all relevant tax legislation, regulations and practice to ensure all relevant changes to tax law/ practice are evaluation and communicated. * Preparation of transfer pricing reviews and required documentation. This includes the review of intercompany transactions ensuring appropriate documentation for use in accounting, compliance and tax reviews * Oversee the R&amp;D tax credit claim and other relief claims * Assist in formulation of strategic business decisions and liaise with Group Headquarters to lever the site as a low tax manufacturing site * Setup such structures and controls necessary to enable the company to transact its business in the most efficient manner both in terms of compliance and administration from a tax perspective * Conduct routine reviews of transactions, thereby ensuring complianceThe Ideal candidate will have * Educated to degree level, or equivalent, and possess a fully completed tax qualification (AITI / CTA), ideally with a Big 4 background. * Ideally the candidate is also a qualified accountant (ACA/ACCA) * Strong corporation tax background, specifically transfer pricing * Experience in fast-paced organization * Knowledge of the pharmaceutical/ manufacturing industry is an advantageBy applying to RPG Recruitment, you are consenting for your details to be reviewed by RPG Recruitment and held on our database. If at any stage in the future, you would like to remove your details from our database , you can do so by requesting in writing for your details to be removed in line with our privacy policy. RPG Recruitment operate to the highest ethical standards of recruitment at all times

item.title: Process Safety Engineer
item.content: We are delighted to announce a new permanent Key Safety Role with our client. The ideal candidate will have experience as a senior safety specialist and will have the responsibility for all the safety processes within the plant. They will play a key part in the growth of this pharmaceutical site. Ideally candidates should have previous experience of a similar role and have experience in the API industry.Why work for this company?This role is a permanent role which offers an exceptional salary, bonus scheme, company pension, private medical cover and many more benefits along with a positive and supportive work culture. Responsibilities include:Support process &amp; facility start-up initiatives on the siteAssist with technology transfer of API processes, including process fit, identification of equipment needs, and facility modificationsProvide oversight for Mechanical Integrity Programs (I&amp;E, Fire Protection, Equipment, RVs, Piping, etc.)Chair and Collaborate closely with Operations colleagues in the preparation of Master Batch Records and execution of process HAZOPs, Hazard identification, risk assessments and chemical agent risk assessments and FMEAs for tech transfer of API processesSupporting improvement of chemical manufacturing process safety performance, product transfers and new product introductionsOversee introduction of new products to the sites from a process safety perspectiveDrive the development, implementation and management of the process safety Management programme.Education and Experience:Minimum of 4 years experience in a technical role in the API industry.Degree in Chemical/Process Engineering. item.title: Production Supervisor
item.content: CompanyOur client is executing production activities for their innovative sister company, which is focussed on developing new plant food crops with exceptional ingredient potential for the food &amp; beverage industry and European hobby market.Role summaryThe Production Supervisor will be focused on making a success out of the projects the company is developing and will be responsible for the undertaking of all production activities including micropropagation. The successful candidate will participate in the Operational Management Team of the company and will work in close cooperation with the other Production Heads in the company.Responsibilities * Leading and managing a team of 3-6 employees in the undertaking of all production activities of the food crops in the nursery. * Ensure an efficient way of working; Finished work is completed to a high-quality standard and in a timely fashion. * Cultivation of basic material and production plants of the food crops. * Nutrition of young plants and production plants according to the agreed programmes. * Sustainable crop protection and maintenance. * Quality control / monitoring of incoming materials for food crops * Executing trials in cooperation with the Trial CoordinatorRequirements * Ethical and responsible behavior * Drive &amp; determination * Excellent planning &amp; communication skills * Demonstrates strong initiative and a &ldquo;Right first-time&quot; approach * People management and teamwork skills * Process knowledge, improvement, and problem-solving ability * Adequate Numeracy &amp; PC Skills * High level of attention to detail * Strong execution and delivery capabilities * Demonstrates autonomy within the established framework and report requirementsAttractive remuneration will be offered in line with experience and would be firmed up during the interview process. If interested to explore please apply enclosing your CV in Word format and Cover Letter

item.title: Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist
item.content: CompanyOur client is a medical devices producer, a wholly independent company with its headquarters in Hong Kong and manufacturing operations in China. It has a distribution network which stretches globally with a name built on quality, trust, and integrity.Role summaryThe Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialist will help developing strategies to ensure regulation compliance. He will make sure that the necessary documentation is completed and submitted. He will keep each department informed of applicable regulations and what needs to be done to ensure the regulations are fully and properly followed.Responsibilities * Reviews and signs-off on product and manufacturing changes for compliance with applicable regulations and initiate any relevant regulatory submissions as a result of the outcome. * Supports Sustaining Projects such as design changes, material changes, supplier changes etc and works as part of a core team with other functions to execute these changes. * Provides guidance to management on upcoming regulatory changes (Brexit, MDR) and the impact of those changes. * Responsible for product registration and manage government approval in a timely manner * Establish and maintain a close relationship with government agencies to achieve operational effectiveness * Support the marketing department to develop strategic method for product launch in the EU and Northern America. * Prepare regulatory documents and assist the sales team on tender and quotation submission * Support QA, Engineering, Marketing teams in both Ireland and GA Hong Kong for Field Corrective Action and determine the following activities such as government reporting and recall. * Support the communication of Recall / Field Action activities between manufacturers and distributors in Europe and North America. * Input and adherence to the scheduling and management of Post Market Surveillance (PMS) plans and reports, Post Market Clinical Follow Up (PMCF) plans and reports, and clinical evaluations (CEPs, CERs). Maintains appropriate regulatory records to demonstrate compliance with applicable regulations. * Proactively create regulatory training with the HR to the internal parties. * Liaise and provide support to Marketing and the Engineering team in the International emerging markets.Requirements * Level 8 Degree (BS, BA) (Technical discipline preferred). * 5-7 years&#39;+ Regulatory experience. Experience in the medical devices area. * Have a good understanding of the Regulations in the various jurisdictions. EU, US, China, Japan, Australia, Canada etc. * Strong leadership skills, including the ability to set goals and provide positive and constructive feedback respectfully to build positive relationships and improve business results. * Ability to work effectively within a team in a fast-paced changing environment. * Strong verbal and written communications with the ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization. * Ability to travel approximately 10%, including international.Attractive remuneration will be offered in line with experience and would be firmed up during the interview process. If interested to explore please apply enclosing your CV in Word format and Cover Letter

item.title: Senior System Analyst/Tester
item.content: Our client is a global, dynamic and high growth fintech that is rapidly becoming a global market leader. Due to continued success and expansion they are looking to recruit a Senior System Analyst to join their highly successful technology team.System Analysts have full responsibility for the business and functional solution design, technical analysis of platform capabilities, business processes analysis and end to end testing (including supporting client UAT).Working both independently and within a client aligned team, you will examine existing IT systems and business models, analyse requirements (both business and technical) and translate these into user stories and core functionality documentationThe Day-to-Day?Analysis:&#xF0FC;Develop and maintain a deep knowledge of the platform functionality and business processes related to their nominated functional area.&#xF0FC;Educate and prepare customers (external and internal) on core platform functionality.&#xF0FC;Working closely with our customer on site to develop solutions and testing these solutions to meet business and technical requirements.Test Design &amp; Preparation:&#xF0FC;Review/analyse business requirements to ensure they are quantifiable and testable.&#xF0FC;Write/Produce artefacts to support testing activities such as Test Designs, Test Matrices, Test Cases, Test Procedures, Test Scripts and Behavioural Models.Test Execution:&#xF0FC;Perform structured and context-driven (formal /ad-hoc) system, system integration and regression testing as required.&#xF0FC;Use internal defect tracking and test case management system(s) to document test cases, record defects and record test case execution results.&#xF0FC;Raise and re-test defects.Experience Required: * University Degree * Confident, and able to take initiative given client&ndash; and delivery-focused environment. * Independent, self-directing and delivery focused working style. * Strong analytical thinking and commercial awareness. * Intermediate computer skills essential (SQL is desirable). * Excellent organisational, administration and time management skills. * Good communication skills, confident in dealing with internal and external clients. Financial services industry knowledge desired.This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Senior System Analyst to work for an industry leading, dynamic and forward-thinking organization, offering excellent progression and development opportunities.If you feel that you have the necessary skills and experience to succeed in the role Senior System Analyst, then please apply now for immediate consideration

item.title: Technical Architect
item.content: GemPool is looking for a Technical Architect to join a company in the Healthcare domain based in Kildare. This company has grown in size and is expanding the team even more. This is a permanent role with a high level of responsibility.They are working in an AWS Infrastructure environment but will be moving to a multi server system soon (Docker).We are looking for someone who has strong experience with systems but also have experience with DevOps and can work alone and as part of a team when needed.Salary: &euro;85-95k Location: Remote/IrelandKey responsibilities: Building out cloud platforms, infrastructure and implementing security best practices. Configuration Management using tools such as Ansible or Chef. Building Docker container-based systems. Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for faster software delivery. Designing and managing the system with little to no support.Essential Requirements: &middot; Strong experience with AWS Infrastructure Environment (VPC, EC2, RDS, ELB, EFS, Cloudfront, subnets) &middot; Experience with Docker &middot; Experience with VPN (AWS lead using AWS Native) &middot; DevOps experience using Ansible &middot; Experience working in a LAMP environment (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) &middot; Experience with configuration managementDesirable Requirements: &middot; Has worked in a small environment with previous experience designing and maintaining the system &middot; Knowledge of networking protocols HTTP, TCP, DNS, Load Balancing, VPN &middot; Experience with IaC tools (Terraform, Packer, Cloudformation) &middot; Experience with development languages (Shell scripting, python, go) &middot; Experience with Linux &middot; Experience with Git, workflows and other source Code Management solutions.If you would like more information contact Laura on (phone number removed) or email at laura.mooney@gempool.ie

item.title: General Manager and Finance Director
item.content: Job Title: General Manager and Finance DirectorSalary: &euro;70,000 - &euro;80,000 + Bonus SchemeLocation: County Louth, IrelandOur Client:Our client is a renowned established FMCG business, with an eye on quality. The company is looking to build a robust product portfolio of premium branded products. The company wishes to appoint a senior and experienced manager, with commercial and financial management skills, to develop and drive the company&rsquo;s strategic business plan.Role:As a key member of the Executive Management team, the General Manager/ Financial Director will report to the business owners and assume a strategic role in the overall management of the company. The post holder will be accountable for the general daily running of the business, financial and risk management operations of both companies. You will have primary day-to-day responsibility for planning, implementing, managing commercial activities in the Group and the Human Resource. The role will encompass strategic business planning; financial and risk management; overseeing the annual commercial plan; general management and line management and leadership responsibilities.Responsibilities:Coordinate the development of an overall strategic business plan, in conjunction with the business ownersCoordinate the defining and delivery of annual KPIs in all aspects of business performanceSupport decision making with the provision of relevant advice and data. item.title: Facilities Electrician
item.content: Purpose : A key contributor to the successful delivery of the Electrical Maintenance Contract which is required to provide Building Services Maintenance and minor Installations to the three sites. The service will cover all aspects of electrical maintenance for a large and diverse range of building services and deliver a safe, quality, efficient and effective maintenance service.Duties : * To be able to analyse, fault-find, carry out repairs and service all plumbing/heating controls, pump controls &amp; electrical supply of installations and appliances in a professional manner and to a high standard in accordance with and in compliance with current regulation/legislation. A good knowledge of machine maintenance (lathes, Mills etc) would be an advantage. * Performs routine and non-routine maintenance service or repairs within the facility, which may involve service of machinery, electrical and mechanical repairs or installations, in conformance to established standards. * Must be able to schedule the workload and prioritise on a daily basis, having a clear ability to communicate effectively with members of staff, tenants and other members of the public * Ability to organise own workload. * Ability to prioritise and reprioritise tasks and in consultation with the Management Office as necessary. * Ensure Maintenance logs are kept up to date for the equipment divided into specific tasks i.e. fire alarm, Emergency lighting etc. plus attendance at quarterly meetings to discuss on going issues and document presentation. The documentation is a vital part of the service and must be kept up to date. * Work in partnership with the customer to seek improvements that will bring continuous improvement in the quality of service provided and overall value for money. * Meet with and accompany Specialist Sub contractors who are providing services to the centres to ensure the work is done safely, correctly and is documented. * Keep Spare Parts stores up to date and stocked with correct spares. Liaise with vendors as required. * To repair, maintain and generally service of lighting and power supply throughout the buildings, to include but not limited to the following list of work activities: - Testing of emergency services as required by Regulations, e.g. emergency lighting IS:3217:2013. A record of such tests will be documented by the Contractor and filed in the Management Office. This shall include the quarterly 30-minute tests and the annual 90 minute test - Checking &amp; maintenance of single and 3 phase systems including switch gear, cabling, fuses, circuit breakers and electrical devices, e.g. motors and replace when faulty.Education / Work Experience : * A minimum of 10 years post-qualification experience in a similar environment. * Experience in the effective supervision of other electricians. * Analysing qualities for an effective remedy to the problems experienced with industrial installations. * The ability to work alone as this will be the norm for the post holder. * Individual must work well under pressure. * The ability to communicate effectively with members of staff, tenants and other members of the public. * Ability to organise own workload. * Ability to prioritise and reprioritise tasks and in consultation with the Management Office as necessary. * Enthusiastic and able to motivate and develop self. * Commitment and integrity. * Flexible and able to work as part of a team if and when necessary. * Good interpersonal skills / Good time management. * Be part of the Emergency Response Team. * Computer literate using the Windows 7 operating platform and all Windows Microsoft Office applications

item.title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer
item.content: The company:One of my best clients within Building Services sector established over 20 years ago is now looking for Senior Mechanical Engineer due to the growth of the business. The company have continued to increase their workload and deliver quality, innovative engineering solutions for our clients even during that difficult times. They have got clients in the UK, Ireland and abroad and they work across a range sectors including Healthcare, Education, Residential, Industrial, Commercial and Hotel &amp; Leisure. The company has now 3 thriving offices and offers a great career progression and help with your Chartership process to become a Chartered Building Services Engineer.The role for Senior Mechanical Design Engineer:The client is looking for a hands-on and focused engineering consultant who can uphold company&rsquo;s approach to quality-driven success. Ideally, you will have Building Services Consultancy Design experience and will be a competent user of Amtech, Relux/Dialux; BIM experience will be advantageous. * A thorough understanding of the theoretical and practical application of their engineering discipline, and a strong understanding of the other disciplines offered by the company. * Proven experience of delivering detailed designs through the full design cycle. * Expert knowledge and experience in the following Mechanical design areas: Water Services, Heating / LTHW, HVAC, Fuel, above-ground drainage and BMS. * Deep knowledge of CIBSE, IEC, BS, IS and EN Standards. * Deep knowledge of Irish building regulations, particularly TGD part B, F, G, L and the ability to demonstrate this knowledge in design and project lead. * Excel at working on several projects simultaneously and show the ability to prioritise and plan work. * Demonstrate a good understanding of other building disciplines in the design and installation of buildings. * Exhibit leadership qualities while working as part of a team. * Ability to make prompt, disciplined project decisions. * Excellent attention to detail and interpersonal skills. * Commercial Awareness.Skills and requirements for the role of Senior Mechanical Design Engineer * Minimum Degree qualification in Mechanical Design Engineering or Building Services * Minimum degree in Mechanical Engineering * Chartership desirable. * 7-9 years building services consultancy design exposure * Expert user of Microsoft office. * BIM experience advantageous. * Experience with thermal modelling, energy assessment, dynamic energy modelling software advantageous

mobile applications * Experience of providing technical sales support to both internal sales organization and external channel partners * Experience in product market research to determine key value drivers, needs and areas of competitive differentiation by key target customer segments * Experience in developing preliminary product positioning, value propositions, monetization of benefits, marketing collateral and sales presentations &amp; tools * Be technically aware, and have experience of translating complex ideas into simple and engaging messages (both written and oral) to a non-technical audience * Self-motivated, proactive, and resourceful with ability to quickly adapt to changes in priorities, circumstances, and directionDesirable * Experience of working in medical device, pharmaceutical, healthcare or other life-science based sector * Working understanding of FDA medical device marketing messaging language * Experience of smart, connected devices and sensors sectorFor immediate consideration, please forward your CV or contact Andy Litchfield on (phone number removed).All applications processed in the strictest of confidence

item.title: Head of IT Contracting
item.content: Head of IT Contracting Recruitment for HERO (Galway, Dublin or Cork)Our CompanyHERO Recruitment is a multi-award winning agency with our most recent accolades include winning &quot;Agency of the Year 2019&quot; &amp; &ldquo;Best in Technical Engineering, Science and Pharmaceuticals&rdquo; for the last for years with the NRF.Our business is about &#39;finding the best in people&#39; by delivering exceptional talent to our valued clients.We are a progressive agency with a down-to-earth approach.We are currently looking to on-board a great leader who is passionate about the IT Contracting Recruitment in the Gig Economy and has a love for their craft. The right person for us will love working with Ireland best of talent to lead our team of IT Contractor Recruiters Head of Contracting.So what&rsquo;s the job of Head of IT Contracting all about?Let us tell you more&hellip; * Our Head of IT Contracting can be located in our Cork, Dublin or Galway office. The option will be theirs. * We&rsquo;re looking for a super high achiever who has a deep understanding of the IT Contracting market in Ireland along with a well-established network of loyal clients and candidates. The position will suit someone eager and ready to work closely with the Directors to set the strategy and its execution for HERO&rsquo;s IT Contracting business. * Our Head of IT Contracting Recruitment will be responsible for building out their IT Contracting team, employing the very best of talent Ireland has to offer to ensure the successful growth of this division within our business. Key to this position will be engaging the most leading edge tools and technologies to deliver the very highest level of quality service to our clients and contractors. * In this role, you will have ownership of the full delivery for your IT Contracting division including full operations, P&amp;L, sales and marketing, data and market analysis, along with the all-important engagement of our HERO team and customers and independent contractors. * The person aligned with our culture will be a natural communicator who develops authentic and meaningful relationships will all people who touch upon our business. They will instinctively create trusting partnerships. They will be someone who can be relied upon to meet and exceed the leading best practice of our industry. * Our Head of IT Contracting will love taking the reins and enjoy the outcomes of seeing the IT division grow and profit under their leadership. They will have a network of well-established relationships with existing IT contracting clients and independent contractors and ensure a positive synergy and prosperity in all our partnerships. * Attracting and delivering the very best of talent solutions for IT contracting will be something our IT Contracting Manager will have a wealth of experience in. Their deep knowledge of working within the gig economy, focused in IT, will be evident in the way they work and in the continued growth of the division and happiness of their team, * They will work with the MD to develop innovative strategies and manage the implementation and execution to achieve the goals and objectives of the big picture. They will continue to review and measure the achievement of milestones to ensure the division is on track for success. * We are looking for a true leader who seeks autonomy and enjoys the ownership and challenge of leading the IT Contracting Recruitment division in HERO. * The person who leads our team will enjoy seeing the success of their team as they prosper and grow in experience and reward. Developing their team will be key in their strategy for the business, empowering their team to become best in class. * We are looking for a person who is passionate about quality and committed to delivering WOW to our clients, candidates and employees. Experience in leading a team and having a strong business acumen, being very commercially savvy in operations and the IT contracting market is essential for this role. * This is a role for someone who knows the contracting market exceptionally well and has many established years working within it.What we are looking for in our Head of IT Contracting: * Exceptional Leader with a successful proven track-record in leading a successful team within IT Contracting Talent Acquisitions * An expert in the IT Gig Economy within Ireland and a forward thinking thought leader. * Minimum of +7 years&rsquo; IT Recruitment experience with +5 years specific recruitment industry experience focused in the IT Contracting sector in Ireland. * Excellent commercial acumen and extensive understanding of business and operations from end to end. * Ability to create business plans and strategy for business growth and client delivery. * Exceptional written and communications skills and big picture thinker. * Great energy and can do attitude. A person who sets the bar high for the business and themselves and loves to be a high achiever. * Ideally, Degree qualified but we appreciate that experience is a great teacher so this is not essential.For further information on super opportunity with HERO, please speak with us in confidence. Contact Michelle Kilcar on (phone number removed) or (phone number removed)/ michelle@hero.ie.Check out all our open jobs on our HERO Recruitment website (url removed)

item.title: Principal Transport Modeller

item.title: Senior Contracts Manager
item.content: Senior Contracts Manager &ndash; GalwayEuro Executive Recruitment has been retained by one of Ireland&rsquo;s largest building contractors to recruit a Senior Contracts Manager covering projects in the Galway region. This role presents a fantastic opportunity for the successful candidate to progress their career with a highly respected employer.Supported by the Directors, this is great opportunity to join a highly successful developing business in Ireland with excellent opportunities for career advancement.The Role: * Lead one or multiple project teams to ensure that contracts are completed on programme. * Manage the compliance of company and current health &amp; safety legislation. * Supporting the project surveyor in the management &amp; control of contract costs &amp; variations with regular reporting of cost projections &amp; status to the Operations Director. * Develop strong relationships with clients. * Management &amp; assessment of subcontractor&rsquo;s quality of work &amp; their ability to maintain scope programme. * Management of programme risk &amp; experience of early interaction with design teams to ensure design deliverable dates &amp; details are achieved. * Maintain an excellent relationship with the management team, subcontractors, and clients. * Planning/scheduling of works. * Must be an excellent communicator, both verbally and in writing. * IT Fluency and familiar with MS packages and MS Project (or similar scheduling packages). * Strong commitment &amp; ownership for all Health and Safety, Quality and Environmental systems throughout the project.Requirements: * Third level qualification in a construction related field coupled with at least 10 -15 years post graduate experience, 5-10 years in the role in a managerial role with a recognised Main Contractor. * Proven record of delivering large scale Commercial, Industrial or Pharmaceutical projects, * Experience of RC Frames, Structural Steel Frames and High Spec Fit-Out elements within projects * Experience in delivering projects (value &euro;5m - &euro;30M) from design stage to completion * Candidates must be capable of taking responsibility for a number of projects concurrently, as required

item.title: Mechanical Project Quantity Surveyor
item.content: Vacancy: Mechanical Project Quantity Surveyor&nbsp;Location: LimerickSalary: Negotiable3D Personnel&rsquo;s client&nbsp;are presently seeking an experienced&nbsp;Mechanical Project Quantity Surveyor&nbsp;to be based in the Limerick/Munster region on a permanent basis. This is an exciting opportunity, working with one of the largest specialist Mechanical &amp; Electrical construction companies in the Limerick/Munster region. &nbsp; The role of&nbsp;Mechanical Project Quantity Surveyor&nbsp;will have you estimating of Sundry Tender projects in the region, provide assistance to the Estimating Department on larger Mechanical Tenders. Working as part of the project team to commercial manage all successful tenders from Estimating Handover stage to final account. Management of 3D Personnel client&rsquo;s Accounts and all sub-contractor Accounts. Compiling and submitting all change orders, holding monthly commercial meetings with Client and ensuring a successful commercial conclusion to each project.Mechanical Quantity Surveyor ResponsibilitiesSkilled at budgeting, reporting, developing BOQ&rsquo;s, profit plans.Good communication skills. Undertake and manage interim commercial meetings with the Client and Internal Project Team. Report in detail as required for the Project Manager on the commercial status of the project.Manage subcontractor accounts, interim valuations and final accounts. Ensure payment certificates are processed and payments are made per the agreed sub-contract and procurement terms. Retentions apply as per agreements.Working for 3D Personnel&rsquo;s client, the&nbsp;Mechanical Project Quantity Surveyor&nbsp;will have the ability to administer the contract obligations and meet additional Client requirements. Issue interim and final accounts and progress applications per project and contract requirements. Monthly applications to be all inclusive of accurate remeasures, site changes, dayworks and any applicable contract claims. Identify escalations, material or labour, as appropriate.Ability to identify potential commercial risks and ensure prompt reporting of same to Senior Management. Follow direction of Senior Management in undertaking work duties.Have a practical understanding of scheduling and the associated commercial implications. Ensure close collaboration with Planning Engineer regarding accuracy of progress reporting.Capable of costing and agreeing daily work changes to include managing the subcontractor remeasurement of contract works, site dayworks and site change orders.Maintain accurate records and provide necessary detailed backup to support commercial tracking and costing.Ability to work on own initiative and can prioritise without direction.Speed and accuracy of information a priority.Negotiate, as necessary, with clients or their representatives.Set an example of enthusiasm, loyalty and hard work in the performance of all duties.&nbsp; Necessary Requirements3rd level Qualifications in Mechanical Engineering/ Building Services Engineering or Quantity SurveyingMinimum 4-6 years of Quantity surveying / Mechanical Engineering experience essential.Proficient in excel.Detailed knowledge of commercial management and Quantity Surveyor role within constructionKnowledge of contract conditions and their applicationsOverall understanding of the business, client and Sub Contractor relations, and M&amp;E installationA positive &ldquo;can do&rdquo; approach determined to succeed generates a sense of energy and urgencyBuilds and maintains excellent working relationshipsAcceptance of responsibility and accountabilityRemains calm under pressureAn exemplar for the company valuesSound, balanced judgmentDemanding of self and othersRecognises own strengths and weaknesses and committed to personal improvement

item.title: Senior Integration Engineer
item.content: Our client is a Ireland&#39;s fastest growing software company and a true leader in the e-commerce space who use the latest .NET technologies. Working with some of the world&rsquo;s leading brands, they provide online services to manage local payment, logistics and online checkout.&nbsp;Role DescriptionAs an Integration Engineer&nbsp;you will be providing technical leadership and guidance to our clients customers while they are building their integrations. You will work with our business development teams to gather requirements, advise on configuration and customisation options and act as a user champion in both internal and external integration discussions.They are looking for someone that will fit in with our culture of collaboration, communication and teamwork. You should be customer focused, detail oriented and a self starter.You should want to do things better &ndash; we believe in continuous improvement of the development process &ndash; and you should have an opinion and contribute to improving. You should care about agile, continuous integration, continuous deployment, TDD, unit testing and integration testing.Manage new on-boarding into the &lsquo;business as usual&rsquo; environment by working with various internal teams to provide a superior on-boarding service to our clients and operational teamsEnsuring strong relationships are built with all clients and client technical teamsManage all technical aspects of engagement with retailer from onboarding integration through to releasePlan and participate in scheduled client and client technical team daily meetings and stand upsUnderstand fully all product offering features and functionalityCollaborate with the engineering teams to understand new requirements and technical platform roadmapEvaluate new tools and technologies based on current and future feature requirements, performance, cost effectiveness, and reliabilityExperienceStrong technical backgroundComfort with code-level debugging for both eSW and customer.Degree in Computer Science or equivalent5 years commercial experience in Software DevelopmentWorking knowledge of programming languages, preferably C# and SQL ServerFamiliarity with .NET applications and running queries against production SQL databases an advantage.Knowledge of eCommerce Platforms such as Magento, Hybris, SFCC or Shopify an advantage.Knowledge of Continuous integration, continuous deployment and continuous delivery toolingDesired ExperienceStrong problem solving and trouble shooting skillsConfidence and comfort with customersAbility to think on your feet and assist our customers with their technical issuesYou should want to work in a fast-paced eCommerce business.Outstanding communication skills required &ndash; primarily the ability to communicate ideas.Excellent organisation skills and high attention to detail.Intellectual curiosity, learning agility, and enthusiasm for tackling tough problems.High level of initiative and desire to get things done.Willingness to introduce change and challenge existing processes and procedures.Ability to build and maintain strong working relationshipsIf interested contact Cathal on (phone number removed) or email your CV to cathal.mcaliskey@gempool.ie

item.title: Electrical Site Supervisor
item.content: Rubicon Consulting is currently recruiting for an Electrical Site Supervisor on a Permanent basis based in Dublin.The role of the Electrical Site Supervisor is to support the Site Manager in the organization and co-ordination of site-based activities and to lead and co-ordinate teams of Electrical Engineering trade professionals on site. The Supervisor will be responsible for tracking and recording of site daily activities and progress. They will lead their teams to deliver to quality, on time and to budget in a safe and efficient manner. They will deal with obstacles and develop team capacity.Requirements: - * Senior Trades qualification or equivalent coupled with 5+ years site experience within pharmaceutical/medical device, commercial, industrial or data centre type sectors * Can interpret schematics and electrical drawings * Strong understanding of site activities and how they are planned and coordinated * Record of success as a Trade Leader * Familiarity with materials ordering and lead timesResponsibilities: -In conjunction with your project team, you will be responsible for the execution of various stages of a project.Commercial:You will have to have full understanding of your IFC scope of work and notify the IFC variations to the CM, for the commercial part of this role you will also complete take-offs for variations as and when they are requested and be required to populate SE progress assessments forms in conjunction with planners.Scope:The successful candidate will be needed to review and fully understand the IFC scope of works. Alongside this you need to Review and agree area site set up, install it inline with the agreed plan &ndash; all on wheels and nothing directly on the floor. You will also need to appoint the person responsible to maintain and clean your area.You must however Ensure temp power is available for directs and subcontractors prior to required date.Quality:The ideal candidate will ensure that all the below is adhered to: * Understand Quality objective of Project &ndash; snag free systems on time. * Review and understand Quality Control Plan which is based on 6M&rsquo;s. * Implement Quality Control Plan on site. * Review and understand ITP. * Ensure only specified materials are used for your scope of installation. * Complete Weekly Quality Audits and check lists and also Clear quality audit actions as soon as possible. * Identify snag items as the installation progresses &ndash; stand down crew for TBT if snags are repeated. Ensure you clear snag items to suit walkdown schedule. * Ensure all personnel have seen relevant FoK&rsquo;s to their task, and Conduct quality TBT&rsquo;s. * Ensure Drawings are Red lined and signed in line with agreed due dates. * Collate and File all relevant documentation delivered with materials, plant and equipment. * Ensure materials, plant and equipment are installed to specification and manufacturers recommendations. * Ensure installation is in accordance with P&amp;IDs and Isometrics. * Understand and follow the requirements associated with maintaining the correct files. * Ensure all your personnel have the relevant training for the allocated tasks.Procurement: * Assist CM with development of Procurement schedule. * Track delivery of all relevant orders to ensure delivery dates align with procurement schedule and programme. * Requisition minor materials in line the IFC requirements and track delivery. * Ensure all IR&#39;s for minor equipment are completed correctly. * Implement plan to ensure all deliveries are checked and verified and Ensure all materials are correctly Stored &ndash; nothing directly on the floor. * Comply with purchasing procedure with regard to delivery docket management.Communications:The ideal candidate will Deliver briefings on key project daily or weekly items, deliver safety and quality TBT&rsquo;s.HR and Subcontractors: * Ensure Biometric or facial recognition clock is in operation and all operatives are instructed on its use (including subcontractors) * Track and detail actual personnel on site daily (directs and subcontractors) for your scope of work and submit to CM daily * Complete Employee assessment forms for tradesmen and apprentices, note that you will need to Advise CM on performance of directs and subcontractor&rsquo;s compliance with our expectations, both good and where there are development opportunitiesGeneral: * Review relevant construction pack (specifications, schedules and drawings) for your scope of work and develop a set of familiarisation notes for Construction Manager (CM) or Project Manager (PM) to review. * Assist Construction Manager is compiling Lesson&#39;s learned at the end of the project.Our CompanyRubicon Consulting is a Talent management consultancy which helps you to optimise business performance and competitive advantage by choosing the right people first time
