item.title: Executive Director Manufacturing Operations
item.content: The CompanyBiopharmaceutical company focused on improving patients&#39; lives by identifying, developing, acquiring and commercialising differentiated and accessible medicines that address unmet medical needs.The company has a portfolio of medicines through its orphan and inflammation groups. The company&#39;s global headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. The company also has offices in the US and Europe.The PositionThe company have ambitious plans and have an exciting opportunity for a permanent full time Executive Director, Manufacturing Operations (Large Molecules) based at the Dublin office.Reporting to the Vice President, Manufacturing &amp; Supply Chain, the Executive Director of Manufacturing Operations (Large Molecules), is responsible for the oversight of the manufacturing of large molecule commercial products through the company&#39;s network of contract manufacturing organisations (CMOs).ResponsibilitiesThe primary focus of this role is to ensure a stable supply of compliant products that meet all commercial and clinical patient demands through well monitored, robust manufacturing processes.Lead the Large Molecule manufacturing team and develop the capability of the team.Partner with the Quality function in the supply of compliant product and oversight of manufacturers.Partner with the Supply Chain function in the development of supply contracts and oversight of manufacturers.Partner with the Technical Development organisation and others in the transition of development products to commercial operations, technology transfers, complex process investigations and process improvements.Develop strategies and plans for the reliable manufacture and long-term manufacturing capacity of large molecule products..Control manufacturing costs to meet budget plans.Identify and execute opportunities for manufacturing and process improvements in collaboration with other functions.Ensures that manufacturing operations consistently meet cGMP and other regulatory requirements.Work in close collaboration with Technical Development, Quality, Supply Chain, Project Management, Regulatory Affairs, Finance and Legal colleagues to meet overall business and Technical Operations function goals.Participates in various cross-functional teams or committees, e.g. Quality Council, Supplier Review Board, S&amp;OP, Budget Development and Review and all product related team meetings associated with large molecule commercial supplies.Qualifications and Skills Required:Primary degree in Science or Engineering, in a related field or study of Pharmacy.15+ years industry experience, with 10+ of those years in a large molecule manufacturing environment, 5+ of those years in a drug substance manufacturing environment, and 5+ of those years managing contract manufacturers of large molecule products.Thorough understanding of evolving best industry practices and regulations in manufacture of large molecule products.A proven team player and people leader with a demonstrated track record in the development of team members.A strong commercial orientation and the ability to be agile and mobilise others in the organization to initiate progressive changeA good understanding of supply of contracts and associated legal issues.Experience of launching new products.Exceptional organisational skills in handling multiple priorities and meeting required forecasts, budget objectives, and milestones.Well-developed analytical, communication, and project management skills.Proven record for the successful implementation and a continuous improvement in a forward thinking organisation.Proactive professional with excellent leadership, and problem-solving capabilities.If you are in interested in this role please apply immediately with an up to date CV. Not sure yet? No CV ready please give me a call for more information.To find out more about Real please visit Real Staffing, a trading division of SThree Partnership LLP is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy| Registered office | 1st Floor, 75 King William Street, London, EC4N 7BE, United Kingdom | Partnership Number | OC(phone number removed) England and Wales

item.title: Senior Python Software Developer

item.title: Packaging Project Engineer (PLC)

item.title: Supplier Relationship Manager
item.content: Position: Supplier Relationship ManagerLocation: Waterford / CambridgeSalary: &pound;60,000 to &pound;70,000 + Excellent Benefits / Prospects (including Relocation Assistance)If there is something stopping you from achieving all you&rsquo;re capable of, you&rsquo;ll relish a role with a company that will positively encourage you to be pro-active &ndash; a real opportunity to release your true potential.The Company: Our Client, an innovative dynamic passionate manufactures minimal invasive next-generation robotic-assisted medical devices that are at the forefront of how surgical procedures are carried out. An award-winning company that plans to significantly disrupt the way surgery is performed for the benefit of millions of patients all around the world.Due to sustained continued expansion they now require a Supplier Relationship Manager to manage a strategic supplier based in Waterford and deliver cost and behavioural savings. Focus on maintaining and improving the third party&rsquo;s performance to meet business objectives.Other responsibilities include but are not limited to: * Working closely and onsite with a key supplier * Supplier process development to improve quality &amp; consistency and reduce cost where possible. * Move the third party relationship into a partnership to drive continual improvement, innovation, technology advances and deliver operational efficiencies * Manage and monitor the supplier performance against agreed SLA and KPI&rsquo;s. Act as key point of contact for escalation for failing relationships, creating plans to improve the service received. * Build out the SRM strategy and policies, providing training and mentoring of all stakeholders in the business * Provide ongoing SRM dashboard reporting. * Key point of contact for the external audits both in the UK and Internationally to provide information on the SRM programme, Supplier contracts and relevant policies and proceduresThe Person: Candidates suitable for consideration should be able to provide evidence of the following: * A Degree/HND in Engineering or be a Time Served with relevant experience. * A knowledge/understanding of engineering concepts such as Design for manufacture, pre-production, industrial engineering, purchasing and procurement processes, integration, cost effectiveness, quality, and readiness for production * Successfully delivering results in a SRM or Procurement / Supplier Quality role * Ability to build relationship at all levels internally but also across the supply base. * In-depth understanding of and credibility to deliver a successful SRM programme * Professional honesty and integrity in dealing with colleagues, suppliers and customers * Previous experience of working within Medical Device (ISO13485) or similarYou will be self-motivated, have excellent communication skills both written and oral, be computer literate, and able to work as part of a team.The successful candidate will enjoy a salary of between &pound;60,000 to &pound;70,000 (DOE) + Excellent Benefits / Prospects (including Relocation Assistance) plus excellent prospects and an employment package that you would expect from a company that values its employees.Do you have the courage to take on this challenge?

item.title: Clinical Quality and Compliance Director
item.content: <p>We're looking for a candidate to this position in an exciting company.<br/></p> <ul><li>Active member of the R&D Quality and Compliance Clinical management team</li><li>Lead Clinical Compliance activities and compliance staff in one or more therapeutic areas.</li><li>Handle multiple projects and ensure overall and timely completion of tasks.</li><li>Works closely with compliance staff and clinical study management teams to provide expert clinical compliance information, manage identified issues, and support continuous improvement.</li><li>Support deviation identification, reporting, and CAPA development</li><li>Responsible for ensuring the development of audit strategy plan(s) and ensuring timely execution of plans for programs.</li><li>Oversees GCP routine and complex audits including but not limited to investigator sites, internal processes, and vendors.</li><li>Represent Regulatory Compliance in Working Groups as appropriate</li><li>Supervise, develop, train and manage internal staff as appropriate.</li><li>Ensure oversight of contracts auditors.</li><li>Effective compliance reporting to senior management and relevant quality governance forums</li><li>Leads intra/inter-departmental teams and/or projects that support continuous improvement of the Quality Management System. Builds positive support and acts as role model for change.</li><li>May lead/support management of regulatory inspection activities such as readiness preparation, inspection management, and/or response management.</li><li>Leads intra or interdepartmental teams of an operational nature such as preparing the Company for minor changes in regulations, continuous improvement initiatives.</li><li>Fosters a commitment to quality in individuals and a culture of quality within the organization.</li></ul> <p> <b></b></p> <ul><li>BA or BS and 10-12+ years of relevant experience (10+ years of relevant experience with an MS).</li><li>Must have significant GCP audit and compliance experience. Clinical Quality Assurance/Compliance experience required. Bio-pharma sponsor or CRO experience required.</li><li>Significant experience with pediatric clinical trials strongly preferred.</li><li>Recognized as an expert resource on a range of clinical compliance topics.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite. Experience with audit management/CAPA management programs strongly preferred.</li><li>Excellent organization skills and project management.</li><li>Able to work equally well as part of a team or independently</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 25% required.</li></ul> <p><br/> </p> <img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?sAgKCRK9GUpNSd2Vrh6I1gn" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Automation Infrastructure Engineer
item.content: Zenith Technologies are currently looking to hire Automation Infrastructure Engineer to join our client&rsquo;s large scale biologics manufacturing facility in Dublin.The Automation Infrastructure Engineer shall be responsible, as part of the client team, for the development and delivery of the IT Infrastructure to support the Manufacturing (OEM, MCS, MES etc.) Systems to enable the start-up, commissioning and qualification of our client&rsquo;s Bulk Drug Substance manufacturing facility.ResponsibilitiesThe Engineer will contribute to the definition of the technical strategy for execution of the Automation IT Infrastructure &amp; VPE integration (domain control and networking)The Engineer will ensure technical alignment between the A&amp;E, IT Infrastructure &amp; VPE contractors and vendors and Automation Team in the Automation project by defining, describing and communicating design and build and installation standards and participate in design reviews, model reviews, etc., and to input on technical elements of the design.The Engineer will also be responsible for reviewing contractors and vendors work during design, construction and validation.The Engineer will also co-ordinate the design, development, installation and qualification of the IT Infrastructure &amp; to ensure alignment with the project schedule to enable equipment FAT&rsquo;s, on-site SAT&rsquo;s, commissioning and validation of the process systems to meet the overall project schedule.Ensures the right technical prioritization in the project.Works closely together with the IT Department, Automation Engineers and Contactors &amp; Vendors to ensure the defined standards are followed consistently in the project and are used as intended.Define and implement procedures required for the successful implementation of automation systems and to ensure the smooth transition of the manufacturing systems to site sustaining activitiesQualifications * Degree level qualification in computer science, business information systems, automation engineering or equivalent.Technical skills * Experience Administration of Microsoft Windows Sever 2012 R2 and 2016 * Good understanding of networking (VLAN, Switches, Routing) * Experience with Active Directory infrastructure and administration. * Experience with Windows Remote Desktop Services * Experience administration of MES systems (Syncade) * Experience with SQL Server 2012 * Experience with VMWare 5.x/6.x * Experience with Thin Client Software solutions * 5 years&rsquo; experience Administration of DeltaVEmerson training courses7027 &ndash; DeltaV Administration * 5 years&rsquo; experience Administration of HyperV Clusters and DeltaV Virtual StudioEmerson training courses 7029 &ndash; Virtual Studio Administration * 5 years&rsquo; experience Administration of DeltaV Batch Executive, Continuous Historian, Batch Historian, Asset ManagementGeneral Skills * Thorough knowledge of Pharmaceutical Industry Regulations (cGMP/cGLP, OSHA, EPA/EQB) is required * Experience in the preparation of method statements, safe plans of action and work permits * Understanding of documentation, such as Hardware Design, Network Design, FAT and SAT documentation * Knowledge of cGMP particularly as it applies to biologics manufacturing and automated systems * Ability to keep work pace and meet deadlines. Good organizing and planning skills * Strong communication skills * Problem solver with a focus on achievement of overall project goals * Proven success working well in a team environment with flexibility to react to changing business needs * Ability to anticipate, evaluate and resolve multiple, simultaneous project issues, delays and problems by utilising technical, project management, and business expertise * Ability to work independently and remotely with minimum direct supervision * Strong Critical thinking skills * Ensuring compliance with practices, policies, procedures, legal requirements and goals of project sponsors and approved methodologies, develop supporting documentation and monitor budget tracking/ timeliness/ scheduled resources*Further details on role available to short listed candidates**Shortlisted applicants who fit the requirements outlined above will be contacted for screen call before being presented to Engineering Management and / or client for technical considerationZenith Technologies, now a Cognizant Company is a world leader in delivering digital transformation solutions to Life Sciences. Through our knowledge and expertise in Automation, MES &amp; Digital, we deliver stable manufacturing systems that are optimised to improve operational efficiencies, whilst maintaining compliance. Our specialist engineering teams have the aptitude to deliver and support Pharma 4.0 architectures and solutions covering all IT, OT and IoT applications, infrastructures and services. Operating across 5 continents and with over 850 skilled employees, Zenith partners with the leading Life Sciences companies globally to provide performance improvements, reduced costs and improve time to market

item.title: Logistics Manager
item.content: Vacancy: Logistics ManagerLocation: DublinSalary:&nbsp; Competitive hourly rateLogistics Manager needed for a long term contract.&nbsp;&nbsp; 3D Personnel&rsquo;s client&nbsp;is a leading Building and Civil contractor. Due to continued success and growth 3D Personnel&rsquo;s client is now looking to appoint an experienced&nbsp;Logistics Manager to support the Business in the delivery of &lsquo;leading edge&rsquo; engineering and construction projects and to support the project team from the earliest stages of the project. &nbsp; As the&nbsp;Logistics Manager&nbsp;you will define and coordinate all available storage areas on site, both within the building and outside of the building up to the hoarding line. Storage space is to be allocated according to the project priorities as advised and agreed with the Contractor/Client. The booking and delivery of materials must at all times be subject to the storage space available and will be a primary function of the&nbsp;Logistics Manager.Logistics Manager Responsibilities:Define and coordinate all available storage areas on site.Allocate Storage Space according to the project priorities.Booking and Coordination of delivery of materials.Liaise with the Sub Contractors and Security Personnel to ensure effective deliveries.Coordinate with Sub Contractors to ensure awareness of holding area locations and develop an appropriate call off system to ensure optimum delivery times to site.Maintain awareness of spare capacity of the plant on site and coordinate deliveries to maximise the use of all vertical transportation plant.Assist the Project Manager in the running of the weekly delivery coordination meeting.As the&nbsp;Logistics Manager&nbsp;you will liaise closely with security personnel to ensure effective deliveries. The&nbsp;Logistics Manager&nbsp;will be a key link between the Security Operatives at the site perimeter and the traffic and material movements within the site boundaries.You will be tasked with devising an appropriate call off system to ensure optimum delivery times while working closely with the SubcontractorThe&nbsp;Logistics Manager&nbsp;will be aware of the spare capacity of the plant on site and will coordinate deliveries to maximise the use of all vertical transportation plant while liaising with the Appointed Person/Crane Coordinator and the Contractor.You will assist the Project Manager in the running of the weekly delivery coordination meeting. Delivery, vertical transportation and storage actions taken from this meeting will be the responsibility of the&nbsp;Logistics ManagerNecessary Requirements:Will possess 5-10 years&rsquo; experience in a similar role, or some site experienceStrong, proven leadership skills and experience of managing substantial, interdisciplinary teamsKnowledge of all phases of construction operations relating to field activities, construction technologies and jobsite managementExperience with managing and influencing large teams, including craft in the fieldIn depth practical knowledge and experience with scope definition, resource loaded schedules, progress and performance curves, earned value and metrics.Proven track record of delivering substantial construction programmes

item.title: Project Manager - Waters of LIFE Integrated Project
item.content: <p><u><b>PLEASE MENTION GREENJOBS IRELAND WHEN APPLYING TO THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY</b></u></p> <div> <div> Project Manager - Waters of LIFE Integrated Project </div> <div> </div> <div>The Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage is the Government Department responsible for housing and water, for physical and spatial planning, for local government, for Heritage and for weather forecasting. The European Union's EU LIFE programme is part of the EU's funding for environment and climate action.</div> <div> </div> <div>The successful candidate will be appointed as the Waters of LIFE Project Manager. The purpose of the role is to successfully manage the EU LIFE Waters of Life Project to deliver the project's objectives within the anticipated timescale and allocated budget. The successful candidate will report to the Principal Adviser within the Water Division of the Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage.</div> <div> </div> <div>The successful candidate will:</div> <div> </div> <div>• Hold an honours FETAC Level 8 degree, in engineering or science or equivalent, in a relevant discipline;</div> <div>• Have at least seven years of recent post qualification relevant experience in water or environmental management;</div> <div>• Have at least 3 years of recent post qualification experience of successfully managing complex projects in a project management role.</div> <div> </div> <div>For more information and how to apply, visit: </div> <div> </div> <div> THE CLOSING DATE FOR RECEIPT OF APPLICATION IS 3PM, THURSDAY 14th January 2021 </div> <div> </div> <div>We are committed to a policy of equal opportunity and encourage applications under all nine grounds of the Employment Equality Act.</div> </div><img src="https://www.jobg8.com/Tracking.aspx?qOIRrPw4sPdjguT61U8eBAm" width="0" height="0" />

item.title: Product Design Engineer
item.content: One of the world&#39;s most recognisable consumer electronics brands is seeking to recruit a Product Design Engineer to join its user-centric product development team. You&#39;ll be helping to develop high-end gaming accessories such as mice, keyboards and controllers. The company offers flexible working, annual bonus and pay review, pension and international travel opportunities.Please note: The company is based in Cork, Ireland. If your application is successful, you will need to be able to commute to work Monday to Friday. Relocation assistance is available if required.As Product Design Engineer will you be responsible for:Leading the development of whole products as well as mechanisms and sub-assemblies.Performing tolerance analysis to ensure high quality robust design of complex mechanical systems and components using tools such as FMEA, CFD and computer simulation.End-to-end project management of multiple projects from concept through to manufacture.Rapid prototyping, functional lab testing and analysis of test data.Work with external manufacturing partners and other suppliers. To be a successful Design Engineer you will have:Proven experience as a Design Engineer, Product Designer, Development Engineer or Mechanical Engineer.Qualified to degree level or higher in Product Design, Mechanical Engineering, Product or Innovation Engineering.Experience in medical devices, consumer electronics or household/kitchen appliances.Proven experience in developing plastic injection moulded components and enclosures for mass manufacture.3D CAD (such as ProE, wildfire, CREO, solidworks, solid-works). In return you will receive an excellent benefits package which includes:&euro;45,000 - &euro;50,000 per annum (depending on experience).Private medical coverPensionShare Purchase Plan23 days holiday plus public holidaysStaff discountDiscounted gym membership If you would like to find out more about this opportunity, click the &quot;APPLY NOW&quot; button below and we&#39;ll be in touch.Please note: Any reference to salary or pay rates in this advertisement are indicative only and should only be used as a guide.We aim to respond to suitable candidates within 5 working days. If you have not heard from us within this time, please feel free to contact us to receive feedback on your application and discuss your requirements.Professional Technical acts as an employment business for temporary positions and an employment agency for permanent positions. We are committed to equal opportunity and diversity

item.title: Product (Business Analyst) – Permanent
item.content: Product (Business Analyst) &ndash; Permanent, Co. GalwayDon&rsquo;t miss out on this great opportunity to work with one of Ireland&rsquo;s leading and fast scaling Software Security companies. This is a permanent opportunity based in Galway city centre.Product (Business Analyst) Role and Responsibilities:The successful candidate will be joining a strong well established agile engineering team which is scaling in line with the company&rsquo;s international business growth. As part of high performing scrum teams you will provide high quality analysis, requirements gathering, competitive research and design skills to drive successful product outcomes for our web-based user interfaces, content filtering and spam filtering platforms.What&rsquo;s involved: * Work with all stakeholders &ndash; business, external partners, developers, testers &amp; product management as appropriate * * to design &amp; refine priority features for the product backlog * ensure solid test requirements, test and acceptance criteria. * to create business deliverables including Process Maps, Business Requirements, Functional Requirements (including Use cases), User Stories and User Acceptance Tests. * participate in workshops to develop requirements. * drive the overall delivery of MVP solutions &amp; product outcomes. * drive quality throughout the SDLC through production of high quality documentation * assist in continual improvement of all methodologies &amp; documentation for analysis / requirement definition phases * conduct product competitive analysis focussing on value and revenue opportunities.What you need: * Relevant Third Level Qualification * Minimum 5 years&#39; experience as a Business or Product Analyst working in an Agile environment. * Business Analyst Skills &amp; techniques to elicit required information &amp; produce deliverables to tight deadlines. * Managing / facilitating workshops and co-ordinating outputs. * Carrying out high impact product competitive analysis * Jira, Gitlab or equivalent tools for Story &amp; Requirements management. * Ability to clearly gather, interpret, analyse &amp; document System functions, Business Processes, User and Data Functional requirements. * Strong communication, effective internal &amp; external stakeholder management with proven client facing experience.What&rsquo;s on Offer: * Competitive Salary and benefits (pension, potential bonus, DIS, Sick Pay, Income protection) * Excellent city centre location. * Remote working and flexible working hours. * Strong sports and social clubs. * Be part of an established, well-funded , highly engaged agile team delivering cutting edge security solutions in an agile environment. * Fast scaling software company offering extensive opportunities for team players to learn and develop their careers.Apply NowIf you would like to discuss this opportunity in person or with one of our IT Resourcers please forward your CV to Vantage Resources or contact Derek Leahy on (phone number removed) or +353 (87) (phone number removed) for a confidential discussion. Vantage Resources will not forward your details without prior discussion and approval.Vantage Resources is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for engagement and/or employment. An inclusive and diverse workforce is an essential part of the development of our organisation&rsquo;s culture which we believe enhances both our working environment and the service we provide to our customers

item.title: Remote Recruiter
item.content: <p><p><b> You’ve finally <br/>found it… </b></p></p> <p> The perfect job opportunity to skyrocket your career in hiring. </p> <p> If that's what you've been looking for, <b>then this page could literally change your life!</b> </p> <p> But only if you keep reading. </p> <p> iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind. </p> <p> To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a <b>Hiring Specialist</b>. </p> <br/><p><p><b> 7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography <br/>School As A Hiring Specialist </b></p></p> 1 <p><p><b> Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In Hiring </b></p></p> <p> If you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple. </p> <p> But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes... </p> <p> Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world. </p> <p> If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us. </p> 2 <p><p><b> Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream Jobs </b></p></p> <p> One of the things you love the most about hiring is the people. </p> <p> Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding. </p> <p> We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs. </p> 3 <p><p><b> Take Our Company To The Next Level </b></p></p> <p> We've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far. </p> <p> But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level. </p> <p> Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company. </p> <p> That means your work will be critical to the future of our company. </p> 4 <p><p><b> Stay In Control Of Your Schedule </b></p></p> <p> Every job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm. </p> <p> That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run. </p> <p> Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule. </p> 5 <p><p><b> Stability You Can Count On </b></p></p> <p> Most startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be. </p> <p> Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales. </p> <p> You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money. </p> 6 <p><p><b> Perks That Make A Difference </b></p></p> <p> To get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions. </p> <p> Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us. </p> <p> We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats. </p> <p> Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come. </p> 7 <p><p><b> Join A Company You Truly Believe In </b></p></p> <p> Many people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world. </p> <p> But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world (you can watch a sample video below). </p> <p> Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography. </p> <p> Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> What Will You <br/> Do As A <br/> Hiring <br/> Specialist? </b></p></p> <p> We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow. </p> <p> Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates. </p> <p> Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company. </p> <br/> <p><p><b> Here’s What We Expect From You </b></p></p> <li> We can trust your decisions in the hiring process </li> <li> You can carry out professional job interviews independently </li> <li> You have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per day </li> <li> You can “sell” our company to job applicants </li> <li> You have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor) </li> <p> This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location. </p> <p> If you delay submitting your application, <br/> someone else will be hired before you. </p>

item.title: Web Developer
item.content: We have an exceptional new role in Dublin with a multinational software company.We are now recruiting for a Senior Web Developer. You will have the opportunity to work with a team focusing on architecture and environmental conservation.Our client is the leading supplier of software for their industry and their success can be attributed to their dynamic team, cutting-edge technology and sustainable design. Their software is used globally and the only one of its kind. You will have the opportunity to join a company successfully making an environmental impact and your contribution will benefit generations to come.Some of your experience should include: * 5+ years&rsquo; development experience * Experience with MVC, ASP.NET and C# * Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React and Redux * REST APIs design and implementation knowledgeAlthough not essential, experience with any of the following is highly beneficial: * Developing using 2D and 3D tools * Android / iOS app development * Cloud computing skills * Knowledge of IoT protocols * REST APIs, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, IIS configurationYour work will be varied and some of your duties will include: * Application development * Mentoring junior developers * Participate in code reviews * Add to the product documentation * Develop online technology * Working in agile environmentWhy you should apply! * Competitive salary * Health insurance * Contributory pension * Life insurance * Additional holiday days * Flexible working conditions * Making a positive impact on the planetOur client emphasises creativity, collaboration and product ownership. If you would like to be at the forefront of conserving the earth&rsquo;s natural resources, then this could be the role for you. For this Senior Web Developer role, our client offers an excellent overall package and you will also have the chance to be involved in creating cutting-edge technology.For more information on this Software Developer role, contact Eddie on (phone number removed) or send your CV to eddie@carrickrecruitment.ie

item.title: Commercial & Operations Manager
item.content: Commercial &amp; Operations ManagerSalary: Dependent on ExperienceHours: Full time, PermanentLocation: Mid-West RegionWe currently recruiting a Commercial &amp; Operations Senior Associate to join our team, supporting our customer base in the Midwest in the areas of: Intruder &amp; Fire Alarms, Access Control &amp; CCTV systems.This is a long-term career opportunity for a competent candidate with the required skills attitude and experience.Responsibilities and Duties: * Co-ordination between the Sales team &amp; Operations regarding scheduling of works. * Confirmation or orders with Key Clients * Communication with engineers ensuring works are carried out on time and within budget. * Client follow up regarding new, ongoing and follow up works, service calls etc. * Compiling quotations for our 15,000 Commercial and Domestic Customers. * Identifying value added services for clients &amp; increasing revenue in the service and maintenance departments. * Providing excellent customer service while engaging with customers. * Co-ordinating the weekly schedules for the engineers and ensuring cost effectiveness.Requirements: * Excellent planning &amp; organisational skills * Confident &amp; well presented * Creative, Driven, self-motivated &amp; pro-active with a &ldquo;Can Do&rdquo; attitude * Ability to work under pressure, on one&rsquo;s own initiative and as part of a team.Education &amp; training * Qualification in Business, IT or other related field * 3-5 years commercial &amp; sales experience * Electrical / Security Industry Knowledge &amp; Experience (Highly Desirable) * Marketing Experience * Business Development / Customer Relations ExperienceIf you feel you are the ideal candidate APPLY today
